review.reviewText:
I checked in at around 8a.m. because I got a flu, which made me unable to walk around and wait for the proper check in time(15:00).
Staff warmly welcomed me though it was irregular, which was a great help for me.

review.title: Quick weekend in SF
review.reviewText: SF was busy, but our check-in was fast and the desk help was excellent.  The rooms are large and comfortable. The location is just off Powell so you avoid some of the noise and crowd, but are a block away to Union Square and the BART system.  Checking out was equally easy and the bell staff held our bags as we finished the weekend.(And some folks will complain about the parking cost, but hey, welcome to SF.) We have stayed at Nikko before and this was another excellent experience.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Great hotel and staff is nice. If you have to park a vehicle, they charge $50 a day for 24 hour valet service. There are other self park locations around that run from 30-40 dollars a night. Great location and many Uber cars around for pick up.

Great Hotel with excellent staff.. Hotel close to Shopping (Union Square) and theater.. My wife and I were celebrating our 27th wedding anniversary and the staff treated us so great.. I will definitely use Expedia again..
Thank you and please thank the Nikko Hotel Operation.
Make it a great day !!
Brian

review.title: San Francisco.....great trip
review.reviewText:
Hotel Nicco really was a great hotel for us & couldn't have been a better placed for all that we experienced while in SF.

In particular the concierge team were brilliantly helpful in all aspects of advice, making reservations & attention to detail....thank you to the team for making our first trip to SF so brilliantl!!!

If we are lucky enough to return to SF the we will stay at the Hotel Micco without hesitation.
Very friendly staffs. Chic interior. Indoor pool, and jacuzzi is one of my main reasons to stay there. In the hub of union square, 2 blocks away from cable car stop.

review.title: Poor service
review.reviewText:
Business traveler be aware! Very poor service! 
Extortion @ their buseniss center! The hotel  replace the business center to a UPS stor where they impose an extortion like fees for copies and fax. They charge me exuberant fees by the hour to hold an 8.5X11 envelop!

review.title: Would have been perfect BUT  .....
review.reviewText:
Nice Hotel in good location but the FREE internet is very lacking and upgrading is a real pain  !!!
Very limited bandwidth makes anything but e-mail very slow.
Forget video.   Even e-mail at certain times of the day can be very slow. 
Was so slow I wanted to upgrade to their  $12 /  day  high speed plan
but that could NOT be easily be done.  Can only be done by phone. 
 They outsource their internet to a 
third party provider and they could not upgrade me by simply giving them 
my log on credentials !!   They wanted the MAC address of my laptop  and since I was at
the front desk o in the lobby I did not have this info.
review.negativeRemarks:
Stop trying to squeeze every last penny out of guests and offer
high speed internet for FREE like other hotels.

review.title: Absolutely beautiful hotel, welcoming staff!
review.reviewText: The hotel is absolutely beautiful from the moment I walked up to the front doors. The staff were very friendly, quick to check me in, and the room was clean, comfortable and fresh. In-Room service was delicious and fast and given it's in the heart of San Francisco, the room was very quiet, peaceful and shut out all light at night for a deep sleep. I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to others.

Everything about the hotel was incredible the pool sauna the staff BUT! The hotel restaurant try to rip you off .
 My fiancé asked for a simple rice dish to go and she said no oil no salt gave her a little direction they tried to charge her $50.
 I was so upset, to me that's just plain taking advantage of somebody there's a common understanding that, that is ridiculous .
 I told the bartender who build us he should've known better and all he said was that's with the chef told me to bill you. that's so wrong he should've stopped it right there

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great location, has all the things you expect from a hotel of this rank. Small things like the shower head not fitting in to the holder so you have to keep holding while showering or put up with it keep falling was a pain. The shower room has only half a glass so the floor gets all wet in the bathroom. And the hotel guide being on a tablet that doesnt work was annoying. Wanted to search info on Zanzibar and their bar but couldn't retrieve info so gave up and went out.
Amazing service! Clean, updated very nice rooms! Pool, hot tub, sauna and steam room!!

review.title: Great location, beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, until we left, it was a friendly and beautiful experience.  The staff was very accommodating and very welcoming. The room was lovely. The workout room and pool/ deck area is excellent. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone traveling to San Francisco!

review.title: Usually this hotel is excellent
review.reviewText: Usually this hotel is excellent.  Unfortunately, this trip was not the case. The room was very small. The bathroom door would not stay open, Which makes things a little claustrophobic.  The room was somewhat dated.

review.title: Excellent escapade at Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful stay at hotel Nikko. Appreciated the curteous and professionnal service at the reception, restaurant, concierge and valet. Enjoyed the comfortable rooms, pool, fitness, sauna and steam room.
review.positiveRemarks: Diversity at the breakfast buffet, pool, sauna and fitness facilities. Easy access to downtown. Coffee shop and restaurant.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown location right off union square area. Easy travel access to SFO and main attractions.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: We had a great stay! The staff was super helpful anx friendly! The location was perfect to get around and see things. Its right by union square with many restaurants within walking distance

review.title: good business hotel close to CBD and conferences
review.reviewText: Seems like a solid operation catering to the business/corporate crowd. Rooms are clean and quiet. The common spaces have seen better days, and there is no "atmosphere" or charm per se, but if you're looking for a good place to crash at night then it's totally fine. Beware of additional fees, which are typical for hotels in the area, and no particular fault of this specific hotel.

review.title: Very clean, great staff, quick check in and out
review.reviewText: Picked it up on a last minute deal. Very pleased with location in Union Square area. Room was very small with only a queen bed was only negative.

The staff could not make clear which credit card the charge will be filed, the one used for reservation or the one registered for on hold, and that really confused me. It resolved in the end but the staff looked resentful.

review.title: Very nice hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near Union Square.  Very clean rooms, comfortable beds, quiet.  Enjoyed three nights.  Pleasant stay.  My third time with this hotel.  Recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything in downtown San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: It's an older building, but it is well-maintained.  Very congenial staff.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, fine dining.  Walk to new SFMOMA and other cultural centers.

review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with friendly staff and great location
Very nice hotel. Close to Japantown, fun to explore. Lots of murals nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel near Shopping area
review.reviewText: We stayed here for two nights and really enjoyed our stay. Very courteous and helpful staff, clean, spacious and comfortable room. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Very Good hotel
review.reviewText: The staff were very friendly, pleasant, knowledgeable and very willing to assist us with directions, transportation methods, and tourist places to visit in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The Nikko was very clean and centrally located close to shopping, and transportation modes to get around the city. Also, it was a petite queen & small
review.negativeRemarks: The refrigerator was stocked with sodas, water, and alcohol, which did not leave hardly any room for us to store anything of our own.
review.locationRemarks: It was very convenient for shopping, boarding tours buses, places to eat and walking to many tourist sites.

review.reviewText: The only thing that we would change about the  Nikko Hotel is the firmness of the bed that we had.   It was a little too firm for us.  Everything else was terrific!

review.title: Nice Hotel. Very quiet!
review.reviewText: We stayed there 6 nights and love it. Hotel is older but very well kept. Room is clean. My kids love the pool and I love the health club. Staffs are nice, calm, responsive, and invisible "in a good way". Hotel is quiet and less crowded than others surrounded. i love the hotel decor. We will stay there again and try the restaurant next time if we have a chance.

review.title: The Short Stay in Frisco Before Home
review.reviewText: After 2 weeks working in CA for business with a short vacation along the way, I picked Nikko because of its location a block or two from Union Square plus the same level of high caliber comfort I had from another 4-star hotel.  The staff was quite professional and accomidating.  I check in around 11:30 am which is about the same time most people check out.  So I was lucky to have the riom available, didn't necessarily need a high floor, took a rest, then eoamed around downtiwn.   They have a good seafood restaurant with a Japanese theme, had oysters instead of sushi (ate tons of sushi in SF earlier on).  Had to get up super early to catch the flight back home, so the airport shuttle drive in area was easy to manage while I checked out.  I recommend this hotel fir singles and couples alike, along with business travelers and tourists.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was beautiful. It looks very luxurious! The price was a little high especially when you have to pay extra to park your car there. We were not expecting that when we booked but there is nowhere else to park. It seemed to be located close to fisherman wharf until you start the trek up and down the hills.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was very friendly and polite
review.negativeRemarks: Parking should be included for the amount of money it was per night
review.locationRemarks: We did an eight mile walk from hotel to AT&T park down to pier 39 and back to the hotel. It was a hike but it is possible

review.title: very accessible to great hot spots.
review.reviewText: Charlyne (at the front desk) very helpful and professional.

review.title: Its not worth the price!
review.reviewText: I had a really good experience when I arrived, the room that I was given was really good but I left the hotel in the morning and return at night just to find the room wasn't clean, so I called the front desk to complain and they offer to send the housekeeping lady at 10pm. Which I declined cause it was too late. THey have a Starbucks in the hotel, that its full of homeless people, which I dont have a problem with, but they were rude with me. So Its a nice hotel with great location but not worth the money I pay.

review.title: Second Stay This Year
review.reviewText: The Nikko meets all of my needs and more.  I really like this hotel and can't wait to see what it's like after the Winter renovations.  I will definetly be staying here once they reopen.
review.negativeRemarks: Updating the decor
review.locationRemarks: Ground Zero for everything

review.title: Great Hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText: convenient location, easy to get to and from. Great shopping close by, fantastic restaurants. The hotel is always clean and always comfortable.

review.title: Conveniently located hotel downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: From the time I drove up to the Valet parking at the hotel, it was a courteous and warm reception.  The staff is absolutely wonderful making you feel like part of the family.   Will definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff at the hotel were all wonderful welcoming making you feel like a VIP.
review.negativeRemarks: I have nothing to criticize.
review.locationRemarks: The location is walking distance to all of the shopping downtown.  Easy access to get back on the freeway on.

review.title: Clean Well Kept Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, although the pillows were too soft. The staff was very helpful. The concierge was great with booking our tour. The only negative about the hotel is the homeless around the building but given that the entire city is congested with homeless, Hotel Nikko was far less affected by it than other hotels in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: The pool was nice and its indoors so the weather was not a factor when using the facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: The pillows were too soft and therefore could not get a good nights rest.
review.locationRemarks: Designer shops everywhere, near all transportation. Restaurants were ok, not too many choices if your on a budget.

review.reviewText:
Good check in process.
Nice facilities.
Room somewhat small

review.title: Great central location.....
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was a fantastic place for a family of 4 to stay. We had a junior suite which was perfect for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Great sized bathroom and good free internet. We were upgraded to the lounge floor so enjoyed complimentary breakfast and pre dinner drinks and snacks which was fab. Staff couldn't have been more helpful and great gym and pool. Would definitely recommended
Very friendly staff.  Very helpful.  Great location.  Great stay.

review.title: Perfect location for all the best SF spots.
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko is great choice in a fabulous location. Easy walking to Union Square, Chinatown and close to the cable car. Very helpful staff. In house facilities are limited (one restaurant and one bar) but everything is on the doorstep. Avoid disappointment like we experienced and book Alcatraz months before your visit. Sold out till end-August 😭

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable rooms and friendly staff, but everything is charged apart. The hotel has a gym area and swimming pool, but you are charged apart to use it. Guests are already paying for staying there, facilities should be included.

review.title: Close to everything.
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel everything was great! Only negative was the front desk told us that the spa was ope 24 hours but actually closed at 10p
Perfect hotel for our family of five.  We had 2 queen beds and got a roll away.  Also, great location!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel and friendly staff.  Good location 
The room is to small.

review.title: Quiet hotel in a busy area.
review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean, very efficient and surprisingly quiet in that it is on a busy street.  The restaurant was also very pleasant with great wait staff.

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Very quiet and well appointed room. Staff were great and location is good for walking in the Union Square area.
Excellent value. Staff were do efficient and professional.  Rooms were clean and we had a great view from the 12th floor! Would highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Repeat customer 20! Years later
review.reviewText:
Pros:  love being able to text to check out and to have my car brought up.  Very clean Would definitely come again, hopefully sooner than 20 years like my first stay!  

Cons: $50 plus tax for parking per night is too much.  They replaced the Japanese restaurant on the top floor w meeting rooms, too bad but I guess that's where the money is at.

review.title: it was amazing
review.reviewText: it is an excellent hotel with all facilities,good location,big rooms,nice staff

review.title: Walking distance to Union Square
review.reviewText: Small room but clean and decent. Staff were very friendly.

review.title: Superb hotel located perfectly, great staff
review.reviewText: Outstanding staff all around. Great property, located near everything. The cable car is right by it and fantastic restaurants

review.title: Perfect Hotel.
review.reviewText: We had an exceptional stay. Beautiful hotel, near perfect condition, amazing pool and hot tub. Free Wifi worked great. Not one negative thing to say. 5 stars all around.
It was pleasant stay at hotel Nikko. Staff was very nice co-operative.hotel is near to city centre.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in great part of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Spacious Rooms, great amenities and lots of excellent shopping!  Extremely comfortable beds!!
We enjoyed our stay. The staff was helpful and friendly and the room was always clean. The pool and fitness area was beautiful.

review.title: Great room with views
review.reviewText: Easy check in, clean room, fancy bathroom, prompt room service, 5star food, polite staff.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Very convenient and easy to find . Room was clean and comfortable

review.title: Never had to drive! All the shopping/food/entertai
review.reviewText: Great anniversary weekend . We were very comfortable

our 1st-time experience with this Hotel, overall pleased and relaxing place to stay in San Francisco.
we would consider coming back next trip & book this hotel again,the only delayed was upon checking in we have our service dog with us, I guess your front desk check in personnel was not knowledgeable about ALL service dog per federal law must be treated equal regardless of type. we were 1st told that ESD does not qualify service dog even after showing her our dog ADA service dog ID card ,she is  careful enough and said she will verify with Manager, came back & gave us a complimentary dog gift bag. We hope in the future all your  Stuff   will be made to aware about the sensitivity of customer with service dog and that federal law prohibit discrimination regardless of size,breed, age, and type.
review.positiveRemarks: we love the room and the special set-up dog corner for our pet,

review.reviewText: Great location. Helpful staff. Comfortable hotel.

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: quick check in, great location, expensive parking.
review.negativeRemarks: expensive garage.
review.locationRemarks: close to everything

review.title: Nice hotel in center of downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Loved our 5 night stay! !!! Staff  yo invlede concierge was excellent

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Nice place friendly staff   This was my second time here. Fitness facility could be improved

review.title: Faded Grandeur
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Nikko many times before. This was my first trip back in about five years. I'm sorry to report that the hotel has not maintained the very high standards that it has in the past. The faded cushions on the lobby chairs are an immediate indication of this deterioration; the room ventilation system, which would only keep the fan on automatic (not constant, so it disturbingly goes on and off) is another. In the context of the very high room prices, I therefore consider the hotel now overpriced. The hotel is rated four stars and that is appropriate; but the building and original concept of the hotel make worthy of five stars IF necessary maintenance and upgrades were implemented.

review.title: Perfectly Fine Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed 1 night for business and have no complaints. Everything was as expected.  Would stay again.

Great location in Union square area. Love that Starbucks was right downstairs. The room was comfortable and clean. I would stay there again. My only compliants are the lack personnel working at the check out desk and concierge, sometimes there was only one person working at each spot. I would have also appreciated a complimentary water bottle.

review.title: Nice hotel in union square
review.reviewText: Nice. Clean hotel. Make sure that you get a higher floor where the rooms are larger with nicer bathrooms

review.title: Worst Anniversary Ever
review.reviewText: Small room, no fridge, no microwave, no service from front desk within 30mins, no free gym, no free pool, horrible view of a building wall outside o your window. This was a horrible decision to spend this much on our anniversary hotel. I wish I would have a refund but booking through Expedia ndoesnt allow it. Do not come here.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I visit annually and have never been disappointed.

Business trip made all the more please staying at Hotel Nikko.
Friendly staff, close to everything you want do or see in San Francisco.
Can't wait for my return trip.
Thank you Hotel Nikko for making my stay a memerable one.
Excellent location, super friendly staff, clean rooms, great views - I've stayed at this hotel nearly a dozen times and never had a bad experience.

review.title: Excelent hotel. Very close to unión square.
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel.
Kindly staff. 
Excelent attention 
For breakfast has a Starbucks Coffee. Also 1 Block is Walgreens supermarket for all kind a Food.

review.title: Standard business hotel /
review.reviewText: Large impersonal, but Clean and comfortable standard business hotel. Devoid of any charm, lines to check out in the AM. Caters to flight attendants, Perfectly adequate but nothing special.

review.title: Very well located
review.reviewText: Just tried Hotel Nikko after looking for some alternatives to my usual hotel in San Francisco (the prices rocketed and didn't match the service at my usual place). Very happy when I was able to find hotel Nikko. First time staying with them and most probably will return there. Great service, attentive staff, nice and functional rooms. Ok, surprised that there is not a complimentary bottle of water. You have your own tablet in the room, very helpful front desk people. I was very satisfied with the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: A complimentary bottle of water.
review.locationRemarks: Right close to the BART and Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel for a pleasure stay
review.reviewText: It was a great experience!  Staff was awesome and service was great.  What struck me was that they remembered my name from the first day.
review.negativeRemarks: No.
review.locationRemarks: Great for quality dining and shopping.

review.title: Nice rooms, friendly staff, great location
review.reviewText: Overall a very positive experience with this hotel.  Staff was friendly, generally knowledgeable, and helpful.  Check in was prompt and efficient, and the staff member thoughtfully offered my an upgrade to a larger room for $20.  (I didn't take her up on the offer.)  The room was fine, certainly not large but not cramped either.  Everything was clean.  Check out was quick and efficient; I had prepaid on Expedia, and this had been correctly processed, so that there was nothing to pay.  The only negative was that at check in you have to page through screen after screen of over-reaching limitations and one-sided "agreements" that you allegedly are agreeing to before you are registered.  Hotel management needs to get their lawyers under control.  I've never run into this before, and It's a nuisance, a complete waste of time, and probably unenforceable for that matter.  One has to wonder if the hotel has had a lot of problems with its guests; it certainly doesn't create a good impression.  Too bad because otherwise the hotel is very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice rooms, friendly and helpful staff.  Great location.  Within easy walking distance of downtown San Francisco, and a block or so from the cable car
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of those silly, time-wasting screens of over-reaching legalese at check in.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown San Francisco near museums and 5 minutes to cable cars.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel in the City
review.reviewText:
Our first time staying at Hotel Nikko. We were told about the hotel by a family member. 
It is located in a great spot just a block or so back from Powell street. Near Union Square.
It was a very pleasant stay for our honeymoon, the bed was so comfortable! We received an upgrade from a room to a suite at check in for only a small extra amount which gave us breakfast each day and full access to the fitness and spa facilities as well as internet wifi. We loved the gym and spa facilities, they were one of the best that we have experienced. 

The staff were all very friendly and accommodating

We will stay again when visiting San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: The décor is a little dated in some areas.
review.locationRemarks: Located just a block back from Powell Street right near Union Square. You can walk down to Westfield and Macy's and all other shops very quickly

review.title: Regular Guest at the Nikko
review.reviewText: Nikko is my favorite hotel in SF. Convenient location and great staff and service. Never disappointed.

review.title: Beautifully designed, and in a central location.
review.reviewText: Hotel staff invariably helpful and friendly--especially the desk staff.  The room cleaning staff were the best I have ever experienced anywhere--they took the time to organize toiletries, and everything was left absolutely spotless.  Bed was very comfortable, and you fall asleep as soon as your head sinks into the soft pillow.  Excellent location where you can walk anywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, staff, hotel and room design, level of comfort, cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: Basic wifi is free, but it isn't reliable and it's very slow.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, so basically you can do anything that comes to mind.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed staying here ! It's a beautiful hotel. I've recommended  it to everyone I've encountered.  It's very clean , comfortable and excellent staff.

review.title: Great hotel & great location
review.reviewText: Great location for access to public transportation and great eating!!!  Wonderful hotel!!

review.title: Great Hotel close to Union Square, Street Car
review.reviewText:
All staff very courteous, helpful, top notch. 
We had a problem with our Expedia reservation, but front desk staff went the extra mile to get it resolved for us.  Their professionalism along with hotel excellence and location makes it a definite that we will stay there again.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: Very lovely hotel . Will stay there again !staff eonderful

review.title: Lovely hotel
review.reviewText:
Great location, comfortable rooms and lovely staff.

Hotel is 2 blocks from union square so easy to get to.  Rooms are lovely, comfortable and clean.  Check in staff are really helpful and suggest anything you need.

Pool/gym are $25 extra but worth it if you're staying for a few days.

We asked for some extra items in the room and the staff were more than helpful supplying them.
review.negativeRemarks: Check out processes
review.locationRemarks: Right in downtown San Francisco.  Play on the trams, shopping, walking to wharf.

review.title: Fantastic hotel great location
review.reviewText: My husband and I go to San Francisco several times a year and have always wanted to stay at the Nikko.  We splurged and stayed this trip.  It was everything we expected and more.  The beds were very comfortable.  I slept like a baby.  It is a little pricey to stay there.  If I could afford it, I would stay there every time and longer.

review.title: Best stay for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great location, great staff, great food, what else can one want.  Perfecto for San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much

review.title: Great hotel with excellent amenities
review.reviewText: Upgraded from a deluxe King to a fabulous suite. Included daily extensive breakfast buffet for two, daily complimentary wine and cheese bar, health club. Spotless rooms and comfortable beds. Overall wonderful experience.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: Right in Union Square, hotel is walking distance from BART and cable cars most sites in city.  Room was comfortable and staff excellent.

review.title: Great hotel, close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Clean and comfortable. The lounge is great for drinks. Hotel staff are very pleasant!  The gym should have been included, I may have been a patron of the spa if I would have been exposed...
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby and bar area. Concierge was great.
review.negativeRemarks: Include the fitness center please.

review.title: Nice hotel but not true luxury
review.reviewText: Very nice but has some major cons. Check in is very slow (only one person working and had a line), they charge extra for health club, bedding is not comfortable, Ac is old.

It was great- hotel restaurant also very good.  All around, excellent service and accomodations.  Only complaint is that the neighborhood is incredibly scary and the Tenderloin should be avoided on-foot, whenever possible.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: Nice room, beautiful ambiance, pool wonderful. Room service portions rediculous and shower ran out of hot water.

review.title: Stantard room as narrow as a hallway
review.reviewText: The room was so tiny. We had more room to roam in the elevator than in the room. And although this is a 4-star hotel, all of the 4-star amenities must be purchased. Absurd... Aside from the nice front desk, the other employees we encountered were very rude. The Chicago White Sox were staying there, and they were the employees' only concern. Elevators were blocked, doors were locked in the interest of keeping things private for them even at the cost of other guests' comfort. If you aren't a well-known athlete, probably best not stay here.

review.title: Great location, v helpful staff.
review.reviewText: Our stay was very good. The help was friendly and accommodating. We got a great price through Expedia.

review.title: great hotel with Japanese flavor
review.reviewText: I stayed there because  of the conference and was very pleased with all hotel amenities
review.positiveRemarks: Location, room style, free WiFi, very nice and quite large pool, sauna, steam room.
review.negativeRemarks: This is a very nice modern Japanese hotel with a nice restaurant on site. Consider adding a tea room as an alternative to Starbucks
review.locationRemarks: perfect location near the Union Square

review.title: Good location, comfortable room
review.reviewText: The location is convenient, near shopping, theaters, restaurants. My room was comfortable and attractive, but sound insulation is poor between rooms and room doors slam extremely loudly, which is annoying late evening and early morning. If you care about TV, the channel lineup was slim. I was disappointed to be charged for all but very basic internet connection.  There are no computers you can use for free to check in for flights and print boarding passes - must pay to use the UPS business center in the lobby.  There is no free shuttle to SFO - the Bell Man will arrange a shuttle for a fee.  BART is a 3 block walk and half the price of the shuttle if you're able to walk with your luggage.
review.positiveRemarks: Price was reasonable and the bed is comfy.  Bathroom is well appointed.  My room was available early and the staff are very good and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Totally free internet.  Free business center.  Free shuttle to SFO
review.locationRemarks: Great location - close to most things you'd want to do in city center.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Kristi,

Thank you for staying with us, and taking the time to write a review about your experience! It is wonderful to hear that you enjoyed your time at Hotel Nikko, and were able to experience the 5-star service we strive to provide all guests.

We look forward to seeing you again in the future!

Thank you,
Dani Ortega 
Marketing Manager

review.title: Perfect location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is the second time to stay at Hotel Nikko San Francisco.  The location is perfect for local sightseeing and touring the coast with rental car services available across the street.  The cleanliness and maid-service was outstanding.  The concierge services was most helpful in locating points of interests and restaurants.   I will stay at the Hotel Nikko again when I visit San Francisco!

review.title: Nice hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel with a great location. Had a little hiccup checking in. I told them I had a VIP amenity from Expedia for their high speed internet. They didn't want to give it to me until I made them read the email. They honored it, but Expedia had the price for the amenity wrong.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Anonymous,

Thank you for not only staying with us, but also providing us with feedback after your recent stay! We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience at our property.

We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future!

Thank you,
Dani Ortega
Marketing Manager

review.reviewText: nice room comfortable bed clean room good area good food i enjoyed my stay and would stay again

managementResponses.response:
Dear masha,

Thank you for staying with us, and taking the time to write a review regarding your stay. We strive to provide a 5-star experience to all of our guests, and that is made possible through feedback like yours. I have shared some of your feedback with our management team, as we are always looking for ways to improve. 

Again, thank you for taking the time to provide us with feedback, and we hope to see you again in the future!

Thank you,
Dani Ortega
Marketing Manager

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Staff and location are great. The host lady at ANZU restaurant ( where you have breakfast ) was remarkable!! The breakfast buffett offers American and Japanese breakfast and is a bit pricy. If you want to use it instead of menu order foods are always the same everyday without slight change which is boring. The coffee maker with cups were placed in the bathroom that I really disliked. You have enough room for them in the actual room whey do you place them in the bathroom?

review.title: Good location, beautifully decorated lobby,classy.
review.reviewText: Centrally located in Union square and within walking distance to world class shopping and dining. The hotel lobby and restaurants are beautifully decorated. Very polite and courteous staff.  The rooms are clean and pretty. Spacious bathrooms. There was only one issue. The windows are not sound proof,even from the 10th floor you could hear yelling and shouting from the streets. Apart from this one issue, this is a very classy hotel.

Good hotel, excellent location, nice staff.
Good price to value deal

managementResponses.response:
Dear Ken,

Again, thank you for staying with us, and we hope to have you as a guest again in the future!

Thank you,
Dani Ortega
Marketing Manager

review.title: Just the right amount of attention!
review.reviewText:
If you want an exceptional hotel that doesn't over do it,  then this is it.  I like to come and go without feeling as though I need to tip the doorman every time I leave.  Don't get me wrong,  they are there to hail you a cab or open the door but it just wasn't turned into a akward "do I need to tip moment"

After checking in,  I never required the front desk again till checkout.  My guest called them a few times asking about wi-Fi, etc... but I found everything perfect without any additional help.  My guest was also able to stop by with out having to go through the usual SF security shakedown.  Don't get me wrong,  the hotel was safe and secure by all means.

Having lived in San Francisco for years,  I loved the location.  TenderknobNOMADowntown all-in-one.  

My only issue was of my own making as I wasn't paying attention when pouring water/ eucalyptus oil on the hot coals in the dry sauna.  I accidentally, spilled the bowl and got a nice little 2nd degree burn on my right forearm.  I didn't let this spoil my trip and didn't even mention it to the hotel staff because it was 100% my fault for picking up the bowl rather than just using the ladle.
review.positiveRemarks: Being able to come and go freely and having everythingI wanted at my fingertips.
review.negativeRemarks: Men's steam room was small.
review.locationRemarks: As I have already mentioned,  this is the most ideal location in all of San Francisco in my opinion.

review.title: Very nice hotel in a great SF location
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel.  Elegant in all ways.  Quiet, comfortable. The heart of SF.

review.title: Great value for the price!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for our anniversary and it was wonderful!  It had a very upscale feeling but still very affordable.  It was in a great location...central to everything.  We didn't have a ton of interaction with the staff, but everyone we came into contact with was very polite and helpful.  You could tell it was an older hotel, but has been nicely updated and was very clean.  We were on the 15th floor and there was still a lot of street noise and you could definitely tell when we got neighbors in the next room, but its a hotel in the city...noise is to be expected.  Overall it was a great experience.  I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The elevators were super fast!  That's always a pleasant surprise.

review.reviewText:
Excellent checkin experience 
Clean room 
Great location

review.title: Parking
review.reviewText: Parking At $57 per day, all costs should be known up front

review.title: nice hotel downtown
review.reviewText:
this was our 2nd stay here. we had a corner room (9th floor), which had a decent view. (we turned down an upgrade for a higher floor) we found the bed comfortable and the bathroom spacious and well-equipped. 
hotel has a Starbucks in one corner of the lobby and a decent full-service restaurant in the other corner. Staff was pleasant and helpful. BART is a few blocks away
review.locationRemarks: lots of shopping nearby

review.title: Spectacular hotel.
review.reviewText: Everything was awesome. Clean roon, great gym and spa. Beautiful view. Lovely personnel. Service , service , service. I will definitely stay there again

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The trip itself was fine.  However, when I got to the room and tried to get on the just "basic" internet, it didn't work. I even went downstairs to talk to the desk clerk and she said it should work. "Just put in your last name and room number." Then I gave her my last name and she said, "OK." She didn't bother to check to see if my last name in the system was the one I gave her. Went back up to my room and STILL ON WI-FI internet connection. OK. Bummer. So I decided to take a shower and chill. HOWEVER, there was no hot water in the shower. I called downstairs after my so-called shower to let them know and they wanted to send someone up. Since I took the cold shower, I declined their suggestion.
review.positiveRemarks: Dinner at the sushi restaurant was fantastic.
review.negativeRemarks: Hot water, more tuned in clerks that will check your name against the name given for WI-FI. Ha! so little space for suggestions!

review.title: Very pleasant hotel experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is lovely, clean, the staff was very friendly.  Having a pleasant hotel experience adds to the overall vacation experience.
review.positiveRemarks: The marble lobby, 6 elevators, never a wait.  The very friendly and professional staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Addition of a breakfast eatery, or at least coffee service in the lobby in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to many areas, right in Union Square.  Good location.

review.title: Great downtown location but no view.
review.reviewText:
Everyone was helpful and pleasant. We did have a few mistakes with check in as there were people training that day. It didn't effect our enjoyment of the hotel and everyone was very accommodating.

Only hiccup besides preferring to have been put on a higher floor( we were on 7) was the shower control fell off as we were trying to get ready for check out. They had someone there in 10 mins and he had it fixed in about 15. The front desk gave us an additional hour to get ready after the shower was fixed. Pretty sure we could have gotten more time had it been a larger group than my party of 2. Over all I would definitely stay here again. We loved it.
review.positiveRemarks: Fantastic lobby. Liked set price for daily parking with in/out privileges.The staff here was excellent. Rooms are trendy but comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: There was a Starbucks attached to the lobby so when ever we tried to use it all the lobby seats were taken and several by Starbucks customers.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. We walked to local shopping, restaurants and activities and had a short 2 block walk to  BART to visit other parts of the city.

review.title: Quiet hotel conveniently located in Union Square.
review.reviewText: Hotel  has a unique decor and quiet compared to the bustling, crowded Hilton across the street. We upgraded to one of the upper floors with a view.  Unfortunately the bathroom was dirty( pee stains and hair in the tub and bathroom floor was not clean).  Complained to front desk and we were immediately moved to another room which was cleaner.  Great view of the city, comfortable bed, however disappointed with the worn carpet and furniture which was showing some wear. The breakfast brunch which came with the upgrade was good. Overall not worth the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Breakfast and the view and close proximity to restaurants, entertainment and shopping.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the rooms with new carpet and furniture.  Hire new housekeeping staff because they are not doing their job of cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: Great location-close to shopping centers, Chinatown, restaurants, and theaters.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Very good value i will deffenitly comeback and I do highly recommend this hotel

review.title: The location was perfect...close to transportation
review.reviewText: this hotel was great...room was awesome and comfortable...has a great gym, pool, steam and sauna overall great services (they even had a dog walk on 5th floor).  Transportation was just steps away to get you where ever you want to be in the city!
review.positiveRemarks: It was all great in all areas!
review.negativeRemarks: nothing...
review.locationRemarks: great shopping and transportation to all areas in the city

review.title: My Favorite Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: Great fitness and spa, nice rooms, decent views and super-friendly staff.

review.title: Great San Francisco Location
review.reviewText: Room is small but quiet.  The Nikko has great food, and the central location can't be beat.
review.positiveRemarks: Central location and early check-in. Dog-friendly.  We'll bring our dog in the future and experience their "dog-park" area on the 5th floor.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and sightseeing on foot

review.title: Great location for the Super Bowl 50 activities.
review.reviewText: Attended Super Bowl 50 activities in SF.  The staff was off the hook, helping with any of our needs.  Within walking distance of downtown venues.
review.negativeRemarks: Be aware of the streets surrounding the hotel after dark.

review.title: LOVED this hotel so much
review.reviewText: What a pure delight to check into this amazing hotel.  We knew it was close to Union Square and that was about it.  LOVED our experience from check-in to check out.  Loved how walkabout it was around Union Square which was big for my teenage shopper.  Our room had gorgeous views and was so comfortable. Imagine our surprise when we turned on the remote control in the bathroom and a tv was there!  We had dinner in the restaurant and the salmon was wonderful.  Their breakfast buffet was amazing with both american and japanese options.  We will definitely stay here on future visits to San Francisco!!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for those wanting to be by Union Square!  We could uber anywhere we wanted though this trip was just a quick trip for us.

review.title: Nice hotel, up charge for everything
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in general in a great location, but I don't enjoy getting up charged for everything, which is what it felt like here. They give you free wifi, but it's clearly labeled "basic" which meant I was constantly switching between just using my data whenever the wifi was spotty, back to wifi. You had to pay extra for better connection. The gym was definitely nicer than normal hotel gyms, but it cost $15 (usually $25, but since the pool was remodeling it was discounted). Room was tiny but that's fine by SF standards.

review.title: Good location near union square and theaters.
review.reviewText: Super polite service within Japanse tradition. Clean building with modern look. Great views from upper floors.

review.title: Great Hotel Minutes From Union Square!
review.reviewText: We have stayed in several nice places in San Francisco and this is our new favorite! Definitely will be back!

review.title: Great oasis in the city
review.reviewText: The Nikko is a great spot for a stay in the city. It's got that great Japanese service that is hard to find elsewhere in the city. Nice gym. Great breakfast. Great location
Good room cleanliness. But the towels were a bit tired......
It was nice. I am from France and enjoyed it.  I would stay here again.

review.title: Convenient!
review.reviewText: Awesome customer service!! Loved how you can walk to dining and shops.

review.title: Wonderfully regressing customer service
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel. Wish the room was slightly larger.

review.title: Great to the Convention Center Easy...
review.reviewText: Staff-Was professional and friendly just Great. They treated me like a regular Guest even though it was my first Visit...

review.title: Very nice hotel, but...
review.reviewText: I was on the Imperial floor which was fantastic.  The breakfast was great and all of the people were wonderful.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything except for the cost of parking.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost of parking. $50.00 per day is crazy.  Have a sign that can be seen.  It was VERY hard to find the hotel.  There are many one way streets and
review.locationRemarks: Great location I was able to get everywhere I needed to go.

review.reviewText: Great experience.!bbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbbb

excellent clean 5star hotel in heart of SFO
great restaurants
nice swimming pool, exercise room
review.locationRemarks: great location near union square

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Loved having Feinsteins in the hotel. Saw Shana Morrison and it was a wonderful intimate experience.

review.title: nice hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Booked a room for Christmas weekend; got a good deal through Expedia points.  VIP upgrades weren't available, but the original room was just fine.  Great location... very short walk to Union Sq., BART, Market Street, etc.  Spacious room, comfy beds, and good separation of spaces, i.e. toilet was separate from shower/sink and vanity areas so it was convenient for 2 people to "get ready" at the same time.   Toilet flushing was very loud (eco?) but otherwise, no complaints at all.  Friendly valets, courteous doormen, accommodating front-desk staff... and the complimentary glass of wine during check-in made the whole process relaxing.
review.negativeRemarks: quieter toilet
review.locationRemarks: Visit Mikkeler for a beer.  Shop in Union Square.  Blue Bottle for coffee.

review.title: Terrible Internet
review.reviewText:
The in-room wifi was useless. 
They allow us to use ONLY three devices at the same time.
I will never stay this hotel again until they change this.
Great experience, very attentive staff, beautiful surroundings...

review.title: Excellent hotel by Union Square
review.reviewText: It was such a beautiful hotel the sushi at the restuarant was AWESOME!!! The location was very central all walking distance from the bart trollies and cable cars!!!!

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located and staff was very helpful.  There are lots of restaurants and shops around and Union Square is just steps away.  We are very happy with our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice if the gym could be accessed without an additional fee.

review.title: Nice hotel,  great location.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the center of San Francisco, neighborhood is ok, close to Bart station and trains. Our room was small but it looked like it was recently remodeled, it was comfortable and it had everything we needed. Front desk agent was attentive and fast.
Excellent!!!!  We would definitely come back to this hotel!

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: great location near all the shops and restaurants of union square, I got a great rate is the only reason i was fortunate enough to stay in a hotel like this in Union Square. Id guess normal rates would be way out of my price range for a hotel this nice but i would definitely stay again if the price was right
Staff was excellent. Room was a bit run down but ok for the rate, Nice central location in the city
The room was nice bit had remnants of cigarette smoke.

review.title: The staff were excellent and very helpful!
review.reviewText: It was overall an excellent experience! We were very pleased with our stay!

review.title: Perfect hotel is very good for shopping, transport
review.reviewText: We were very glad that we stayed at hotel. We travelled lots of using transports, shopping and restaurants. Beautiful area. It is more safe

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: The staff is excellent and engaging, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the art the decorates the rooms and common areas is contemporary and tasteful.

review.title: In the heart of shopping area
review.reviewText: The reception desk personnel had personality and made us feel welcome. The man that delivered our bags was beaming and welling to help us with any needs...including opening our bottle of wine.The hotel staff was extremely helpful and bent over backwards to provide excellent service. The hotel needs a bit of an update in public areas, but it is clean, comfortable and the room large and well appointed. Housekeeping does a great job and room service was quick and the food delicious. We'd stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet was extensive but the alcarte items were limited...I'd love to have fruit but not on the menu.
review.locationRemarks: Just 2 blocks from Union /square and tons of shops made Christmas shopping convenient and fun. The Asian Museum is a short walk and it was excellent.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText:
Very good 4 stars hotel
In the middle of all stores
Excellent breakfast
You need to remove this part from your rating request. I don't want to write anything. I just want to click and send.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Easy access from all freeways. Very close to union square and shopping. Great hotel staff. The restaurant did not record our dinner reservations. All other restaurants were booked, Saturday night, After walking around for half an hour, All we could find was a burger at a small restaurant. I was very disappointed. We usually stay at a hotel on Powell, across from Union square, where we never had problems with the restaurant. I probably won't go back to the Nikko because of this.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant reservations. Be sure to book dinner reservations at another restaurant. If your like me and it's time to eat...., you want to eat.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping

review.title: Very nice hotel with excellent staff.
review.reviewText:
As soon as we entered the valet the staff was professional, friendly and accommodating to our desires. 
We also had a wonderful dinner in the restaurant. Cocktails and food quality was excellent.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located to everything.

review.title: A Plus Stay
review.reviewText: I will be booking this Beautiful Hotel Again, will not stay at any other Hotel in the city,. I have stay at Hotels in the area and none of them compared to Hotel Nikko. I just wish I could have stayed another night.
review.negativeRemarks: The early morning Construction noise.

review.reviewText: Very nice. Excellent location. Would stay there again. Nice bar area.
Comfortable clean food was pricey in hotel but good quality

review.title: Impeccable service
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Five stars being the rule not the exception.
mellow location adjacent Japan Town village row of restaurants. easy parking and access.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Great location in the heart of union square. Great value and very clean. The staff was professional and very helpful.

This hotel has many hidden costs. The food is also substandard and costs too much. The windows let in all the noise from the outside streets.
Disappointed.

review.title: fun experience
review.reviewText: Hotel was located near Union Station near a lot of stores and restaurants.  Unfortunately, the night club was closed, the pool was under reconstruction and the heater was broken our first day.  However, the positives outweighed the negatives.  There was a concierge on premise, the room was clean and comfortable and  in just a few minutes we were near all the stores and Christmas activity.  It was great!!
review.negativeRemarks: seats by the valet entrance downstairs.  rooms could be bigger.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. near department stores and walgreeens.  near great restaurants.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Walking distance to Union square, start of cable cab, Bart train to airport and a lot of good restaurant and breakfast place like Cafe de la pressed or Honey honey creepy etc. Breakfast rate is too high in the hotel 30$ even above 12 years old.

review.title: Outstanding service
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and spacious. Restaurant Anzu was excellent for breakfast. Parking was a bit expensive though.
Loved our stay. The staff was very friendly. Hotel pool is under cinstruction but it will be beautiful once it's done. Great location.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Good experience overall, but we got stuck in one of the elevators, and they didn't come right away. My daughter was scared to leave the room and ride the elevator for the rest of the stay.

review.title: This hotel is a great place to stay near shopping
review.reviewText: Will definitely stay here when I come back to visit..

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: The service, the room, the location. In overall this hotel is excellent.

review.title: Moderately Upscale Hotel Near Union Square
review.reviewText: Built in the 1980s, this well-kept, efficiently run hotel is adjacent to much of the heart of San Francisco: dining, shopping, theaters, and urban transit. While the lobby areas are immaculate and bright, I noticed that some of the furnishings in the rooms show signs of wear--furniture that should be replaced, for example. The members of the staff gave quick and helpful service, and it has a secure feeling in spite of the gritty urban surroundings. I have stayed here before and enjoy returning.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything about the hotel is clean and bright. The reception areas a spacious and welcoming.
review.negativeRemarks: Room furninshings show wear and tear and need to be upgraded.
review.locationRemarks: Super location: a few blocks from good or inexpensive restaurants, the big Market Street shopping centers and major theaters.

review.title: Nice stay.
review.reviewText: Have now tried here, the Hilton and Parc 55.  Will be interesting to see where I end up next year.
review.negativeRemarks:
1.  Draperies were off of the rings in a few spots.
2.  Stain on bedroom carpet.
3.  Ceiling access door in bathroom had flaky paint on the ceiling.
review.locationRemarks:
4.  Bathroom wall was clean, but grout appeared dirty.

I'm being SUPER picky here- perfection is possible and this was VERY close.

review.reviewText: Great location and great hotel. The staff was very friendly. Starbucks is located in the hotel which is very convenient to grab a coffee and breakfast sandwich in the morning. Car rental locations are one block away from hotel which is a benefit if interested in renting a car to explore the other side of Golden Gate Bridge and/or wine country. Also, cabs are very easy to get in front of the hotel.

review.title: Wonderful. Staff very polite accommodating
review.reviewText: The only minus is the pool is undergoing a renovation. Should be beautiful when finished. Will have to plan a return trip

review.title: Will go back next time
review.reviewText:
When you land at SFO, you are slightly confused.  You get on the BART, take it to Powell Station, walk up to the street and feel safe.  You walk one and a half blocks and you are at the hotel Nikko.  Staff friendly and accommodating.  Traditionally handing you the key card with two hands, just like the Japanese culture dictates, its a respect for you the guest.  Rooms were clean except for one blemish on a accent pillow, but the sheets were clean.  The shower was beautiful.  Walls are not paper thin as many other hotels.  

We paid  more per night to stay here versus another hotel...well worth it.

Reputable and safe neighborhood.
 This place is great!

review.title: Perfect hotel for all the shopping
review.reviewText:
Everything was great about this hotel. I liked that there was a hallway and wall that blocked the door from the beds so we never heard anything in the hallway. Staff was very attentive, rooms were clean and free wifi.

The only negative was the bed was too soft. And, room service food was warm, not hot.

review.title: Nice hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Great hotel: staff, room and service were all outstanding

Did not have our reserved room w a king bed so gave us an "upgrade" to club floor room w 2 queens - we were still charged for a king room.  We were supposed to get free upgraded wifi for Expedia gift, but had no way to access it. 2nd night the room next door had a huge loud party. It took 30 min for them to do anything about it. Overall, bad customer service. Won't stay there again.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Very good except that we were disturbed one night at 2am by a group of adults who were banging and kicking the walls and our door.  It woke us up in fright.
review.positiveRemarks: The cleaning staff was very considerate and cleaned our room thoroughly and neatly.
review.negativeRemarks: I believe such rowdy behavior from guests that disturb others past midnight shouldn't even exist.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location.  So accessible .

review.reviewText: Great staff.. highly recommend . We had a great time

review.title: Luxurious stay at an affordable price
review.reviewText: We have stayed in different hotels and of course have paid an arm and a leg! No other hotels have compared with Hotel Nikko. The staff is very professional and helpful. The room was amazing we are a family of 4 and usually it's a tight fit in hotel rooms. Not in this case we were very comfortable and the room looked like it came out of a magazine. We will definitely make hotel Nikko our usual stay when visit SF
Great location, small rooms, staff not always kind, the pool is not in working condition
A great hotel with a wonderful staff. A bit too far from the sights of San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean. The staff was attentive and very friendly.

review.title: Family vaction
review.reviewText: Everything about hotel Nikko was great. The rooms, bathrooms, and staff was all fabulous. Everything was in walking distance and we enjoy our visit. San Francisco was beautiful.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, Chinatown, and lots of shopping.

review.title: be back ASAP
review.reviewText: To much to list happy as can be as I've stayed at The Westine SF The Saint Regis and Four Seasons to name a few. Very happy!!
Really clean room, comfortable bed and the text concierge made things really easy!

photos.caption: 22nd floor bay view imperial deluxe room
Halloween spirit at the lobby area

review.title: Elegant hotel in the heart of downtown San Fran.
review.reviewText:
The hotel has a very modern decoration in consideratin w the rest of the hotels in downtown area. Very close to BArt station and the shopping area. Self parking is not available in the hotel and valet parking is highly expensive like the rest of the hotels and public parkings in the area...($50 for std size cars and $67 for oversize cars).
There are 2 types of breakfast options in the hotel both JApanese and continental. However in my opinion the continental breakfast was not so succesful (i had better breakfast at the Hilton). There is a Starbucks at the hotel's entrance which is a  convenient option.. The snack and beverage alternatives in the room was thoughtful...

review.title: hotel nikko
review.reviewText:
located in union square, central to shopping, restaurants, public transportation.
clean quiet and well staffed. very friendly. always something to do. nice pool, gym and spa.
would recommend a stay there to everyone
review.positiveRemarks: everything, location friendly informed staff, great food
review.negativeRemarks: was satisfied with everything
review.locationRemarks: great restaurants, good and plentiful shows, access to all sections and attractions of the city

review.title: Asian flair great location
review.reviewText:
Great location, near Powell St.
Stayed 4 nights.  Room very clean.
Went w/ 2 other couples, we had smallest room w/ 1 queen luxurious bed, large shower only (no tub), cool sliding frosted glass door - no fan in bathroom :(  . No full length mirror, bathroom had largest mirror. 
Other room had 2 beds, so almost double the size &  had a vanity w/ a large mirror (~ full length).
Hotel staff excellent - wanted extra towel & bathmat(soaked one), they sent up full set of towels & bathmat.
Had view of Old Siam Thai Restaurant, went there last night, excellent.
Brother had breakfast  package for breakfast which he said was very good.,(should be, $30pp)
Hotel also caters to Asian visitors; signage had Japanese(?) as well.
~ 7 minutes to BART/MUNI, convenient to get to SFO airport
review.positiveRemarks:
Location, more upscale, cool lobby. 
6 Elevators, very short wait
Lemon water in lobby BYOGlass
review.negativeRemarks: Stairs near fountain a little dirty where water hits (sounds funny to write that!)
review.locationRemarks:
See above & ~2 blocks from Union Square.
Nearby Restaurants, Walgreens (which sells EVERYTHING: food, including good sushi, wine & liquor!!)

review.title: Nikko Hotel, San Francisco, near Union Square
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel. Friendly staff. Lots of elevators, no never a long wait even from higher floors. Well-equipped exercise room. Unfortunately, swimming pool was closed for renovation work during our stay. 

Good location...convenient to Union Square. Some areas near hotel were a little uncomfortable to walk solo in, but if you move in a different direction, it was fine. Never had a problem, just felt a bit uncomfortable. 

Hotel restaurant is a little pricey, but food is very good.
review.positiveRemarks: Restaurant Anzu. Fitness room. Staff. Daily newspapers available...if you get downstairs early enough.

review.title: Quality and Convenience Make This a Top Choice
review.reviewText: Exceptional hotel. Big enough to offer all that you expect from a first class hotel. Unlike the massive Hilton next door, the Nikko is small enough so you truly feel like a guest and not just one of hundreds of visitors. The property is in great shape. The rooms are well appointed with quality amenities.  I truly enjoyed staying here.

review.title: Hotel is very centrally located to everything.
review.reviewText: Very good customer service, comfortable beds. Very clean. I was very impressed.

review.title: Great travel/tourist hotel
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff, very nice layout. Rooms aren't huge so wouldn't recommend them for families, but for business travel (only a few blocks from fidi) its a solid place.
In the heart of sf union square/shopping area. Beautifulhotel. Nice staff.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Great experience. Would stay here again. Close to everything. Friendly staff and clean rooms. Accommodated our early check/arrival with ease and professionalism.

review.title: Very friendly staff
review.reviewText: We felt very safe the staff was awesome. Very close to shopping and all amenities.

review.title: Nice hotel / SMALL room
review.reviewText: Have stayed at Hotel Nikko before in a standard room which was very nice and spacious. This visit was much different. We were put in a room half the size of a standard room, more like a closet. Very disappointed.

review.title: Great hotel next to all the downtown sites
review.reviewText: Hotel was super comfortable, the bed was so great you didn't want to get out and about.  The staff was very helpful and I can't say a bad thing about the hotel.

review.title: fantastic all around
review.reviewText: This was my second time here and not my last. This will be my go to hotel when in the city. The location is fabulous and has east access in and out for cars and taxis.  It's a big hotel with spacious rooms, fitness center and indoor pool (a real plus when traveling w kids). The rooms are so quiet you wouldn't know union square is buzzing right below you. Staff is friendly, rooms are large and clean, and there is a Starbucks  in the lobby!   Can't beat that!

review.title: Great location...just so-so on everything else
review.reviewText: The location was perfect for me since I was going to a concert at the AT&T park and wanted to do some wandering around union square. The thing that was lame was that EVERYTHING cost extra here and I already paid a good amount of money just for the room. To go to the pool...extra money! Wifi...an added fee. Gym? Yep. You have to pay more. So that was pretty dumb.
review.negativeRemarks: Include fees in the room for everyone. Not just the people staying in the top of the top.

review.title: Located right down town.
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay. The relaxing stay Was wonderful . Definitely worth coming back to stay

review.title: Great Location, good stay
review.reviewText: Really good but short stay. The only thing I can say is that we heard street noise pretty clearly all the way up on the 7th floor through the glass?
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent staff, clean and comfortable room. Great location.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square in SF is the best place to stay in order to explore. Many destinations are walking distance.

review.title: Outstanding!
review.reviewText: I was very impressed by the Imperial room I had. The staff was perfect.  I can't think of a single interaction that wasn't professional,  courteous and customer focused.  I am going back to San Francisco next year and have already booked my room at the Nikko again!

review.title: Beautiful hotel in a convenient downtown location!
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the hotel's location was only about a 5 minute walk from Union Square. My wife and I have traveled extensively over the years, and we've stayed in many nice hotels in international and U.S. locations. However, this hotel is by far the nicest overall in which we've ever stayed.

review.title: A short holiday.
review.reviewText: We were upgraded to a  room on the 19th floor with 2 queen sized beds. The room was very well appointed with lovely bathroom. Very good wi-fi.
review.positiveRemarks: Free coffee making facility in room.
review.negativeRemarks: Difficult to fault.
review.locationRemarks: Great position for shops, restaurants and cable cars.

review.title: Great location, friendly service, nice perks
review.reviewText: Spent a extended weekend at the Nikko, a great home base for exploring San Francisco. Location was convenient to Union Square shopping, the Powell BART station to get everywhere else, the Powell cable car turnaround, many restaurants in Chinatown, Nob Hill and the Financial District if you don't mind walking. (You're in San Francisco. Bring good walking shoes!) Feinstein's at the Nikko was a huge surprise--heard Minnie Driver (actress, singer, songwriter) perform a beautiful set in this very intimate 140 seat cabaret club. Jordan, one of the club team, was very helpful and accommodating. If you splurge on the Imperial Club level rooms, you get a fantastic spread of wine, beer and heavy hors d'oeuvres from 5-7 pm. (Breakfast in the Imperial Club was just okay, though. Probably want to stick to the breakfast in the restaurant.) All the staff were pleasant and professional. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Imperial Club lounge, Feinstein's, staff, decor
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square: shopping and restaurants
Chinatown: snacks and dive bars
Nob Hill: high end cocktails
Financial District: restaurants
review.userLocation: On the road all the time

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Our check in experience was excellent, follow up service from the front desk because we were early outstanding.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square-not far from China Town-Short walk to cable car pick up and hop on hop off buss stops here.

review.title: Great hotel near union square
review.reviewText: Great room. The location near Union square was perfect. The imperial floor was worth the cost.The continental breakfast and afternoon wine, beer and food was really good.The hotel made the trip very enjoyable.
review.negativeRemarks: We got in early and had to wait until 2:00 to get into the room
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: Great corner room 1605 with fantastic city view.
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Great location. I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located. Walking distance to restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Excellent.
review.reviewText:
Overall, I have only positive memories and interactions from staying at this hotel. I came with my good friend - we are both new, young professionals and wanted to "treat" ourselves. Hotel Nikko delivered! It was the perfect choice... Hotel Nikko balances class and marvel with just enough personal touch, which leaves guests feeling valued and delighted. Everyone from housekeeping, front desk, and restaurant staff acknowledged me with sincerity, making me feel valued and offering to help with any issue or question. I also appreciate the special offers via email and the support via text. 

I have already recommended this hotel to several friends, professionals and family members...all who appreciate finer hotels with something "extra special"... The aesthetic beauty of Hotel Nikko is complemented by the excellent staff who make an effort to get to know you if that is what you like. I only wish I had more time to appreciate the other amenities and dining experiences. 

If anything, I think the pool could use some updating however, I noticed a sign that there will be some renovations happening?

Thanks so much, hope to see you again soon, Hotel Nikko.

close to sightseeing spots and shopping area.
I like Bed. I enjoyed good sleeping.I guess memory foam mattless.

review.title: Great location in union square
review.reviewText: Honestly an amazing hotel. The only downside was our floor stay was on the lower levels with no view. Aside from that, management and every single employee was absolutely welcoming. Great hotel, highly recommended

review.title: We had amazing views up over the 15th floor.
review.reviewText: Room seemed small - but view was nice.   Bathrooms 1/3 size of the room itself.   That was nice!  Bedding comfortable and overall ~ we would stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location was pretty good!   Staff checking in, checking out, restaurants, maid service, all great!

review.title: Downtown hotel excellent and well located
review.reviewText: This was an excellent stay to visit San Francisco. Everything positive.  If I have one very small negative, it is that this hotel likes the temperature in the lobby and public areas cooler than our Canadian winters.
review.negativeRemarks: Temperature in the lobby, bar and public areas, it is freezing in there

review.reviewText: It was excellent we have a good time with my wife.
Nice hotel, great view of city, clean and friendly staff

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Very small room, exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. Constantly had problems with room key not working. Hotel within a few minutes walk of union square and tram. Was more disappointed with the area than the hotel. Would stay at Fishermans wharf next time, IF I decided to return.

review.title: A wonderful hotel, not the best neighbourhood.
review.reviewText: A great hotel close to union square. The rooms are clean and well maintained, the staff friendly and helpful. This is a great hotel to stay at but be careful if you're walking from the hotel. Homeless people are plentiful though not aggressive, they will approach you almost as soon as you're outside.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean rooms, friendly helpful staff. Lots of restaurants in the area
review.locationRemarks: The location is close to union square and market street. If you aren't bothered by homeless people the location is great. Don't walk down Turk street.

review.title: Nice and clean hotel in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: Clean spacious room ( Double with 2 queen rooms) , nice spacious bathroom, very comfortable bed , friendly and helpful quick responsive staff!
review.locationRemarks: Location is in the center of San Fransisco

review.title: Just be aware of expenses.
review.reviewText: Parking was expensive but convienent. Location is close to within 2 blocks to all forms of transportation. SF airport was 11.8 miles away.  We had our grandchildren and they loved the pool and the friends they made there in the hotel. Great Vacation and thank you Nikko for great staff and service. oh, they did double charge me 500 for the deposit on the room. They apologized. so just check your receipts and know what you've just been charged. SF Sarcomas Resturante was delicious (Make Reservations)
review.negativeRemarks: hotel parking cost
review.locationRemarks: Went to CA Academy of Science, Alcatraz, Muir Woods, Cable Car Museum, Golden Gate Park, Japanese Gardens, AT&T Park, Golden Gate Bridge, Lombard St..

review.title: Nice location and friendly staff
review.reviewText: We arrived before check in time but were still given a room.  Hotel is smaller than some in Union square which makes it more convenient.  Room was comfortable but on the small side.  Great because there weren't a lot of kids running around.  Would recommend this hotel and would return.

review.title: Great hotel and staff
review.reviewText:
This hotel was in a great location and accessible to many places to go. The staff was very accommodating even upgrading our room due to prolonged wait for our room being ready. The king bed was the most comfortable bed my husband and I have ever slept in! We never ate in the restaurant but had complementary continital breakfast every morning as part of our upgrade as well as beer and wine happy hour in the evening. Those services were not in the main restaurant but in a separate lounge on the 23rd floor. 
We will definitely stay there again if we travel to San Fransisco in the future.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: Great

review.reviewText: Exclusive hotel with walking distance to just about everything.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in perfect location
review.reviewText: The staff here are so wonderful. From the professionalism of the front desk person, to the end of our stay, we never wanted for anything. Stayed on the Executive level and the wine and cheese reception for those floors was amazing. Fully stocked all during the open hours with hot appetizers from the fabulous Japanese restaurant within the Nikko. Being Expedia Gold+ meant we were also treated to free wifi and a full breakfast at the Japanese restaurant Anzu that's within the Nikko. This hotel is within walking distance of numerous shops and restaurants. Right near Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff here are so wonderful. Anzu restaurant within is amazing. Close to all shops, transport and restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was super soft which I understand they are known for, however it wasn't good at all if you've ever had any back issues regrettably.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square for some amazing shopping. Just a cab ride away from AT&T Park. (Around $11) Walking distance of fabulous restaurants

review.reviewText: Great location.  Walking distance to Westfield. Room is clean, comfortable, adequate space.  Nice and soft towels, robes and beddings as one would expect from a 5 stars hotel.  Valet parking was friendly and quick.  Breakfast was good and reasonably priced.  Check in counter was ok staffed.  Just a short wait checking in.

review.title: Good location, overpriced
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great.  However, it was overpriced and too fancy for my taste.  The bathroom door was a sliding glass door that offered no privacy.  The room itself was very small including the bed.  It said it was a queen, but felt more like a full.
review.locationRemarks: Market Street and the Trolley were close by.

review.reviewText: Great staff, awesome rooms and amenities. Rooms aren't massive, which I actually prefer.

review.title: Very small rooms. Carpets and rooms need upgrading
review.reviewText:
Too expensive for such bad rooms. Understand that SF is expensive in Real estate but rooms need upgrading. Especially bathrooms.  
Our checkin girl was annoying. Attitude was really bad. But the rest of the staff during our 4 day stay were very courteous.
Excellent location. Everything is in walking distance.

review.title: Loved our stay
review.reviewText:
We stayed at Hotel Nikko for a week in August and it was such a lovely experience.
As it was our wedding anniversary we were given a complementary upgrade to a King Suite on the 20th floor which was fabulous. The bed was so comfortable and the room amenities were great.
The room and whole hotel was spotlessly clean and the staff were very friendly and accommodating.
We ate in ANZU one evening and the meal was outstanding, our waiter served us to a very high standard.
