I would definitely stay in this hotel if I return to San Francisco, and the location was great.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, in particular the bed and the service
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: The location is great, just off Union Square so lots of shopping and restaurants and very close to the cable cars

review.reviewText: Convenient and close to Union Square, Cable Cars, and the Bart.  Would stay there again.
Great location. Great customer service. Small room. Furnishings could use updating. However, the we were comfortable.

review.title: Comfort and convenience in SC
review.reviewText: Beautiful and comfortable room. Great beds. Great location.

review.title: Worst location ever! Right in Tenderloin! Danger!!
review.reviewText: Worst, scariest location we could have possibly stayed in. Right in the Tenderloin area. Couldn't walk anywhere! Drug dealers, people screaming and fighting. Street lined with homeless people. Saw a woman 1/2 black away with no top on. We were approached by screaming homeless person on drugs just ranting. So scary. No police anywhere. This is a nice hotel in the absolute worst area. Can't believe none of the reviews warned us! Do not stay here. Stay in north beach or somewhere by the bay. So much cleaner and safer. Saw people checking out saying the same thing. We should have done that right away.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: this is a great hotel centrally located with an even better staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. I will stay again for sure. There are a lot of bad and over priced hotels in San Francisco this is one of the good ones.
review.negativeRemarks: Price

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: Really nice experience. Room was comfortable and clean. Staff were excellent. The restaurant was sub-par, but so are most hotel restaurants. The Eastern aesthetic, with lots of cold marble, was not my cup of tea, but overall good experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant. Below mediocre sushi yet extremely expensive.
review.locationRemarks: That area of town is crazy - luxury hotels next to hostels and homeless shelters. That's Union Square, though. A real mixed bag.

review.title: My home away from home
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Nikko is my go to in SF. Central to getting anywhere quickly, but a quiet modern oasis. I always know I will get a great nights rest. 

The staff, always helpful, friendly and prompt on the rare instance I need something.

Great hotel in a convenient location. Staff is very nice and helpful. The room is comfortable and clean. There is a Starbucks at the ground level. It is very easy to walk to sights (2 blocks to cable car), shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Nice but $50/day for parking
review.reviewText: The hotel was overall what we expected - clean-ish, comfortable and close to the areas we wanted to visit. The staff were friendly and the amenities were nice. However, be aware of the $50+ a day parking fee!! For a hotel that charges the fee it does for nightly stays, we were pretty shocked to find that charge for parking. It's a selfish way to make money off of guests in an establishment that already comes with a hefty charge. I'm not sure how comparable it was to the area but that charge alone would prevent us from staying there again.

Great location, and extremely comfortable room. They were replacing the outside area of the gym and pool on the 5th floor so there was construction workers around, but they should be gone soon when work is complete.
review.positiveRemarks: Treated guests like they were paying a lot for their room

review.title: Great Union Square location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with an excellent restaurant in a wonderful location 2 blocks from Union Square.  Also has a Starbucks in the lower level.  Nice rooms, attentive staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Upscale, clean and bright in A+ location!

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: I would return for just the comfortable mattress and the great shower.  The standard room was a little smaller than usual, but not cramped.  The decor was attractive and it had everything we needed.  The free wi-fi was inconsistent but I chose not to pay for the high speed upgrade.  The location was close to shopping and restaurants as well as public transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: The housekeepers were a little casual about cleaning up - things like leaving used paper coffee cups and not washing used glasses.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square with lots of shopping and restaurants; cable car line was nearby; the concierges were helpful with navigation tips.

review.title: Excellent friendly staff. Central location.
review.reviewText: Quicklly moved us to another room on our second night even when inspection for suspected bed bugs proved the room to be clean, for our peace of mind.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, only here one night, but enjoyed the location to union square,  and china town gate. Great choice of restaurants closeby. Starbucks in hotel entrance was also great. The hotel concierge arranged transportation to OAK airport since the BART bay tunnel was closed for repairs. BART station and cable cars are only a block or two away.
review.positiveRemarks: The room, lobby very nice, and upscale.

review.title: Best hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: We stay 3 nights celebrating birthday, excellent staff, best location, nice rooms. Very recommended .

review.title: Hotel nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: Was supposed to have room with queen bed. Bed was barely size of double bed. Room was next door to elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: More helpful concierge the lady was very helpful, man was not.
review.locationRemarks: Near cable car line

review.title: Nice hotel. Expensive but nice
review.reviewText: Lots of construction going on around the pool/spa area.  Would of probably done that on a less busier month.    Excellent food. Helpful staff. We will return again next year

review.title: Wouldn't allow early check-in
review.reviewText:
Overall the stay was mediocre.  Definitely not as nice advertised and located in an absolutely terrible part of San Francisco.  The tenderloin district is no joke.  It's a dangerous area with an out of control homeless problem.

I was very frustrated that I wasn't able to check-in early.  I've never had a problem getting to a hotel an hour or two before check-in time until now.  They said they would call me when a room was available, but when I went to check again at check-in time they had a room available without hesitation, so there was obviously something open and they just didn't contact me.
review.locationRemarks: Terrible terrible location.

review.title: Perfect Location.  Luxury through and through
review.reviewText: Big Thank you to Charlene at the front desk.  Also Steffan at the front desk.  And the bellman Andrew was also awesome.  I visited San Francisco to see my friend perform in a show.  I debated whether or not to lay out a lot of money for this hotel or save some money and stay in a hostel.  LOL.  Not even a question...This hotel is perfection...there is not one aspect of this place I can criticize.  The staff, the room, the amenities...perfect stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was beautiful, the bed was beyond comfortable....
review.negativeRemarks: the only problem is I don't live here
review.locationRemarks: Union square, rent a bike, go see some theatre! Glengarry Glenross opens soon and this weekend Picasso at the Lapine Agile closes August 2 2015.

review.title: Excellent hotel in the middle of Union Square.
review.reviewText: We thought this was an excellent hotel in the middle of Union Square. Pretty close to just about everything you need in the city. The hotel/room was very clean. We thought the bathroom was huge for a hotel in San Francisco. Staff was friendly, helpful, and very accommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: Great city location. The hotel was very clean. The deluxe room was very clean, quite, and a good size for two adults one child. Staff was perfect.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks away from the Powell Street trolley & Westfield mall. Rent a car & parking garage across the street. Catch a Giants game only one mile away.

review.title: Rooms are small for the price
review.reviewText: When we arrived at the hotel and checked into the Queen studio which was really small considering the price per night we paid. I complained and they gave us a $20/night upgrade to a regular sized king room which was really nice and clean. After the upgrade, we really enjoyed our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size for price
review.locationRemarks: Walk to the ferry building, walk to the BART which can get you to and from the airport for cheaper than a taxi, walk to the streetcar or cable car.

review.title: 2nd stay at Hotel Nikko and will be back!
review.reviewText: My family and I enjoyed our stay here. The location is excellent if you like being in Union Square. The walk to the Powell Street turnaround and BART is short and the hotel is surrounded by a lot of great, high-rated on Yelp restaurants and cafes. We prefer the bigger chain hotels with plush upgrades and amenities as opposed to the old, boutique hotels though. We were lucky to get a great rate through Expedia.
review.positiveRemarks: The climate control in the room is OUTSTANDING! The air conditioning was quiet and made the room so comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Better pricing on overnight parking fees for hotel guests
review.locationRemarks: The location is excellent if you like being in Union Square. The walk to the Powell Street turnaround and BART is short and the hotel is surrounded by

review.title: Nice hotel in the city near everything
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Good location. Only complaint is small but really bugged me. In order to use the business center you have to use a credit card. If you want to go online and print airline tickets it will cost you. Seems like a cheap move from a classy hotel.

photos.caption: Restroom w/ in mirror TV and Tub
Stand Alone Shower in addition to tub

review.title: Nikko Hotel Just Lovely
review.reviewText: I reserved my room here through Expedia as a VIP+ reservation utilizing Expedia rewards and taking advantage of double value for my points.  When I arrived, the room I had reserved, The Nikko Club Room had been sold out, so they upgraded me to a Nikko Floor Suite which was a superb corner suite with a beautiful view of the city.  The room was clean and very spacious.  The staff was professional and very friendly.  They allowed me extra time to check out without charging me, which helped out considering I had just finished running the SF Marathon so the extra time to recoup was much needed.  I had mentioned this to them when I checked in and they were very accommodating.  I didn't get a chance to try the pool or fitness center, but I did enjoy complimentary continental breakfast which was more than plenty to get me going in the morning.  Thank you Hotel Nikko.  I will be back.
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of Union Square with plenty of shopping and restaurants.  Restaurants can be pricey however.

review.title: Hotel in Excellent location downtown San Fran
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was very well located close to all major attractions in San Fran. We walked easily to Chinatown, Little Italy and the Ferry Marketplace. Very doable to walk to Fisherman's Wharf in you are in good shape and take the Cable Car back to Union Square. Had a great time. Hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. Starbucks downstairs was a great plus!

review.title: Comfortable room, excellent service, great food!
review.reviewText: I was there for three days during an on-site conference.  For the conference the staff was excellent, prompt, and professional.  The food that was served, prepared on-site, was very very good.  Conference facilities were modern, clean and well equipped.  From the overnight perspective my room was very spacious.  The bathroom was clean, enjoying both a tub and separate shower. Bed was very cozy, slept extremely well. I had a flight delay and arrived much later than they had expected.  I was marked for early check-in at noon, but did not arrive until 7:30pm.  I was offered a free upgrade from my standard room to a king suite, and was given access to the business class level floor for their Imperial Lounge offering free breakfast and daily happy hour.  Needless to say you "won me at Hello".  Was a very pleasant surprise after a long day of travel and very generous offer.  The next time I find myself in San Francisco I will return to the Nikko Hotel!  Great job Nikko family!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, modern decor, great food and staff, convenient location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great location!!! Dining and shopping within blocks. Club floor beautiful... Continental breakfast and daily wine and appies from 5-7pm...nice perk
Only downside was housekeeping... Room not cleaned properly.. Empty bottles left behind... Just think could of been better
Long check in and check out lines

review.title: Excellent locations, friendly and attentive staff.
review.reviewText: Great location for tourists to SF.  The restaurant was also excellent with very good sushi and a high calibre menu.
review.locationRemarks: Local to Union Square and China town.  Easy reach of bus and trams to the piers and to the GG park

review.title: Great Location, Clean Hotel, Polite Staff
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel, at a great location, close to almost everything you need in San Francisco. Very close to Market St. for train to airport, and all sort of department stores, mall, China Town, etc.
Extremely helpful and polite staff and concierge service. Just book with them whatever you need: car rental, tour, or even if you want to have a  nice breakfast.
Good location, staff helpful when enquiring about travelling around the city! Disappointing you have to pay extra for leisure facilities and wifi!

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a great location if you don't want to rent a car. We took the Bart in from the airport then either walked to our destination, rode the cable cars or took a tour. There is a Starbucks, mall and many great restaurants within a few blocks. Bonus - it was very hot when we went and this hotel has air conditioning. It's also nice to be able to have the windows closed so you don't hear street noise. Book early and prices are reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: Be able to "opt out" of the courtesy bar. Then you don't have to worry about being charged outrageous prices for items in it.
review.locationRemarks: Cable cars, mall, Union Square, China Town all within walking distance. We even walked to Little Italy and took the cable cars back.

review.title: Great hotel, fantastic location for central SF
review.reviewText: Brilliant time in San Francisco.  Hotel Nikko was just as we needed it to be - convenient, not too expensive, clean and quiet

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel that's close to Union Square and Market shopping stores.  Room staff went beyond their service by putting the roses I gave to my gf in a vase.

review.title: Nice hotel great location
review.reviewText: Warm and courteous staff nice rooms and very well situated near Union Square and Chinatown. In the center of all the action!

review.title: Good value and location.
review.reviewText: We found the hotel to be clean and well maintained. The staff was courteous and helpful. The proximity to Union Sq. was also very good. Our only complaint would be the extra charges for the pool and computer access. However, we would recommend the hotel to anyone planning a vacation to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Eliminate some of the extra fees.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for tourist sites.

review.title: Bedroom
review.reviewText: It was a very nice hotel to stay at but I did not like that you did not have a closed door to the bathroom, you only had a sliding door and you could hear people go the bathroom.  I know you were just trying to make the room look classy with the sliding bathroom door but I did not like it.  We did not like hearing people go to the bathroom.  Privacy would be nice.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to stores and the cable car
review.negativeRemarks: Change the sliding bathroom door and fan in the bathroom.  We did not see a switch for the fan in the bathroom for when the mirrors got misty.

review.title: Nice hotel can walk to everything
review.reviewText: Family of 7 had a great time at hotel. Will stay here next year.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were great. Check in was smooth, directions to transportation was accurate, door man was so very nice all the time, great parking attendants.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car, shopping, and the F trolley car made getting around with 4 grand children easy.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Surprisingly poor hospitality considering the four-star price.
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms were comfortable and clean
review.negativeRemarks: The pool was in need of a cleaning and update. The staff should be far more accommodating and caring. Very cold reception.
review.locationRemarks: On the edge of Union Square -- lots of tourists and homeless.

review.reviewText: Easy check in. Lovely room. Great service from all staff.
Great customer service. The only thing I was a little taken back by was the additional charge to use the gym.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: We had a great couple of days here, right from check in until we checked out it was great
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, modern hotel and rooms. Great buffet breakfast and dinner restaurant on site.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Location by Union Square is good. Plenty of things nearby although San Fran is a typical big city with homeless people everywhere.

review.reviewText: Great relaxing stay close to everything. Lobby is beautiful.
review.positiveRemarks: Really loved the show (drums) on Friday night and appreciated the complimentary wine. I hung out each evening in the lobby because it is so peaceful.
review.negativeRemarks: Have front desk staff advise you when checking in about the show.

review.title: Very comfy...
review.reviewText: Stayed here as a second hotel on our honeymoon trip.
review.positiveRemarks: Insanely comfy beds, great indoor pool, friendly and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The wifi is barely works, forcing you to pay for an upgrade. Street noises are super loud, so try to get an avoid a room on the main strip.

review.title: Sleek hotel
review.reviewText: This a modern but inviting hotel. There is some street noise, but did not hear any noise from hallway or other rooms. The breakfast buffet is excellent, but pricey. The staff was very friendly. I would go back.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: Great stay good location helpful staff. Very satisfied.

review.title: OK hotel in the heart of downtown
review.reviewText: Hotel was OK. They make this place sound fancier than it really is. Conditions are definitely livable with some decent views of the downtown skyline. Most attractions are within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is silent and good for relaxing.
review.negativeRemarks: More facilities. We really wanted a airport pickup shuttle considering how expensive this place is.
review.locationRemarks: Typical downtown SF stuff. There are several rental car agencies and tour bus points within walking distance.

review.reviewText: I was guaranteed an early check in by both Nikko and Expedia. I was refused early check in unless I upgraded my room to a more expensive room

review.title: Nice.   Close to everything!
review.reviewText: Great for business travel.   Has a starbucks on the bottom floor and the room was excellent.
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent.   Close to all the business centers.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel near union square although it is at the edge of the terrible tenderloin district. But that's just San Francisco

review.title: great hotel - loved everything about it
review.reviewText: Great hotel - loved everything about it.  Close to everything -- right down the block from the trolley.  Starbucks on the corner.
review.negativeRemarks: Only negative is that they charge you to use their gym.
review.locationRemarks: See above

review.title: Nice time
review.reviewText: Great location, very nice facilities and the staff was very helpful.

review.title: Everything costs extra
review.reviewText: Be prepared to pay for everything if you are staying at the Nikko.  The price seemed reasonable for a hotel of this quality but that's because everything little things costs big dollars and it adds up.  Also, although close to union square it's also pretty shady around the hotel.  Wouldn't recommend going there with kids or roaming around too late at night.   The hotel was nice, staff were very nice and the room and facilities were also nice.  Just lots of extra fees everywhere.

review.title: This hotel is a joke for being a VIP hotel
review.reviewText:
I booked this hotel because of my previous pleasant experience with Expedia VIP hotels, but this hotel is a joke for being on the list of VIP hotels - being an Expedia Elite, you need to pay $25 to use the gym(where's the "exclusive amenities" that the VIP hotels promised?), and I can't say our "upgraded" room is even mid-sized, and the room's interior is quite unimpressive.

I would never return to this hotel, it doesn't justify its price, and it's a shame for the whole VIP hotel list.

review.title: excellent downtown hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed here for a long weekend recently. We had a very comfortable room with a spectacular view. The room itself was well-furnished--sofa, desk and chair, and the bathroom well-appointed  (with a separate room for toilet). It happened that we arrived during Pride weekend immediately after the Supreme Court’s ruling on gay marriage. The city was in a very celebratory mood-the parade was only a few blocks away--but the hotel handled it with ease. We were pleased with our brunch in the hotel restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: the front desk is pokey. the staff is friendly but oblivious to the line of number of people waiting to be served
review.locationRemarks: very close to shopping; easy access to BART.

review.title: Better than expected...perfect San Fran experience
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Nikko on the 20th floor ("Nikko Floor"). Upon arrival, we asked for two queen beds, instead of a king, and they changed our reservation with no problem at all. We were totally impressed by our large, spacious room with an INCREDIBLE city view. We were pleasantly surprised to find a very large, modern bathroom with a tub separate from the shower. Beds were super soft, and comfortable; we slept like babies with minimal noise from the city/other guests. Hotel Nikko is situated nicely with the perfect amount of distance from Union Square and the BART. Very short walk to the F-train (trolley), bus stops, and cable cars. We walked to Chinatown. Housekeeping cleaned our room twice a day and even left chocolates on our pillows. Room was immaculate the entire stay!!! All in all, we will definitely stay here again, on our next trip to this amazing city. I highly recommend this hotel!
review.negativeRemarks: There is no hand soap in the bathroom; that was our only true inconvenience. We had to buy hand soap at Walgreens.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Westfield Center, cable cars, close to Big Bus stop, Chinatown, restaurants, shopping, public transit.

review.title: Location location location
review.reviewText: Location is excellent. Everything is close by! Rooms were clean. Beds were comfortable.

review.title: nice japanese hotel close to union square
review.reviewText:
i expected more. the facility is getting old. i hope they will do some renovation.

i saw someone else's hair on the desk, in the bathroom, etc. they need to clean up harder and more carefully.
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: shopping, dining, walking, entertainment.

review.title: Great Location and super people
review.reviewText:
I stayed 10 days in the Nikko.  Good location with tons of restaurants in walking distance.  Great, friendly staff.
Parking is expensive but there is a public garage across the street and 5 Rental car companies on the same block.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of Restaurants within walking distance

review.title: Excellent hotel location
review.reviewText: The room was perfect, the bed and pillows were the most comfortable I've ever experienced, the staff extremely courteous and accommodating! Excellent hotel! Right in the heart of the city! Everything is 2 steps away!

review.title: Great location and super comfortable beds!
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our recent stay at Hotel Nikko. The location was perfect for us. We walked many places and used Uber for everything else. The trolley stop was literally across the street which was also great to ride to Lombard street. Hotel staff was super accommodating. Expedia had actually over booked us when we got there but the staff honored out request for our king bed. The concierge at the hotel was SUPERB!!!!

review.title: Nice high end hotel
review.reviewText: Worth the price, clean, and friendly staff.  Close to union square and other tourist and traveler attractions.

review.title: Nice hotel in a central location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel with great ameneties. My only complaint is that on our 2nd night a member of staff knocked on the door while I was in the shower. When I didn't respond he entered the room as i was exiting the shower. He brought towels but was supposed to take them to the room next door. It was a little awkward. Despite this, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the hotel and would still recommend it to others.

review.title: Clean, Friendly Hotel in the heart of San Fran.
review.reviewText: Spacious and clean rooms, friendly staff, nice environment that's a good mix of family-friendly and upscale, warm pool, and a great location!

Convenient and excellent customer service!  The staff is wonderful at this hotel and I've never slept in a more comfortable bed and the best thing is having a sauna and a steam room open 24 hours- I love that it was so convenient when I was in meetings all day long to come back and have a great sushi dinner around the corner (sushi boat) and then head to the hotel for sauna and steam room until the wee hours !

review.title: Good Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: Just a solid hotel in San Francisco.  Good value.  Good location.  Particularly a good business hotel...
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is way too expensive
review.locationRemarks: In Union Square so it's convenient

review.title: Very clean and friendly
review.reviewText: I stayed for 3 nights in an Imperial Club Room. The rooms are very clean and spacious, free WiFi, an in-room thermostat (very important), and complimentary breakfast every morning. The staff and doormen are very friendly - it's expected but should not be underappreciated! I especially liked the fact that not everyone has access to the top floors from the elevators without the proper room card. I picked this hotel mainly because it's very close to major transportation and also because of the reviews of how clean it is - which it really is. I will definitely be returning :)
review.positiveRemarks: Imperial Club floors need room card to gain access to the top floors from the elevators - no concern of trespassors.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed here for our summer vacation and chose this hotel almost totally because of a great deal Expedia offered.  Now that we've stayed, we couldn't be happier.  The hotel is near tons of things to do and unlike many other budget hotels I've stayed in, this place was immaculate.

review.title: I would go the again A++
review.reviewText: VERY nice staff. Close to all transportation. Walking distance to Union Square. Starbucks connected to the hotel.

review.title: Fair to good.
review.reviewText: They charge $25 to use the gym!!!! Disappointed that this wasn't 'advertised' before I arrived.
Hotel staff is good and very helpful. Concierge team has a good understanding of the surroundings.
review.negativeRemarks: Location set  me off. Secondly for the amount of money is charged i think at the minimum Hotel should provide a shuttle service to the Airport.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is a plus.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean room and a comfortable bed. Staff was very courteous. Next time I vacation in SF, I will stay on the Wharf but only to be closer to tourist attractions. Good hotel, just not in the best location for me and my family when on vacation.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and Hop On Hop Off bus tours. Getting to Fisherman's Wharf was a pain via cable car, so we used city buses instead.

review.title: Downtown is terrible
review.reviewText: The street scene of panhandlers, homeless, and drug dealing is terrible.  It's right outside throat door and not a comfortable experience.  Elsewhere in the city is much better.  Avoid this place!

review.title: Beautiful Hotel but expensive
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko had a great lobby/ main floor with very friendly staff. The King sized bed - deluxe room was fine but I expected more for the price. Sound proofing between floors/rooms needs to be improved. We were on the 6th floor above the fitness centre (5th floor) and could hear the treadmills and dropped weights every morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Great lobby and Fitness centre. Very helpful/friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Lower price and better soundproofing.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to Union Square and lots of shopping.

review.title: Chose it for a business visit and fits the budget
review.reviewText: Chose it for a visit in June. Was put up on the 21st floor. The facilities are wonderful. The aesthetics are nice too (for me and my wife). Very close to Market St. Has some decent places to pick up food from. The best part was the early check in they allowed. They let me check in at 11:30 because I was transferring from another hotel 2 blocks down.

review.title: Pleasant enough but I expected more
review.reviewText: Very helpful staff. Gym and pool amenities excellent. We had booked a deluxe room and I have to say it was a bit disappointing. Felt very tired. Had to ask for clean towels and for someone to fix broken wardrobe door but staff responded quickly and positively. The bar was good, with great we serice, but shut three out of our five nights. Be wary of the location.  Great for Union Square but only two blocks the other way you are into Tenderloin which was not recommended late at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms really need revamping.
review.locationRemarks: Very central but need to be careful around the Tenderloin.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location. Easy walk to shops and restaurants. Only thing I didn't like is they charge you a few for using their gym. As much as we pay to stay there, you would think the gym would be free.

review.title: Prime location in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights for self-guided tour around San Francisco.  Hotel Nikko is of very good quality and provided us a comfortable stay in SF.  Although, the price was a bit high, it's service and quality matched what it asked for.
review.positiveRemarks: Good quality service, comfortable, secured, prime location.
review.negativeRemarks: I can't think of any.  Perhaps, offer me discount for next stay?
review.locationRemarks: Plenty of shops and restaurants near by.  A model hotel location for city strollers.

review.title: Anniversary Vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel is very up-scale, super-friendly staff, made us feel very special. Nice views from our 19th floor room. We were in a petite queen - it was a little smaller than usual, but not an issue for the two of us.
review.positiveRemarks: Great place in Union Square area. Three block walk to the Bart and Cable-cars.
review.negativeRemarks: We could hear a toilet flush from one of the rooms around us, from above us, I think. The TV (widescreen 46 in) was great, but it kept freezing.
review.locationRemarks: Tons of shopping, great restaurants. Try Honey Honey (3 blocks away) for any meal - GREAT food!

review.title: Excellent except for Internet access.
review.reviewText: This an excellent hotel with brilliant customer service in a central location in San Francisco close to transport and rental cars.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for Internet access which was unreliable and slower than that available from Starbucks for free next door was disappointing.

review.reviewText: Overnight - short stay.  Unobtrusive staff but good and prompt.

review.title: Nice location for the center of the city
review.reviewText: Everything is great except someone made a mistake to put us into a disabled access room, which we didn't request for. It was a BIG inconvenience for the shower. We feel bad for whoever has to clean it afterwards. Other than that, it's a nice clean hotel in the center of the city.

review.title: Great experience
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived at this hotel it was clear that we were going to have a great time staying here. We will definitely highly recommend this hotel as they can not do enough for you to make your stay great. Thanks

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: Great location. Close to Union square, financial district, at&t stadium

review.title: Good location and nice service
review.reviewText: This hotel is near the Union Square. So we could use cable cars and buses easily. The staff were very friendly. I changed the room because I didn't realize that I booked only one bed for three adults. They were very nice, and concierge was very helpful as well. They also stored our baggage while we were sight-seeing San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and their service.
review.negativeRemarks: Their info (transportation) had wrong one, though only minor. They told us to get bus #38 in front of Jack in the box, but it was wrong.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car Powell line goes near by. Bart station, bus stops, and many Department stores are in walking distance.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: LOVE THIS HOTEL STAYED HERE THREE TIMES NOW, LOVE THE FRIENDLY STAFF, ALSO THE HOTEL HAS WHAT WE WANT LOVELY ROOMS. GOT A GREAT POOL WITH SPA AND GOOD GYM ALSO THE HOTEL IS GOOD AS WALKING DISTANCE TO SHOPS AND CHINA TOWN, TRAIN STATION AND MUCH MORE. THE STAFF ARE SO HELPFUL WHICH MAKES A BIG DIFFERENCE I WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN
review.positiveRemarks: THE ROOMS ARE LOVELY VERY CLEAN. LOVE THE POOL AND SPA AND MY HUSBAND LOVES THE GYM, ALSO THAT EVERYTHING IS WALKING DISTANCE
review.negativeRemarks: FREE WIFI
review.locationRemarks: CHINA TOWN,GREAT SHOPPING, RAILWAY STATION AND THE TRAMS

review.title: Great hotel highly recommend
review.reviewText: Just a great serene place to stay. Near all activities and fabulous restaurants.
review.positiveRemarks: hotel staff and very well kept

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: This was an amazing hotel. It was close to everything and the staff was very nice and accommodating. The  only negative feedback I have is, when I asked for a car service to the airport I was told it was $105. I was not informed until the next day by the bellman that an in-house vehicle was available for a $50 flat fee. Maybe I asked the wrong question, but I feel like it should have been mentioned.
review.locationRemarks:
Union Square
Macy's
Cafe Mason- Affordable quality option for breakfast!

review.title: Excellent!
review.reviewText:
What a great place to stay!  I will make this my hotel of choice when staying in San Francisco  

Great staff, super clean rooms, great decorating!!  The best location!!

review.title: Great location !
review.reviewText: The hotel was in the perfect spot! Super close to the cable car stops , shops and restaurants. And about a 15 cable car ride down to fishermans wharft ! The hotel was clean, they did an amazing job and cleaning the rooms in the morning and then even came back in the afternoon quick to make the beds nicely and place little chocolates on the pillows! Would definitely recommend it to anyone :D

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice and within walking distance to a few attractions. It's also very close to all public transportation. The only thing I did not like was how many bums hung around outside the hotel asking for money.
very nice hotel and friendly staff.....................

review.title: It was a very nice hotel
review.reviewText: It was a very nice hotel and I would recommend to others

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything
review.reviewText:
Great hotel- only comment is that there seem to be some confusion on the day of our checkout
We came back from breakfast at 10.20am and someone was already cleaning our room throwing away some of our snacks! This was strange as all our belongings were still in the room and I actually left the do not disturb sign on the door.

review.title: Great location but rooms are in need of an update.
review.reviewText: We paid for wifi and was told we can connect up to 6 devices. However, the speed is so slow, it took forever to just retrieve emails. Front office staff were friendly but not very efficient. It took long time for every single request to be processed.

review.title: Hotel in centre
review.reviewText: Upgraded and can recommend this hotel very good all round
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Shopping

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Premium big format luxury hotel right in the middle of San Francisco's shopping district. Great staff and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept on! Wifi was super fast but is an extra charge with standard rooms.

review.title: Awesome retreat in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent place to stay in the heart of San Francisco well located excellent staff and beautiful modern decor. I will definitely return here

The hotel is clean and nice to stay.  It is close to everything if you plan to tour around city of San Francisco.  After you checked in, they will give you a map and a booklet that guide you through the main attractions in the city, which is definitely a plus.

We loved the accommodations, the hotel was in a good location, the staff was helpful, and the rooms were very comfortable and clean. The bathroom was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. We plan on using the facilities again.
review.positiveRemarks: Location close to transportation and restuarants and it was clean, comfortable and modern.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet and gym should be included in the charge for a room.
review.locationRemarks: American theatre is nearby as well as many good restuarants. You are located close to Bart, and the cable car and bus routes to take you anywhere.

review.reviewText: Very close to union square and downtown. the room was very clean andI would recommend this hotel to other travelers.

review.title: Clean room nice view
review.reviewText: I had a nice short stay when I flew in SF for an event. The room is clean, bright and updated. The friendly receptionist kindly suggested and booked airport shuttle that took about 25 minutes to SFO on early Sunday morning.
review.negativeRemarks: My stay was too short to notice any
review.locationRemarks: Close to theaters, Union Square shopping, Chinatown.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was fine. Excellent breakfast, comfortable bed, rapid elevator, big swimming pool, made big fun of our short vacation
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, location, health club, restaurant, everything
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Heart of San Francisco, pleasure to walk to major attractions

review.title: Nice clean hotel near Union square
review.reviewText: Staffs were very pleasant & respectful. I had a very clean & comfortable room with city view.  I was very happy with my pick.
review.negativeRemarks: N/A
review.locationRemarks: It only few minutes walk to major shopping malls and restaurants. Walkable to many attractions too.

review.title: Perfect atmosphere, cleanliness, staff, location!
review.reviewText:
Our stay was perfect.  We had two rooms as it was for a family celebration.  Everything we requested was done without hesitation.   
The entire staff we encountered was extremely pleasant and very friendly.
Cleanliness is extremely important to us. We were pleased in every aspect.  The hotel nor the rooms had any "hotel scent". 
The decor is outstanding. Relaxing, modern and posh.  Flowers everywhere.
The pool area was spotless.  The water temperature was important to us, our ten month old granddaughter was very comfortable. We only left the pool because of our schedule not due to temp.
The morning buffet is recommended -- variety, service, quality.
We will recommend this hotel(chain)to our family and friends.
All in all we will visit the  Nikko again!
review.positiveRemarks:
We wanted to take the beds home! 
The rooms were quiet - no outside/hallway noise.
 Also the shower--roomy, the flow selector had many choices
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing to add at this time
review.locationRemarks: In the heart of the city. Walking distance to many activities.

review.title: Doesn't  deserve  half what i payed  for it
review.reviewText:
The worst decision  on my trip was to stay at nikko  hotel.  Almost 350$ per night for nothing. Half king bed for 2 person no facilities at all included not even wifi. Very small  room. No view just stuffed  between building. Small shower , no tub no bidet .
The only positive  is the location close to business district and shopping

review.title: Very modern hotel
review.reviewText: Very pretty and modern hotel.  It had a small room for a deluxe King.  And it ended up being further away from attractions that we spent our days enjoying.  Breakfast would have cost us $60/day extra.  So we walked across the street each morning and had a fantastic breakfast at Lori's Diner on Mason Street.  We were also chased down by a homeless person while trying to catch a taxi.  He kept screaming, "I'm sane, I'm sane, I'm sane", and I had to jump into a taxi as he ran right at me and my husband.  Honestly it was hard to walk around this area without bumping into panhandlers and homeless.  Most were cordial and didn't push too much on their requests for money, except for that guy.  We didn't get a good deal on this room.  And will probably go for the Hyatt or Hilton next time that is closer to attractions and less expensive.  Especially since we are the type that spend very little time in our hotel room.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly and the hotel was clean and modern.
review.negativeRemarks: After paying close to $400/night, we really expected to get something (like breakfast) at no additional cost.
review.locationRemarks: We needed a better location.  Too far for us on Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf.  But very close to Union Square.

review.reviewText: I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Nikko in San Francisco. The check-in process was quick and the front desk staff were welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable about the area. My room was comfortable, clean and modern. The bed was comfortable and the view spectacular. The hotel was centrally located and close to many amenities including restaurants, shopping and public transit. The concierges were very helpful in planning excursions.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the staff and the facilities.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was located in a great shopping and entertainment area.

review.reviewText: The hotel is very clean, comfortable and in a great location. Staff is excellent.

review.title: Good business hotel, especially if you are Japanes
review.reviewText: Took my kids here for a fun overnight - they loved how classy the hotel was. Nice pool and hot tub, great room service.
review.positiveRemarks: Pool, Hot tub, and Fitness Center.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant with American food.
review.locationRemarks: It's in SF. I could go on and on.

review.title: quite a lot of additional charge eg ex room
review.reviewText: quite a lot of additional charge such as exercise room, wireless internet. staff are quite helpful, center of union square that would not worry no where to eat, the mattress is way too soft (flimsy),

Nice hotel,good local. Hotel arranged for me to take an early morning van to airport, confirmed the ride time and expense and in morning van operation failed to arrive stating that they don't start so early. Result my cost to airport 3 times what I expected to get a taxi!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive wifi internet compared with tethering to an iPhone
review.locationRemarks: Good local for shopping and sightseeing

review.title: Felt like a tourist cash dispenser.
review.reviewText:
Issues as a list.
1.  Fixed shower head didn't work. 
2.  Sink blocked.
3.  Terrible one cup coffee machine, with only minimal coffee packs (one each).
4.  Ridiculous mini bar charges.
5.  The gourmet restaurant brought two courses at once and forgot I was on a wine pairing menu,  so at on time
 I had two dishes to eat and two glasses of wine to drink (the wine came after prompting, so two glasses late and together!
6.  In the same 'gourmet' restaurant I had five courses in under an hour!  I have never felt so Pressured to eat and drink in my life.
7.  Had to pay for wife above the room cost.
8.  I related these issues to the receptionist the next morning-she shrugged her shoulders and said that she hoped I had a better stay next time!
The feeling was that They wanted me in pump as much cash out of me as possible and never see me again.  The staff were polite and nice enough but clearly didn't believe in the idea of a quality hotel.
review.positiveRemarks:
Room was immaculately laid out.
Food was tasty.
review.negativeRemarks: The customer experience - there wasn't one. As I said I flet Un valued.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location for Union Square.

review.reviewText: We loved this hotel. Great location,  excellent staff.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Location is close to great restaurants and wonderful shops.  Homeless population is much greater though than other hotels closer to Union Square.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to everything
review.reviewText:
-Nice hotel
-Great location
-Walking distance to most tourist attractions 
-typical downtown hotel...expensive parking, everything costs extra (wifi, amenities  access, etc)

review.title: Excellent location all around!
review.reviewText: After a horrible air transportation to San Fransico we were hesitant about our hotel, but when we walked in.........WOW! Such a beautiful hotel and warm, friendly and courteous staff! Our room was an even better experience. Bed was very comfortable. Highly recommend this hotel. Oh, I didn't mention the swimming pool and jacuzzi. Icing on the cake!

review.title: great hotel in the middle of downtown SF
review.reviewText: everything was great, only complaint is the food and drinks at the hotel are pretty pricey, but that's the price you pay for luxury
review.positiveRemarks: the location is very convenient, central to everything in downtown
review.negativeRemarks: how about some free water in the rooms?  they charge $6 for a small bottle of water
review.locationRemarks: the location is near the business district, Chinatown, the antique shops in the neighborhood and Market Street

review.reviewText: I had an average experience, nothing more to say.
review.locationRemarks: excellent location

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Our fourth stay. Really like the staff, location. Bell and front desk people are wonderful.

review.title: Everything is great
review.reviewText: Everything is great here. good staff and good valet parking. we also have welcome chocolate every night. Valet parking is very convenient.
everything is a charge-hotel needs to open up their workout room too all, not just those who pay extra.
Staff was awesome and helpful. And the location was great

review.title: Always love the Nikko
review.reviewText: I get to SFO every few months and I like to stay near Union Square.  I bounce around based upon the rates (which can vary widely), but when it is available I always choose the Nikko first.  This is a great hotel in a great location.  The staff are friendly and competent, and the rooms are nice.  My experience with other hotels like the Hilton or the Parc 55 varies, but the Nikko is always reliable great.

review.title: Great Hotel next SF Union Square
review.reviewText: My stay with Hotel Nikko SF was very pleasant. Rooms were well appointed. Nice modern features and updates. Great location for all your SF excursions and union square shopping.

review.title: BEST HOTEL EVER!
review.reviewText:
Where do I start?

I will stay here every time I visit San Francisco.
The experience was phenomenal.  Within a 10 min walk to the BART.  The staff are excellent.  I love the Asian culture and the doorman were great. They open your door and they are helpful.  My friend stayed at the Marriott and she wasn't even acknowledged when she walked through the door.  The front desk staff was awesome.  The music in the lobby was entertaining.  The front desk staff made sure we were happy and checked in.  The room was SMALL but that's ok.  It met our needs.  I couldn't stay in the cramped space for more than a week tho.  The STEAM ROOM is to DIE for.  omg!  I went twice in one night.  LOVED IT!  Please don't even look at other hotels in the area. STOP!   You've found perfection...book now.  You will be more than satisfied.
review.locationRemarks:
Close to BART
Jazz Restaraunt
Chinatown

review.reviewText: Very nice staff, location next to a lot of public transportation, ups store was very convenient, wish there was free wifi, starbucks location great/convenient. Bed and pillows were extremely comfortable, toilet was awesome

review.title: Noce hotel
review.reviewText: Bery good expirience in general, very noce, very nice

review.title: Not a Japanese Hotel more to me.
review.reviewText:
I'd stayed in several hotels before like Hxxton,Renaixxanse,Prixxce more than 10 kind of and 50 times more.
Usually I prefered Japanese Hotel when I choose hotel to stay for clean and kind and well serviced.

So I choosed this hotel for my San franciso travel this time.
But it was my big mistake.

<Bad>
- No cleaned room.
- Annoying noise from Gym underfloor of my room for 24H.
  (Gym in underfloor of room??? , It doesn't make sense!!!)
review.negativeRemarks:
Room should be cleaned more.
No rooms next on Gym floor.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good

review.title: Way better than expected!
review.reviewText:
We were staying to a hotel next door prior to coming over to this one due to my husband's work travel. I booked this as an Expedia vacation package for a great deal and was not expecting anything above mediocre. Upon walking in, there was a lovely open and airy marble foyer. We were greeted by a very friendly staff member who checked us in and offered us complimentary wine. We were staying on the 10th floor in a King Superior and it did not disappoint. 

A few major highlights:

Large room, large TV, floor to ceiling window that looked over Union Square, comfy bed & HUGE walk in bathroom. Like, I've never seen a hotel bathroom so giant. Bathtub with separate walk in shower that had obviously recently been updated. I also enjoyed the "Do Not Disturb" button on the thermostat so we didn't have to deal with keeping that pesky door knob thing on. It was so close to all of the major attractions at union square and getting cabs or ubers was a breeze. 

Though we probably won't stay in Union Square again, just due to personal preference, if someone I know is going, this is where I will send them. Great stay, Hotel Nikko!
Very nice overall experience.  Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Very good location.  One block from Union Square and the cable car line.

review.reviewText: Well located, clean and comfortable hotel with pleasant and efficient staff.

review.title: Nice hotel but lots of homeless people in neighbor
review.reviewText: My room was comfy. King size bed i think had a down pad matress.my shower had mold in it. I called the front desk and they sent up the house keeping manager whom then called in the maid for that floor. They sprayed some smelly chemicals apologized and left.....my shower still had mold in it And continued to do so for the next 2 days i stayed. But i didnt complain any further. I was shocked though that this nice hotel allowed that. But thats probably why they are not a 5 star,because they dont care about their customers feelings.,

review.title: Clean, Friendly, Comfortable
review.reviewText: Nice friendly hotel, wi-fi was $15/day (or I think $40 / week) which is way to much. The room was very comfortable and they brought up a fridge for self use which was awesome. Beds were awesome, and bathrooms were luxurious.

review.title: San Francisco Nikko
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel.  Rooms and location are great.  Only shortcoming is the wifi

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: I have stayed at 10 hotels in the last year in San Francisco, for business and pleasure, over 30 nights.  This hotel has a excellent location, staff, room was awesome.  This is one of my top picks for the value.
Excellent overall downtown hotel -- wonderful stay. Valet parking pricey, but that's true of most downtown places.

review.title: Are you kidding me
review.reviewText:
When we went to check in they told me there would be a fee to use the pool. I could not believe it  I can 
stay at a motel 6 in the pool is include but here where they charge more than double the rate of a motel 6 you want to charge me to use the pool ? The bed had hairs on it had to ask them twice to come and change the linen. They did give me a pool key with no upcharge just hate to be charged for this.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very quiet sleep very well
review.negativeRemarks: For the price you pay I think they should include the pool and a small breakfast like bread, cereal,etc
review.locationRemarks: Its in the heart of downtown so there is a lot to go and see, and do

review.reviewText: Would stay again, but would consider a room larger than the petite queen. Not a lot of extra space, bit efficient.

review.title: Definitely returning.
review.reviewText: We stayed here in March for 2 nights and had an amazing experience. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Location is perfect. A block away from shopping and the trolleys. We had dinner at the restaurant and found it to be so delicious. No bad experiences or negative comments except that over night parking was expensive. Otherwise I will stay here again when I return to the city.

review.title: Great Hotel, Centrally Located
review.reviewText: Great location! Hotel staff were also great. Clean, well cared for, and modern. Rented a car at the airport and found we didn't need it. Car rental return just around the block!! Good thing, too! Price of parking at the hotel was $57.00 a night!! To be fair, parking all over the city was scarce and expensive. Other than that, this was a GREAT place to stay! Westfield Mall just two blocks away, as was the Cable Car stop. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: One of my favorite places to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I've stayed at many places in SF and the Nikko is one of my favorites.  The staff is always friendly, the location is convenient (especially to BART), the rooms are well equipped and very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: As always, I'm annoyed by having to pay for internet access.  I also don't like having to pay to access the fitness center.  Ticky-Tacky.
review.locationRemarks: Aside from the usual things, try Dottie's True Blue Cafe and I always to go Osha Thai.

review.reviewText: It was an incredible experience. The room was clean and had al the amenities. Location was excellent, and the staff was helpful and friendly.

review.title: Upscale Hotel, just minutes from Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is a beautiful modern hotel close enough to Union Square but very quiet and very comfortable. Best hotel bed ever! They could use a nice bar on the top floor to take advantage of the city views but otherwise, highly recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar.....boring.
review.locationRemarks: Very central....2 blocks from Powel and the trolley, the subway and the great shopping.

review.title: Not as great as in the past
review.reviewText: Haved stayed here 4 times. Rooms are starting to show age.  Wi Fi is very expensive and they now charge for gym.

review.title: Great hotel in the heart of the city
review.reviewText: Very welcoming staff and very nice rooms. We enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Too expensive and charge in every details
review.reviewText: To use hotel facilities, you have to pay for swimming pool and fitness.
review.locationRemarks: a bit walk from BART

review.reviewText: Loved the hotel!!! Only thing I would Reccommend would be some more lighting in the room and a full length mirror. Otherwise a fantastic stay and wish I was going to be in San Francisco more often

review.title: good hotel in the center of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Clean and nice hotel in the center of the town, with helpful staff and good amenities.

review.title: Excellent location, excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean, staff are wonderful and helpful.  The room temperature was excellent!!  The room was good size with a spectular view of the city.  The hotel food could use some attention.  I did not feel the food I had was fresh.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location.  Easy access to bart and close to all the action downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was not cleaned as thoroughly as I would have liked.  It would be nice if they could put magnified mirrors in the bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is near by and easy to access.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a good hotel.  The staff was very professional and attentive, willing to help you with anything you ask for, including reccommendations for restaurants, attractions, etc. The rooms are a bit small, but clean.  The bed was a bit uncomfortable, but no big deal.   It's in a good location next to Union Square, which makes access to everything simple.  I would stay here again.

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for four nights on a mini get-away. This hotel is conveniently located in Union Square and within walking distace to many great resturants, shopping, and other attractions.

Room was a great size, comfortable, and had some nice amenities.

Hotel staff especially front desk and housekeeping were very accomodating and friendly. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Awesome experience
review.reviewText: We had a great experience. Wanted some privacy and got a not under the door explaining that we could request linen or cleaning service any times 24/7. 24th floor bay view was amazing. Everyone from the bell hops to the housekeeping staff was amazing. 5 star service and restaurant at a much better price

review.title: Beautiful, clean ,near all public transportation!
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and the staff. They gave us a free room upgrade so we were on the 19 th floor. Had a nice view of the city.  Yes, we could hear some noise from the city, but it is to be expected if you stay in the middle of the city. we were treated very well. Didn't buy the internet package, we were on vacation. Didn't need it! They gave us a complimentary pass to the fitness center. That was very nice, but we were just to busy exploring the city to use it. All I can say is this hotel is very, very nice. They made us feel very welcomed, were very helpful and made you feel special. Its location is near all the major forms of transportation, the cable cars, public transit ect.  Rooms were very clean!!! I felt very safe walking from Union Square to the hotel. We did not rent a car. You can get all over their city using their transit system! Loved everyday we spent there. would go back again.
review.positiveRemarks: The atmosphere. Beautiful , with orchids displayed in the lobby. The staff made us feel like we were special. Very clean, which is very important!
review.negativeRemarks: we were happy with everything.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, about 2 blocks.  Ate at John's Grill & Café Mason. did the Big Bus tour. all the tour companies picked us up at the hotel.

review.title: Great place and location
review.reviewText: I had never been to San Fran before, so I honestly had no idea where I should stay. This hotel is located in a great place if you want to be close to shopping. We loved it! It was clean, the staff were super helpful and went out of heir way to make our stay comfortable. I was really impressed.

review.title: Best Front Desk Staff
review.reviewText: Upon check in , I had a very warm welcoming and everything in regard to the hotel services and facilities were well explained. Devon,  one of the front desk receptionists
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant Staff 's efficiency
review.locationRemarks: Market Street

review.title: Nice hotel in a convenient location
review.reviewText:
Modern, minimalist facility.  All the staff at the front desk, bar, concierge desk, were all professional, friendly, and helpful.
Location worked great for my group.  Very happy overall with the experience and would recommend the hotel to others visiting the city.

review.title: Nice hotel. Nice location.
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent.  Hotel is in great condition.  Rooms were decent size for SF and clean.  Standard furnishing.  Near Union Square so it's convenient for walking to many points of interest.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit pricey for standard offering.
review.locationRemarks: Very near Union Square so lots of shopping and restaurants near by.  Walking distance to many things (e.g. my wife and I walked to AT&T Park).

review.title: Perfect location in downtown SF!
review.reviewText: Super friendly and accommodating staff. Only 2 blocks from Westfield mall and BART. I absolutely cannot wait for my next trip to be able to stay here again! You guys are awesome!

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, great location, and the staff was helpful. My only complaint would be that the hotel was expensive and they did not include use of gym/ pool in the room rate.  We felt like there were added charges that should have been included.
Clean and spacious room, good location and very helpful staff. Would recommend it to others.
Nice hotel, petite room is tiny. Took me while to figure out where bath room is.

review.title: In the middle of everything, food and shopping.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, clean room, good service from valet, bell man, front desk and concierge.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was just great, everyone was friendly and could not be more accomadating. Room was clean and we had great view of the city. I would highly rrcommend Hotel Nikko!

review.title: Nice upscale hotel near shopping
review.reviewText: We could hear the conversation clearly from the adjacent room. It was very odd for this to happen in such an upscale hotel. The hotel guests' voices were speaking in normal tones. Something needs to be done so that noise from the next room from underneath the adjoining door does not bother the guests. Additionally, free wireless access needs to be one of the perks of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean hotel with excellent service and kind staff.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Highly recommend Hotel Nikko. Beautiful rooms, amazing staff, great facilities. Definitely staying again!

Great hotel and hospitality.
I would return definitely.

review.title: Excellent location to MUNI and cable cars.
review.reviewText: Excellent facility with fun family pool. Very helpful staff. Great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was so friendly. We were given wine on check in.

review.title: A very stylish and sophisticated hotel.
review.reviewText:
We recently had a three day stay at the Hotel Nikko.  We've stayed there before and one of the main reasons I come back is the ambiance at the hotel.  The design motifs are Asian, very clean and sophisticated.  This follows through from the lobby to the restaurant and the rooms.  We originally booked a petite queen but after seeing the size of the room opted to upgrade to the next level.  It was well worth the additional fee and we got free wi-fi added as well.

This hotel has a quiet, tranquil feel to it.  If you want a hotel which is more bustling and boisterous the Nikko is probably not for you.

We were somewhat disappointed with the condition of the furniture in the room as well as the somewhat outdated feel.  Hopefully the hotel is planning a makeover in the near future as it could use it.

All in all we will continue to stay at the Hotel Nikko whenever we are in town.
review.positiveRemarks: Overall style and feel of the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade furnishings and wall treatment in rooms.  Open the bar during the day if one wants a drink.
review.locationRemarks: No better location in downtown.  Close to everything.

review.title: Few issues...
review.reviewText:
Too expansive 
Too Many extras 
Parking $50
Upgrade tI higher floor and access to the pool is $80 including 2 so so breakfast 
One hour late check out (12pm to 1pm ) $50!
and the list going on and on 
We pay more then $1000 for 2 nights!
Good location 
Nice but firm stuff no flexibility at all
Be ready to pay
Great location right downtown. Excellent service. Great views and very clean environment. Starbucks in the lobby didn't hurt either.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger room for the money

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Good location, nice hotel, rooms are simple yet pretty, beds aren't that comfortable.

This was a very good place to stay in SF proper.  Close to the Powell St Bart station and Union Square. It was clean, had a Starbucks in the lobby, was easy to have Uber drivers come to..and more.
The rooms very clean, while mine was kinda small. The bed was super comfortable, great views of the city and more.

My excellent ratings for all survey categories says it all about my recent experience at the Hotel Nikko.  It's a superb hotel, and it will be our exclusive hotel in San Francisco whenever we travel to that city.

review.title: Comfortable Union Square hotel
review.reviewText: There is a lot to see and do in the Bay Area, and the Nikko was convenient to public transportation and a good place to rest after a busy day of sightseeing.
review.positiveRemarks: Large clean bathroom and a comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Drop some of the extra charges - specifically for use of the pool.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Market Street, one block from Powell Street and the start of the Powell Mason Cable Car line.

review.title: Get Away
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel... They all made me feel special!

I was very disappointed that WiFi is not free at the Nikko.  One clearly felt like you were being milked for every detail of your visit.  The parking was also quite pricey.  

Furthermore, I was disappointed that although I already had paid $ 30 for an extra guest on Expedia, the hotel charged me another $35/night for a rollaway bed.  It seems like they need to work this out with Expedia in advance.
review.negativeRemarks: as above.  It's expensive enough as it is.  Don't need to continue to keep charging for everything else.

review.title: Nikko Hotel - April 2015
review.reviewText: Nice hotel and good location near Union Square.  The room had no shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, all towels were not there, the shower was not clean andf there was only one bar of soap for the basin and none for the shower.  It took two calls to Housekeeping to fix these things.  I had booked the Nikko based on their reputation for service.  I was disappointed with this.  The next day we had the Easter buffet at the Anzu restaurant.  For about $69 each for a party of four, it was OK but we all agreed it was not worth that price.  A bit disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping services to a set of standards each day for each room and effective supervision of this.
review.locationRemarks: Nice location near Union Square.

review.title: nickel and dimed
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko is clean, the amenities satisfactory, and the location convenient to all city attractions. the staff are friendly and helpful. I would prefer to be charged more to stay, and not have blue cheese olives be an extra dollar in a martini. It sets a tone that every little extra at the hotel comes with a price attached. I have earned upgrade status, and they had none available upon check in so they comped breakfast, So I had two breakfasts during my stay which were both on my bill. When I questioned the charge, I was informed that the breakfast I was entitled to was on the 23rd floor, which I was not given a key to allow entry . Instead of apologizing and removing the charges, they informed a manager must approve. if it stands I paid 60.00 for two bagels and a cup of tea. I am still waiting to hear from a manager. And when you charge $50 for overnight parking how much are you left with to tip the valet, when you take your car out repeatedly?? I would rather you charge 75 an night and have a sign  that says" no tipping." These are small complaints, however there are plenty of places to stay in the area.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The Hotel is very nice. I 'm a expedia + member so I got a room upgrade and free wireless internet. Extremely satisfied both with Hotel Nikko San Francisco and Expedia!!!

review.title: Fabulous hotel. Great experience
review.reviewText: I was immediately transported to a serene world of Japanese hospitality with the warm courtesy of the front desk staff at check in. The room was smallish but I was a business traveler and the other amenities made up for it. Paying for WiFi wasn't fun or regular protocol for me. The breakfast buffet with Japanese assortments besides continental fare was a surprise. Will def Recommend to my friends.
review.negativeRemarks: Free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Eclectic bunch of restaurants around. Try katanyaya for great sushi pakwan for delectable Pakistani BBQ

review.title: nice hotel ,location and staff are great
review.reviewText:
When we first arrived we were checked in by Mr,Michel who was extremely pleasant and very helpful  he made us like hotel and made our stay very comfortable .
hotel location is in the middle of everywhere 3 minutes  close to cable car,westfield mall ,union square ........

review.title: Good location, extra charges ridiculous
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The room was small, but clean and comfortable so not a problem at all.  The fact that has a professional at a very nice hotel, I was going to be charged for internet access AND use of the gym seems ridiculous to me, so I wouldn't stay here again.  There are other options nearby that are just as nice without the petty extra charges.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't charge for basic internet use.  don't charge to use the gym.

review.title: Customer service--GREAT
review.reviewText:
Several years ago I stayed at the Nikko and the service was sterile, all staff went through the motions and were compliant, but that was it.

Wow how things have changed for the better. I am not sure if I have ever been so well accommodated.

There is a purposeful intent on the part of all employees to treat guests well, very well!
review.negativeRemarks: no recommendations
review.locationRemarks: shopping and great food near Union Square.

review.title: Good all round Hotel, in a good (busy) location.
review.reviewText:
We were given this hotel through Expedia's unpublished hotel service.  This is actually where my main complaint falls, with Expedia.  We had seen the Hotel Nikko and had liked it but I would never book somewhere where they charge for internet use. Before you book the Unpublished hotel service they list the features and general location of the secret hotel, we liked the features it offered (leisure facilities, internet, star rating etc).  So we booked it and hoped for the best.  Obviously we were given Hotel Nikko, but what hadn't been made clear was that even though the hotel had these "features" available they were mostly at an additional charge.  This is sneaky in my opinion. Secondly we booked a room for two people and we were given a "petite queen" room.  I emailed the hotel and asked what this meant exactly.  The response was a room ideal for one person but could fit a second.  By this point I was pretty mad as accommodation is not cheap in this city and I felt cheated.

I emailed both Expedia and the hotel and asked for an explanation.  For this I would mark Expedia 1/5 as they did absolutely nothing to help.  But I would mark Nikko 5/5 as they offered to upgrade our room to a deluxe king and give us complimentary internet for our stay which was great and they did it without me asking for anything.
review.positiveRemarks: In summary, the hotel is very nice, the staff were very nice, the Location is good.  Overall experience directly with the hotel was positive.
review.negativeRemarks:
The deluxe king room is quite small (cant imagine how small the petite queen is)
There are too many additional charges (leisure facilities/Internet).
review.locationRemarks: Location is very good for shops.  We'd go for a slightly less busy location next time.

review.reviewText: We enjoyed our time at Hotel Nikko.  We felt that things were a bit overpriced, as we had to pay an additional daily fee to use the internet and an additional fee to use the pool and workout facilities.  The hotel room was very clean, and well cared for.  We enjoyed the buffet breakfast each morning in their restaurant. However, the drinks in the restaurant were a little weak and small for the price they charged.  All in all, we had a good experience, but next time we might try to find a hotel that doesn't charge for every amenity.
review.positiveRemarks: We liked the atmosphere, and the buffet breakfast each morning.
review.locationRemarks: We picked this hotel because of its proximity to public transportation and the shopping at Union Square.  This was a perfect location both.

review.title: Perfect Location for San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is very, friendly staff and the location is excellent. It's close to restaurants, shopping and all forms of transportation. We would highly recommend it to anyone going to San Francisco.

review.title: Downtown Union Square location
review.reviewText: Good location if you want to be near Union Square and in downtown. There is a good Italian restaurant on the corner and a Starbucks. The hotel room bathroom tiles feel a bit dated in the King bed deluxe room type. I would try the Nikko floor rooms on floors 20 and above next time. The check in service was kind of slow but thats probably because the level of personal attention and service is really good once you do check in. You can text room service if you need anything which is a cool feature. I would suggest offsite parking garages 1 to 2 blocks away to save $20 a night on hotel valet parking which is way over priced. The hotel should re think that system when guests are parking off site and walking to save money. Valet parking rates should be more in line with nearby competitor rates.

review.title: Nice hotel close to wonderful shopping!
review.reviewText: The staff was extremely nice and helpful.  The room was very clean with excellent amenities.  I would definitely stay here again!
It was a nice stay ! The restaurants were closed for private events so I had to go out.hotel staff was friendly
Nice room, great service.  For being in the middle of Union Square, the room was pretty quiet as well!
House keeper did not made my room the first day of my stay at the hotel while I was out in the city shopping

review.title: Overrated
review.reviewText:
The rooms have gone "green"
Which is fine, but if you are going to do so then make sure tablet you provide for all hotel information works.  I had to call 5 times to ask for a in room dining menu.  I finally ended up Just changing my room.  You also have to pay $25 extra dollars to use their spa/pool/fitness center. Overall I would not recommend this hotel to anyone

Hotel Nikko was clean, modern and in a good location.  The staff were so helpful and friendly.  My room had two queen beds and was very large with separate shower and tub, large closet and nice view.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Great hotel--A lunch and dinner in the restaurant were excellent.  There were too many pillows on the bed and no place to put them at night, but that's the culture right now and we are probably the anti-pillow minority!  Bed, bathroom and room were all great, staff polite and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: See above. Elegant fittings, calm environment.
review.negativeRemarks: High charges for bottled water (we got ours at Walgreen's) and for in-room internet.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, near cable car stop, Embarcadero, shops, tourist sites.

review.title: Imperial suite, imperial experience
review.reviewText: I can t stop gushing about my recent stay at the Nikko in San Francisco. The room was beyond amazing and made our all girls trip unforgettable. The view is unbeatable .

review.title: Not as trendy as some others but it is a classic
review.reviewText:
Over all, this is a hotel experience I would expect. Location is great. Front desk is friendly and quick. If anything happens, they react right away.
I am happy 85% - 15% would be... space/design is outdated. I can tell it was still good in 1990s. Compared to many other hotels I stayed, this hotel needs a face-lift.
It is not bad - it is a classic "modern" hotel I used to know. Like Hilton/Sheraton from 1980s. Nostalgic in some way.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean-ness and location. Service was good too.
review.negativeRemarks: Decor and bedding. Other hotels use better furniture and linens.
review.locationRemarks: Center of downtown SF - you can walk to most of the area. Powell station is right down the block too.

review.title: A Perfect Stay at a Perfect Place
review.reviewText: We arrived early and was welcomed with an early arrival opportunity.  Our room on the 21st floor was a double queen.  It was very roomy and spotlessly clean.
