The view of the city was amazing.  It was very quiet even though we feared it wouldn't be because it was near the elevator. We purchased the Asian/American breakfast buffet which was a feast for the eyes and stomach.  The ceiling mirrors above the buffet seemed to make the food all the more spectacular.  The morning Miso soup came as a surprise to me and I will now include it in my own breakfasts at home. The smoked fish was delicate and delicious and the American fare was also delicious.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked everything about this hotel.  The location is perfect and it even has a Starbucks on the entrance level.  The staff is friendly and efficient
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is near Union Square, many fine restaurants and shops and easy access to taxis.

review.title: Hotel surprised me with cleanliness and service
review.reviewText: This hotel actually surprised me and I usually always find something I didn't like about a room but not here.  The room was perfectly laid out to not feel cramped the room was clean and the bathroom was immaculate which you never find.  I honestly feel like the room was recently renovated that's how nice it was.
review.negativeRemarks: My only complaint is the amount of homeless people in SF, which can't be controlled by the hotels.  It took away from the beauty of the city
review.locationRemarks: There are so many things to do nearby that are either a short walk or short uber ride away.

review.title: Perfect San Francisco Location
review.reviewText: Perfectly located close but not too close to Union Square.  Clean and comfortable with super friendly staff.  Good value for money.

review.title: best stay in SF so far!
review.reviewText: This is by far the best place I have ever stayed in while visiting the SF bay area. The staff was attentive to everything I needed. The entire hotel was clean and vivid. Of course this is what you would expect for an upscale hotel. However, I believe this place was cheaper than the other upscale hotels in the area. Therefore I paid less for more! The girlfriend enjoyed everything this hotel had to offer as well.
review.negativeRemarks: They did not have some ice machines, however, if you call them they do deliver it them right to you door.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, so that means tons of shopping!

review.title: Room includes nothing- extra fee bonanza
review.reviewText: This hotel charges an extra fee for everything. Extra fee items include, roll away bed, health club, pool, parking, water, some base toiletries, wifi and others.  Extra fee charges were also steep compared to other, real 4 star hotels in San Francisco.  This hotel has striped out everything possible and made it fee based.  What you really get is a 2.5 star hotel. The base hotel room is very small and barely fits a sized down "Queen Bed". I would avoid the Nikko and pay a little more for another hotel upfront because, after fees, you will pay more at this hotel and only get a room the size of a phone booth.  The hotel is also located on the edge of Union square in the tenderloin district.  The area can be dangerous during the day but especially at night.  Walking to and from the hotel you will pass and likely end up interacting with junkies, pimps and homeless people.

review.title: Nikko is a great place to stay
review.reviewText: Excellent accommodations. Very modern and should be rated 4+ stars.

Great place to stay in San Francisco. Convenient to every places. Large rooms with good Japanese style breakfast. The valet parking was expensive, but there was a self parking nearby which costs less. Recommend to everyone.

review.title: Affordable Luxury, Great Sevice, Centrally Located
review.reviewText: Courteous, kind, and attentive staff without being over-the-top.  Rooms were clean, sizable and well-kept.  The hotel is a short walk to Union Square and Powell St BART.  Several nearby restaurants.  Complimentary WiFi.  I travel to San Francisco once a month.  At approximately $225/night this is one of the best 4 star values I've found in the area.  Only one downside - there is an additive fee for full access to their gym.  Exceeded my expectations.  Will be back.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff - great service, location, and room size / cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: There was an additive fee for the on-site gym.

review.reviewText: Very friendly staff and great location. Recommended for a couple and family.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Very efficient and helpful staff.  Modern hotel with great fitness and pool area.  Close to shopping and cable cars. Would stay here again.

The front desk staff (including the manager that was "helping") didn't listen and inflexible about adjust my length of stay.  Especially, we had booked multiple rooms and given repeated business.  Hospitality is about being accommodating and the two women I dealt with was the complete opposite.

review.title: Weekend Visit
review.reviewText: First time stay at Hotel Nikko. Very nice hotel. Close to everything. The staff are very professional and friendly. We arrived early and were able to get a room quickly and easily on a Saturday morning. Our room had a nice view and was impeccablly clean and modern. We will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Very polite and happy staff. 
Very enjoyable. 
Comfortable room. 
We had a hard time parking, GPS tries to take you to the front of the hotel, but parking is off on the other side of the hotel. 
Great experience overall.
review.negativeRemarks: Only issue we had was trying to park. Parking is expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Most of the stuff we didn't wasn't close by, maybe possibly needed to be in a different location.

review.title: Good location, modern look
review.reviewText:
Great location, modern look and beautiful and very friendly staff. The beds are incredible comfortable as well. 

The downsides: 
Rooms are very small and the "deluxe king" varies pretty drastically depending on what floor / room you get. The food is very bland and overpriced, I would not recommend the room service.  No free wifi even in the lobby area. We had to move rooms 3 times due to not functioning tablets and were not offered any compensation for the high inconvenience.

Overall, however, I would absolutely still stay there and recommend it to others.

review.title: Hotel Nikko, great location!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Nikko, great location and staff.

review.title: Perfect location at Union Square
review.reviewText: I have to say that the location is key. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION. Really close to the best fashion stores, nice restaurants and it has an Starbucks downstairs. ANZU, the restaurant at the Lobby is pretty good.

review.title: excellent experience
review.reviewText: Central location. They gave us a free upgrade to s room with 2 king beds. We had to pay $25 to use the health club, but it was well worth it. State of the art workout equipment, pool, jacuzzi and sauna. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing we didn't like was having to pay for wifi access.

review.title: Pool and Health Club not included!
review.reviewText: One of the reasons I stayed here is my wife enjoys a pool so I was disappointed and surprised to learn that the pool and health club are are extra $25/day! The hotel features pictures of both and says nothing about extra charges.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: We reserved a double queen room and a deluxe king room. They were both clean and updated. The hotel service excellent. Clean bathrooms, beautiful furnishings and linens. The king deluxe was small. But the double queen rooms were spacious. The location was walking distance to union square and many restaurants. The only disappointment was you have to pay $25 to use their pool and gym facilities.

review.title: Fantastic hotel - great location!
review.reviewText:
Had a great stay at the Nikko - the staff were very welcoming and helpful throughout my stay

Next time I'm in town I'll be staying here again

review.title: Nice hotel but extra charges for everything
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel
Good localization 
wifi, gym, parking and everything else for additional charge

review.title: Hotel Nikko SF
review.reviewText: Excellent location for business, shopping and tourist attractions. The number of vagrants in the area, particularly on Market Street was a cause of concern and detracts from a beautiful city.
review.positiveRemarks: Amenities, business centre, ready access to lifts, attention to room cleanliness, polite and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: The  breakfast could be improved with availability of a chef who cooks eggs as required, eg. Omelet, poached eggs and the like supporting the buffet.
review.locationRemarks:
Shopping a short walk. Fisherman's Wharf, Disney Museum, Asian Museum,
Chinatown and ready tour access to tourist sites beyond the city boundary

review.title: An oasis of quiet in downtown SF
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. We were looking for an evening of quiet, and we got it. So serene! Lovely view, perfect location. Couldn't ask for more.
Very clean hotel. Attentive staff. Fast room service.
Great ambience and friendly staff. Most things in downtown are walking distance and you can take the cable car to the fisherman's wharf.

review.title: In the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Fabulous stay!! Upon check-in was updated to a spacious suite to accommodate my previous requests, if possible, for highest floor with a view.  Received a corner room with views on both sides on the 18th floor. The check-in staff were very welcoming and helpful, as well as, the attendants upon arrival. Received the same welcoming and friendly service at their restaurant, ANZU.
review.negativeRemarks: Can't think of a thing to be changed.  Hopefully, stay the way you are.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of shopping within walking distance!

review.title: Great location...shame they charge for everything
review.reviewText: Charge for internet. Charge for gym and pool. Bed was supposed to be a queen, they called it a petite queen,,,

review.title: Comfortable stay, yet surprising extra charges on
review.reviewText: Didn't see that the Health Club was additinal charge, so needed to pay $25USD upon arrival-nice pool area though with jacuzzi & outdoor tanning area.
review.negativeRemarks: Needs a makeup mirror in the bathroom, (asked for 1) & include Std. internet access in the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: prime downtown locale

review.title: Nice Hotel Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The staff were professional, kind and efficient.  Hotel Nikko offers rooms on Imperial floors, which provides a continental breakfast and happy hour.  The Imperial Room staff are very attentive and the food and drinks offered are plentiful.  Overall, the hotel is impressive and I would highly recommend it.  Plus, it is close to Union Square shopping and many great restaurants!
review.positiveRemarks: The cleanliness of the hotel, the professional and helpful staff, and the nice, large rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping and plenty of restaurants

review.title: Nice hotel in downtown S.F.
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, ease to all kinds of stuff downtown, clean and quiet.

review.title: Top Notch Service
review.reviewText: We stayed as a family of four on vacation.  At some hotels, business travelers get the "white glove" treatment while families are treated more casually (or as an annoyance).  Every member of the Nikko staff treated both our kids and us as royalty-- every bit as well as the business travelers.  It was an absolute pleasure staying at the Nikko.
review.positiveRemarks: Once we walked through the doors into the hotel, everything was made easy for us-- nice facilities and remarkable staff.

review.title: Not dog friendly after all
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because it claimed to be dog friendly and when I called to ask I was told there was a park 2 blocks away where my dog could go potty.  Not true at all.  If a hotel claims to be dog friendly but doesn't have a small patch of grass or fake grass at least on the roof, it is not dog friendly.  We paid $50 extra per night to have our dog here and she has no where to go?  Also, they told us once arriving only that she is not allowed to be left alone in a crate, so we couldn't go out for dinner or anything.  The hotel has restaurants and bars, but none with a patio where our dog could join us.  So, we were stuck with their terrible tasting and grossly overpriced room service.  When I went to speak with a manager she was a little rude but did agree to take the room service bill off.  Also, this hotel adds fees on for everything and I believe is a rip off.

review.title: Nice hotel San Fran
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Nice Friendly staff as well. No issues. Not fancy but not run down.

review.title: High quality Hotel near public transportation
review.reviewText: Overall we had a good stay. The hotel staff was helpful and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: We appreciated the proximity to BART making traveling from and to SFO very easy.
review.negativeRemarks: I would suggest that the hotel provide complimentary Internet access for all guestrooms.
review.locationRemarks: There are several good restaurants in the area. For those looking for exercise it is a short walk up Nob and Russian Hills which we took advantage of.

review.title: Very friendly, clean hotel
review.reviewText: The receptionist was very friendly. Amelia was very helpful. The room I had, with a single King size bed, was quite roomy and clean. The staff at the hotel lounge was very friendly too, with several nice drinks available.
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't like that I had to pay for the internet service. I wish that it would be free.
review.locationRemarks: Many shopping and nightlife places nearby.

review.reviewText: My family of four absolutely loved staying at this hotel. The accommodations were fabulous. My only complaint is the $25 one time charge for use of the pool and workout room. I feel that should be included in the overall price of the room. We also paid $57 a day to park our car, which seems a bit expensive. Regardless, we would stay again.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel with great attention to details. One star off for having to pay for the gym and pool. Pool is extremely small and shallow, so shallow that they don't even have to hire a life guard. But other than that, everything is perfect.

review.title: SFO Conference
review.reviewText: Great hotel and great location!  From the start the experience was amazing.  Because of my status with Expedia Rewards I was upgraded to the top floor and given free internet. The hotel was amazing; nice large room with king bed, large bathroom with a TV in the mirror.  I would definitely stay there next time I am in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The workout facility was nice, but there was a $24 charge to use it; however it was a one time charge for the entire stay no matter how long you stay.
review.locationRemarks: Very central location close to everything.

review.title: our personal experience
review.reviewText:
parking is way to expencive 
we were supose to have and up garde ,for been a member of Expedia ,but the were nothing availavle
we beleive this can be fix all ways
review.negativeRemarks: room service and parking charges
review.locationRemarks: sausalito is very nice  to spend a day there ,drinking wine by the bay

review.title: Nice for a quick stay
review.reviewText: Stayed in the petite queen room... We had no idea how "petite" and tiny it would be. Staff was pleasant, room was clean, location is great.

review.title: Short weekend in SF. Great stay.
review.reviewText:
I came solo for a weekend. Weather was outstanding, the downtown was hectic, but the food, music and scenery was worth it all.

I had never stayed at the Nikko, I had heard great things, and I couldn't believe how great a place they have right in the heart of everything.

A great looking lobby, and a very helpful staff.

The Nikko is right in the heart of everything. Good and bad. Pan handlers can be aggressive, just stay off your phone and keep moving. Head up people!

And if you are addicted to the coffee too, there is a starbucks in the lobby.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hotel Nikko, had a quick early check in for me. I got upgraded from a queen to a king, so my room had nice size to it. And the best bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing that I can think of.
review.locationRemarks: If you want to try a great steak, seafood place. Go to nearby John's grill. Wonderful city history. For a beer, go to Lefty's.

review.title: Very quick and smooth check in/out
review.reviewText: I was little bit concerned after reading some Expedia reviews. But we had very good experience. Nothing to talk about. It was exactly what it suppose to be: quick check in/out. We were greeted with a glass of wine and upgraded without asking ( thanks Expedia!). Quiet and clean room, perfect location, no noise from the hallway ( often a case even in more expensive hotels). I wish the swimming pool access  would be included in daily rate, but, well, it is business and it is San Francisco. I will stay there again.

review.title: Nice Modern Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was an excellent location and comfort.  The lobby area was beautiful with lounge chairs, water features, etc.  The room was simple and very modern décor.  The bathroom was amazing with plenty of room.  The prices are higher than boutique hotels but worth the extra price!
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the modern décor, roomy bathroom and lobby area.
review.negativeRemarks: No suggestions.
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect.  Its within walking distance of shops and transportation.  There were several restaurants around the area to try.

review.title: Modern hotel close to Union Square, San Francisco
review.reviewText: Brief but great. Stayed overnight before a Half Marathon in order to avoid parking hassles.
review.negativeRemarks: Configuration of the rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, entertainment, sightseeing.

review.title: Convienant location, mediocre hotel
review.reviewText:
Cool energy when arriving in lobby. Nice touch of Asian decor. Water flowing through the steps when you walk out to the street entrance. Didn't try the spa, pool, or gym because it's an additional fee. Valet parking is pricey too when there's a garage across the corner if you want to carry in your luggage yourself. Do not leave valuables of any kind in your car. THEY WILL BE STOLEN!
I would've chosen a higher floor, 10th floor and I could still hear all the drunk and homeless racket. If you dare open the mini bar check the beer you're about to open. Mine was 8 months expired. Carpet floor were dirty with stains as well. Decor is a bit outdated too. They do offer wine if you check in after 5, don't think they'll offer it again so grab it while you can.

review.title: Hotel in the Center of Everything
review.reviewText: Great location. Short walk to bus, bart, and cable car. Shopping, restaurants, necessities in surrounding blocks. Large, comfortable, impecable room. Very helpful front desk staff.

review.title: Expensive WiFi
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Friendly. Clean. Great location.  But honestly, in this day and age - and in the epicenter of the technology ecosystem - how can hotels charge for WiFi?

review.title: Very Well!
review.reviewText: Recommended, but don't lije the location, becarse are many homeless

review.title: GREAT ONCE IN A WHILE BUDGET BUSTER
review.reviewText: it's just a nice feeling to be welcomed in a professional yet sincere way, then open your hotel room door to a well-presented, fresh and clean space.  If the pool was a saline pool instead of chlorine that would put it over the top, and the morning breakfast buffet is a special experience unto itself.  Marvelous...
review.positiveRemarks: cleanliness and up to date feeling of it.  the grand piano in the main lobby.  the pleasant people, staff and guests.  the family friendly attitude.
review.negativeRemarks: make the pool saline, and change the TV service to a more user friendly format. offer a rewards program for discounts to regular guests.
review.locationRemarks: Walk around on Market street to take in the street performers, catch the N Judah line and take it through SF all the way to Ocean Beach and back

review.title: Close to shopping mall
review.reviewText: Powell cable car station is nearby the hotel. It is convenient to go to fisherman wharf. Also very good for scenic view. In addition to that,can take  the street muni car and subway at Powell station. From there can go anywhere in the city.

review.title: Quiet and comfortable hotel near BART, cable cars
review.reviewText: Shopper's Dream! We loved our comfy room and excellent bed and the swimming pool!
review.positiveRemarks: Quiet in the heart of the city.

review.title: understaffed, undersized
review.reviewText: The bed was very comfortable but the steam room and sauna weren't quite hot enough and the jacuzzi was not deep enough.  Room service charged twice for delivery. The restaurant and bar were closed by 9:30 pm.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed, the spacious bathroom and the cleanliness.
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: noisy location, lots of panhandlers, Chinatown and North Beach nearby.

review.title: Amazing hotel in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: The whole stay was very comfortable. Some people like to complain about the location but that's life, there will be homeless people in the downtown area, so stop complaining about it. It is really close to the train stations which is superbly convenient in SF.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, services, staff, and room comfort.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the Nikko.  We were close to public transportation, great food, and local shopping.  The hotel was very comfortable and clean.  Wonderful service and the sushi bar was fabulous!  We will stay here again!

review.title: All talk, no action.
review.reviewText: What the staff and management SAYS and what they actually DO are two different things. Nothing confirmed this more than this revealing fact: The Nikko's clever email system sent me an automated message immediately upon check in. The note was from the hotel's general manager and vice president welcoming "me" and inviting direct email should anything require her attention. I did have an issue and promptly wrote a very thoughtful and diplomatic response and request for action. It's now been two days since the conclusion of our 3 night stay and I still have not received any reply or action. So, everyone at the Nikko was well-schooled in manners. Responding with actions to address problems seems to be another thing.

review.title: Great thanks
review.reviewText: It was a nice stay, hotel staff is great aswel thanks to hotel nikko
Only stayed one night but had a wonderful experience. Everything was perfect. Next time we go to San Francisco, we will definately return to the Nikko Hotel.

review.title: Awesome experience
review.reviewText: Great staff, clean, pretty room, giant sexy bathroom, and great location.  People who work there are as diverse and amazing as the city itself. My husband and I loved it!

review.title: 2-night Imperial room stay
review.reviewText: Had a King Imperial Club room for twon nights which included wine, beer snack happy hour in the club room each night- along with club room continental breakfast or resaurant breakfast buffet each day. Hotel is in a great downtown location. Valet parking a bit pricey, but over-all experience was just about perfect. Will definitely visit again.
review.positiveRemarks: The steam room and sauna in the athletic center are very nice. Imperial Club benefits are very nice. Room was very quiet, clean and comfortable
review.negativeRemarks: The television guide programing needs updating
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown gate is just around the corner, old SF Mint (open sunday)

review.title: Great hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: My second time staying here - it's a great hotel. Was there on business.
review.positiveRemarks: Enjoyed the room - beds were comfortable and I was upgraded (Expedia Member for the win!). Loved the standing shower with a separate bath.
review.negativeRemarks: Gym access is $25 (regardless of length of stay). No water bottles in gym - just the paper cups. That doesn't work for a treadmill.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is really close as is Market. Easy to get around downtown area.

review.title: Hotel is excellent (if you must stay in SF)
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was a wonderful experience. The hotel staff were great, and SO polite. A very welcome thing after driving around in town up and down the steep hills of treachery. Our room was quiet and everything was incredibly clean. We really enjoyed our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: The $50 + tax mandatory valet parking is an absolute rip-off. Charging for internet is just another slap in the face.
review.locationRemarks: This is SF, you can't walk 50 feet without finding something to do :)

review.title: Great hotel in prime SF area close to everything
review.reviewText: Had a wonderful experience at Hotel Nikko. All the hotel employees were very friendly. Would definitely stay there again

review.title: Love SF
review.reviewText: Loved everything about the hotel but I thought that amenities like the health club should have been free :)

review.title: Close to everything!
review.reviewText: Here for just 1 night for business. A great, relaxing place to stay right in Union Square!
it was a nice stay except that my coffee maker needs to be changed twice because everytime i brew 2nd cup the coffeemaker does not turn on.

review.title: Nice hotel right in the city
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice and the rooms are comfortable, although not in great condition (but ok). The hotel is localized in a central area and within the city. I would recommend the hotel if you are not looking for something fancy, but a place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Room condition (doors, carpet, curtains...)

review.reviewText: I was only there for one night, but it's very clean and the staff was excellent. It's also in a great location downtown close to a lot of very good shopping.

review.title: amazing
review.reviewText: short stay but nothing but good things about this hotel . great location and very well priced for a hotel of its class
review.positiveRemarks: everything , ive travelled all around the world and this is now one of my favorite hotels

review.title: Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: We he'd two rooms. The Petite Queen is on the small side so we upgraded one room to regular. The regular with two double bed is easily twice as large. They gave us the room around 11:30am despite the official check in time is 4pm. The pool was nice but there was a $25 surcharge per stay. I wish they wouldnot nickel and dime guests. Wifi was extra. This is more a business hotel but location, service and accommodation  were first class.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel. I would stay here again.  Great room and service. 
Restaurant is great as well.

review.title: Good Location, Small Room
review.reviewText: The hotel is near Union Square and Market Street, so very centralized and easy to access. The room was quite small, which would have been fine if it had been in tip-top shape, but there were scuff marks on the walls and smudges on the thermostat that were a bit unappealing. It was also frustrating to be charged tax on the valet parking fee!

review.title: As expected
review.reviewText: Very pleasant hotel. Staff was attentive. Great location. My only complaint is that they wouldnt grant me a late checkout. I had a long night! In terms of the quality of the hotel itself it was as expected for a nicer establishment.

review.title: Great hotel and great location
review.reviewText: Stayed for a week. Hotel and staff are nice. Room seemed recently updated. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in the heart of Union Square
review.reviewText: This gorgeous hotel far exceeded our expectations! I informed the concierge that this trip was a surprise birthday present for my wife and they did NOT disappoint. Everything from a happy birthday greeting at our checkin to a waiting bottle of champagne chilling in our room. The dinner reservations they made for us also went well above expectations. The restaurant staff certainly did everything to make this trip very special. I would highly recommend Hotel Nikko to anyone and everyone!

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: Loved it here. Room was small but comfortable. Staff was extremely patient and helpful with all of our touristy questions. Very central location to trolley and subway and bussing as well as shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Beware
review.reviewText: They tried to put us in a room on a lower floor with only small double beds when our reservation was for 2 queens. Once we complained and showed them the reservation, they switched us and we were very happy with the new room but frustrated with all the hassle to get there.

review.title: Easy access to everything
review.reviewText: Our room was spacious and comfortable, and I loved the asian decor.  Great gym too.

review.title: Not a great first visit..
review.reviewText: Arrived at hotel and had to drive around hotel several times in horrible traffic to find entrance..finally entered hotel at 3pm and the line to check in was horribly ling with only 3 people working..tried to go get cocktail while waiting for check in and was told both places in hotel were closed!  No  one advised us about facilities at check in and had to explore on our own. Concierge recommended taking big bus for touring and it was awful!  No room on bus to sit and couldn't see or here... Horrible experience

review.title: Beast hotel
review.reviewText: What I loved the most is the bed it is so comfort  and the restroom is really good
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing really
review.locationRemarks: Everything is close by which is cool

review.title: Nice hotel convenient downtown location
review.reviewText: I'm a resident of San Francisco and decided to spend an evening at the Hotel Nikko, following a holiday party downtown. At check-in, I received a surprise upgrade to a 1-bedroom suite for being an Expedia member.  It was a corner room with beautiful views of the city.  The hotel is conveniently located downtown near the center of Union Square, where there are endless shopping and dining opportunities.  The hotel staff was very friendly, professional, and customer service centered.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. It's the perfect combination of classy and modern, and the location cannot be beat.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern Japanese theme, ANZU Restaurant, comfortable beds, and breathtaking views of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking rate of $50 daily could be reduced, and internet access could be made complimentary.
review.locationRemarks: Near the center of Union Square, which is the epicenter of shopping and dining in San Francisco.

review.title: Great location to Union Square!!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and price on Expedia - but they do charge extra for wifi and to use their pool?  They ask when you check in to upgrade $60 more to cover extras which I didn't like or do,  I liked the great location and the rooms were nice but small for the lower price on Expedua if you don't mind which we didn't since we were out most of the time and wanted the lower price over the Xmas holiday.  Starbucks was next door so we didn't do the hotel's expensive Asian buffet either.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location to walk to everything
review.negativeRemarks: Should not be charged extra for wifi and to use their pool - also they charge $57 to park there but we parked in a garage 1/2 block away cheaper.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping around Union Square and restaurants !!  Don't need a cab to get to places around there,

review.title: all good, but the parking

Perfect location. Nice and clean rooms/bathrooms.Friendly staff.
Will stay there again.

review.title: Excellent location. Restaurant was great!
review.reviewText: My only complaint is that the room was rather small. Everything else was great.

I will not be staying here again. Go with the westin market or the W for the same price range and area. They are much better value.

review.title: Great hotel, wonderful staff, great location.
review.reviewText: I had a fantastic experience at Hotel Nikko. The location is great. This is now my favorite place to stay in San Francisco and the best experience I have had at a San Francisco hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: Good hotel. With all the times I visit SF I wonder why I never stayed here before. And the rent-a-car place the BeverlyHills is suprisingly affordable too.

review.title: The worst hotel ever....
review.reviewText:
I had the worst experience ever at your hotel. As you can see below, I asked "I need a quiet room" but my next door woke me up 5:30 morning w his alarm. Sometimes he came back really late, 2-3am, and slam door. 

The light bulb was burned out, but housekeeping didn't change. She didn't even tell/call to the electrician. My bathroom was dark with only half of light. 
Moreover, she didn't refill amenities which was out. One day, I called and asked to clean up my room, they said ok, but my room had never cleaned that day. The room was dusty as well. 

Lastly, I was bitten by ticks a several times. I knew my room was old one, not a new-remodeled. That's why bulb was out, ticks are in bed and the room was dusty. 

I asked in advance that I wanted have a nice quiet room, but I got the worst service. This is not 4stars hotel. I do travel a lot and I always stay 4stars hotel or above. I know how 4stars hotel should be. Nikko has no hospitality.

P.S.
When I was checking in, the lady was rude as well. I was asked to show my passport. I gave her enough infos such as my credit card and driver license which is enough. Why do I have to give them my passport? Other hotels never ask, but Nikko.
review.locationRemarks: Location is good for everything. Shopping, restaurant and so on.

review.title: Great location in SF
review.reviewText:
Outstanding service
Very clean
Large yet warm and quiet

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: The facilities are impeccable but the wi fi ($16) was very spotty and most other hotels in the area do not charge $25 for gym access.

review.title: Nice hotel but lots of charges
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and clean and staff are welcoming, but too much charges, such as Internet charges? Fitness center charges?
Well located and efficient hotel staff. Needs to upgrade rooms and customer experience!

review.title: Wonderful location, terrible service
review.reviewText:
I paid for three nights of Internet and was unable to get more than a few hours. After calling and calling and calling and talking for hours to the tech people, I gave up and had them refund the money. Every day I could only get room service after calling several times and even then she only made up the beds and didn't leave replacement items.

The hotel is lovely and the location great. They need to work on their service.

review.reviewText: Amazing location and great hotel!  I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice quiet hotel, perfect location
review.reviewText: Great union square hotel. Walking distance to all the shops, Bart, etc. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Large, comfortable room.

review.title: Great hotel if you can get the right price
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko staff provides great customer service. The hotel itself is great, rooms are excellent. Location is great as well. We were up-sold to a larger room at check-in, but the staff wasn't pushy and the upgrade was worth it. To me the only downside is the ridiculous charges for both wireless and the use of the hotel's pool / spa / exercise area. I skipped my workouts because of it.
OK Hotel. Not bad if you just do the Expedia reservation and nothing more. Expect expensive charges for anything else.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying $50 + tax for parking is just a joke. Makes the $35 public parking across the street look like a great deal.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Very close to the Union Square and several bars and restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel with reasonable price
review.reviewText: Room cleaniness disappointing; this includes the lack of the bathroom cleaning for three days and the borderline cleaniness of the bed lingerie (grayish discoloration)
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the rooms

review.title:
Nice, closed to shopping.
Good place to stay!!!
review.reviewText:

I didn't like their breakfast buffet.

review.title: Perfect location on Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Modern hotel located in Downtown San Francisco. Walking distant to al kind of public transportation (very easy to get here from the airport) and close to main streets in downtown.
Very clean and comfortable room and the staff was nice. They provide you with maps of the area. 
I don't like about this hotel that they try to charge you for every single thing, and moreover the prices are ridiculously high. For instance the breakfast was around $24, and if you want the room service, they add 19% to the order plus 4$ extra. I really think it's excessive. Also you cannot even move a tray with a bottle of water from the desk because they immediately ($6 water!).
review.positiveRemarks: very clean room, modern hotel, perfect location
review.locationRemarks: You are in downtown San Francisco, so you have all kind of shops, restaurants and cafes around you.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: My stay at this hotel was great. Very friendly staff, very helpful & quick service. Loved to stay here again. Recommended to anyone who wants to stay at SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Yes, I think FREE WIFI should be available in all types of rooms.

review.title: Good location, clean
review.reviewText: Good location, clean, expensive parking, excelent breakfast

review.title: Classy hotel, good location
review.reviewText: This is a modern hotel, with all the high-tech comforts.  Check-in was a breeze, and the room was clean and comfortable.  The hotel gym was state of the art.  The hotel restaurant, Anzu, had outstanding food.  I definitely enjoyed my stay.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown SF, easy walking distance to just about everything.

review.title: Great location and atmosphere
review.reviewText: My hotel stay was great. Staff was very attentive, room was very nice, and the beds were comfortable. There were plenty of places to eat close by and Union Square was just a short walk away. Public transportation was also easy to get to, making getting around as easy as possible in the city. The onsite bar/club was also very nice and had a good vibe during our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed the location the most. The room and hotel were great, but having everything so close was even better.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is just a short walk, Westfield mall is a 10 minute walk, many great options to eat very close by as well.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel in a great location , walking distance to union square shopping area and Westfield mall. The staff was very nice and respectful. Concierge and employees were very helpful to me and my boyfriend when we asked for directions. Easy to find cabs around the area. Walking distance to restaurants and trolley station . Housekeeping was fast to replace towels or anything needed.
The room was beautiful. The hotel staff was very accommodating and super friendly. The location is amazing, just a couple blocks from Union Square and cable car turn around.

review.title: Great location, superior class.
review.reviewText: We had a great time, and I will recommend the Hotel

review.title: Great location and a very nice hotel.
review.reviewText: The room was great.  It was clean and very comfortable.  The staff was very nice and fun.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the room were perfect.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great.  It's right where the cable car turns around and so it's a great stop.  There are soooo many places to shop, eat, and have fun.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel, excellent location
review.reviewText: I booked this Hotel not knowing the area of San Francisco and was absolutely amazed with the location and cleanliness of the Hotel.  The staff were extremely pleasant and always willing to assist whether it was with the concierge or assisting with transportation.  I would definately recommend this hotel and without hesitation stay at this location in the future.

Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and the room was big enough for two people to be comfortable. Did not eat at the hotel for either breakfast or dinner since there are so many other options all around the hotel. The location is excellent and within walking distance of China Town and the financial district. Many great food and beverage options also are within walking distance.

review.title: Modern hotel in the heart of Union Square area
review.reviewText: The staff at Hotel Nikko are exceptionally helpful.  The decor is updated and modern and overall cleanliness is very good. The location is great. We were in the middle of great shopping, close to the cable car start and end, walking access to great restaurants, and there is a Starbucks attached to the hotel.  The location is also across the street from the hop on hop off city bus tour, which is very convenient.  We would absolutely stay again. The upgrade to the hospitality package on the higher floors including afternoon drinks/snacks and continental breakfast, and wifi was well worth the extra expense.  The location is perfect.

review.title: great location but no internet
review.reviewText: Great location, nice rooms but turned out to be more like a full service Hotel that nickel and dimes you for all the extras. Pay extra for internet (not even free in the lobby), pay extra to use the pool or fitness. Especially for travelers looking to make reservations and plan their daily activities internet is really necessary and has become a basic included service.  for the nightly rate paid to stay at this hotel. I thought an additional $17 dollars plus tax a day was ridiculous.
Great hotel convenient to Union Square and shopping.

review.title: Comfy and close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Check in was quick and we were right there at 3:00 pm. Room was ready and very clean. The beds were nice and comfy. It was easy to get to get car from parking, the valet service was very helpful.

review.title: Hotel was close to all shopping
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko was an excellent choice for our stay.  We found that the staff was exceptional and so friendly and accommodating.  When we checked in in error we were given a room with 2 double beds even though we booked and paid for 2 queen beds.  We addressed it to the front desk and without any issues we were then moved to a room with the beds we originally booked with a free of charge upgrade.  I felt safe and found the room very comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: The beds were very comfortable and the staff was over the top friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: There could be an upgrade to the cable.  There were limited choices to the selection.
review.locationRemarks: The shopping was only 1 or 2 blocks away as well as most of the dining choices.

review.title: Close and Clean!
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel a number of different times now and everything has remained exactly the same. The service is completely five stars all the way. The cleanliness and lay out of the rooms are also five stars. The location also, couldn't be better. It is only a couple blocks away from the cable cars, union square, the mall, and all the madness and noise. You really can't get better than this in San Fran if you want to stay near to Market and away from the wharf. I would recommend this hotel to everybody. This is my go to hotel when in San Fran. I don't even have to think twice!

review.title: Girls shopping trip
review.reviewText: Excellent location just steps from all the trendy shops and Union Square. Excellent service all around by the hotel staff. Wine at check-in was a nice touch. Awesome valet service.

review.title: Very nice hotel centrally located.
review.reviewText: My wife and I were able to walk to the famous SF trolley, Chinatown, high end shopping and excellent dining. This hotel is very centrally located and near just about everything. If we needed to get across town there was a Bart station nearby too
review.negativeRemarks: Parking is an issue so be prepared too pay valet fees
review.locationRemarks: Fine dining, Chinatown, high end shopping, nob hill

review.reviewText: Super relaxing hotel even though I was at a conference.
review.locationRemarks: Super convenient to everything in SF

review.title: Prime location in DT SF
review.reviewText: The room was lovely. Only drawback was the $20/day charge for using the health club (spa, fitness center, etc) which I think is kind of ridiculous.

review.title: Pricey, but worth it...
review.reviewText: Wonderful place to stay, centrally located, you can walk to all the shopping....the BEST Macy's EVER across the street, 1 block down...
review.negativeRemarks: Had to go to 4 different floors before I found an ice machine that actually had ice.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, walking distance to all things shopping...

review.title: Great place to stay.
review.reviewText: We had a nice corner room on the 16th floor. Very modernized and up kept. Clean with a really comfortable bed. Definitely would stay again.

review.title: Good choise
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a great area. The ambiance is nice. Great choise for walking to the shopping area, to union square just 3 blocks away, Chinatown walking. Beautiful elegant hotel and the service very welcoming.

review.title: Love it!
review.reviewText: Great hotel, comfortable rooms, delisious breakfast at Anzu, great location!

review.title: The comfort is amazing.
review.reviewText: The whole experience as very positive. The staff was great except they gave us the wrong information abut luggage that was delivered late. The staff went out of their way to address our needs except that one incident. The room was very comfortable. The ambience was wonderful. The location was just right and accessible to great restaurants and other hotels.
review.negativeRemarks: Better reporting if luggage delivered late has arrived.
review.locationRemarks: great restaurants, music, shops.

review.title: Room Upgrade
review.reviewText: Our stay at the Nikko was a pleasant experience.  We arrived late at night and they gave us an upgrade to a corner sweet on the 18th floor.  Great views of the city and a very comfortable room.  I went back and forth between the Nikko and the Donatello but I made the right decision.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotel is very centrally located at anywhere you would like to go in the city.  Very close to the BART subway and bus service.

review.title: Close to convention center
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Nikko before. In  the past I had a room in the upper levels which I loved. This time i reserved the room through Expedia and felt that I had a much smaller and less desirable room, probably because of the discounted rate.  While the room was comfortable, I had experienced a previous room at the Nikko that was far more luxurious and comfortable and thus had higher expectations. I like the location, the service and the cleanliness, but i wish I had been aware that this was not a room on the upper levels.

managementResponses.response:
Richard,

It is always especially nice to host guests for their first time visiting San Francisco. I'm glad that you had a wonderful time here. You were certainly here at one of my favorite times in the city; San Francisco truly shines in September and October.

It is very easy to access almost all of San Francisco using public transportation from the hotel and I'm glad that you were able to do that during your stay. It makes moving through the city both convenient and inexpensive. And you get a chance to experience the city and it's people along the way!

Please come back and visit San Francisco and Hotel Nikko again soon.

Sincerely,
Danielle Ortega
Marketing Manager

review.title: 1st trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Hospitality at its best Our stay at Hotel Nikko greatly contributed to the  wonderful San Francisco  experience. Its location and quality of the service was perfect. Food from room service was much  better than expected.
review.positiveRemarks: The ambience of all the hotel Nikko very conducive to a relaxing stay. Will recommend and stay again at this property. Great location.
review.negativeRemarks: The room doors close pretty hard and wakes up neighbors.

review.reviewText: One of the best options to visit San Francisco, Beutifull Hotel.
Great experience in this hotel. Great staff... Very nice...

review.title: Nice hotel that's in the heart of downtown
review.reviewText: I stayed at the Hotel Nikko San Francisco last week for five days/four nights. I was looking for a hotel that was downtown and accessible by transportation so that I could navigate the city, which I found with the Nikko. The hotel is in a great location. Overall the rooms are clean and a decent size. I read in a previous hotel review about how travellers should stay on the 15th floor or higher to hear less of the street noise, so I got a room on the 15th floor. There's a mini bar in the room where if you move the contents inside, you will automatically be charged for it. My recommendation? Ask the concierge for your own mini fridge (they'll bring one up to your room to use free of charge) so that you can store your items.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location! I used public transportation to get around and the MUNI, BART and cable cars were within a 5 minute walk from the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel's wi-fi service was bad. I paid $31 for the 72 hour package and it was SLOW. Save yourself the cash and go to cafe with free/fast wi-fi.
review.locationRemarks: If you like to shop, you can do a lot of that downtown. You can also walk to take the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf or walk to Chinatown.

review.title: Nice hotel but "a la cart" is ridiculous.
review.reviewText:
For > $300/night, they should not add $30 breakfast, $20/day internet and $20 to use gym! 12 Oz water $6
Clean and quiet. ...
pleasant staff.

review.title: Weekend trip to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Late checkin OK, excellent room service, speedy check out process
review.negativeRemarks: Downtown area is deteriorating; no police presence; incredible number of homeless people and panhandlers; pretty certain I heard gunshots Saturday PM
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your very nice review.

We are very proud of our employees, and of the service that they provide, here at Hotel Nikko. We are lucky that many of our hoteliers have been with us for several years and treat our guests as they would guests in their own homes.

I'm also glad that you were able to utilize MUNI while you were here. Being just a block away from one of the main MUNI and BART stations does allow Hotel Nikko's guests access to public transportation to almost anywhere in the city, and most of the Bay Area in a very short time.

Thanks again for your note and please come visit us again soon.

Sincerely,
Danielle Ortega
Marketing Manager

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated very close to any of the Muni transpiration system.  It made it very easy and safe to travel around and visit all famous SF sites.  The service people at the hotel were always helpful and courteous.

managementResponses.response:
Jennifer,

I'm so glad that you enjoyed your stay with us at Hotel Nikko! The shopping is fantastic in our neighborhood, with Union Square and two of the city's best malls all within a few minutes walking distance of the hotel.

It seems like you also got to visit AT&T Park during your stay! I'm so glad. San Franciscans are really very proud of both our ballpark and of the San Francisco Giants, the winners of this year's World Series!

Please come back and visit us again sometime soon.

Sincerely,
Danielle Ortega
Marketing Manager

review.title: Great one night stay...
review.reviewText: Came to San Francisco for the World Series and got this room last minute. Beautiful hotel & comfortable stay! Close to Union Square shopping (walking disyance) & about 5-10 minute cab ride to AT&T park. Hotel let us check in early and let us check our bags behind the counter so we could explore this city before our drive home.

managementResponses.response:
Liz-

Thank you for staying with us at Hotel Nikko San Francisco! I'm glad that you enjoyed your stay with us and particularly enjoyed the Nikko Lounge.

San Francisco is an expensive city and you did come to visit during one of the prime times of the year, our gorgeous "Indian Summer". Because of this and the fact that the city was hosting one of the largest annual conventions that we have all year, room rates were a little higher and the city was a bit busier than it generally is during your time here.

Please come back and visit us again sometime soon. It's beautiful here all year round, even during winter. Thank you again for choosing Hotel Nikko as your home during your visit.

Sincerely,
Danielle Ortega
Marketing Manager

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText:
The best thing about the hotel was the location.  Very close to Union Square, and the cable car stop at Powell.  Bus, tram and BART train stops were near by too, which made getting around town very easy.  

I thought the hotel was very much on the expensive side, particularly when compared to other places I've stayed in both in the US or elsewhere in the world - 5 star prices, but wasn't a 5 star hotel; don't know whether this is a feature of San Francisco. i.e. is it an expensive city, or whether we just had picked a busy time of the year to visit.  There was a huge conference going on in town, which could have affected room prices. 

Our room  was on the small side, and a bit noisy - although we were 12 floors up, we could hear noise coming up from the street, and not just traffic - could hear voices at night, which made sleeping difficult.  On the plus side, we were given complimentary access to one of their executive lounges, which provided a continental breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Better sound proofing or better window glazing.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square & Cable car stop.

review.title: Low value for money, lack of integrity
review.reviewText: I chose their best room available, paid $400 and got an average room and they simply said I'm not entited to the breakfast buffet that was part of what I purchased via Expedia. The only positive about this hotel is its location.

managementResponses.response:
Dear LILLAM,

Thank you so very much for the nice review. We're glad you enjoyed your stay with us at Hotel Nikko.

Hotel Nikko is at the nexus of a few different neighborhoods, but I like to point out to guests that we are just a block away from Union Square, the most upscale shopping area in San Francisco, where Tiffany, Neiman Marcus and Macy's are all located. I hope that you had a chance to do some shopping while you were here!

We hope to welcome you back again to Hotel Nikko very soon!

Sincerely,
Danielle Ortega
Marketing Manager

review.title: Beautiful Hotel - But
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko is beautiful, however we were VERY disappointed with the surrounding neighborhood/area.  It borders the Tenderloin district within 2 blocks.  The surrounding area is quit seedy/sketchy - and questionable venturing out at night for dinner, +.  During the day, OK, but again not great.  No issues with the Hotel itself except the surrounding area.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean, very modern - bed very comfortable, bathroom clean and spacious.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and public transportation - close to Union Square

review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable and clean. We had issues with check in, we requested 3 rooms close to each other and one room was unable to checkin till 5:45pm. Parking valet upon checkout was a nightmare, keys lost...cars lost...for $50 a night should be way more on top of it!

review.title: Perfect. Zen.
review.reviewText: Loved this hotel. Great food, tasteful everything.

review.title: Awesome staff! Nice room, great location!
review.reviewText: Nice staff at checkin. The room (Imperial floor) was comfortable, beds/pillows awesome. Lounge was ok. Very nice people working there, and a great Union Square location.
Love it!! I enjoyed my stay very much. I will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel...we loved our stay there and would definately return there again. :)

review.title: Awesome Honeymoon!
review.reviewText:
First of all let me say that the staff is an A+, Manuel at the front desk and Theresa at the concierge desk made it more pleasant.
The location of the hotel couldn't be better, very easy access to the subway (just two blocks away). a lot of restaurants, and my newly wife love the stores at Union Square.
Love it...!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: nop, is an A+

review.reviewText: I booked 2 rooms with 2 double beds each to accommodate 6 people.  When I arrived to check in I was given 2 rooms each with a king size bed. I told the front desk that when I booked the rooms it asked me how many people and it did not make sense to give us King sized beds. She said that when you book with expedia this is merely a request of what kind of beds you would like. I can understand that it can be considered a request if there were 2 people to each room. I think it should be expected that each person be given a bed to sleep in. She said there were no rooms available with double beds and would bring in roll away beds. I really had no choice so I agreed. When we went up to our rooms a roll away was brought to one room. We left for dinner and arrived back to the hotel close to midnight only to find the 2nd room still did not have a roll away bed. We had to call to the desk to remind them. This was quite an inconvenience and we felt crammed into a room that was too small for the number of people we had in our party.

review.title: great hotel for the business traveller.
review.reviewText: Got an up grade at check in. Perfect business hotel. ate at the hotel restaurant which was all excellent. I prefer this Hotel to the very busy Hilton next doo.

review.title: Awesome
review.reviewText: The room a petit queen was absolutely very nice. The bed was heaven. The staff helpful in helping me find a place to eat.

Very clean hotel in convenient location with nearby bars and shopping.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Ate the breakfast buffet one morning and it was $30 with tax and tip and selection of American food items was limited.  They do have many Japanese food items.  There was no omelette bar and you could not get waffles.  The eggs were mushy.  Had better breakfast at Taylor Street Cafe the prior morning.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Very very good . however you have to pay for wifi .not good in this day and age .also you have to pay 60$ to park your car for 24 hours

review.title: Fun in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Just returned from a wonderful trip with my Sister in San Francisco.  We stayed at Hotel Nikko.  They were friendly and helpful with all our questions.  I particularly felt secure because of their staff at every entrance.  Always there to help with doors, luggage even waiting for the tour bus.  We had an early flight out and were up at 4:00am,,,and the "Door Guys" were right there for us.  Thanks for such a lovely 5 nights....
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and absolutely gorgeous.  The marble floors and walls, a large swimming pool and spa with views of the city.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Union Square and all the top notch stores.  We saw Tango dancing Sunday afternoon,,great fun.  Convenient Walgreens also close by

review.title: Very conveniently positioned, close to Union Squar
review.reviewText:
Common areas very pleasing and clean.  Good veriaty for breakfast.   We were offered a complimentary glass of wine on check in, a nice touch.  the staff were all very helpful.  We were offered an upgrade that moved us from 12th to 22nd floor.  Although at first not sure but were pleased to have opted for it as the additional extras were well worth the additional cost:  a much bigger room, exclusive use of 25th floor lounge every evening between 5 and 7 pm with as much wine beer and nibbles as you can eat, with no additional charge. 

No major negatives except a couple of small observations:  The breakfast staff whilst extremely friendly and helpful did  on a few occasions we had to repeat ourselves as to what we wanted... hey may well have been our English accents.  Who was it that said the only thing that separates the British and the Americans is their common language... !

Our room was extremely comfortable and would have had a 5 star rating had to not been for a few signs of stains /wear and tear on the sofa, but only a few.
review.negativeRemarks: See comments above.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square,  can easily catch the hop on hop off bus and the famous SF Tram.  Superb for shopping and lots of good quality restaurants

review.title: If you are too rich...
review.reviewText:
I state here for 3 nights with my wife. Here's the pros and cons:

  clean room
  nice location

- wifi charge for $15.99?? And no complementary wifi even in lobby. Why should I pay $15.99 for sending a FB message to families telling them we arrived hotel safely?
- extremely unhappy experience with receptionist. Here's the complete story: 

I asked front desk if I can mail package to my room and was told that's allow - NOBODY mentioned it's NOT free. Later I was charged $6 for receiving package without my knowledge. My wife and I argued with manager but was suggested by the gentleman receptionist "reading every sentence written on our website". Fine. I can afford staying at ur hotel for over $200 a night, so can I afford the $6 package fee. What makes me angry is that they charge guest without notice. That's how you perform robbery in a legal, civilized way. This is the most horrible experience during our trip to San Francisco. Love SF, hope next trip we'll find a hotel without being robbed.

I recommend staying here if you want convenient location, clean room, have too much money and wanna pay $15.99 for wifi (NO free wifi in lobby), and possibly pay for whatever without notice.
review.negativeRemarks:
- wifi charge for $15.99?? 
- extremely unhappy experience with receptionist. check the complete story above

There was a separate shower and bath included, which allowed for us to clean ourselves in the shower and the later dip in a nice piping hot tub. It made for an amazing experience. The room was kept nice and clean during our stay, which was very much appreciated.

review.title: Standard room is a micro room with double bed
review.reviewText: This hotel is bait and switch at its finest. Rooms for this hotel are often sold at "discount" but the discounted room is small even for a closet dressed up as a room.  The hotel will happily upgrade you (not to a suite but to a small room with a king bed for a nightly fee equal to the amount you already paid) for a steep fee to a room that is still very small but at least it is not micro. Hotel also has a large daily charge for the health club and wifi fee is very steep and only includes one device.  I understand hotels charging for wifi but the fee should be reasonable and at least 2 devices should be included. I would strongly recommend avoiding this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel is all about Bait and Switch

it was a very surprising nice hotel in the middle of union square.  the room was clean the bathrooms very well maintained.  there were only a few knocks, but that comes will all hotels in downtown areas, was the cost of parking(57.00) and that about everything was extra add ons.  like the airlines, i guess everyone is trying to make

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: We used to stay across the street at Hilton when we came to the city. Several years ago we decided to try Nikko and we have been loyal customers ever since. Now today, I must say that the service has gone down a little bit and the price has increased a lot. It used to be $40/day to park the car. Now it is $50 to park plus a $7 tax. $57 total...way too much just to park. We always come there for an occasion ie: birthday or anniversary.  In the past they have upgraded our room at no charge and sometimes sent a bottle of champaigne to the room. We also used to get a room that had a couch (for our child to sleep on) at no extra charge. Now those rooms are way more expensive. The last two times we have stayed there our room did not have a couch for our child to sleep on. They just do not take care of us the way they used to or offer the extra's that made us loyal to them in the first place. We no longer get what we pay for with the higher priced room. The bell service is the best part of the stay. They greet you every time you come in or leave...opening doors, offering to flag a taxi for you, carry your bags etc. I feel like the bell service was the best part of our stay. The location is nice because we can walk to Union Square from the hotel. For our next visit to the city we will likely look into other options. A year ago I stayed at the Best Western on the Warf with a beautiful view of the bay. The room was cheaper, the parking was $35, missing that extra service but affordable
review.negativeRemarks: see above - improve the service at checkin with room upgrades etc especially when we say we are there for a birthday or anniversary
review.locationRemarks: shopping at Union Square is in walking distance.  The warf and other things like our dinner reservation at The House of Prime Rib required a taxi

review.title: Good hotel central to everything.
review.reviewText: Good hotel right near all of the transit lines (BART, MUNI, Cable Cars). I would compare this hotel to a Hilton or other major hotel chain. They charge you for everything such as WIFI and access to the pool and gym BUT I would recommend this over a Hilton. Check in was prompt, staff seemed happy although I asked for almost nothing. The hotel it's self could probably use a little updating especially in the common areas but it was by no means shabby. The rooms are very clean and have a modern touch to them. Great showers even though they spray water a bit on the bathroom floor (I don't care because I'm not the one cleaning it). Major props though to the power toilet though. I can't believe I am saying it but the toilet was the highlight of the hotel. It is basically a toilet with a bidet built into or onto it. Not a normal European bidet mind you but rather a bidet on steroids as only Japanese could imagine or invent. Heated seat, variable pressure, position, water temp, oscillating function, self cleaning type of bidet. I looked this thing up and it retails between $600 and $1000 so the fact this was in a standard queen size room was pretty cool. I stayed on the 20th floor and had a partial view of the Bay Bridge and Tenderloine area. Only complaint was that the hotel pool was undergoing renovations which the atrium pool was the primary reason I booked this hotel (oh and they would have charged a $20 fee to even use it I found out) so we could not use the pool.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Darren,

Thank you for taking the time to review us, but I am sorry that we did not meet all of your expectations. We had unexpected maintenance for our pool and, for the safety of our guests, had to close it. I have forwarded your comments regarding our pricing to our management team. We value any feedback we get from our guests -- yours is very much appreciated. I am very glad to hear Desiree took great care of you, she is a valued member of our team!

We hope to see you again soon!

Being the weather was 65 daily, this was not suitable. Yes, the Hilton is heated, but to walk across the street day after day and come out to the cool air was not a good option. They should have either discounted out room or maybe provided free internet, fitness, etc. I paid 70 bucks a day to upgrade for those things. 
On a positive note, all of the concierge staff were great, especially Desiree. We attended a show at Feinsteins and this was great as well. Check in staff and all others within the hotel were great. Location a plus!

review.reviewText: Upon arriving Hotel Nikko at 11pm on a friday night, valet service kindly greeted us escorted us and our belongings in the right direction. Although $50/day for in and out privileges is a bit pricey, the valet was on time and courteous. Entering the main lobby for check in, the representative (I think his name was Ken), welcomed us into the hotel, made us feel welcome and offered help for our luggage. We told him the reason for stay was for my girlfriends birthday weekend getaway, and he INSTANTLY upgraded our smaller room to a bigger king sized room. The room was clean, room service was quick to respond, bathroom was clean...I could go on and on about how great this hotel was. Not to mention it was in the heart of the city, made driving incredibly easy and quick. China town was within 5 minutes, Golden Gate Bridge was no more than 10-15 min away. All in all, the entire weekend was fabulous and would do it all over again!

review.title: Perfect location, beautiful hotel, great staff.
review.reviewText: What a lovely experience! The Nikko is located within walking distance of Union Square, (and fabulous shopping!) Chinatown, Little Italy. You can also walk to Fisherman's Wharf or walk to any of the nearby Cable Car stops and hop a cable car. The Concierge service at the Nikko is golden, not only are they extremely helpful, but very friendly and approachable. In fact, everyone who works there is very friendly. The only reason I couldn't give a complete 5 star review is because the little things that really added up by the end of our stay. Wi-fi is extra per day, and there is a fee for the pool and gym area, albeit a one time fee. There was a bottle of water on the table in the room, I naively thought is was complimentary and drank it. It was not free. Also, just moving something to make room in the minibar/fridge for something is an automatic charge. I ended up racking up a couple charges accidentally. As fancy-pants as this hotel is, it made me appreciate the all inclusive nature of the Quality Inns of the world. But all that said, I would highly recommend this hotel, and definitely stay there again.

review.reviewText: Stayed at hotels that didn't have windows that opened. Hotel Nikko, too, doesn't have windows that open. But at Nikko, the room was full of dust when we walked in. Other hotels managed to have a clean look and feel (and comfort) even with no window openings. Hotel Nikko didn't. I kept on getting sick 'cause of the dust problem. When we turned on the heat, of course dust problem occurred again. Other than that, the hotel was great. Towels were extremely clean, rooms were bigger than other hotels around. They have indoor pool (we upgraded our room to get pool access) but didn't use it 'cause of the strong chlorine odour. So, if you are just looking for a place to sleep, go here. If you are looking for comfort, clean, pool access, and ton of time to be spent at the hotel - go somewhere else.

review.title: great bargain, close to transit

Nikko staff was excellent. Very friendly and eager to help. Wish the room was a tad bigger but I ordered the petite queen so I got what I signed up for. Spent very little time in the room anyway as SF has soooo much to do. Nikko is clean, felt safe, and had abundant and fast elevator service. We were on the 18th and never had to wait more than 2 minutes for a lift. Recommend with no hesitation.

The location was central and an easy walk around downtown SF. The staff were friendly, especially the concierge who went out of the way to help locate a particular item we were looking for.

Our room rate was reasonable as we had got it as a "secret deal" on Expedia, however everything else at this hotel was super expensive, breakfast not included, $30, parking $50per day, internet $16 per day and you had to pay extra to use the pool & gym.

So a very comfortable stay but read the small print or you could spend more than you bargained for.

review.title: This is NOT a $1000 room as advertised on Expedia.
review.reviewText:
I booked this room through expedia bc it was advertised as a $1000 room on special for $250.

If I had even spent $500 on this room, I would have felt ripped off. Windows were dirty, no view, small and dark. Was advertised as pet friendly, but was asked if my dog was a "service animal." The fitness room was Not included as part of the Expedia rate either.

I spoke to the front desk and they said there is NO way my room would have cost $1000 at regular price. this was vey inflated.

This rating is more about Expedias false advertising than Hotel Nikko. The hotel is nice but don't be fooled to believe you are getting amazing value. The front desk felt sorry for me and later extended a fitness pass.

After this experience I will use extreme caution if booking hotels through expedia!

review.reviewText: Perfect for city and tourist attractions without being in fishermans wharf

review.title: Amazing hotel, close to Opera House, shaddy area
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself is amazing. Beautiful and modern, with a clear Japanese inspiration. The staff were incredibly polite and attentive, they responded to our needs quickly, and provided us with anything we requested. The price seems right for the standard of the hotel, though the area leaves a lot to be desired. Although we could walk to the War Memorial Opera House within 20 minutes from the hotel, the streets did seem pretty sketchy and I wouldn't have felt safe walking at night by myself. So definitely a cab is necessary. Also, you have to pay for the overnight parking, which seems excessive since you are already paying quite a bit of money to stay in the hotel to begin with.
The bar and restaurant were phenomenal, and the array of food for the breakfast buffet was ample. We upgraded to the Imperial suites on the 23rd floor, with its own lounge serving complimentary wine and cheese. The spread here wasn't too impressive, but it came included with the room upgrade.
This is a good hotel to stay for a night, maybe two. But the location does give me pause to stay any more nights.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern, stylish and incredibly nice and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Include free parking, at least for guests who are staying in the more expensive suites.
review.locationRemarks: War Memorial Opera House is within a 20 minute walk, but be warned of the sketchy area.

review.title: NICE HOTEL CLOSE TO EVERYTHING..
review.reviewText: very nice hotel. we traveled with our 5 month old baby and the room was a great size and quite at night time. the staff was excellent. would stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone. excellent service from drive up to check in to check out.

Check-in staff is extremely rude an unhelpful.

The rest of the staff is helpful and friendly.

No perks bot Expedia VIP.

Parking is $57/per day

Pool access is an extra $20

Gym access is extra

Lots of vagrants.

The Lobby Bar is the best part about this place.

Upgraded for and other $60 a night fee for same room better view and hey it actual came w/ internet.lol

However it doesn't take long until I realized it was my misunderstanding.
The room has everything that I need.
In addition to that, I can feel here and there that employees are caring of me.

review.reviewText: If you want great service, a nice room and a break from both tourist schlock and the uber-trendiness of San Francisco's business scene, stay at the Nikko.

review.title: Nice hotel close to many art galleries
review.reviewText: Went to see Vonda Shepard in the Feinstein room, which is in the hotel. Great show in a great little venue with cabaret seating. Efficient valet parking.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice staff at front and concierge desks. Fast elevators, nicely decorated and clean rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Located close to Union Square and many art galleries and restaurants.

review.title: Bad staff experience, felt ripped off and insulted
review.reviewText:
On check in and from my Expedia email, I was told I would get complimentary internet access because of my Expedia VIP status. However upon checkout, they not only tried to double charge me for it, the staff member tried to convince me that there was nothing in their system about the complimentary internet and that I somehow made it up. I eventually had the email from Expedia to show her and also explained they had charged me twice for the same thing anyway. That feeling of being ripped off was bad enough, but the staff member didn't have to try to convince me I was wrong without looking into it first.

I'm an experienced business traveller in the SF Bay area and have probably stayed at the majority of hotels around Union Square. Tons of better options around, Hyatt, Wyndham Parc55 for example.
review.positiveRemarks: Relatively close to union square, SF shopping center and BART but beware, it's on the closer side to the Tenderloin district which you should avoid.
review.negativeRemarks: Service, staff.
review.locationRemarks: If possible, try to stay at the Hyatt or Wyndham Parc 55 which are comparable in price but further away from the unsafe Tenderloin than the Nikko
