managementResponses.response:
Dear Mr. Guest,

Thank you very much for your note about your pleasant experience, and we look forward to any future stay at the Hotel Nikko San Francisco.

Concerning your inquiry of bed bugs on the internet, many websites allow free access postings and unfortunately may not be valid. Pests are a concern for any hotel, please be assured that not only are we in full compliance with federal and state laws concerning pest control in the hotel, but we are extremely proactive with the current state of this nationwide problem. Just this past fall 2013, we installed all brand new mattresses (every four years); and this year added mattress and box spring encasements:

Recommended by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), The National Pest Management Association (NPMA) and leading entomologists, encasing your mattress and box spring is perhaps the most cost effective, proactive step a property manager can make to limit exposure. I can fully assure you, the Hotel Nikko is committed to offering the very best in accommodations in the city of San Francisco and we look forward to your next visit
Sincerely
Marcia Striffeler

The only think I would take issue with was the down comforter - it had obviously not been cleaned in a while (if ever) and had some suspicious stains on it. The fact that it was not clean is not only gross, but not good considering this hotel has had reports of bed bugs.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of the down pillows and comforters - unhygienic, unnecessary, and the pillows were too full to be comfortable

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
I recently stayed at hotel nikko for six nights with my family. I was not impressed.

I had initially requested the two rooms that I paid for to be connected as an easier mean of communication for my family. However, when I arrived, I learned that the two rooms were on completely different floors and the receptionist told me that the hotel hadn't received my request when I have a record of proof. Additionally, during my stay, I found my hotel room quite dirty. There were several different stains on the carpet that were there the entire time I stayed at the hotel (even thought they were cleaned every day!). Also, there was a lot of calcium build-up around the shower and bathtub tiles (Gross!).

Overall, I was extremely unsatisfied with this hotel. The only thing that I really enjoyed was the fast internet connection but otherwise I wouldn't stay here again.

review.title: Nice, but....
review.reviewText:
This was a birthday weekend for both of us. One we've had at this hotel before two years ago. It is very pleasing in all accommodations, but unfortunately they have fallen victims to greed. They now charge you a separate fee for use of the exercise room, the business center, wifi in your room, the spa, the pool and of course parking. Like the airlines, if they can charge you for something, they do!!! I elected OT to use any of those "extra services" and my bill, with all the taxes and SF fees, etc. was $400+ for a two night stay! The place wasn't THAT nice. Another way of saying this, I would not have stayed at the Niko if I had known about these changes/charges for this ultimate price. I had other options.

As for Expedia, like the airlines, you need to start showing the full price with all the taxes and city fees when you advertise a price.
review.negativeRemarks: You can keep up with the "jones" and charge these extra fees because 'you can', like the other hotels in the area. Or distinguish yourself by NOT.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for nearby restaurants, entertainment and shopping.

review.title: Great Location- Union Square
review.reviewText:
Had a great experience at check-in. It was fast and friendly. We were even given a complementary pass to the pool and fitness center since it was our first stay.

The room was equipped with two full beds, not queens as stated in the description but were comfortable. The bathroom was very spacious and modern.

We visited the pool a couple of times and it was well heated. The jacuzzi was too hot. So hot that when we put our feet in the bottom we were burned by the very hot water coming out. A few minutes later the manager and a facilities person came and adjusted the temperature.

We did not eat at Hotel Nikko since we wanted to eat in the city, but Starbucks is conveniently on-site.

Overall, the stay was relaxing and pleasant.

review.title: Shining Brightly
review.reviewText:
This was my first stay at Hotel Nikko, for three nights mid-week.

The first impression was very positive, a spotlessly clean and elegant lobby with its front desk staffed by courteous professionals who greeted me by name as I approached. Nikko's bank of Mitsubishi elevators served me as if they were butlers, immediate arrival and fast moving! The overall vibe of this facility is of being well managed with much attention paid to these little details.
I enjoyed the clean, heated indoor pool and spa facilities- the former being quite unusual for a San Francisco hotel.

My room was extremely comfortable: an excellent bed, a choice of pillows, large plasma TV, roomy bathroom with a standing shower and a tub as well. This room had a nice view of downtown SF!

On my final night I had dinner at Nikko's house restaurant, Anzu, and was so pleased with its fresh sushi and chocolate dessert.

Overall, this was a great stay and I will stay there again.

review.title: Upscale hotel in the heart pf San Francisco
review.reviewText:
We visited the Hotel Nikko November 20-24 in San Francisco for my husband's 40th birthday. We arrived very early on the morning of the 20th and our room was not yet ready (10am). This was no problem and we quickly checked our bags in downstairs until our room was ready. We did this on the way out as well and there were not problems. At that time I also requested a room with a city view but was told the hotel was pretty booked and they would do their best. We stopped down the street for lunch a nice cafe' and walked around Union Square and hit a few stores while we waited for our room to be ready. About in hour before check-in we decided to try again and it jut so happened our room was ready for us. To our surprise when we entered the room, 1405, it was a corner room with 2 full walls of windows. Talk about a view-- it was fantastic and really made our trip. The room was clean and just the right size. The bed was very comfortable and didn't hear any noise from neighboring guests.

Throughout our stay we had the breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant, Anzu, several times which was very good with plenty of selection. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We did check out the fitness center and pool but did not have a chance to use it. We got most of our exercise running around town anyways.

Would stay here again. :-)
review.positiveRemarks: location, city view from room, and staff

review.title: just perfect in the middle of everything
San Francisco's finest
review.reviewText:
I was exhausted when I arrived. I was helped by the valet in a way I would never expect to get my car parked. When I got to the front desk, I had a confirmed reservation but the confirmation number was only on my computer. I was told this was not a problem. When I presented my visa card, it was one that had recently been given to me by my bank when I opened a new account, and it did not have my name on it. The front desk clerk told me that was a problem because they required one with my name on it. This was stressful because that made sense and yet it was all I had. If I had not been allowed to check in because of this, I do not think a good night was at all possible.
The front desk clerk explained she would tell her manager of the situation. She returned shortly and told me that one time only they would make an exception and honor my reservation. I was then given my key with a smile.
I have never been more grateful while checking in to a hotel. The manager that allowed me to stay at their amazing hotel made a friend for life. My room was top notch, and I could not possibly be more grateful to them.

review.title: Great hotel close to union square
review.reviewText: We stayed in a deluxe king on the 17th floor. The room was adequate size was very clean and had all the neccesities for an above average hotel. There is a garage on the corner that charges 32.00 for 24 hrs. but didn't have the energy after driving in the 49ers game traffic for an hour and a half. Paid 240.00 for a Sunday night don't know if that's a good deal or not. Check in was easy (no line) the gentleman was not overly friendly but efficient. Tried to up sell us on our room and breakfast for 60.00 more but we declined. Overall a good experience would stay again.

totally recommend this for business trip. the workout room was outstanding.

review.title: Modern hotel in the shopping district
review.reviewText:
My sister and I stayed in late October. The hotel was very pleasant, nice atmosphere, helpful staff. We did not eat in the restaurant or use the fitness facilities or attend the nightclub so can't comment on those, but everything was very well done so I'm sure those would be as well. We did not visit the breakfast buffet either, which seemed a little pricey. We would definitely stay there again. Thanks to Ernesto, the concierge, for a great restaurant referral to Fog Harbour at Pier 39 - terrific meal and lovely restaurant. He also set us up with their preferred double decker tour, Big Bus, which seemed the best of all the available options, although we preferred the audio tour to the live guides, if truth be told. Good general tour route - didn't hit all the high spots, but most.

The large homeless population in the area is sad to see, but not any reflection on the hotel itself. The whole area is a popular spot for tourists and homeless alike. Sad but not unusual for the downtown area of a populated city, especially one with a temperate climate. We don't know the San Francisco policies on assisting the homeless but some further efforts may be needed.
review.positiveRemarks: The clean modern look of the hotel - very sleek and comfortable. Good room size, but you want one up high enough to be out of the "street noise".
review.negativeRemarks: the extra charges are somewhat disconcerting, although we were well aware of them before we booked, and everything was laid out when we checked in.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square was okay, shopping was good variety but not great prices. Walked to Chinatown and Nob Hill and took cable car back.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Joe
Wow! I have never had a comment like this before! It has been passed on to our very aprofessional security department for review. .
We appreciate you brining this unusual event to our attention.

Marcia Striffeler

review.title: Bad Security
review.reviewText: A very conspicuously dressed pimp and his 6' hooker plopped down on a large marble table, 12" from our faces, in the lobby in full view of the concierge (he was on the phone). The pimp places a music device playing "Tupac" hip-hop on high volume on the marble table for all to hear sitting near by. This was at 11:30AM 10/27 on a Sunday morning. We get up to move feeling something bad is about to happen. Then then the pimp character hurls racial blasts at us (we gather he was insulted that we were not prospective customers) - to our amazement, the concierge never broke with the phone conversation. No security exists, period. We walked directly over to the concierge and confronted him (in a very loud tone - intentionally making a scene). Again, never broke from the phone conversation. The staff at the check-in area looked at us but did nothing. Meanwhile, the pimp and hooker stroll through lobby like they owned it, out the door. Nikko needs to seriously review their security policies. The poor/homeless outside of the building is to be expected - not the lobby
review.negativeRemarks: security
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco great

I was on the fourth floor so my bed faced the wall & not the windows & I couldn't see the sky. So I would recommend getting a room with a view if your going to stay more than a few nights or if your not a fan of small spaces.

review.title: Wonderful hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: We spent a couple nights at the Nikko for a weekend away from LA. We like how central it is to shopping and restaurants, but we always stay in Union Square, so that's not new. The Nikko is as luxurious as a 4 star in SF gets. The rooms are clean, modern, fresh and comfortable. The staff is really friendly, and it's great that there's a Starbucks right downstairs. The sushi restaurant (ANZU) seemed great, but didn't get to try it this time. I'll stay at the Nikko again!
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy and luxurious rooms, Starbucks downstairs

review.reviewText: It was a nice place to stay, the hotel is lovely. But the rooms were way smaller then they seemed online. I also like to be able to have a window open while I sleep.

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of everything
review.reviewText:
Only stayed for one night, booking last minute, getting a fantastic rate and an Expedia Elite Plus upgrade to boot. Have had, unfortunately, a very short stay, as would have definitely liked to stay a bit longer.

The room was spacious and clean, the bed was very comfortable and everything worked as expected. I did not have to use the hotel's Wi-Fi (had my own mifi), so can't comment on that, but others already have.

Valet parking was expensive ($55 incl. tax), but very friendly and efficient. The location is great if you plan to take BART instead.

The Club level was excellent and private with great breakfast and wine in the afternoon The ANZU restaurant had excellent food decor and wine selection Staff called you by name and treated you like long lost friend The shower had a drainage problem and from the time of reporting it to Mr. Flores fixing it was less than 30 minutes

review.title: Last minute choice in Union Square area.
review.reviewText:
I have driven past this hotel many times, but never stopped and stayed. I looks great from the outside, but I thought it would be an expensive businessman's hotel.

SURPRISE! After my last minute decision to spend the weekend in San Francisco, Nikko San Francisco was the last one that offered a reasonable price for 2 nites. The room was small, true, but elegant, and a way that one could only describe 'quiet elegance'. Perfect for anyone who wants a quiet place to get away for a weekend. The lobby was astounding with its overwhelming use of white marble, and stairs leading to street 2 floors below had a very noisy cascading waterfall, down the same type of while marble we walked on. The noisy fountain was a plus, not a distraction. The use of the hottest, latest types of lamps, sconces, and other touches gave the feeling of elegant, understated beauty. The room service food was great, and all staff were impressively engaged in making me feel special during my staying. I easily give it 5 stars in all categories.
review.negativeRemarks: Wet bar in the room.
review.locationRemarks: hey, it's Union Square, San Francisco. That says enough all by itself.

review.title: Add ons galore
review.reviewText: An OK hotel but all you get is the room. If you want to use the gym or spa you pay extra. Car parking is also extra and expensive. We were looking for a relaxing drink in the bar but we could not find it. Thought is was in the lobby as directed by staff so sat for over half an hour waiting to be served. Finally got up and tracked some one down only to be told they didn't serve people in the lobby, even though we sat and watched the serve a group of people!!!! No apologies, or anything. Not good
review.negativeRemarks: Service, parking, directions for bars, etc

Checking in takes a long time, but you get a glass of wine when you reach the counter. They should offer it while you are waiting your turn! Rooms are clean and functional, but don't expect anything fancy or luxurious, they are small and plain.

If you can, try to avoid staying on Saturday night. The rate is almost twice as high.
review.locationRemarks: There is a Starbucks next door, and Mason cafe half a block away offers excellent breakfast.

review.title: Too Little Room for the Cash
review.reviewText:
My wife an I stayed the night in San Francisco in October. We did not make a reservation prior to arriving so we could see what area to stay in. While drinking coffee we searched Expedia for rooms and found the Hotel Nikko had gone from almost $500 a night to $180, I guess since it was 6pm on the day we were staying. We reserved ot thinking "WOW", this is going to be awesome.

Not quite, the room was only about 80-100 square feet with a bed desk and tv. Not fancy at all!!! I have stayed at $100 dollar rooms that were way nicer.

Plus there is a $50 a day parking fee and a $20 a day gym/pool use fee. Do your research and get your money worth. The mass transit in Frisco is amazing so you can pretty much stay anywhere and get to the heart of the city

In order to include breakfast and wifi. Since we don't eat breakfast we only wanted the wifi. This was too very costly. In our last day we rented a car and wanted to park over night. The parking price on the other side of the street was half of the hotel's.

Overall except the location and the clean room everything else was overprice. As i said before since there was a big convention in town the rooms were also overpriced. So no thank you I'm not coming back.

She stated it could take up to 10 days to be credited back to my account and that it is a California state law??? I'm pretty sure the state doesn't care if I try and sneak a snickers bar out of the mini bar!! The bed was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in and the concierge, Ernesto, was extremely helpful. I would definetly return.

review.reviewText: They charge to me for a breakfast that was included in the cost of the room. Very bad feeling.

review.title: Great location in a great city!
review.reviewText:
Overall a great hotel in a central location. The hotel is spacious and airy with plenty of facilities. However the hotel does charge for hotel pool use which is a one off fixed charge. Bit naughty though. The staff are very friendly and helpful, although never enough staff on at peak times and at one point reception was left completely unattended for 5 minutes. Completely unacceptable in a 4 star hotel.
Cocktail bar is opulent with a wonderful live piano player so the hefty price tag felt justified. We never ate at the hotel.
Rooms are a good size (we stayed on the 15th floor) for a deluxe room and its always worth requesting a high floor for a great city view. Beds are very comfy.
Finally the internet is expensive and probably not worth it. My pet hate is hotels charging for internet when it is free for them anyway. Grrrr. However, i would definitely stay in this hotel again and would happily recommend it to couples and families alike looking for something a little bit special in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: More staff attending concierge and reception at peak times. No charge for the internet!!!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is nearby so lots of restaurants within walking distance. I recommend 'Johns Grill' a historical steak restaurant which is great fun.
