review.title: Conference Stay
review.reviewText: Stayed here recently for a week long business conference. The hotel is within walking distance from the Moscone Center. The checkin process was fast and simple and the front desk staff was very polite and professional. I was in a king on the 17th floor, and had a great view. The room was very clean and had plenty of space. I would stay here again for sure.

review.title: Perfect location, great service
review.reviewText: We arrived late, after midnight and were checked in quickly by a pleasant desk host. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. The concierge, Christian was especially helpful and patient with our questions about directions and everything else. We enjoyed the buffet brunch at the Anzu Restaurant. The food and service was excellent. The hotel was impressive and a great value.
review.positiveRemarks: We really had a positive experience and will stay there when we return to this wonderful city of San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathtub could use updating.
review.locationRemarks: The location was central to public transportation, shopping, restaurants, and bars.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to work.
review.reviewText: Location is convenient to my office, the room is quite comfortable, and the staff is very courteous. All of which are very important while traveling for work and spending insane numbers of hours in a conference room.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, and a comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: The price for a single glass of Scotch was a bit shocking....but it was good Scotch and the service was perfect, so I shouldn't complain too much.
review.locationRemarks: Unfortunately I do not know much about things to do near by...I travel and stay there for work.

review.title: Great hotel to Market St and Union Square shopping
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much as because of the great sized and clean rooms and hotel staff service was excellent.
review.positiveRemarks: The location, room size and cleanliness, separate shower and bath in the King Deluxe rooms and hotel staff service and friendliness
review.locationRemarks: Very handy location as it's close to the BART train system, Market St shops, Union Square and Powell St cable car terminus.

review.title: Clean, convenient stay in great location.
review.reviewText: Central location, friendly staff and nice clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Too much chlorine in the pool and jacuzzi. It actually discolored my brand new swim trunks.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square, Powell Street cable cars, Market Street, Westfield Mall (very nice cupola). The Big Bus Hop-On, Hop-Off bus stops outside.

review.title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Service
review.reviewText: I flew in to San Francisco for a wedding and I was definitely impressed by the service of the hotel, they go out of their way to give you the best experience possible.

review.title: Nice hotel. Close to transportation
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Close to transportation. Beautiful view

review.title: First class service & first class stay
review.reviewText: Arrived at hotel Nikko and Charlene checked me in and also upgraded my hotel room.I was quite pleased with the upgrade.Fantastic view and nice soaking bathtub 2 flat screen TV's 2 bathrooms, it was a great upgrade. The stay was very professional,patient & kind.The hotel also has a restuarant, the Anzu and the food was delicious.They have great sushi and the free range chicken dinner was excellent.I definitely plan on returning to the Hotel Nikko in the future.Excellent stay & experience.Highly recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was first class & the staff was too
review.negativeRemarks: They have a massage therapist on call,but if they added a spa so guest can get facials and such, that would be fabulous
review.locationRemarks: Location was great.I was a block from Union Square where there was lots of great shopping,food,and entertainment.If you need a cab, very easily access

review.title: Japanese Hospitality, Great location
review.reviewText: Excellent and attentive Service. Only stayed one night but everything was perfect

review.title: Nice hotel - area not great
review.reviewText:
Really nice hotel. & facilities.
Convenient for union square and Powell for station & cable cars.
Unfortunately, it's also very close to the main location for down & outs and beggars.

The hotel needs to recognise that reality and advise guests to exit via O'farrel street rather than Mason street.

review.title: All around excellent.
review.reviewText: Convenient to city tourism: Union Square, China Town, Cable Cars....

review.title: Great location for shopping
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. Tenderloin District a little too close for comfort. Enjoyed the closeness of public transport and visitor centre, as well as lots of great shopping.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for shopping, although reasonably priced places to eat were a little difficult to find without guidance from locals.

review.title: Nikko
review.reviewText: Great location, easy access to major events, shopping and restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: Free wireless with the price of the room
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, Market Street, Powell Trolley, Foley's Pub. Great restaurants within 3 blocks

review.title: Nice hotel if you are not driving
review.reviewText: Received a warm welcome from reception staff, reasonable sized room; area was a bit of a shock in terms of the number of homeless on the street otherwise a great experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve availability of concierge, when in attendance always a queue and at times when not in attendance requiring you totext requests.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, street cars and shops

review.title: almost perfect
review.reviewText: I need to keep this short.. The hotel was beautiful and very comfortable.. My only complaint is the door hop .. He was a little on the rude side.. Everyone else we ran into were wonderful. Thanks for a good time...

review.title: Beautiful hotel––amazing location
review.reviewText: The Nikko was clean, modern, comfortable, and amazingly located. The view of the city was incredible, and the bed was super nice to sleep in. Highly recommend getting breakfast in bed via their write-your-order-and-leave-outside-your-door service.

review.title: Room comfort could be improved
review.reviewText: While the room was spacious, the hotel's air conditioning system seemed old - kept switching off and on every few minutes, and the air quality in the room felt inadequate. Also, the water pressure in the shower was very low.
review.positiveRemarks: On the positive side, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the location of the hotel was good.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: Reception was very polite and check in was easy. The bellman was very helpful and fast. The breakfast was good and offered a buffet. Japanese and American food items are available, plus an extensive menu. The room was a good size, well kept with a coffee maker, iron / ironing board with robes.
review.positiveRemarks: The Hotel was clean and recently updated. The staff was extremely polite and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The location was great, right near one of the main cable car lines, just 1 1/2 blocks off Union Square.

review.title: Disappointed that we were not upgraded sooner
review.reviewText: I would love to give this hotel stars. Our room (eventually) was outstanding and all the people we dealt with friendly enough. We were booked for 4 nights. We requested a fridge and when out and bought breakfast food and snacks to save money eating out. At about 8:30 am, we were woken by loud sounds: hammering, sawing. It sounding like they were in our room it was so close. It went on and on. We called down and were told that yes, there was some construction happening our floor, they were very sorry and would we like an upgrade? We took the upgrade (which ironically included breakfast and appies). This room was big, beautiful with a fantastic view. Huge bathroom, very clean. Bottom line: The hotel obviously knew that construction would be happening on our floor right next to that room , and yet still put us there. At the very least they could have 1) told us and 2) automatically upgraded up so we didn't have to be rudely woken up on the first day of our holidays. Every front desk person I talked to was very apologetic and all said they knew nothing about construction. (Perhaps possible). However, a hotel knows what is going on where and when and they put us in that room to see if we would put up with it. They did the right thing by putting us in the upgraded room but should not have put us in the other room in the first place.

review.title: Away on business
review.reviewText: I have no complaints, had a short and comfortable experience.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location, but...
review.reviewText:
The hotel is very well located, close to shops, restaurants etc.
Rooms are clean, nice bathroom.
But, random charges show up everywhere ($20 for the pool, $16 to rent a movie, $16 for the wireless internet, $50 for valet parking, and so on and so forth). I felt like I was taken for a ride.
review.negativeRemarks: Random fees that show up everywhere

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Staff was absolutely wonderful, bed was too comfy to ever want to leave.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, kind staff, the room rate was extremely reasonable considering how beautiful the hotel was.
review.negativeRemarks: Guests shouldn't be charged to use the pool. That's ridiculous.
review.locationRemarks: Biscuits and Blues across the street. I highly recommend going there. The honey butter will change your life!

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Theresa was very helpful with my reservation and made sure all my requests were met. My room had an amazing view and was very clean. All the hotel staff were helpful and friendly. I will be back!
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Nice hotel ealking diatance to union square
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, walking distance to great restaurants and shopping area.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to shopping mall, restaurants and different shops in the street. Lot to see around.

review.title: Not how I remembered it
review.reviewText: I had stayed at Hotel Nikko many years ago (15+) and was very impressed at that time. On this trip, I was disappointed this trip to find that my room was not in very good condition for a hotel of this caliber. The draperies were torn off the tracks and I could not easily pull them open or closed. The sheets on the bed looked like someone's pen had exploded on them - what looked like black ink everywhere. The towels looked like they had not been refreshed in 10 years. There was no pile left, and they were flat and rough like sand paper. The shower grout had some mildew/mold in it. Overall it was very disappointing. On the upside, the bed was very comfortable, the staff were very nice and the restaurant Anzu was excellent for both breakfast and dinner. However, with all of the choices of high-end hotels all over the place in San Francisco, on my next business trip, I will try a different hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Someone needs to inspect the rooms more carefully and fix things that are broken. Housekeeping needs to make sure sheets are clean.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good for my business trip.

review.title: Great location in busy city
review.reviewText: Luxury in Union Square, plenty of restaurants, easy public transportation.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rooms, comfortable bed, fantastic bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: Internet should be free
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco is at the hotel's steps

review.title: Nice hotel but overpriced. San Francisco pricey
review.reviewText:
Room was nice but only slightly better than a Marriott or Holiday Inn. They charge $20 extra for gym and pool. WIFI extra too! Bottled water was untouchable at $8. Staff were nice and friendly.

Room was clean but floor had a wet spot near fridge. Somewhat noisy even at 11th floor.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good. Found free parking on street at hotel. Cable car station just one block away.

review.title: Horrible rip off!
review.reviewText: Really felt discriminated against at this hotel. Apparently guests who pay full price get access to all all amenities but if you find a deal online they will nickle an dime you to death. $20 to use the pool, $15.99 for wireless internet!, $45 for Valet parking and no option to self-park. Made me feel I was taken for a ride. Lured in with a cheap rate only to be charged for services that other guests get for free. When I complained at the front desk they would not consider my complaint even for a second. Asked them to wave the wireless internet charge and again was practically laughed at by staff who seemed to hate working for the place more than I hated being there. An apparently very high end and financially lucrative Hotel that would not wave a $15.99 fee to make a guest happy shows how much the staff really cared about their clientele. Very Petty. All other places I've stayed at and most restaurants now offer free WiFi. Get with the times Hotel Nikko.
review.negativeRemarks: Treated horribly by staff that obviously hated working for the place.
review.locationRemarks: Very Central but in the middle of the tourist/San Fran. downtown madness. Would have been better to get a place by the Castro or on Haight.

review.title: Great hotel, in the heart of Union Square.
review.reviewText: We got a gorgeous corner room with a beautiful view! We were steps away from everything we needed: transportation, restaurants, tourist attractions, even walking distance from AT&T Park! The hotel was in excellent condition and very clean. The staff was also extremely friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location! The pool and workout area was also very nice. It did cost a little extra, but well worth the money.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is steps away from the bus as well as the BART, which is a convenient & cheap way to get to / from the airport.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Had a really pleasant experience staying in this Hotel. The Staff was really courteous, and polite, and the Hotel was maintained very well. Thank You, to the staff, and all the employees that we came in contact with!

Richard & Julie
review.positiveRemarks: Mostly the location, and the cleanliness of the The location, and the cleanliness of the property.
review.negativeRemarks: Wish they could improve the water pressure in the bath.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, good transportation, and a lot of restaurants, in Walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Overall a good place to stay close to Union Square, however you have to pay extra to use their facilities such as the internet, the pool or their exercise facility, and their customer service is below the standards for a 4 star hotel.

I left something behind in the room fridge and called the very same day and was told someone would get back to me. It took a few more phone calls over the next few days to find out that the item was no longer there.

There are much better hotels for the same price around Union Square and I'll be sure to use them instead of going back to Hotel Nikko.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service and do away with the extra fees for use of the hotel facilities.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square. Great shopping

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great location in downtown San Francisco, close to the Bart(Powell), trams, union square, china town. Walking distance to loads.
Room was a nice size, plenty big(petite queen) and nice and clean.
Staff were very helpful

review.title: Decent, but deceiving.
review.reviewText:
The Hotel Nikko has moderately high rates, but all kinds of extra cost "amenities." WiFi in your room for 24 hrs
is 16 dollars, their swimming pool is 20 dollars a day. These were highlighted on their website--not specifically
included, but not clear either. I won't go there again. At least there were no bedbugs.
review.positiveRemarks: The guys outside were great at getting a taxi.
review.negativeRemarks: Front desk attitude.
review.locationRemarks: Just ignore the panhandlers and there is lots to see within a few blocks.

review.title: Beautiful hotel- worth a visit
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stayed at Hotel Nikko. We visited the restaurant which served delicious food. As we were only staying for a short time we asked the concierge (Scott) for help. He was absolutely brilliant and had a good knowledge of the city and was happy to help.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were friendly and the restaurant superb
review.locationRemarks: Located close to union square

review.title: California Road Trip 2013
review.reviewText:
We stayed at The Nikko Hotel for the San Francisco leg of our trip and were very pleased with this choice. The Hotel is in a very central location and within walking distance to Union Square, fantastic shopping facilities and restaurants. The transport links in SanFrancisco are amazing and its easy to explore the City by public transport (you even get reduced admission to the California Academy of Sciences if you travel there by public transport!).
The Nikko Hotel is a very well presented Hotel with good gym and pool facilities. Our room was very clean and spacious and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a Starbucks connected directly to the Hotel foyer which is handy for a quick morning coffee.
There is an Irish pub (Foleys) next door on O'Farrell St. which serves great food, and a small japanese restaurant called Dojima Ann which is very good too. We had an excellent meal at a busy Itallian restaurant called Scala on Powell St, but much more expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: The beautifully decorated spacious foyer was wonderful. The beds were extremely comfortable. The location was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Very minor things - some of the furniture in the bedroom is starting to shows signs of wear
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location within easy walking distance to shopping, restaurant facilities, public transport and cable car.

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: The concierge was so helpful in giving us options and advice for our tourist activities! Our room had windows on two sides-- we felt like we were in a tree house far above the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was a bit mushy-- not much support.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and Chinatown. Several good dining options nearby.

review.title: Will Be Back!
review.reviewText: The Nikko is truly a lovely hotel. It is not gaudy or overly decorated like some other Union Square hotels. All public spaces and rooms are nicely appointed and spotless. Wonderful views from higher floors, very comfortable beds and nice large bathrooms with huge tubs and stall showers. Nikko's greatest strength lies in their staff - all are charming, sincere and committed to making your stay with them a pleasant one. Housekeeping is fast, thorough and thoughtfully refill the rooms based on your preferences/needs. Everyone was a delight to encounter, from our arrival at the front door until our departure. Will definitely be my choice for future visits.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean décor, nice but not overly ornate. Lobby seating extremely comfortable. Fast elevators, great beds, gym/pool.
review.negativeRemarks: Thought the room carpet was near end of life, but it was clean. One outlet in the bathroom did not function, but not a big deal.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Market Street for stores and transportation. Only felt a car was necessary for two days of our stay in order to see wine country.

review.title: Central hotel for shopping
review.reviewText: Service was first class. Beautiful hotel, staff extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel is really central for shopping and only 40 mins walk from Fisherman's wharf. Room had great view and immaculately clean. No faults found
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: central for shopping and sightseeing

review.title: Nice hotel but is close to the 'Loin'
review.reviewText: Great hotel and made even better as they gave me and my family an upgrade to the Imperial Club Floor. This was great as it included a complimentary breakfast! Rooms were clean and spacious and they accommodated a request for both rooms to be next to each other. The restaurant was a bit a disappointment and lacked atmosphere - only ate there once and then went out every night - loads of places to eat in SF. Gym was good and used the pool a couple of times - although was a little small and shallow. As you would expect there are undesirables in any city, but there a lot in SF - so would suggest turning right only as you come out of the hotel. That said it was well located and everything was easy to get to.
review.positiveRemarks: Imperial Club and complimentary breakfast. Room size and complimentary wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant
review.locationRemarks: Good, but be aware Tenderloin is next door!

review.title: Great location and great price
review.reviewText: Love the location if you want to be close to union square and the heart of the city. Hotel was also very pretty and well taken care of. The bed was extremely comfortable. And it was $50 less than the Hilton across the street :)
review.locationRemarks: Lori's Diner is open 24 hrs & is an easy walk for a late night snack / meal. Dining outside at the Cheesecake Factory has quite the view & great food

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location and friendly helpful staff also a free in room safe and plenty of viewing options on the tv also probably the best equipped gym I have encountered in any hotel
review.positiveRemarks: The location is just within walking distance of union square. The staff were very helpful with touring ideas.
review.negativeRemarks: Price per night is a bit high. As well as wait times during check in.

review.title: Imperial stay!
review.reviewText:
Awesome experience in one of the Imperial Club rooms on the 24th floor. The room was clean, sleek, and spacious (considering that it's in San Francisco). The hotel's location, just two blocks from Union Square, is outstanding. The hotel staff were highly professional and kind. From the valet-parking employee (Cesar) to the bellman (Malake?), everyone was eager to help (including maps, recommendations, etc.) Five stars.
The breakfast room (on the 23rd floor) has a spectacular view of the city. The fitness center is quite large and there is a swimming pool! We were on a road trip (Kansas-California and back) and stayed in San Francisco for three days. After each long day of touring San Francisco, coming back to our room was a bliss. We enjoyed the hotel so much that it made us wish to have arranged for a longer stay.

review.title: Worth it..
review.reviewText: They have been surprising me since i stayed with them last time.. Right from the location to the Guests room everything was great.

review.title: DOWNTOWN UNION SQUARE
review.reviewText: MOST FABULOUS VIEWS..RIGHT BY CABLE CARS...THE UTMOST IMPORTANCE OF TAKING CARE OF EVERY NEED...
review.positiveRemarks: EVERYTHING--I MEAN EVERYTHING...LOCATION,STAFF,VIEWS...CABLE CARS SHOPPING ECT...
review.negativeRemarks: I CAN THINK OF NOTHING. 1ST CLASS HOTEL
review.locationRemarks: RIGHT BY CABLE CARS -SHOPPING-GREAT DINNING..SOUNDS CRAZY BUT A GREAT WALGREENS WITH FRESH FOOD OF ALL KINDS

review.title: Will return if ever in SF and happily recommend...
review.reviewText: Initial visual very pleasing, reception staff very polite and helpful, room excellent, pool and gym all that is required, location ideal (close to all forms of transport). Hotel parking is expensive but so is everywhere in San Fran. Stay here definitely.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking costs
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and all forms of transport.

review.title: The location
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was very convenient for walking to many spots. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to many of the places we wanted to see.

review.title: Nice hotel very close to shopping and trolley
review.reviewText: Very helpful and accommodating staff. Made my wife and I feel very welcome
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful accommodations, pleasant friendly staff, great location, close to everything the city has to offer.

review.title: Ok but nothing special
review.reviewText: This hotel was on par with the Westiin but in a better location because it was close to the muni station. The only negatives were no free Internet, charged for use of the pool which is ridicules and I informed them that this was a birthday trip and any other hotel of this calibre has always given a birthday treat - this hotel nothing not even a simple card.
review.negativeRemarks: Upcharges
review.locationRemarks: Close to muni but on edge of Tenderloin

review.title: Wonderful rooms, location not so good.
review.reviewText: Extremely clean and comfortable room. Mattresses beyond comfortable, best night sleep in a hotel. Quiet, view was so-so, but that wasn't important to me. Did not like that it was an extra charge for the use of the pool and/or fitness center. While the hotel is impressive and very comfortable and clean, the area around the hotel has many shops and central to cable cars, shopping and restaurants and night life, but the amount of homeless loitering and begging really brings the enjoyment level way down. I need to go back in a month and I will not stay at Nikko because of the area surrounding the hotel. i will try another location in San Francisco. It isn't that I am unaccustomed to the homeless, I am from a much bigger city than San Francisco. The amount and widespread dispersion is what was surprising. Also, just so you are prepared, marijuana is smoked openly on the street and we encountered it about 50 times each day. Immediately around the hotel as well.
review.negativeRemarks: The area around the hotel and the downtown area as a whole needs to have its' homeless problem addressed.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, close to public transportation. China town, Japan Center ,Market Street, Westfield Mall, streetcar rides.

review.title: Nicer hotel near union square
review.reviewText: Overall great experience and i will return again. Loved the environment, and the hotel had a nice size gym. You do have to pay an extra $20 to use the gym/pool.
review.positiveRemarks: The comfort and attentive hotel staff
review.negativeRemarks: Pool was alittle old but still nice to hang out in
review.locationRemarks: Its downtown sf! So much to do!!

review.title: Nice hotel, next to Market street.
review.reviewText: Great experience, very nice hotel. Gym and pool facility are great.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly, the rooms were clean and comfortable and the location was excellent.

review.title: One of the nicest hotels I've have stayed at.
review.reviewText: The staff was very accommodating. The rooms were neat and clean.
review.positiveRemarks: The interior was bright and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: The tv. was very difficult to work. When you went to guide, there was no way to know what was playing on that channel. Annoying. No refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: Very well located. Lots of restaurants in area. Only two blocks from cable car.

review.title: Beautiful hotel in amazing location
review.reviewText:
I really loved my stay at Hotel Nikko. The number one reason was the staff. Everyone from the front desk, concierge, and bell staff were all so warm, friendly, accommodating and did their job well. The lobby is beautiful with marble floors, modern couches/chairs and dispensers with cucumber/citrus water. There's even an entrance to Starbucks from the lobby. The location is fantastic - I was able to walk to Union Square and Market St/San Francisco Center in only a couple of blocks. The line for the cable cars is also in the same vicinity. I would think it's great for anyone visiting San Francisco for the first time.

Although I had hoped to, I didn't end up using the pool or fitness center. I was also a little disappointed by the extra fees. And other reviewers had said something about the carpeting; and yes, the carpeting in my room was stained. Housekeeping could probably use to go over the room again, too. But, the beds were super comfortable and I had no problems with noise. I've actually never slept at hotel as well as I did here.

I also noticed some of the other, more expensive hotels near Hotel Nikko and none looked as nice as Nikko. All in all, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Minor improvements in housekeeping. Keep fees to a minimum
review.locationRemarks: In the center of it all! Union Square, cable cars, Market St, San Francisco Center, easy bus ride to other parts of city

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of downtown.
review.reviewText: My wife and I were celebrating our honeymoon by driving from Seattle to San Francisco and we wanted to end or trip in a fancy hotel. Hotel Nikko suited us just fine! Our room, although quite small, was very clean and cozy. The staff was VERY knowledgeable and helpful with any questions we had. I'd recommend them to anybody.
review.positiveRemarks: Everything. The staff was great, as was our view.
review.locationRemarks: It was a bit away from the piers, but we were happy to do a lot of walking so that didn't bother us.

review.title: Always courteous and helpful
review.reviewText: Staff was excellent from the moment we pulled up. Little touches like calling our room to let us know that our bags were coming up. Didn't have to wonder when they would arrive.
review.negativeRemarks: Restaurant seemed a little short-handed for Sat morning.
review.locationRemarks: Union square shopping.

review.title: beautiful hotel right in downtown
review.reviewText: this hotel is beautiful and right in the heart of downtown. there are a lot of cool bars and restaurant right around this hotel. its far from fisherman's wharf and pier 39 but there are lots of cable cars right down the block you can ride down to the water. the concierge was usually busy so dont rely on that, i never got to talk to them once.

review.title: great location one block of Union Square
review.reviewText: Appreciated the valet service being so quick. Also helpful in calling us a taxi.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the style of the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower was very small. Our view wasn't the best, but ok.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - lots of shopping. Eno Wine Tasting bar was the BEST!

review.title: Kiwis in San Fran
review.reviewText: Loved staying here, great central location. Nice room, good staff, no complaints at all except maybe free wifi would be good but being able to go downstairs to Starbucks works ok.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and quality of the hotel itself.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi.
review.locationRemarks: Great for walking everywhere or for getting the bus. Was quiet too.

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice, very clean, the staff was nice, the location was excellent, I recommend this hotel
review.positiveRemarks: The location, the service and the hotel
review.locationRemarks: It´s near de union square, the mall, restaurants, very good location

review.title: Good, but they ding you on the extras.
review.reviewText: Great hotel - looks nice and modern and has average/decent rooms. Great staff. Only issues are you have to pay an extra $20 per stay to use the pool and fitness centre. And WiFi is ridiculous as you have to pay $16 a day which is unreasonable. You can go to another hotel and get free WiFi.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra fees
review.locationRemarks: Union square

review.title: Great location, very central.
review.reviewText: The accommodation was very comfortable and pleasing to the eye. The staff were very helpful and obliging. Nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was superb. The facilities ie. pool, gym, seating area - excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: The marble in the foyer looked a little tired.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, near Union Square for shops and entertainment.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is located near the cable car terminal, bus stops, BART, and shopping. Starbucks is also on the ground floor. The room is clean but small. I wish there was more space in the mini fridge for our own food. Overall we had a great stay.

review.title: The perfect hotel
review.reviewText:
We booked for three nights without any particular expectations, and were amazed to have what was, for us, the perfect hotel experience. Our room was very roomy, extremely comfortable and immaculately clean. It was tastefully appointed and had a reasonable view, though mainly of the hotel across the way.

Throughout our stay, we were continually and exceptionally pleased at the consumate competence and the obvious desire to be helpful of the staff with whom we engaged. In all our exchanges, we were treated with superior professionalism, and without even a hint of condescension.
review.positiveRemarks: It was a joy to be to be assisted by staff so obviously desiring to serve and to smooth our way. Beautiful hotel, great location. terrific room.
review.negativeRemarks: The business facility was average. I came without a laptop, and when using a hotel computer for Internet, was asked to do so while standing.
review.locationRemarks: About two blocks from Union Square, many restaurants and good shopping nearby.

review.title: Amazing hotel!
review.reviewText: The staff is very nice and the hotel is beautiful amazing two days spend there it's a very clean hotel and marble entrance! They offer breakfast lunch and dinner in there restaurant that's not included with stay but worth every penny!
review.positiveRemarks: The rooms clean hallways smell clean fresh new. Staff so nice!
review.negativeRemarks: Only that they charge $6 for a bottle of water it's a bit high nothing else I have to say really!
review.locationRemarks: It's down the street from union square and shopping, the electric train busses taxis always outside hotel plenty restaurants around great walking area

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Union Square & Market Street
review.reviewText: It's only a couple blocks from Union Square and shopping at Macy's, etc... as well as the start of a Cable Car line.
review.locationRemarks: Ride the Cable Car. Shopping in Union Square

review.title: Nice place to stay, terrible neighborhood
review.reviewText: I am very pleased with my stay at this hotel it's unfortunate that the neighborhood is terrible, there are bums everywhere, can't even sit outside at the Starbucks thats attached because there was always bums sitting there, cannot go a city block without passing at least one, thats EXTREME!! It's to bad this hotel is in the wrong place but we did enjoying staying in it!
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, friendly staff, nice lobby while listening to piana music on the speakers, pool and weight room are very nice as well as our room
review.negativeRemarks: The neighorhood! There can and should be some control on that area of bums bothering the tourists
review.locationRemarks: Getting on the trolley to Fishermand Wharf, china town, shopping

review.title: Great location--easy access to Union Square,
review.reviewText: Very easy and pleasant experience--I appreciated the room upgrade for only $30, and the concierge team were so kind and helpful from arrival to departure. In fact they were the best staff in the hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: I enjoyed being so close to Union Square & Market Street --restaurants and stores. The hotel lobby is comfortable, inviting: a great place to relax.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathrooms are super bright--just tone the lighting down a bit!
review.locationRemarks: Tons of restaurants, stores and easy access to transportation. For a business traveler it's very comfortable.

review.title: Great hotel for everyone.
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel to stay with family, friends or business. Its very good located, near all important activities or transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: No free Wi-Fi. And expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Very well located, near shops, tourist locations, starbuck's and wallgreens.

review.title: The hotel staff was amazing.
review.reviewText: The hotel is gorgeous. The staff extremely accommodating. Location and view were outstanding
review.positiveRemarks: The beauty and the staff and the location
review.locationRemarks: Union Square!!! By everything

managementResponses.response: thank you for your comment

review.title: Very helpful and friendly staff!
review.reviewText: Everyone at the Hotel Nikko was helpful and friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, theater, AT&T Park.

review.title: Overall a great option but beware of extra charges
review.reviewText: Was overall an impressive hotel & initially great value but they charge extra for wifi, pool/gym etc & I find this deceiving of the original price quoted. Great location, great facilities (once you pay extra). I think the staff should be a bit more informative about tourist attractions, etc as we were sent to the wrong area twice from reservation staff. Apart from that we were happy with our stay, thanks!
review.positiveRemarks: Great Location, lovely room, fun indoor pool & spa (especially with kids), excellent gym.
review.negativeRemarks: Hidden extras quite costly, reception staff could be a bit more knowledgable
review.locationRemarks: Really great location, easy access to shops, food, transport etc

review.title: Very Nice, Friendly and Professional Service
review.reviewText:
When We checked in the staff was very welcoming and nice. They explained everything up front and made sure to let us know that if we had any questions to let them know. We went over to the concierge and were very happy we did. He explained to us everything around since we had never been to San Fran before. He was really quite the help and made sure to point out on a labeled map where everything was in proximity to us.

We never ate at the hotel but it looked very nice. Maybe a little bit pricey but there are lots of good options if you like to explore. The japanese restaurant right down the street was very good.

Also the Pool was very good and there is a nice gym that comes with the duration of the stay for 20$ per room. well worth is to relax in the hot tub and sauna and steam.

All in all i would say this hotel is very nice and would definitely stay there again!
review.locationRemarks: Very nice location and lots of options right around whether you're looking to shop or go for a nice dinner.

review.title: Very customer service driven!
review.reviewText: The entire experience was excellent! The hotel staff let us check in a little early and suggested an upgraded room since it was available. Everyone was very courteous and friendly. One of the nicest travel experiences that I have had!
review.locationRemarks: The location was fabulous. A short walk from Union Square and one short block from BART which we took from the airport. It couldn't have been easier

review.title: Centrally located...everything is around
review.reviewText: Everything was great with the exception of the mandatory valet parking with atrociously high rates..... Other than that..great!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Centrally located....everything is around witching walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking rates
review.locationRemarks: Everything.....mason st cafe.....Starbucks next door....market st and union square right down the street.

review.title: Nice hotel in the city
review.reviewText: I had a great experience here. I would come back again.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to union square, convention center and Powell station. The hotel is clean and upgraded.

review.title: Good but not exceptional
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at the Nikko before, but this time stayed in a smaller room. The hotel experience was much the same, with reasonably friendly desk staff, just no free wifi/access to the health centre. The swimming pool is useless for swimming anyway - it's really just for paddling. There is no free wifi in the lobby either, but plenty of places nearby have it so no big deal. The in-room wifi is expensive but not outrageously so. The same is true of breakfast in the Anzu restaurant. There is also 24 hour room service.

Room service/restaurant prices exclude tax, and come with "gratuity" (which is mandatory and filled in for you like the tax) and "service" (which is for you to fill in) and "tip" (also for you to fill in, separately). They don't seem to realise that all three of these mean the same thing.

review.title: Great downtown San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText:
Have now stayed at the Nikko more than a half dozen times. The hotel, its staff and its facilities are wonderful. Its location is perfect. Try to get a stay on the Imperial Floors - they include access to a lounge for continental breakfast and happy hour as well as the restaurant breakfast buffet and health club. Looking forward to our next stay.

PS - don't touch the minibar or refreshment treats in the room unless you want to pay for them. They are on the electronic system that charges if you do anything more than breathe on them.
review.locationRemarks: Located one block off Union Square - all of SF's greatness is readily accessible.

review.title: Nice hotel for less money
review.reviewText: Moved here from Hilton next door for the last 2 nights of our stay. It was about $100 per night less. The hotel is very elegant and clean. We loved all the marble in the lobby. The water dispensers with fresh lemons and limes cut up in them were a nice touch. The room was very nicely appointed with the only complaint being a carpet that was stained and in need of replacement. The bath was very nice with a beautiful bowl sink. Our room was on the eighth floor so the view was not very good. Try for a higher floor if you want a nice view. All the staff were very friendly. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Very elegant and clean. Friendly staff. Good price.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet in room needs attention. Ice machine needs a better sign - took me forever to find it.
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco. Alcatraz tour, Fisherman's Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge. Lots to do in San Francisco.

review.title: nice hotel in downtown sfo
review.reviewText: its a nice hotel, I would not say it is fantastic but just above average. location is good.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Great Locale & Great views! Tidy Room but show a but if wear & tear.

review.title: Our stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The service and staff were excellent as was the location

review.title: Great hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: Great experience at this hotel. Check in was a little slow, but everything else was great. Would stay here again.

review.title: nice hotel to stay.
review.reviewText:
When we got there, we couldn't check in due to early arrival. They gave us some suggestions, so we felt not bad.
We upgraded the room since the new room offers light breakfast at the lounge and some beer and wine and cheese, which only cost ＄30. It's because expedia elite program.
In the room, when I took shower, water flew to the room because the glass wall had some spaces that water can leak. However, basically, the room was comfirtable.

review.title: Ohhhhkay
review.reviewText: I attended a conference at the hotel. The conference room was pleasant enough. The breakfast and snack offerings could have been better, especially given that this is a food city. Unripe fruits and pasty-looking coffee cake may be acceptable in some locales...I actually found myself grabbing a more appetizing spinach croissant from the Starbucks in the lobby one morning.
review.positiveRemarks: Attractive lobby, very friendly check-in. Nice to have a full sized bathtub.
review.negativeRemarks:
Extra fee to use the pool and gym after these rates?!--lame!

Small, somewhat dingy room with direct view of another building.
review.locationRemarks: Typical business hotel near Union Square/Tenderloin.

review.title: Great stay if you don't need any of the amenities.
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Great hotel if you are just looking for a place to sleep while visiting the city. Internet and gym/pool access all come with additional fees, so keep this in mind when booking. Great stay if you're like myself and don't need these extra amenities.

review.title: excellent location, spacious room, pleasant staff
review.reviewText: excellent location, convenient to all the shopping plus an easy walk to other transport and sites to visit.
review.positiveRemarks: brilliant location and very comfortable room
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Great business hotel
review.reviewText: A wonderful business hotel with A+ service; the rooms are looking a little beat up but the staff makes up for it in providing excellent service. I wish they had complimentary wi-fi and water in the rooms - and didn't nickel dime you for everything from internet to using the gym, but I guess that's how things work in 2013.

review.title: Hotel with a great view and staff
review.reviewText: Truly amazing staff, everyone was friendly and attentive. Room was spacious, quiet and had a very comfy bed. Would definitely stay next time I am in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, comfy beds, great view, nice lobby to lounge in
review.negativeRemarks: As with any hotel in SF, parking is expensive
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel and the location is easy to find.

review.title: Near SOMA
review.reviewText:
Great outside balcony
Health club and outside balcony can do with refurbishing as 4 Seasons in Baltimore makes experience seem to need refreshing.
I think the experience in locker rooms is lacking.
No saunas , no toiletries , and no personalized service.
My suite was fairly well appointed with outdated stereo - CD player, which was state of art some 15 yrs ago.
23 rd floor lounge with breakfast and afternoon cheese and drinks fabulous as is lounge.
In house menu for second floor restaurant is limited.
Staff friendly. Overall very good experience!

review.title: Perfect for Anyone!
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel last minute on our honeymoon road trip through California and let me tell you we were beyond impressed! This hotel is supposedly a 4-star but in our opinion it is a 5-star and beyond. The service was impeccable, the staff is amazingly friendly and helpful, the location is superb and the price was way better than the other hotels in the area. One thing you should be aware of is the *required* $45/day valet parking due at check-out. However, for such a nice hotel it was way worth it seeing how everyone hotel, even the 1.5 stars, charge at least $35-50 for parking per day and its not always valet. Oh and also, the rooms were beyond comfortable, beautifully decorated, and have great views. We ended up staying a second night because of how impressed we were. We will definitely be back and will recommend to everyone we know!

review.title: Good luxurious accomodation
review.reviewText: Last minute booking made it very expensive! In a bad area of San Francisco........vagrants loitering outside the main entrance gave the impression that walking alone would be unsafe. Not recommend going outside alone after dark.
review.negativeRemarks: Unsafe region of SF
review.locationRemarks: High above the city, good walk into seafront

review.title: Stunning hotel, well worth the money
review.reviewText: Shocked at first by how exceptional a bargain this hotel was, based on the cost paid and the quality of the place. It was clean, comfortable, with polite staff and a decent view over the city. The bathroom was just as impressive with three showers and a decent amount of water pressure. The hotel is easily found, a short walk up Powell street from the BART transit from SFO/Oakland airport.
review.locationRemarks: Central location, close to Union Square, Market Street and all

review.title: Nice hotel in super busy area
review.reviewText:
This is a very good hotel- the staff are great, the hotel is clean and nice- just be aware that it's located in an incredibly busy area of the city that never seems to stay quiet. I've lived in large cities before and I'm well used to their noise, but this area of San Francisco goes above and beyond in that department. We were 8 floors up and I was still awaked by drunk revelers/ car horns/ and strange noises every night. However, it's only a 5 minute walk from Union Square and all of the shopping and restaurants located there, so there were definitely some huge pluses and minuses with our location.

The staff were wonderful and always went out of their way to help us with our needs. The facilities and the rooms were nice enough, and I was quite comfortable overall.

Be aware that if you drive, there is no self-park. It's valet only, $45 for 24 hrs, unlimited coming and going.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: great spacious room. great amenities. complimentary water in the lobby. location close to all the shopping!

review.title: Overpriced, overrated mediocrity
review.reviewText:
For the "discounted" price this was a super small, mediocre room to spend a few hours in. There was really nothing distinguishing about it except the price.

Besides that, I was charged for two items from the mini-bar that I never used, the signage about the hotel's meager amenities was inaccurate, and the concierge was subtly disdainful and quite unhelpful.

review.title: another stay at nikko
review.reviewText: Good location, needs free wifi. This was my 5th stay at Nikko

review.title: staff very helpful, traveling with small child
review.reviewText: rooms clean, needed extra towels staff went out of their way to help when not his job. call down for little extra things & response time within what you would expect. stayed at the Hilton the night before because I could not get a room for all nocs with you. have to say staff not as friendly, fee for car is too much. did not get a chance to eat at your restraurants, schedule was to hectic & children add to the mix.
review.positiveRemarks: location, hard to find room available for all nights needed
review.negativeRemarks: pkg for fees on pool, spa, or something similar
review.locationRemarks: shopping & access to public transportation

review.title: Excellent in all ways
review.reviewText: Excellent in all ways - The hotel is well location, is well appointed and has excellent service and a great resturant

review.title: Expensive!
review.reviewText: Honestly, I was really excited when booking this hotel, but immediately regretted upon arrival. This hotel charges for everything! If you are on a budget, I don't recommend this place. And to be honest, I've stayed at several hotels before and there was really not a big difference between staying here or at a cheaper hotel. It is nice and clean, but I definitely recommend staying elsewhere even if it is a little downgraded because it's probably still as nice and clean. They charge an extra $20 per room, per day just to use the gym/health club, pool and spa. It is an extra $15.50 just to get WiFi in your room. The valet parking is about $51 (including tax, ridiculous!). Also, upon check-in, I was specifically told by the front desk lady that my credit card would not have any holds on it (meaning they would not temporarily remove money from it, for security reasons) at all; however, when I came home there was a $150 hold on my card. She didn't seem knowledgeable at all because I also asked her if our room would have a separate bath and shower and she said no, but it did (which was nice, but still...unhelpful staff). I basically became so paranoid staying there, because I was afraid that if I touched a single thing, I would be charged! Overall, it was a nice and clean hotel and the staff, although note completely knowledgeable, were friendly; however, I definitely would not recommend this hotel to anyone because you can definitely find another hotel that's just as nice elsewhere
review.negativeRemarks: please do not charge for every little thing! also, please make sure all your staff are on the same page!
review.locationRemarks: it is actually a really good location in the heart of downtown SF near alot of shopping centers; however, there are a lot of homeless around...

review.title: Room with a moon.
review.reviewText:
Hotel Nikko is in a great location for tourists. We only used it for sleeping in, but the young staff were helpful and to hand when we wanted something.
Our only dissatisfaction was with the hotel phone bill, which was instantly sorted out by the v efficient manager, quite late the night before our departure on the 27th. and she was instantly available. We were asked to pay $170 for 2 calls within California of about 15 mins duration each, plus a couple of calls which lasted seconds to the same numbers. I know inland calls are free in America so it seemed most unreasonable to charge that much, obviously we expected to pay something.
However, the manager, Harriet I think her name was, offered a compromise which was acceptable. Just.
Otherwise we were very happy and loved our room with a spectacular view, plus full moon over the bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and view and not too much fussing over us.
review.negativeRemarks: The phone bill
review.locationRemarks: Excellent, as you can locate everything from nearby Market Street by the various forms of transport, and on foot.

review.title: How nice hospitality. . .
review.reviewText: We arrived at SFO around 11am after taking long flight from Japan, then the hotel kindly accepted our early check-in it was around 1pm. It helped us very much to take a break with relief.

review.title: Great hotel for business and dinning.
review.reviewText: All room facility is very modern and up-to-date. Very clean room. Bathroom and shower facility is very clean and new. The bed there was very good. I did slept better than my home :) Also there business centre staff is very helpful and professional. Also their 2F Restaurant is excellent. Not only real tokyo style sushi but also wide variety of California cuisine were fantastic! "Beef roast on top of heated stone" was excellent. Also small bar beside restaurant was very welcoming people. Pretty good Dry Martini.

review.title: holding my money hostage
review.reviewText:
i travel using a bank debit card and was qute shocked that the held $100/day for incidentals. especially depressing when i was there for 5 days and charged $21 to the room. this pollicy seems quite excessive.

like all about the hotel but this issue.

review.title: Great hotel with great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is very modern and hip looking--with a Japanese twist. It is kept up very well. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms were clean and nice. You are greeted with champagne upon arrival, or you can opt for cucumber or lemon water. The room seemed a bit small for some reason. We spent an extra $40 to upgrade to a "suite," so we were scared to see what a regular room would have looked like. I believe the "suite" price came with WiFi. The views of San Francisco were breathtaking. The shower and tub were nice, and we loved the modern bowl sink. The location was perfect--literally a couple minutes walk to Union Square and the Curran Theater. Unfortunately, very loud hotel guests kept us up on and off with the screaming, crying, and slamming doors. It was not the fault of the hotel, obviously, and they came and took care of it once someone called in the problem. That comment should not, however, reflect the clientele, because it was definitely more upscale.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor is pleasing to the eye.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking was $55 for the night.
review.locationRemarks: It was a 2 minute walk to Union Square, which could not have been more perfect. It was also close to the Curran, where we saw Jersey Boys.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Will defiantly stay here again.

review.title: Love this place!
review.reviewText: This is my third time staying in the last few weeks. I love the peaceful and tranquity of this hotel. Close to everything however, the rooms are so quiet. Excellent service, will always stay there!

review.title: First Time in 'frisco
review.reviewText:
Beautiful hotel near union square and walking distance from the Moscone Centre and Powell/Hyde Cable Car.

Nice sized rooms

Kept beautifully clean

No free wifi

Gym and pool cost $20 for your entire stay. Great if you use it
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Superb

review.title: Good but have to pay for pool
review.reviewText: A pool is presented but you have to pay for it 20 dollars daily.

review.title: too many fees
review.reviewText: Its anice hotel very nice location. The restaurants hugely overpriced. Too many fees. A fee for the pool a fee for wi fi etc. Staff was very helpful and nice.

review.title: Great hotel to stay while in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, friendly staff. Would stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking.
review.locationRemarks: Very good central location.

review.title: Great location at a good price
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean, modern, and comfortable. The staff was great as they were attentive to our needs and went out of their way to help with doors, luggage, finding restaurants, and more.
review.positiveRemarks: Location of this hotel is perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: We took 3 laps driving around the hotel before we found the proper entrance for check-in/valet.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great for restaurants, shopping, sightseeing, and AT&T Park.

review.title: Great hotel for everyone...
review.reviewText: Excellent experience. Complimentary glass of wine upon check-in for myself and additional guest. Great location, right in the center of the city (a few blocks from Macy's). The hotel's restaurant, "Anzu" was also excellent in both ambiance and food quality.

review.title: I love this hotel and it in heart of Union Square!
review.reviewText: Best hotel I've stayed in San Francisco! It is newly remodeled, has an indoor pool/spa, and is in an excellent location. I'd stay here again every time! Got a great deal or expedia too!
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square

review.title: Centrally located
review.reviewText: The hallway smelled like body odor. The elevators weren't room key protected. Which is something you want staying in this part of SF.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. the staff were helpful. The room was very good

review.title: Decent for one night stay.
review.reviewText: Not fond of area immediately surrounding hotel. However, hotel itself was nice. No complaints. Would not recommed for families with children as surrounding area really not that great.

review.title: My "go to hotel' in S.F.
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is my "go to hotel" when I visit S.F. It is centrally located and always a pkeasant stay!
review.negativeRemarks: Not a thing
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful!

review.title: Wonderful Hotel for Everyone!
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and service was excellent. The room on the 11th floor was amazing. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large. It was quiet. I didn't hear any street noise, people walking in the hallway or above our room. We had a restful night. Everything was in it's place; very clean and modern. The glass enclosed pool area was great also. The gym offered exercise options for everyone. The hotel is located in the best location. Close to public transportation, shopping, restaurants and night life. I would recommend the Hotel Nikko to all travelers and look forward to staying there again.
review.positiveRemarks: View, comfortable bed, and large bathroom
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Close to everything.

review.title: un happy
review.reviewText: for the price that I paid on weekday. I only get the refill water not a seal cap water. All the table and desk is not a qualify product. The ambiance of the hotel was not what I was looking forward to.

review.title: Very happy
review.reviewText:
I will definetly return to this hotel. Great amenities,
helpful, friendly staff. Super location.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks:
Super location. Easy walking distance to many
sites and public transportation.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: Had only interaction with one staff member who checked me into my room. She was very nice and friendly. The room was perfect, clean, neat and up to date. Being 1 block away from Union Square, could not as for better location.
review.negativeRemarks: I would suggest some way of promoting the restaurants. Did not try them but would have if there had been some kind of inducement

review.title: Good hotel for couple
review.reviewText:
Staff at desk wonderful.registration was quick and smooth.
The room was somewhat small for king bed,bed was high esp for a handicapped room.there was only one bedside table.
Washbasin area in the bathroom could be larger a
review.positiveRemarks: Site,cleanliness,large reception area lounge,friendly staff at front desk
review.negativeRemarks: Size of room and minimum furniture

review.title: Great hotel for visitor
review.reviewText:
overall, this hotel is perfect ! great location and awesome services!

However, it is little bit annoying when people shut their door hardly.

review.title: Great Hotel Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Smooth check-in. Friendly and knowledgeable and helpful staff. Quiet room. Highly recommend.

review.title: Totally worth it and will stay again!
review.reviewText:
This place is fabulous, especially for the price. Yes there are surcharges for every little thing but if you are there just for a place to stay overnight, without needing to workout, connect to their wireless internet, go swimming, etc...then this is the best possible place. Oh, and everyone else in the area also applies surcharges to everything but don't have the same level of quality and comfort.

Beds were super soft and the view was awesome. Thank you Hotel Nikko!!
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, friendly and helpful staff, modern, and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a little small but so are everyone else's hotel rooms in the area, it's SF. Expensive valet service.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, lots of dining options and close to all sorts of hot spots.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in a great location, walking distance from Union Square. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby.

The hotel is very upscale, but reasonably priced. It was clean, modern, and the hospitality was great.

review.title: A pleasant stay.
review.reviewText: This was a pleasant stay for us. The room was smaller than I expected, but overall we enjoyed out weekend. $45 for parking seems to be a little high.
review.negativeRemarks: The cost of parking.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square & the Tenderloin.

managementResponses.response: thank you for your comment

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very nice place to stay and enjoy San Francisco with the family and friends

review.title: Wonderful Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and value. Like having the option of not paying for things you don't use. Gym, pool, wi-fi, ect... Our room was beautiful, beds were very comfortable. The bathroom, its nice to have the toilet seperate from the bathing area. The valet and Bell men are doing a great job, so polite and helpful. Will stay here again soon on our next visit.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, great rooms, and great price. Best, not paying for things you dont use, Wi-Fi Pool, gym ect...
review.negativeRemarks: The carpet in the hallway was a bit overstated and needed cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square, lots of shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Lovely, clean and convenient but pricey extras
review.reviewText: Excellent customer service and a great location. My only disappointment is the endless additional fees. It seems this hotel (like so many in this price range) feels the need to charge ridiculous prices for everything from use of the business center to internet access to use of the pool and fitness center. And there is no free wifi in the public spaces.
review.negativeRemarks: fees for everything! Not even free wifi in public spaces
review.locationRemarks: easy walk to public transit, near some good restaurants

review.title: Great, but not inexpensive!
review.reviewText: Great place to stay other than the fact that everything is very expensive, including room service. Bill was almost double from the cost of the meal and you had to pay separate for using wireless and their workout room.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive - having to pay for use of wireless and workout facility
review.locationRemarks: Great location in downtown San Francisco. The hotel was just blocks from where I needed to go.

review.title: Club Rooms
review.reviewText: We paid the additional $60/night for a Empress (club) room which included internet, beer, wine and cocktail food in the evening and breakfast in the morning. My advice would be do not do this, the evening food was awful and the breakfast is very basic, nowhere near the quality i have experienced at other hotel clubs.

review.title: great stay in Nikko
review.reviewText: great location, good amenities, a good 4.5 star hotel. Only complaint was internet not included. Very petty as it's available downstairs in Starbucks for free.
review.negativeRemarks: no internet in rooms, which is strange for a business class hotel.
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Nice central hotel
review.reviewText: Great location near union square. Service is very good, my room was clean & comfortable (although) a tad small, & the bed was not queen sized.
review.positiveRemarks: The sushi bar is amazing. Also the concierges were all excellent.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome, steps from great shopping & bart metro.

review.title: An Island of Serenity
review.reviewText: The first room I was offered turned out to have been smoked in, so I rejected it. I was immediately given a new, bigger room and received several apologies. After that, I had no problems. I received business associates at the hotel, and on two occasions we had rather lavish dinners in the restaurant -- both of which were exquisite. The ambience and aesthetic of the Nikko were exceptional, and I shall certainly return.
review.locationRemarks: Unfortunately, the Nikko -- along with several competitive hotels -- is located in an unpleasant part of San Francisco.

managementResponses.response: thank you for your comment

review.title: great location and value
review.reviewText: Great location - steps from union square and the powell street muni/bart station (take bart train from airport). Nikko is a large international hotel chain.

review.title: Enjoyed the stay
review.reviewText: Quiet room, very friendly staff. The fitness room is very well appointed (costs $20 per stay though).
review.locationRemarks: Right downtown, close to Union Square.

review.title: Great hotel.
review.reviewText: Everything was great, including location. My only complaint is that there was no option to have a limited buffet (ie, cereal, fruit, pastries). The full buffet was all that was available.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, beautiful, and a great staff.
review.negativeRemarks: No limited buffet
review.locationRemarks: Great, near Union Square and many alternatives for public transportation.

review.title: Great hotel for a business traveller
review.reviewText:
I had stayed at this hotel many years ago. It is still a very decent hotel. Very clean and well managed. I had booked my room through Expedia but they allowed me to upgrade to a better room (higher floor) for an additional $10/day.

I did not use room service or any of the restaurants. But the pool was very clean as well as the ladies' locker room. My room was very quiet.

All the staff was very, very friendly and helpful. Great location, central to public transportation, if necessary and many, many restaurants.

Well run hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was very clean. Bed was superb. Very quiet!
review.negativeRemarks: Having to pay additional $20 to use the pool/health club for the length of my stay.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect. Very central to everything.

review.title: Great hotel with complete utility
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel with probably everything you need. The hotel restaurant has superb Japanese food.

review.title: Extremely central, good all-round service.
review.reviewText: Suitable for (and used) by business and leisure travellers alike. Seemed to be a high-throughput operation and as such, it was surprisingly well-maintained and managed.
review.positiveRemarks: Room sizes, professionalism of staff (but see re concierge).
review.negativeRemarks: Concierge was unhelpful. Interior design was slightly banal but this was overall only a small consideration.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Nice place great location. Only downside is the unpublished additional cost for use of internet, and fitness/pool access. Really? Still price overall very reasonable good value will stay again..

review.title: Great Value & location
review.reviewText: great location for holidays or business. Great value for the money I paid.

review.title: Classy Union Square hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel 2 blocks from Union Square and Westfield Mall. Very quiet with easy access to Bart system, trolley cars and 5th Steet access to get quickly to I-80 just 5 blocks away. Room was excellant and quiet. Asian theme of course and done with modern touch.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access for business, dining and shopping in Union Square area
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Great Hotel for all; business travelers & tourists
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very friendly and pleasant staff at the front desk, and there is a Starbucks right in the corner of the hotel, on ground floor. It was a great experience and I would definitely stay there again in the future.

review.title: Nikko Hotel, great stay!
review.reviewText:
Very receptive and responsive staff. A special rate was available. Ordinarily, I wouldn't stay at the Nikko since their rate exceeds our budget. Nikko is an upgrade from our usual hotel in Japantown. Phone service was exceptional.
We appreciated front desk referral to nearby restaurant outside of hotel--walk outside of parking garage/valet service, down the corner to First Crush--very good restaurant, mushroom soup delicious, fresh, and Hawaiian fish (Wahou? or maybe spelled with 4 vowels). Would definitely return if low rate available. Also, convenient to BART, a big plus, walking distance if not in a rush, to the Ferry Building or performing arts center--Davies, Herbst.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: Hotel nikkio generally ok
review.reviewText:
The hotel Nikkio is generally an excellent hotel.

Had stayed there previously and was somewhat dissappointed to with the size of the petite room compared to my last stay. It was clean and well kept.

The hotel has an policy of carging extra for everything other than the basic room .$20 for wireless interney $20 dollars for use of the gym(which just 1 room although there is a pool. This policy of nickle and diming seems a bit chintzy.

The bathtub in the room was low and difficult and somewhat dangerous and slippery to get out of.
review.negativeRemarks: charges for miscellanous services and bathroom setup
review.locationRemarks: downtown near union square from where san francisco is easily accesable. Downtoen below geary remains somewhat funky.

review.title: A great location
review.reviewText: A superior hotel in a most convenient location, close to the metro, BART, cable cars, Muni busses and streetcars. A very good restaurant in the hotel and many small cafes and grills in the surrounding area. Overall a hotel I highly recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: In room coffee and tea, could be a much better quality and selection

review.title: The Hotel Nikko San Francisco Experience
review.reviewText: When I was checking into the hotel, that was uneventful. But the nice thing about it is that you are offered a glass of wine to take up to your room when you finish with your check-in. The staff are friendly and professional. The person behind the concierage desk is both friendly, efficient and professional. However, the bell hops are slightly different. We were all in a queue to leave our luggages at the hotel, but they started to call out to people from the back, even though I was standing right in front. I am rather annoyed about that.
review.positiveRemarks: I like this hotel for its location. It is walking distance to the subway station, to all the great shopping and restaurants at Union
review.negativeRemarks: There is no free wifi available. Not even in the lobby.
review.locationRemarks: It is just off the main street at Union City. At night, don't go beyond the block as is is rather unsafe at night.

review.title: Very convenient area, clean hotel, Friendly Staff.
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice. I have been here twice. First time got a room with 2 queen size beds in it. This room is way bigger than the room with 1 queen size bed in it. (for same price). Room with only 1 queen, the bed is as small as a full size bed (1 step above a twin). They tried to give me the room with one queen this time, thru expedia package. They allowed me to upgrade to a room with a King Size bed for $60 more each night. :-{ however, it was on their floors (23 and up) which supposedly are the "special" rooms. This room had a tv embedded in the bathroom mirror, but the faucet covered the screen. What a horrible design. Like really?! The view was cool. The bed was big enough. The bell hop guys are very nice! The staff help are pretty nice except for the 1 lady at the front desk we called to inquire about the small bed. She was no help and kept insisting that small bed was a Queen. YEA RIGHT! The other guy helped, but at $60 extra a night. The area has homeless people, but not too bad in the immediate area of the hotel. A block over on Powel st. they begin to start visibly begging for money much more, due to the many tourist walking past. I may go there again. Its a bit pricy, but its clean, and close to the mall, restaurants, bart station and cable cars. There's a starbucks inside-and a club. The complimentary breakfast is blah. Just fruit and cereal. No guy cooking up Omlettes like at the Hyatt's comp breakfast. I may go there again, tho they are a bit pricey.
review.positiveRemarks: The bell hop guys, very friendly and immediately open the doors for you and are ready to check your bags. Its great they they are so friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: They charge alot to upgrade, and try to pass off a full/twin size bed for a Queen sized bed.
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. Homeless people around, but they dont seem aggressive. Just begging.

review.title: Excellent SF hotel
review.reviewText: We are return visitors to Nikko. Very helpful friendly service.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. Close to Union Square and Market St.

review.title: Best Hotel for the money.
review.reviewText: This Hotel is the only place I'll stay from now on!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is great, and very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: I had no least favorite
review.locationRemarks: the location is the best! It's close to everything, including public transportation.

review.title: Cost performance?
review.reviewText: Nikko Hotel is one of the expensive hotels around the area. Thinking the cost performance, the rate will be downed. Therefore, you had better put the issue of cost performance in the rate.

review.title: convenient and comfortable for business travel
review.reviewText: Clean and quiet compared to the Hilton across the street. Very comfortable. Use of business center is expensive.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient.

review.title: Barely okay even in a pinch.
review.reviewText: Older hotel with inadequate maintenance and poorly trained staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall quality of product and services.
review.locationRemarks: Blocks from Union square.

review.title: great central location for exploring...
review.reviewText: Great location, service was good, they were able to accommodate my early check in twice. On the downside the gym/pool fees were $20-25, seemed a bit steep for a workout and WiFi wasn't available in all rooms.

review.title: Good hotel; beware doesn't include pool use
review.reviewText: Have just one complaint. The Expedia site features an indoor pool among the pictures. Actually, I was charged an additional $20 for access to the pool, which I don't think was at all proper without the additional fee clearly noted on the Expedia website or the pictures of the pool deleted from the site as it's not included.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool use not included
review.locationRemarks: Starbucks in lobby; other breakfast options nearby.

review.title: Great location, friendly service
review.reviewText: Excellent location for shopping and dining. Staff was friendly and efficient. My wife left some important stuff in a drawer, which they located and sent to us in Nevada. It was back in our hands a day later much to our relief!
review.negativeRemarks: Neighborhood just to South of hotel (toward Market St.) getting pretty seedy.

review.title: Very Nice

review.positiveRemarks: location and condition was very good
