review.title: great weekend hotel
review.reviewText: The Staff Was Very Friendly And The Atmosphere Of The Hotel Was Very Japanese, with A Twist Of San Francisco.

review.title: Do you have a million dollars to spend?
review.reviewText: For how much I spent a night I would expect free wifi and pool and jacuzzi, but not only did i not get to do those things you expect to be free they want to charge you an extra $50 to use the pool and wifi... Also be sure to have an extra $45 a night for parking near this hotel. Worst experience I've had.
review.negativeRemarks: No "Free" wifi and pool/jacuzzi.
review.locationRemarks: Very busy $45 a night for parking.

review.title: Anniversary Couple
review.reviewText: We stayed here for our anniversary, having stayed at the Hotel Nikko a couple of times before, The room on the 14th floor was clean and comfortable. The floor lamp did not work and one of the closet doors did not open all the way. The bed was very comfortable. Around 9 PM one of the adjoining rooms had their TV volume turned way up which lasted a couple hours.
review.positiveRemarks: Past experience and proximity to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Valet parking was a bit pricey

review.title: Great modern and comfortable hotel
review.reviewText:
Great modern hotel a bit expensive no free internet
Nice pool jacuzzi, steam room and exercise room.
review.negativeRemarks: paying for internet

review.title: great hotel for business trip

very nice and friendly staff. fast smooth elevators.
very clean. good location.
I will stay there again.

review.title: Union Square District, San Francisco, CA
review.reviewText: Excellent location with shopping and restaurants right outside the door. Buses, Muni and cable cars in immediate vicinity. Amenities were extra fee making stay fairly expensive if someone wanted to use them. Would definitely stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra fee to use amenities such as pool and exercise room.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of great shopping and good, fun restaurants.

review.title: Great hotel for a business trip
review.reviewText: I was on a grueling 3-day business trip to SF. The hotel was clean, quiet and a lovely respite from a hectic 72 hours of meetings.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing about the hotel was the cleanliness, the quiet and the staff in general, Scott in particular.
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent and centrally located.

review.title: Fantastic hotel, fantastic staff
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel in a great location. I arrived late and the night manager made sure everything was so perfect for me! I would highly recommend this hotel!!

review.title: Good place for business traveler
review.reviewText: Good place. Good for business traveler with solid location and decent service and friendly and efficient service. I would stay again but I would note the hotel does not quite have the extra oomph to really serve the guest.
review.negativeRemarks: needs more outlets and lighting in the bathroom was weak.
review.locationRemarks: solid- a block from Union Square, two from BART, etc.

review.title: Overall GREAT place to stay!
review.reviewText: Very clean, pool and hot tub area very nice! Easy in and out. Very nice hospitable staff!

review.title: Easy access to Union Square and shopping
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a fantastic location for those wanting to stay around or near Union Square. It is approximately 2 blocks from the heart of Union Square, and tons of shopping, and only a brisk 15 minute walk down Market to the Ferry Building.

The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful in making everyone's stay pleasant and enjoyable. Our room was a very nice size, had a decent view, and was very clean.

The only two things I was not pleased with is that even though the bathrooms have both a shower and bathtub (with a European shower head), none of the shower heads functioned well, and the water pressure was really low, making it difficult to wash my hair.

The other quite vexing issue is that there is no free wifi in the hotel (not even the lobby), and the hotel charges $15 for a 24-hr period. I feel in this day and age that wifi should be complimentary to hotel guests. Thank goodness for Starbucks at the base of the hotel where you can get free wi-fi and coffee!

For the price, it's a hotel worth checking out because of the service and location.

managementResponses.response: thank you for your comment!

review.title: great for everyone
review.reviewText: Very comfortable. Very friendly staff. I would stay again
review.locationRemarks: very central. great shopping near by

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: Sleek modern design and good sized rooms! The only disappointment was not being able to check-in early upon arrival at noon. We were tired and wanted to rest when we arrived, but unfortunately were not able to do so. The location is VERY CONVENIENT and generally in a nice area. The only thing to be careful of is if you travel 1-2 blocks southwest of the hotel which borders the tenderloin.
review.positiveRemarks: Sleek modern design and good sized rooms!
review.negativeRemarks: Not being able to check-in early upon arrival at noon.
review.locationRemarks: Great CONVENIENT location, but be careful going 1-2 blocks southwest of the hotel which gets into the tenderloin.

review.title: Disgusted
review.reviewText: Awful experience!!! Flew up here from Orange County because the hotel featured the rrazz room and had Jefferson starship playing which we purchased tickets for. Upon arriving and checking in found out that the rrazz room is no longer there as of a few days! We made the best of it because we flew up there specifically for the concert which was a Christmas gift. Anyway come to find out there is some lawsuit about the rrazz room playing too much R&B so they wanted them out because of the clientele they were drawing. Being a Motown fan myself this angers me. Not only was a lot of money spent to get up to San Francisco and see the concert, but to find out it is this kind of discrimination is unacceptable. I will never visit hotel nikko again and neither should anyone who supports wonderful people who bring us R&B!!! And by the way I'm white as rice

review.title: Great location to everything
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time in san Francisco staying at Nikko hotel. It was in a great location. Only down side you have to pay for the pool. But we were to busy being out and about that it didn't really matter. Also wish there was a hotel bar that stayed open later.. All around a wonderful time and we will be back very soon
review.negativeRemarks: No bar open late
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Mediocre service, nice location
review.reviewText:
Concierge was not helpful. Sent us to a restaurant where we had to wait 40 minutes. Everyone else had reservations. We told him when we returned that the restaurant would have taken a reservation from us when we had inquired about the restaurant the day before. He said, "Uh huh." It didn't seem to dawn on him to offer to make a reservation. The same guy gave us bad directions.

No free internet access even from the business center. How out of touch and antiquated for San Francisco!

Parking at hotel is $50/day. Across the street is $30.

review.title: gr8!
review.reviewText: only thing is the pool could use attention , other than that gr8!
review.negativeRemarks: pool needs more water
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Pleasant stay here for 3 nights. Concierge (Ernesto) was very helpful. Main selling point was the location to union square and Bart station at Powell street.if its location you are after then you can't go wrong with this hotel.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText:
This was my first time here and I loved it. Very classy. Perfect location to downtown San Francisco. Lots of restaurants and bars near by. I stayed in room 905 which had an incredible view of the city. Very romantic at night. The only complaint is the outrageous parking. But that's at any nice hotel in the city. I recommend calling any hotel first to find out the parking price so you don't have a heart attack during check out.
But this hotel is wonderful. I was there during Christmas and the lobby was very beautiful. The staff was very friendly. Valet, room service etc. They even let me check in 2 hours early which was great after a 5 hour drive. I plan on staying here whenever I come back. Great place.
review.positiveRemarks: Style of hotel and location. Classy place.
review.negativeRemarks: Least favorite thing is a wide spread San Fransico issue. The parking issue. Parking is ridiculous. $55.00. But it's everywhere.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect. About 5 minute walk to union square. 5 minute walk to the Bart. 5 minute walk to the Westfield mall.

review.title: Too close to the crowds of SF
review.reviewText: I was very upset about the business room where I was charged $7.50 for 15 minutes on the computer. That is extortion. When I told the desk clerk, he said that it was run by a private company and that they had no control over it. This kind of soured my experience because it is such a rip off.

review.title: Great stay - highly recommended
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 6 nights over Christmas and had a wonderful stay. Staff were friendly and very helpful - polite and went out of their way to ensure our visit was comfortable - we upgraded upon arrival and had full use of the health club facilities and full Internet in rooms - placement of hotel is fantastic a block from union square - highly rated and would stay again - we were a family of four.
review.negativeRemarks: None to speak of
review.locationRemarks: Grea access to all shopping and transportation

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: No problems - great service. Close to shopping and restaurants and easy to get to everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: No complaints
review.locationRemarks: 200m walk to cable car, many restaurants and shopping close by but do your research as tenderloin district nearby.

review.title: Highly Recommended
review.reviewText: We loved the hotel and its location in San Francisco. The staff was wonderful

review.title: Great Location. But not for families....
review.reviewText:
The hotel is at a great location, lots of shops and restaurants around. The train is close by.
The hotel is almost a 5 star hotel, they treat you very good and we were able to do an early check in around 1130am.
The downside is that they charge you for everything. I know it's a almost five star hotel, but it kind of seems ridiculous to be to be able to access the pool. I've been in other 5 star hotels and none of them charge to be able to use the pool.
I would recommend this hotel if you are staying one or two nights, but not for families.
The good thing is you can get around almost anywhere from here.....
review.negativeRemarks: Couldn't enjoy the pool, you have to pay for it, and pretty expensive
review.locationRemarks: Lots of Shops, Restaurants and Train nearby

review.title: San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel! Extremely clean and comfortable and a great location to Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.title: Great hotel. Perfect location!
review.reviewText: Very accommodating. Staff was very nice and helpful.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location

review.title: Hotel Nikko in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Excellent attention to detail by every member of the hotel staff. Quality personnel.
Great location downtown San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of valet parking
review.locationRemarks: 1 1/2 blocks from Union Square in Nob Hill Very well positioned

review.title: Great service but a very 'tired' hotel.
review.reviewText:
A great checkin experience complete with a glass of wine and Asian-style service couldn't make up for this hotels dire need for a renovation or at least new housekeeping team.

The bathtub had a 'film of dirt' so that I almost didn't want to shower in it, let alone take a bath. Again, the great service took over after I reported it they immediately wanted to send up a cleaning crew.

The wallpaper was peeling and everything felt grayish and brownish. Hopefully they will improve their housekeeping and start renovating the rooms and hallways soon.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Good value, great location! Expensive Internet.
review.reviewText:
The staff and concierge were friendly and very helpful. It was our first trip to San Francisco, so we had many questions about how to get around, where to shop, and where to eat. All of our questions were answered with good advice!

Internet access is very expensive at $16 PER DEVICE per day so be prepared for that. There is free wi-fi in the ground-level Starbucks, but it becomes useless during the day when the coffee shop is full of people. My T-Mobile phone only received Edge service in my room, so tethering wasn't really an option. The in-room wi-fi is provided by AT&T. I used it for just one day during our stay and it was reasonably fast on my MacBook (approx. 15 Mbps down and 6 Mbps up when accessing speedtest.net).

Everything you need is very closeby - car rental shops, Walgreens, Macy's, shopping mall, restaurants, pubs, Apple Store, Starbucks, cable car - all within a couple of blocks.

You really can't go wrong by choosing the Nikko! Enjoy!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive Internet
review.locationRemarks: Very close to everything you need for a wonderful stay in San Francisco!

review.title: A good hotel in the heart of the city.
review.reviewText:
Great location. Friendly staff. Adequate accommodations.
The hotel is showing its age and is in need of a renovation.

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the comfort & condition of our room and bathroom. The front desk was very accomodating and answered all questions. Food in the Anzu room was excellent. Overall a very good experience and well worth it for our money.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and site of the Rrazz Room where we saw an excellent show, right in the hotel.

review.title: Personal touch in digital age
review.reviewText: Knowing this hotel for many years, mnay of the services became digital but somehow didn't lose personal touch. Good to be back. Wish that "Benkei" comes back.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking, luggage handling,

review.title: You will enjoy staying at the Hotel Nikko!!
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel in an outstanding location - & there's even a starbucks attached!! There is also a lovely indoor pool, nice clean workout room, & a very cozy & inviting bar. Our room was very comfortable & tastefully decorated, with spacious bathroom. It was a nice touch to have a radio with iPod docking station & iPhone charger. My only complaint is that the charge for parking is very steep. Otherwise, highly recommended!!
review.negativeRemarks: parking fee
review.locationRemarks: OUTSTANDING - centrally located near Union Square & fabulous shopping & restaurants

review.title: Good San Francisco location, and a great value.

Nikko is a fantastic value! Period.

Kyle in San Diego

review.title: One-Night Stay
review.reviewText: Very good high-class hotel for a nice price. Lobby looks great and got a complimentary glass of wine when I checked in. The room was very nice and I wish I could have stayed a bit more (though my view may be skewed based on the fact that the previous hotel I was at for business was nowhere near as nice). While I did not use the hotel services (only stayed one night), I did see others use them and service appeared to be very helpful at all times. The hotel is also in downtown and pretty close to the BART. Its very convenient to the cable cars and between those and the BART, you can seemingly reach the majority of the major sites to see in San Fran easily. In all, I would stay here again and would recommend this to others.
review.locationRemarks: About 1-2 blocks from BART Powell Station near Union Square in downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Close to every shopping your heart desires.

review.title: A great hotel for everyone!
review.reviewText:
Relaxing and clean. Loved the shower head and shower soap display. The white robe was a very cute addition. Thank you to the staff for suggesting dinner at the Rio Grill... We had the most romantic evening - it was Perfect!!!

Thank you
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Exceptional - right across the street from a very nice little mall...

review.title: Romantic Weekend Getaway
review.reviewText: The room itself was a little small, but the bathroom was large with a shower and a separate bathtub. The bathtub had a shower nozzle with it to wash off after a bath, which is such a great convenience. We were on the 17th floor, which was not a problem, just interesting to be so high up. I could barely hear people in the other rooms, which is good for privacy. The decor is modern/ Japanese and is very classy. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There is complimentary lemon and orange water in the lobby. The major downside was the cost to use many amenities. There is a $20 (per day I think) fee to use to pool and fitness center. You also have to pay for internet use. Also, do not remove any item from the refridgerator unless you want to pay for it. It will automatically charge you if something is moved, but they are happy to remove the accidental charges if you do not use something. It is in a great location though. Very close to restaurants, bars and Union Square with shops. A Starbucks is right next door to the entrance. Overall, it was a great experience and place to spend the weekend.
review.positiveRemarks: The bathtub, complimentary citrus water, glass shower and close distance to restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: .Cleanliness of shower tiles, cost to use pool and internet.
review.locationRemarks: Awesome! Easy to walk to fun places and in the middle of downtown.

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: Everything seemed to cost extra (wireless internet, fitness/pool). Good location.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless internet and pool cost extra

review.title: Nice hotel, poor (literally) location.
review.reviewText: Overall this hotel is good, not great. The lobby is covered in marble and water fountains, which are kinda neat. However, for the price I was unimpressed. The location is decent at best, very close to the BART station and shopping at Union Square if you walk in one direction. However, if you walk in the other direction you walk right into the homeless-covered streets of the Tenderloin. The hotel itself is very clean, the staff is friendly, the beds are covered in comfortable pillows, but the rooms are little on the small side (expected in the middle of SF). The amenities provided are really what keep Hotel Nikko from being a great hotel. There is wireless internet (which you have to pay for per day and per device) is TERRIBLE. There is a fee to use the gym, a fee to use the pool, a fee for basically everything beyond use of the bed and soap in the bathroom. As a general room, if you are looking for a standard hotel amenity that you would expect from a nice hotel (i.e. gym, pool, wireless internet, flexible check-out times...) this hotel has it (except for the flexible check-out time), but you will have to pay extra for it. In general, the hotel is clean, looks nice, and the staff is as pleasant and helpful as expected, but this hotel lacks the appeal that would entice me to stay again, especially since there are many other options in San Francisco from which to choose.
review.positiveRemarks: nice lobby, comfortable bed, HUGE bathroom. Fountains / waterfalls are neat.
review.negativeRemarks: Location!
review.locationRemarks: Mediocre at best, as it is on the border of Union Square & the Tenderloin, so there are LOTS of bums, beggars, and the ripe smells that go with them.

review.title: nice hotel, tough neighborhood for a walk
review.reviewText:
hotel nikko, SF. i stay in SF on a regular basis for business (monthly). nikko was the best price for the dates. it is located near union square. it was clean, efficient for the stay. courteous staff (especially door men). however, the following were drawbacks-

1-charges for the amenities were the norm here - some hotels do, some don't. expect to pay too much (approx 15-20$ per day extra) for internet and gym access (very annoying).
2-surrounding area. superficially, this looks like the ideal area - close to shopping and restaurants, etc. problem: the area is over run with aggressive pan handlers! it is like running the gauntlet just to go to dinner. no relaxing strolls here - but instead person after sad person asking (in your face!) for money. you can only give so much, unfortunately.

so, pick something farther north towards the business district or fisherman;s warf otherwise, the ambiance of SF is loss.
review.negativeRemarks: neighborhood, extra charges for gym
review.locationRemarks: lots of homeless of all stripes

review.title: Modern and great location
review.reviewText:
Hotel Nikko is in a really good location in the heart of the city. We preferred to stay in the this area rather than the Fisherman's Wharf area, which is very busy and touristy. We were travelling with kids, and it is very suitable for both families and business people alike.

Easy access to great shopping, restaurants and trams.

The hotel is in excellent condition and staff were courteous and helpful. The only issue for us was that the check in time was 3pm - and we arrived at midday. Although we had requested our room be ready for an early check-in, it wasn't, and we were offered a room with 2 x double beds rather than the 2 x queen beds we had booked and paid for. As we had been travelling for about 18 hours by this time, we took the room, but it was a little disappointing.

Rooms were very well appointed though and the bathroom was very modern and clean.

Had a great sleep and didn't find it noisy at all.

Would definitely recommend Hotel Nikko.

Overall, we had a wonderful stay as the staff were very friendly and our room was very clean with a partial view of the water and the bridge. Location is superb for shopping and dining.The buffet breakfast was nice to have included, though one can get a room excluding breakfast. If you had to pay, you will spend $60 for two. Ouch! By the way, we were upgraded because I am an elite plus Expedia member, though surprisingly, the font desk did not know of such promotions. Regardless,we were upgraded.

review.title: Won't stay there again.
review.reviewText:
We arrived and thought, "Wow, this place in nice!" Well, it was, for the most part. All I can say is, READ THE FINE PRINT. IF you even look in the fridge, and God forbid you jiggle the merchandise at all, you get charged for consuming it (motion sensors under the snacks/drinks). Daily charge for the WiFi. And a charge for using the swimming pool.... really? A charge for using the hotel pool when you are already a guest??? Unless you don't mind the nickle and dime charges ALONG with a hefty per night charge, then go here.
Also, the hotel is older and could use some upgrades in carpeting. Our bath tub had hair in it, and although 3 people were booked into the room, the room was only set up for 2 people. We had to request more towels, cups, and toilet paper.
I won't stay there again.

review.title: Great base for visiting San Francisco
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel in a great position. Easy to get about the city on public transport and the information centre at Powell Street station is close by for brochures, advice and to buy your muni passport for the transport system. The room was beautiful and had a great view. We were on the 17th floor. The lifts (elevators) were fantastic; there were six and we never waited for more than a minute for one, usually considerably less. We didn't eat in the hotel, but there was so much nearby that we had plenty of places to choose from. The Sunflower Cafe across the street does a great breakfast if you don't want to pay the hotel prices (we never found out the price of breakfast in the hotel but a bottle of water in the room would have set us back $9 - that's £6 - when you could buy a much larger bottle for considerably less from a nearby supermarket). We would go back to this hotel again.

review.title: Elegant and stylish hotel in great location
review.reviewText: We deliberated for a long time over the ideal hotel for our family holiday to San Francisco. The main choices for location were Union Square vs Fisherman's Wharf. Since our kids are teenagers we opted for Union Square. This hotel is very conveniently situated, being close to the Powell/Market Street Cable Car terminus and one of the major shopping areas of SF. Apple Store, Gap, Banana Republic and a massive Westfield Shopping Centre are all within a few minutes walk. The hotel room itself was stylish and kept very clean. We had a deal via Expedia for a room with two queen sized beds, and the hotel graciously provided a rollaway bed. For $20 extra we got access to the pool and gym during our stay, which for the 4 of us was good value. It was strange that Wi-Fi was not included ($16 per day extra) or that there wasn't an option to buy a few days worth of wifi access at a special price eg $50 for 5 days. This is probably because this hotel is more geared towards business than family customers. Breakfast is also an expensive add-on, but as others have commented there are plenty of places to buy breakfast and get wi-fi access. There is space in the room fridge for milk and yoghurt. Unlike some other reviewers, we found the reception staff to be very helpful. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.

review.negativeRemarks: Expensive wi-fi and breakfast options

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText:
I would stay at this hotel again. We stayed on the Imperial Club floor. This gave us free breakfast in the club lounge or at the restaurant. The restaurant breakfast would have cost $30 per person so it saved us money. The room was very large and clean. The hotel was in the city center. Most of our time was spent at Fisherman's Wharf, the Feryy Building, etc. so it would have been better to stay closer to those things. This hotel was close to Union Square. Cabs are very hard to find in San Francisco that's why I suggest being close to what you want to see,

The only negative about this hotel is that they are short staffed. The staff that is there is very nice. They just need more help at the front desk and the concierge.

Overall I would tell you it's a good choice.

As we were checking in, we were offered a glass of wine, a very nice touch! The hotel is in a great location and it was perfect for our weekend get away without our kids! There are a lot of great coffee places in San Francisco, but it was really nice having a Starbucks in the hotel lobby for convenience.
