review.title: Good hotel with poor AC
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel. Courteous staff. Valet was expensive but convenient. Poor air conditioning. Room stayed warm all night in May with AC at lowest setting.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning
review.locationRemarks: Conveient

managementResponses.response: thank you for your comment. All of our charges are listed on our FAQ page for you to look at prior to booking your next visit. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel...little disappointed that WiFi wasn't included.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location, centrally located. You had to pay extra for wifi and the fitness room. The breakfast brunch was very large but very expensive. Overall it was a nice hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Had to pay for wifi and the fitness room

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: It's a beautiful hotel near the convention center. Great room and deal.

review.title: About hotel
review.reviewText:
we spend three nights.
We had great times.
For example, good services, clean and very kind staffs

review.title: General over view
review.reviewText: This hotel is very conveniently located in the central business district, close to Union square and shopping centers, department stores and transport. The rooms are somewhat old fashioned, but this hotel has a reasonable sized gym and pool and a Starbucks Coffee shop is located virtually within the hotel foyer - good considering it's difficult, if,not impossible, for a hotel to make a good cup of coffee, or in my case Chai tea.... check in was easy and the check out also without any hiccups. I would have liked a door man at the door to open it when approaching with a lot of parcels. And when we arrived, the valet didn't even attempt to help us with our bags out of the taxi and into the hotel... Overall, the positioning of the Nikko is its greatest strength - a generally comfortable hotel, but in need of a renovation.
review.negativeRemarks: Old fashioned and in need of re-vamp.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, close to everything and a good starting point for a vacation.

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText:
If only smell of sweat in the room had been a little bit less pronounced.
Great experience other than that. Great service.
Polite personnel.A++

managementResponses.response: Thank you for choosing us. We appreciate your comment and look forward to having you back again!

review.title: Business stay
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, i generally stay at the Hyatt's, and was very pleased with the Hotel Nikko.

review.title: Great location; nice hotel but not worth price
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a nice location, but I'd still prefer the Westin St. Francis or The Palace at this price range. They had some nice features that we didn't use - the restaurant (pricey), the jazz bar (no interest), and the fitness center/pool (they charged $20 for access!!!). I still don't understand why high end hotels charge for the basic things like a fitness center or internet when little guys like Red Roof Inn even offer free internet access.
review.negativeRemarks: Charging $20 for the pool
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks away from the center of town, ten steps away from an amazing Irish pub

review.title: Hotel Nikko-trip for two
review.reviewText:
Hotel Nikko was a very nice hotel in a great location downtown. The room was very small, though, for the price. Views from the room were awful, and overlooked a vacant low-rise building. No room in the fridge for our personal items.

Pool, internet access, and exercise equipment were all extra expenses that we did not utilize.
review.negativeRemarks: size of the room, awful views
review.locationRemarks: heart of downtown, close to shopping and muni

review.title: Elegant hotel in S.F
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, wonderful staff. Our room was small but very chic.My only complaint was that they charged for every little thing. 16.00 for internet., 58.00 for parking, and a few more things . I just think for the price that they should be included. All in all it was a nice experiance.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra charges
review.locationRemarks: Right downtown San Francisco. I could see Macy's from our window. Right in the middle of everything.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Everything great, only one little glitch - room service staff didn't quite know what was on their own menu!
review.positiveRemarks: Stylish and lovely spa on floor 5
review.negativeRemarks: Room service staff didn't have a copy of their own menu!! But were still very nice.
review.locationRemarks: Union square - what else is there to say?!!

review.title: Slept Great!
review.reviewText: Looking for a relaxing and pleasurable place to stay in San Fransisco? Hotel Nikko was amazing! Spendy but worth it.

review.title: Hotel Nikko...Hard to beat
review.reviewText: Location is great with with trams,trains and buses all within a few minutes walk.Major shopping only a short walk away as well

review.title: Great Location/Comfortable rooms
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located, only minutes walk from Union Square, Market Street, cable car. The rooms and bathroom are spacious, updated, and well appointed. The staff was most helpful, with excellent suggestions on restaurants and travel tips.
review.negativeRemarks: Not enough TV channels
review.locationRemarks: Minutes away from Union Square shopping and Market/Mission Streeet museums and theater

review.title: Ditch the radio
review.reviewText: My only complaint was the antiquated "clock radio" that was in the room. Not only was it an eyesore amongst the modern decor, but it went off precisely 30 minutes before I had to wake up (early for a morning flight), and after hitting snooze, 20 minutes, etc. With wake-up calls and TV that offers radio, why do we need clock radios?? Especially in a four-star hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The bedding was like sleeping in a cloud.
review.negativeRemarks: The "clock radio" that was in the room, an eyesore amongst the modern decor, especially when it went off precisely 30 minutes before I had to wake up.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect. 5-minute walk to flagship Gap, Nordstrom, etc. and Union Square.

review.title: Amazing staff and experience.
review.reviewText:
Took my girlfriend to San Fran for her first time. We loved the hotel. Staff was amazing and very helpful. The Japanese buffet was delicious!!!!!
Thanks to everyone! We will be back!!!
review.positiveRemarks: The Japanese buffet and the view
review.negativeRemarks: Na
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Loved the Nikko
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel. The staff is superb; the location fantastic.

review.title: Comfortable stay, nice breakfast!
review.reviewText:
Big room with a good view, the windows were single pane and let traffic noise through, even on the 21st floor, but otherwise a very peaceful stay.
Breakfast here is fantastic, very diverse menu with quality food.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from outside
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and trams, nice walk to the bay following tram lines

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay there. Comfortable room. Good view. Loved the pool - steam/sauna
review.negativeRemarks: air conditioning could be better
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: A nice surprise
review.reviewText:
I wasn't expecting much from this hotel after staying in some top quality hotels during our trip.
That changed as soon as we arrived. The hotel was very nice with great friendly staff and great comfortable rooms.
The hotel was located on Union Square and only blocks from all the main San Francisco attractions and shopping precincts.
Be sure to go to the Irish Hotel a couple of doors down for the duelling piano's show.
review.locationRemarks: very central to everything

review.title: Room Request
review.reviewText: When we first got there we were suppose to have a room with a King size bed. Instead they put us in a room with what they called a Queen size Bed however at 5 ft my feet were off the bed When I contorted them about this, they immediately accommodated my request and moved me to a room immediately plus provided us with a continental breakfast the remainder of the week at no charge. Very nice place and that was our only issue which they corrected.
review.negativeRemarks: that we were not put in the correct room
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Excellent.
review.reviewText: Excellent welcome, the hotel is really well kept and in a great location for seeing the city. The staff were really helpful when we asked anything of them and the room was kept really clean and tidy.

review.title: 3rd time in SF
review.reviewText: We personally repaired the showerhead that leaked badly the first day. Also the carpet was a bit worn. Central location to most everything. Overall an enjoyable stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Paying to use pool
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Greatly enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: Customer service given by the staff was superb. Everyone from reception deck, concierge, valet, housekeeping staff, even the woman who took my request for wake-up call was exceptional. The room had a nice deep bathtub and a separate glass shower stall. I also enjoyed the TV Japan on one of channels. There were nice touches such as self-service water at the lobby with citrus slices. I only wish they didn't charge extra for guest room wi-fi use, but there is Starbucks inside the hotel and there's free wi-fi there. Only couple of blocks from the nearest Bart station or Muni bus stop and lots of additional restaurants are within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, excellent customer service, pleasant rooms
review.negativeRemarks: Additional charge for in-room wi-fi and parking is pricey.
review.locationRemarks: Very near Powell Bart station, Muni bus stop. Both Union Square stores and Westfield mall are within a short walking distance.

review.title: Very nice, but out of use pool.
review.reviewText:
Overall this hotel was very nice, clean, with friendly staff, and in a great location.

Our only quibble was that the spa and pool was under renovation during our stay, which was not communicated to us when booking, or when we checked in.

That being said, I would definately say there again myself and recomend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, bathroom and view from room
review.negativeRemarks: Pool out of use
review.locationRemarks: Great central location near to trams, trains and buses. Round the corner from Union Square

review.title: nice, but all take and little give
review.reviewText: I have stayed here before and enjoyed the stay however this trip was not as good but the cost is not adjusted. Many perks were not available on site due to reasons I did not care to hear but the rates were not adjusted. I spent 45 minutes on the phone with Expedia so an argumentitive front desk clerk would allow for the meals that were to be included. The hotel is in a great location but I will look for another hotel the next time I go to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Difficult staff
review.locationRemarks: Ideal for union square and trolley

review.title: I expected more
review.reviewText:
I thought the overall atmosphere cold and indifferent. I resent having to pay for internet services. free tv channel selection was quite limited and no free premium channels. on-demand was pitiful, I should pay to watch a show that was broadcasr three weeks ago?
For a luxury hotel to be so pennypinching was hard to take.
the configuration of the room was odd and has a lot of wasted space.
review.negativeRemarks: little amenities

review.title: Great hotel - wonderful experience
review.reviewText:
I've read a lot about the hotel after I booked it and was cautious about my choice. Well, now I know I made a great choice. The hotel of this caliber for the price that I got on Expedia - this is a rare find. Upscale elegant hotel, beautiful swimming pool, great service, large room with a great view - this was such a positive experience!

Now - the negative things people say about the hotel. It is all a matter of how you look at it. Yes, hotel charges $20 for the use for facilities. However, $20 is not a big deal if you paid what you paid for the room, and the facilities are magnificent, so it's a good deal anyway. Yes, swimming pool is shallow ranging from 2 ft to 4 ft - not overly convenient, but it is ok to do your lapse. Yes, Internet charge is $15 per day (I think) but there is a Starbucks which you can enter directly from inside the building and work on a computer, if you're not willing to pay. Yes, Sunday brunch was $24 per person but it looked ok. On the other hand, service was superb at all levels - from front desk to concierge to porter. And there was lemon water in the lobby - delicious. When we needed refrigerator in the room, we got it within 5 minutes - free of charge. When out shower head did not switch to flexible hose easily, a maintenance person came in - again within 5 minutes. Great experience!
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful upscale hotel. Great location in mid-town San Francisco. Great service.
review.negativeRemarks: Extra charges. Shallow swimming pool. No Internet.
review.locationRemarks: Great mid-town location.

review.title: Right the first time.
review.reviewText: This was my first time to San Francisco and the Nikko was perfect!!! Very close to public parking, public transportation, many restaurants and within walking distance to China Town. I would DEFINITELY stay here again...

review.title: Excellent hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The room was clean and very comfortable. The bathroom arrangement was lovely, however, the primary shower had a loose connection and water sprayed to the side, so we just used the hand-held shower - though I did tell the front desk about the problem.
review.positiveRemarks: Simple, elegant lobby spaces; large carafes of water with lemon, lime or orange slices there, a great concierge service, wonderful on site restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: Spraying of water from one shower head.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to the Powell Street cable car turn around; walking distance to excellent shopping, restaurants, etc.

review.title: Alarm clock kept me up
review.reviewText: Everything about the stay itself and the staff was fantastic except for the alarm that kept going off half the night til i had to manually unplug it. Note to staff, make sure alarm clocks are turned off/reset after each guest; sleep deprived guests are cranky guests.

review.title: Happy with Nikko overall
review.reviewText: Original room with just Queen bed was too tiny so we upgraded to room with two double beds which was more spacious but was $40 more per night. They switched us very easily. There was no mini-fridge we could use other than mini-bar, so we called down and they brought us a mini-fridge on wheels which had a very loud motor. Bathroom was nice, but shower was clogged, and had to call for service. Also very limited TV channel options with no guide to tell you what channels they had. Service at front desk and parking area was very courteous. Very easy central location.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was showing some age. Not good TV channel selection
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located

review.title: Convenient SF stay
review.reviewText: We booked five rooms for five couples for an overnight stay in SF. We got a great rate through Expedia.ca. The check-in was efficient and the rooms were spacious and clean. there was no free wi-fi when one did not book through the hotel's own website but there was a coffee shop downstairs with free wi-fi access. The location was central to shopping and dining in Union Square. Friends staying on the 7th floor heard some ambulance noise at night but we did not hear anything on the 11th floor.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to great dining places like Kuleto's (Italian food). Also two blocks away from Union Square for shopping.

review.title: jodie's review
review.reviewText: Hotel is clean and neat. Near Union Station and the Piers. Excellent service. Even room service meals were presented well and cooked to order.

review.title: Bryan
review.reviewText: Very good - clean and trendy with great dining. We chose to eat in each evening as the food was so good. However, I do think when you've paid a premium price for a hotel you should get at least free wi-fi access.
review.negativeRemarks: Access to gym/health centre and wireless internet are additional extra cost
review.locationRemarks: Excellent for those who prefer to be in the best shopping district.

review.title: Excellent location and great service.
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with this Hotel. The location is excellent for easy access to all the areas you want to see. Staff were friendly and helpful with advice on how to make the most of your time and ideas of what to do. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was modern, comfortable, spacious and cleaned daily.

review.title: Couples Getaway
review.reviewText: I had a minor issue at when I checked in, about the bathroom not being cleaned, and the staff was very prompt and attentive. Also had an issue with a misplaced bag, and when the airline delivered to the front desk, they promptly called me to deliver the bag. Very pleased with the staff. Hotel was in great shape, great decor, and perfect central location. Everything we wanted to do was in walking distance, or within walking distance to transportation to get us there! Highly recommend
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the condition of the hotel. Appeared to be recently remodeled.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, and very near all forms of transportation (Muni, BART and Cable Cars)

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great service, I wish all hotels are able to teach & train their staff on how important their guests are & why they should provide firts class service to them.
review.negativeRemarks: location
review.locationRemarks: too central & parking is a problem

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Really liked this hotel. The location was excellent as it is so near to everything but we did not find it too loud. The room itself is lovely with a huge very comfy bed. There is lots of space for all your clothes and it was very clean. The bathroom was really nice and was enormous with a big shower and bath. The lobby is impressive and staff were friendly. Very impressed and would stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and room was very impressive
review.negativeRemarks: You had to pay to use the pool and wi-fi in your room
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location

review.title: Awesome!!!
review.reviewText: Loved the gorgeous hotel! Great location! Views are incredible! Staff is so friendly! Pure luxury and felt totally spoiled!
review.positiveRemarks: So many favorite things about Hotel Nikko! A great added touch was the fresh lemon water or lime water before or after your elevator ride!
review.negativeRemarks: Least fave thing about the hotel was that I couldn't stay longer!
review.locationRemarks: Location was great...close to greatest shopping, sites, transportation, etc!

review.title: Priced for what you get
review.reviewText:
Cold place, old, no personality, for that money you can have much more in SF.
In addition, Expedia was showing in the bid a free internet deal, but when I purchased the room it was not crearly written in the coupon so I had to discuss at the reception; the Hotel gave me finally Internet free, but it was not a nice travel experience

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Very satisfactory. Room needs some attention to repairs but well located

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText:
Not a bad experience at all.
The swimming pool was very shallow, 4ft at the deepest point, on the opposite side you bang your feet on the bottom.
Hotel was great overall, with nice staff, very clean.
Would definitely recommend.
review.negativeRemarks: Shallow pool
review.locationRemarks: Location is within walking distance of the Moscone center.

review.title: Awesome location!!!
review.reviewText: Great location! It has all the amenities, but they dont necessarily take care of their VIP's! Other than that good hotel. THE CLIFT gives them a run for the money...
review.negativeRemarks: Treated like a regular JOE when I was suppose to be a VIP guest
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: A Wonderful Stay at Hotel Nikko for My Birthday
review.reviewText: I celebrated my 40th birthday this April at Hotel Nikko in San Francisco. I love the hotel. It's located at the Union Square in San Francisco. The hotel is in a prime location. A variety of good restaurants are just around the hotel corners. The Westfield shopping center and retail shops are just 5-10 minutes within walking distance. I got a good deal on Expedia and happened to be placed in a good room on the 7th floor facing Parc 55 Windham. The hotel has all amenities you would find in other hotels like Hilton and Fairmont. Staff was very helpful and friendly. I will definitely come back to stay at this hotel in my next trip.

review.title: Worth the stay!
review.reviewText: Great location! Great staff! Great hote! Great experience!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. It was within walking distance to many San Francisco attractions. The concierges was superb, they knew their city and knew it well.

review.title: Not 4 Star IMO
review.reviewText: I've been coming here for years but it's defnitely not as good as it once was. The rooms have scuff marks on the walls but other then that the room was clean. The drape didn't close all the way so that was a pain in the butt. Housekeeping was on the ball though. The staff were good but some weren't. To charge like $20 to use the gym is just riduculous! To charge $20 for a movie is almost as ridiculous. I am wondering if they'll charge us for toilet flushes in the future?

review.title: Comfy, clean and easy
review.reviewText: Hotel location was perfect. Easy walk to some great cafes, restaurants and stores. Hotel service was good and rooms were comfortable and clean. It's a fair way from Pier 39 but taxi's are easy to get.

review.title: Quality but you pay for it.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a decent area and was clean and tidy. Breakfast was expensive but nice.

Overall I felt the hotel was clean, tidy and quite nice but for the price it wasn't that much better than the Holiday Inn. Also I really hate when an expensive hotel charges exorbitant prices just for WiFi Access when other cheaper hotels offer it for free.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel but sorry they don't have kettles in hotels in the States.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: Great near an Irish Bar
review.userLocation: Chester, Cheshire West and Chester, UK

review.title: Great Hotel.
review.reviewText: Fantastic staff, room was very clean and modern. The breakfast was brilliant also.
review.positiveRemarks: Free wine and finger food. T.V in the bathroom. Free water in reception.

review.title: Did not keep our reservations.
review.reviewText: When we arrived on the first night they put us in a double room even though we had made reservations for a King room for 4 nights. They said they had run out of King rooms and only had doubles available which made me wonder why they hadn't set aside a King room for us and not actually made our reservations although we had the receipt from Expedia.com. They finally moved us to a King room the next day after complaining to the manager.
review.negativeRemarks: The service, they are not helpful or friendly
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, central

review.title: location
review.reviewText: modern clean centrally located one block from powell st and union square, two blocks from westfield shopping plaza. close to all food and transport

review.title: ok for a night
review.reviewText: it was ok, hallways smelled musty. Great location but in need of a rehab
review.negativeRemarks: worn out
review.locationRemarks: very good

review.title: I'd stay at Hotel Nikko any time!
review.reviewText: Clean room, lots of space for what it was. Good price for everything. Very friendly staff.

review.title: Overall, nice hotel.
review.reviewText: Overall, nice hotel and very convenient location. Standard business class hotel with the expected amenities. Staff was courteous and helpful throughout. Some more vegetarian options in the restaurant and room service would be nice :-)

review.title: Good stay
review.reviewText: Good location, good service, room is a bit on the small side but quite acceptable. No issues overall. There are heaps of hotel options in this area and this is a decent one if you can get it for a good price.

review.title: Great stay and trip in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at the Hotel Nikko in San Francisco. The customer service was great and each of the staff members we had contact with were wonderful! The rooms were spacious and clean and the benefits received from staying in an Imperial Club Suite were great for a family. A very family friendly hotel and one we would be sure to stay at again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, size of the rooms, comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing negative to say - the stay was great.
review.locationRemarks: Great location - easy access to anywhere in the city from here.

review.title: Small but convenient
review.reviewText: This was our first time visiting San Francisco and chose this hotel based off of ratings we saw. Our stay was very pleasant - we didn't spend much time in the room but it was a little small. The hotel is located in Union Square which is pretty much close to everything we wanted to do - easy access to the Muni and Bart. Not too sure how safe/comfortable the area is to walk around at night since there were several homeless folks following you around asking for money...
review.positiveRemarks: great location - central to just about everything we wanted to do.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms were small and windows did not open in the rooms.

review.title: Locals playing tourists
review.reviewText: My family and I live an hour from San Francisco. We are return guests, third stay in the past 12 months. Hotel is updated and clean. Staff very friendly. Although the pool is on the smaller side, the kids enjoy it very much, it is indoor and heated.
review.positiveRemarks: Cleanliness, friendly, indoor pool for kids, very convenient central location.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive hotel parking (just like all other hotels in the area).
review.locationRemarks: Hotel Nikko, along with numerous other hotels, is very centrally located two blocks from the Union Square area, very walkable to many attractions.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText:
The staff were very welcoming and happy to help. We were there for my partner's birthday and they gave us complimentary passes for the gym, sauna and pool for our entire stay. I know it was only something like $25 but the fact that they with no question were happy to offer us this was lovely.

Great location, fabulous rooms and wonderful staff. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit San Francisco.

review.title: Great choice!
review.reviewText: Great value & location! Health club open 24x7--something to do when I was awake at 3 AM.

review.title: Comfortable and relaxing
review.reviewText: The room was spacious and comfortable. The staff most obliging as we requested a late checkout of 2pm and were not charged. Staff at all levels were friendly and helpful. The position of the hotel was ideal for both sight seeing and shopping. We can highly recommend this hotel as a cost effective option for a short holiday stay in San Francisco. .
review.positiveRemarks: Relaxing ambience, the availability of a deep bath and the option of a late checkout.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to ask for a refrigerator
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Nikki
review.reviewText:
Great hotel. The staff are fantastic, the concierge was brilliant.
Great location.
Absolutely nothing to complain about.
review.positiveRemarks: Locatiom, the concierge, the hotel was great.
review.negativeRemarks: This was a great hotel, nothing to copai about.
review.locationRemarks:
Convenient, easy access to transport, a short walk to Union Square.
The only irritant with San Fran is the beggars who hang around the tourist spots.

review.title: elaine- a mom and lawyer who travels alot
review.reviewText: the room Expedia booked me into was extremely small for the price (I was told around 200 sqare feet)-usually used for flight attendants simply doing an overnight. Certainly not for me and my nine year old trying to have a short vacation. While staff upgraded me to a slightly bigger room the second night after I complained, it was not without an additional cost to me. I should not have had to pay for a slightly bigger room which was the size only of a normal hotel room!
review.negativeRemarks: room
review.locationRemarks: it was ok

review.title: great stay!!
review.reviewText: great rooms, very friendly staff, well located for enjoyable walks to alot of cool eating places and ofcourse the trolly. Our whole family enjoyed the hotel. the view from the 12th floor was great. Get a corner room and you will have the best view....
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great!

review.title: Recommended
review.reviewText: Conveniently located, good condition, clean comfortable rooms. Good facilities. Would recommend staying here.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing negative
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located, but the area has a lot of homeless (bad that is not the hotel's fault)

review.title: High quality downtown/union square hotel
review.reviewText:
Great staff, great location in union square. Just about everything walkable. Hotel has a great pool, also the hotel is surprisingly friendly for kids.

Only a couple minor things: The room amenities state free wifi, but that's not the case. You have to go downstairs to the Starbucks for free wifi. Also, I'm a basketball fan and even though the cable channels were supposed to include TNT, they do not. Very frustrating, because I was hoping to watch an important game.

Otherwise, great spot. Parking is expensive ($45 overnight ) but you can get it as low as $25 per night just a few blocks away.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking, no free wifi
review.locationRemarks: Downtown, crowded but fun

review.title: Content from London
review.reviewText: Overall this is an excellent hotel set in a good location to tour San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: The lift key system could be abit tricky
review.locationRemarks: Central San Francisco, close to many of the major attractions and also therefore quite a few pan-handlers!

review.title: great vacations!!!
review.reviewText:
Wonderful vacations
Excellent room, location, staff...was perfect!!!!
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: hotel in central SF
review.reviewText: Great location (close to tourist attractions and good restaurants) and over all experience (room standards, Starbucks in the same building, friendly staff)
review.negativeRemarks: Gym should be included in the price

review.title: Hotel Nikko - April 2012
review.reviewText: Great hotel and location - went to San Francisco for Spring Break with my daughter. Easy to get around town. Close to the cable car, public transportation and also easy walking distance to Chinatown, Ferry Market, Union Square. Only had dessert at the restaurant but it was great - sushi menu looked fabulous...
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Standard Hotel-no bells and whistles
review.reviewText: I thought this hotel would be a little nicer than what it was. There wasn't anything special about it. The floor that we stayed on had a strange odor to it (like someone cookiing food)!!
review.locationRemarks: Location was in good proximity to Union Square and trolley

review.title: Excellent SF hotel
review.reviewText: Cannot fault the hotel, service or its food. This is a very nicely designed large hotel with distinct Japanese flavour. Like in Japan everything works and nothing is out of place.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious clean design and good food
review.locationRemarks: Like in so many US cities, social neglect is evident not too far from the hotel.

review.title: NIKKO, worth a try
review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't always helpful in giving accurate advise on tourist events.

review.title: Petite Queen, avoid
review.reviewText: The hotel has a great central location to everything in the downtown area and I received a great rate on Expedia. I would highly reccomend an upgrade as I took the discount rate room off of Expedia and it was tiny. The walls were thin and I could hear vividly the conversations in the next room and they were not even being loud. I was on the 21st floor and I could still hear all the noise out on the streets. The shower was a major disappointment in this discount room, awful water pressure too. The room was clean, but if I was to stay here again I would get one of their better rooms. I got what I paid for.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound Insulation
review.locationRemarks: Great Central Location

review.title: Short Family Trip
review.reviewText:
Spacious room, nice bath and well designed. Carpet looks clean but has certain strange smell (can use a shampoo). Good location and we were able to take BART to and from SFO airport. Pool and sauna and steam room are nice and worth the $20 per stay (we stayed for 3 nights). Car rental are near by (across the street almost). We rented for the day and did not keep overnight to avoid the hefty parking fee. We were able to visit Muir wood, wineries in Sanoma, golden gate park all in one day.
Make sure you try the Old Siam Thai restuarant. Great food and prices are reasonable. Skip the Japanese resturants around the hotel (food are average at most but pricy).
Overall, we had a great stay at this hotel and were able to walk to lots of places nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: Smelly carpet
review.locationRemarks: Very well located

review.title: Our stay at Nikko
review.reviewText: Have enjoyed our stay very much. Excellent hotel. Highly recommendable.

review.title: Short break
review.reviewText: Good location and ideal to get to most places. Starbucks next door was perfect and ideal to get Internet access.

review.title: Long Weekend SF Getaway
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, comfortable hotel in a great location! We were able to walk to lots of great shopping. The indoor pool and hot tub were a bonus, and the fitness room was well equipped for a hotel. We also enjoyed the restaurant, Anzu. My 13-year old son got a kick out of cooking his own thinly sliced beef on a hot rock brought tableside! Overall, a very nice stay for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Love the indoor pool in the atrium and the fitness center
review.negativeRemarks: Parking was expensive
review.locationRemarks: Great central location - very close to Union Square and lots of shopping, and close to the cable car turnaround

review.title: A wonderful place to stay.
review.reviewText: The hotel service was excellent. The staff always greeted with a smile. They were very knowledgeable about places to go and had many recommendations that I found very helpful. I would definately go back and stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: All the staff members were very helpful and very nice!
review.locationRemarks: location was great. it was in the middle of everything!

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautiful and in a prime location. It's close to shops, restaurantsand the BART. Our room was modern and very clean. Overall, we enjoyed it very much. There were only a few times when I wish the service was better but nothing mjaor came up.
review.positiveRemarks: Modern and clean. Location is FABULOUS too.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room.
review.locationRemarks: perfect. Right by the BART and downtown.

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: This nice Japanese hotel is politeness at its best. They upgraded me to an imperial suite for nearly nothing. The room is cleaned twice a day and prepared for sleep at night. The food is fantastic, specially the sushi restaurant. We had a great dinner celebrate an occasion and everybody made sure we were well taken care off. I will always stay at the Nikko hotel in my trips to San Francisco.

review.title: Lovely hotel, but you'll pay for internet!
review.reviewText:
The nicest place we've ever stayed!

My only complaint was paying for the wifi--even cheap hotels offer that for free! The cost is normally $15.95 per 24 hour period. But, I splurged and bought a 3-day package for $31.95, which I didn't realize would only support one devise. So, even though I could access the internet with my Kindle, but my daughter could not with hers!

The maids did a fabulous job, and were so very discreet. We never once saw their cart in the hallway!

The concierge, Chris, was absolutely amazing with helping us to decide where to eat and what sites to see! He's such a happy and polite young man!

We could have not normally afforded this fabulous hotel, but the Expedia deal swayed us. And I'm so glad that we stayed there!

There are 6 very fast elevators in the lobby. Although there are 25 floors, we never had to wait more than a minute for an elevator.

There's a smiling face everywhere you go in this hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: First class all the way, and a wonderful staff!
review.negativeRemarks: $15.95 per day for internet?!?!?!?
review.locationRemarks: Located downtown within walking distance of trolleys, cable cars, and city buses. (We never rode the train.) Most of the "sites" are quite far away.

review.title: San Fran
review.reviewText: My daughter and I spent 4 days in San Francisco last week. We found the hotel to be a wonderful surprise and extremely convenient to all the tourist attractions (China Town, Cable Cars to Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, etc.) We would definately stay here again!

review.title: Overrated Hotel
review.reviewText: I booked this room for a trip for myself and my best girlfriend. For how expensive the hotel was, it was very simple, nothing extraordinary about neither the hotels decor nor the room. I upgraded my room to the deluxe king bedroom but was disappointed in how small the room was. The hotel charges an extra $20 to use the pool and fitness center; I thought these amenities should have been included at no charge for hotel guest.
review.negativeRemarks: Expense rate
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of downtown San Francisco

review.title: Disappointed...
review.reviewText: Overall service was mediocre at best - rooms are out dated, especially bathrooms...our room ws not ame two days ina row and turn down was not done any of the days. Public areas such as bar and restaurant were unkempt - dirty glasses sitting on tables not cleared off, etc...
review.negativeRemarks: The room
review.locationRemarks: Good location

review.title: Family holiday in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: We had a week at The Nikko and were very well looked after. We had rooms on the club floor and access to th club lounge. This was a little tired and could do with refurbishing and upgrading. Otherwise no complaints at all.
review.locationRemarks: Really central with easy walking to Union Square, shopping and transport

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the best location, if wanting to be in downtown San Francisco. 1-2 blocks from Union Square and shopping. Overall good hotel.

review.title: Outstanding
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel and the location was ideal for us as it was located near every place we wanted to see. We love visiting eareas and not having to use our car.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: THere was no lamp on the bedside table so I had to get out of bed to turn out the light. I did not ask to have this remedied, however. My assumption is that they would have corrected it.
review.locationRemarks: great downtown location

review.title: Good location, overall okay
review.reviewText: Good location in Union Square. Our room was small but adequate. The room was a little dingy but the decor was modern and the bed was comfortable. The lobby, staff, and bar of the hotel were nice. Overall it was a good location for us to come back to at the end of a long day of sightseeing. Good rates and it seemed safe. I'd probably go back if I returned to SanFran.

review.title: Honeymoon Blunder
review.reviewText:
This hotel stay was for my honeymoon. I called ahead to let the concierge know it was my honeymoon, and see what I could do special for my new wife. The concierge offered an extremely overpriced bottle of champagne, which would be waiting in the room when we arrived. I agreed. When my wife and I arrived, there was no champagne waiting. I went to talk to the concierge, who apologized, and offered the bottle be brought up to the room, complimentary. I reluctantly agreed, the point had been ruined, but, who turns down free champagne. Then, upon check-out, we were charged for the bottle! When I addressed this at check-out, I was informed that there were no "notes in the system" and she would have to talk to the food service manager, as soon as she had time, and would call our room. Well, an hour later, when we absolutely had to leave to catch our flight, she still had not called. We went downstairs, and she had forgotten, and had to go check with the manger. She came back, and again, wanted us to pay because there were "no notes in the system". Finally, they comped the bottle when I showed them the apology note from the other manager that said the bottle was complementary.

Overall, the hotel is beautiful, the food is good, but the service is not what would be expected for the price. There is an overall lack of communication, and they ruined my honeymoon surprise for my wife.
review.negativeRemarks: small room, poor service
review.locationRemarks: excellent location, walking distance from everything

review.title: Our stay
review.reviewText:
This Hotel was very welcoming and friendly.
Good location and near to all sights.

review.title: San Francisco Trip
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, very modern close to a lot of great things to do in the city. Parking is extremely expensive at $45 a night.
review.negativeRemarks: The price to park your car.

review.title: Pleasant time at the Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: The breakfast buffet was great; beautiful strawberries, sweet pineapple and the smoothie drinks were delightful. The only drawback is the loud music in the lobby, a bit overbearing for my tastes. The room is a bit tiny but San Fran has so much to offer that the time you spend in the room is really not a lot that you are getting a good deal for your money, especially when breakfast is included. I would go back again in a heart beat.

review.title: Would stay again.
review.reviewText: The hotel is geographically convenient to anywhere we wanted to go. Our view was awesome and the staff was great. The only thing I didnt care for was the "Scar face" theme...All the gray marble, black fixtures etc. (The free breakfast buffet was great too).
review.negativeRemarks: The decor
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect

review.title: This hotel has a great little swimming pool
review.reviewText: The presence of the 19m indoor pool persuaded me to book this hotel. This is a good sized pool for a hotel and it didn't disappoint. The food is very good and the hotel is very comfortable. The charge for internet use seemd a bit high and the service wasn't only just adequate. That's about the only flaw.

review.title: How to find ways to charge guests
review.reviewText:
They charge for every thing...
One night parking $60.00
WIFI...$16.00
one small water bottle they have kept in the room , if you open it by mistake pay $6.00. ( it actually cost $1.50 outside.)
If you want to use their GYM, be ready to shell out $25.00 per day.
they also have a small refrigerator in the room,if you open by mistake, and dont use any of the things inside, You will be charged $ 60.00 . so dont open the refrigerator ( sensor in fridge automatically charge that..- BTW they refunded that money.
they dont provide complimentary breakfast, toothpaste shaving, or any of that .
I was grateful, they did not charge me for breathing in their room...oh wait, I might be giving them ideas...cus Hotel Nikko finds ways to charge their customers. BTW this is luxurious hotel, it looks great from lobby, I never stayed in any motel in my life, but i am thinking you can get better service from a Motel.
review.negativeRemarks: service
review.locationRemarks: sanfrancisco downtown

review.title: Conference Stay
review.reviewText: Stayed for a conference in Feb 2012. Great hotel for this purpose.

review.title: Had a wonderful stay
review.reviewText: The Hotel was clean, comfortable, quiet and well-located and Guest Services went above and beyond the call of duty. Made for a wonderful stay. Now if only the phone and Internet charges could be more reasonable.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, quiet, cleanliness and Guest Services
review.negativeRemarks: if only the phone and Internet charges could be more reasonable.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal.

review.title: Comfortable and Convenient Hotel off Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel - very convenient location and good facilities.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the pool facilities - practically empty most days.
review.negativeRemarks: TV facilities and choice of channel were pretty poor.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient location

review.title: Mini-getaway
review.reviewText: I got a great deal on airfare and lodging. When I arrived, I was pleased to see the view from my 15th story room. The bathroom was lovely and sparkling. Bed very comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Great proximity to North Beach and Chinatown!

review.title: Great time
review.reviewText: Very clean room.Very freindly staff made for a pleasent stay.

review.title: Charged each time you open the fridge... absurd!
review.reviewText: I did not like the fact that I had a bill under my door the day I checked out. Apparently, you get charged $4.00 for a Cola Soda each time you open the fridge... even though I didn't take anything from it. They removed the charges but it was an inconvienence for me to have to go down to the lobby when I was rushing to get out that day. I also swear the hotel said free wireless when I booked it and they told me while checking in that it was $31 for 3 days of use. The rooms were clean and comfortable but small. I would not stay there again when there are so many other great boutique-hotel options in that area for cheaper.
review.negativeRemarks: Charges for opening Fridge, Wifi fee even though it said it was included.
review.locationRemarks: It's an okay area... lots of people asking for money and street people.

review.title: Great location, but be ready for the "Sales Pitch"
review.reviewText:
PROS:
Hotel Nikko is in a great location in Union Square. Close to public transporation (BART (metro/subway system with Visitors center), city pass ticket booth, world famous rail car stop, bus lines, cabs line up out front of the hotel so you never wait for a cab,etc. Great restaurants, bars, entertainment, shopping. Parking is hard to find and expensive in San Francisco, so I recommend taking public transportation.The room was small (depends on what level of room you purchase), but very modern and clean, large flat screen TV, nice linens/pillows, vessel sink/modern bathroom. The staff was great. Very good customer service/hospitality. Starbucks in the building. Great for breakfast. Nice Jacuzzi.

Cons:

Be prepared for the sales pitch on lots of extras: Parking extra $40 - 50/day. $16/day to use wifi internet. Breakfast $24. Go to Stabucks instead. Swimming pool/Workout area $20. Swimming pool looks nice but shallow so its terrible for laps, 2 1/2 feet on one end, and 4 1/2 on the other. Good for Kids though.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, beautiful hotel, modern, clean, staff is friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Sales Pitch on upgrades. Extra Costs/Hidden charges excluded from Hotel price. Swimming pool too shallow to do proper laps in.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square Awesome! Excellent location. Starbucks inside hotel Nikko too.

review.title: few upgrades
review.reviewText:
Our major concern was that tub was older and did not appear clean.
Room could have used more mirrors and also
more, better lighting (ie: makeup mirror in bathroom)
review.positiveRemarks: good location to convention center & trolley station, shopping
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom
review.locationRemarks: good location

review.title: Nikko hotel of San Fran Cisco
review.reviewText:
the only problem we had was the breakfast coupons. My 16 year old was not supplied any tickets because she was staying in the hotel with her parents.
This was the only problem we encountered.

review.title: Fun in San Fran
review.reviewText: Location was convenient to many things. The decor of the hotel was unique. The breakfast buffet was the best I've seen.
review.negativeRemarks: cost
review.locationRemarks: close to a variety of places

review.title: Hotel Nikko SF
review.reviewText:
Overall, a lovely hotel. The staff was very nice, the room was beautiful. The location was easyily accessbible.

I was there to celebrate my 30th birthday. It is important to note that this hotel by name, decor, and demogrpahics is (obviously) of Asain influence. And while the staff was amazing and our stay was very pleasant, this hotel was genuinely Asain (food selections, etc.)
review.positiveRemarks: Decor was beautiful, restaurant was nice, cleaning staff was VERY nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Mattress in our Imperial Club room was stiff. No mini frig... there was a space but not one in the room.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good. View was nice -- however our particular view was obstructed (22nd floor).

review.title: Great last night
review.reviewText:
Only stayed 1 night to end our San Francisco stay after staying at the Hyatt Fishermans Wharf.
I booked the Nikko Floor but was upgraded to the Imperial floor for an extra $20.
Staff were great and room was excellent. Would definitely stay again.
review.positiveRemarks: Classy well located hotel for Union square
review.negativeRemarks: Cost of parking, but that was expensive everywhere
review.locationRemarks:
I stayed there for the shopping at union square, though would suite as a base for all of
San Francisco

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This was a wonderful hotel. There was easy access to public transport. There's an excellent gym onsite and an indoor pool and spa.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the indoor pool and spa!
review.locationRemarks: It was close to public transport. Its a short, easy walk to the BART and cable cars.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location and has an impressive lobby. The rooms are a decent size and clean. I would have given the hotel a higher rating if the front desk staff had been responsive. Despite calling and emailing before I arrived to confirm that a refrigerator would be in the room, I had to make 5 visits to the lobby to obtain that item and different pillows (both customary items per the hotel literature). Each time, I was told that the request would be filled immediately, but it was not. In addition, the wifi charge is exorbitant and the gym pass should be included in the price of the room.

review.title: The best concierge...ever. And great facility!
review.reviewText: Great stay at the Nikko...centrally located, and excellent facility. The best part, though, was Christopher, the concierge. He was extremely knowledgeable, a lovely person to speak with, and the best concierge we have ever met.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located.

review.title: 10 years ago my favorite
review.reviewText:
this was one of my favorite hotels 10 years ago.. and yes, in the last ten years nothing seems to have changed except the prices. Rooms on the Nikko floor (now the 20th is Nikko floor and the old Nikko floors are Imperial Floors (redecorated!) are old.. clean, but still aging and old.
Breakfast is good, but don´t get excited about the buffet, it´s everyday exactly the same, one would expect at least a bit of variattion, no?
Parking.. as mentioned by other reviewers is SF priced, although (by mistake and corrected afterwards) they charged me for 2 cars while only having one.
The starbucks downstairs is a positive point, free wifi. In general, not the best place to stay anymore in SF, redo the rooms, don´t make everything (wifi, gym, pool) paid but include it and it will be a great place. Staff is nice, helpful, willing to solve problems but it seems management only wants to make money.
review.positiveRemarks: staff friendly, showers and bathroom OK.
review.negativeRemarks: overcharged for what you get.
review.locationRemarks: very central in downtown SF, all within reach. Don´t walk to much south into the tenderloin at night.

review.title: Four day stay from Boulder, Colorado
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice. Fantastic location. The room was lovely - a bit dated, but large and clean. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Excellent overall.
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, very good service, exquisite restaurant, expensive but very well trained and helpful staff, clean and well equipped room. Somewhat surprised at the $20 charge for the fitness room.
review.negativeRemarks: Unanticipated charge for the fitness club; I decided not to use the gym.
review.locationRemarks: Very good location, close to the convention center, restaurants and shops.

review.title: Great Location, Great Hotel, very friendly staff!.
review.reviewText: My room was slightly smaller from what I expected, but was very clean and cozy. The location of this hotel is GREAT; I planned a weekend getaway for my boyfriend and I and it was our first time in San Francisco. We were able to walk to Chinatown, Transamerica Building, Coit Tower and cable car station. The zone has lot of shopping and it is safe, we had a great experience and enjoyed walking in the neighborhood. Food in the hotel is expensive and I knew this from other reviews BUT there is a Subway and a Starbucks just steps away from the lobby and many good restaurants nearby. It was well-worth every dollar.

review.title: Must stay!
review.reviewText: High end hotel in the heart of downtown SanFran - can't beat the views of the corner rooms!
review.positiveRemarks: High end in perfect downtown location w/ cable car views!
review.negativeRemarks: 11A checkout
review.locationRemarks: perfect - 1-2 blocks to anything you want to see

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Great location. Very helpful staff. Would not hesitate to rebook in the future.

review.title: Location Location Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location of the city with ease of access to many places.

review.title: Hotel Nikko - Needs updating!
review.reviewText:
I have stayed many times at the Nikko and enjoyed the experience. However, I think the hotel is beginning to look "tired" and needs some updating. My room was clean but tiny. The coffee pot was a "dribble" pot and made a mess when I tried to our a cup of coffee. There was only one pack of caffeinated coffee in my room instead of the usual two that we get at hotels. I was also upset that the hotel charged for internet access, even in the hotel lobby. Most hotels these days offer free internet to their guests.

I will be returning to San Franciso in the future but will try some other hotels the next time.
review.locationRemarks: The location is great being right downtown.

review.title: Good Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location and a friendly staff. Hot chocolate and cider in the lobby in the afternoons are a nice touch. A Starbucks on the first floor is very convenient for a caffeine fix. The Nikko has extremely fast elevator service. Never waited more than 15 seconds. Room was always cleaned thoroughly. However, petite queen room is extremely small.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location and a friendly staff. Room was always cleaned thoroughly. Hot chocolate and cider in the lobby in the afternoons are a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Petite queen room extremely small.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, within walking distance of restaurants, shops and public transportation.

review.title: Very positive experience
review.reviewText: Except for the parking expense ($50/day), the overall experience was excellent. Great location, enjoyable ambiance, and very good service.
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking
review.locationRemarks: Location is central to Market St and Nob Hill.

review.title: SF Fancy Food Show
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel but the rooms are quite small. Between INTERNET FEES and parking, it was $70 a day extra and those 2 things were a big drawback but as a hotel overall, it was quite good. Parking I understand but in 2012, internet? Really? C'mon, really????
review.negativeRemarks: Internet fees...Grrrrrrrrrrr
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Right in the heart of everything!

review.title: Awful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText:
I went to the Hotel for the Fancy Food Show and I heard that this hotel was great so I decided to stay.

Right when I got there, I was very disappointed by the parking rate. it was $49 + Tax.

I had a rental car for the 4 days I stayed in sanfransisco so I end up paying about $160.
I went in to check in and found because I only had a debit card, they told me the had to hold $100 each night, so they held $300 from my account. Very disappointing. Lastly, I went in to the hotel and there I saw what I thought was a complimentary water bottle, which retails only $1.50 at a market, they charged me $6 for the bottle.

The house keeping did not change the sheets, A pen mark I unintentionally made was there when I got back.....

So, If you ask me , My stay at the Nikko Hotel in San Fransisco was Dreadful.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. Thats the only thing I can compliment on.

review.title: Asian Fusion
review.reviewText: Very nice and classy hotel. Slept very well in lovely bedding. Enjoyed cocktails in the bar.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the convention center and to other nice hotel bars restuarants.

review.title: dirty
review.reviewText: good friendly service but out of date and dirty facility

review.title: Great location, good price
review.reviewText: I had a small room, but it was inexpensive for the location. The room was very clean and had everything I needed.

review.title: A Must Stay
review.reviewText: the room was spacious and the hotel has all the amenities you need: spa, restaurant, lounge/club, gym and pool. Excellent location, we were able to walk to all the beautiful San Francisco restaurants, bars, shopping and attractions. We are definitely planning another stay in the future
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: EXCELLENT!!

review.title: Exceptional.
review.reviewText: Very clean, great room and location and outstanding customer service.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent.

review.title: Enjoy SF
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, good location. We had a great time in SF, we didnt stay too much time in the hotel, but the time we spent in the room was confortable. We left our baggage for 3 days after our stay in the luggage room, because we traveled outside SF, unfortunately the hotel was full and i could not get a room for 3 more days.
review.negativeRemarks: No free wifi

review.title: Great Hotel!!!
review.reviewText: Wonderful Hotel. Right near Union Square. Safe, and Very Nice. Nicest Hotel I have ever stayed at.
review.negativeRemarks: No Drink or snack machines
review.locationRemarks: right near Union Square

review.title: Great staff and location
review.reviewText: A great place to stay for a first time visitor to San Francisco. Great location, nice, clean rooms, but most importantly, the staff was friendly AND helpful. Couldn't ask for more from a hotel.

review.title: Great Clean Modern Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very beautiful hotel, clean simple and modern look and feel....Very close to Union Square, only two blocks, very clean rooms updated and modern, on cable car route. We had a wonderful time there in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Location very close to Union Square and Cable Car and modern feel.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking very expensive and did not use our rental car at all.
review.locationRemarks: Location excellent; 2 blocks to Union Square; Taxi at hotel; cable cars outside hotel to Fisherman's Wharf; walked back to hotel from Chinatown

review.title: Good Hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: Good Hotel in great location for shopping, sightseeing, access to airport (via Bart).
review.negativeRemarks: charge for internet and for fitness center
review.locationRemarks: Close to Bart, Market Street, Shopping, etc.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
The hotel has an excellent location, a couple of blocks away from Union Square and the Trolly.
Staff was very nice. The room and the bathroom were spacious and except for the window shades, everything was in excellent conditions. The restaurant is a little bit dark but the breakfast buffet was good. I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Loved it!
review.reviewText: We go to San Francisco often to enjoy the city. This was our first time at this hotel. We loved it. It is new, sparkling clean, located conveniently 1 block from Powell cable car and 2 blocks from Union Square shopping. The rooms are in pristine shape, unusually spacious with great sound proofing and large functional bathrooms. The whole hotel has a green award and the heating, A/C is smooth and soundless. The staff is very helpful. A wonderful place to stay if you like fine places at reasonable cost. Also great for people with allergies or asthma.
review.negativeRemarks: parking charges (like the rest of San Francisco)
review.locationRemarks: great, if you love downtown

review.title: Weird
review.reviewText: Safe was not working and staff was making noises at the door around 11 pm and try to open the door.

review.title: Tiny, aging room
review.reviewText: The room is too tiny and quite misleading compared to Expedia posted photos. It is also aging. The only advantage is the convinence, it is so closed to the union square.

review.title: I had a great time...
review.reviewText: I would stay there again. Clean & nice hotel with a great location!!!!!
review.locationRemarks: good

review.title: Modern Eastern hotel in SF
review.reviewText:
My overall experience of the Nikko is very good. The room is small, but clean and in nice condition. The bathroom is in excellent condition. One of the best part of this hotel is its relatively big gym and indoor swimming pool with hot tub on the 5th floor. Very nice.

An area for improvement for the Nikko is that it can take a long time to get help from the service staff. My hypothesis is that either the Nikko under-staff its service staffs or its customers are asking way too many questions (as many are foreign). I would guess that it is the latter. Nonetheless, I had to wait quite a long time (>10 minutes) each time that I needed help including my check in and check out. Besides that, I totally enjoyed my stay here and would consider coming back.
review.positiveRemarks: The spacious and well equipped gym with indoor swimming pool and hot tub
review.negativeRemarks: The time it takes for the staff to help you
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq is a very nice and bustling area.Hotel is at the edge of Union Sq, guests can walk past a few not as nice streets. Overall, nice location!!!

review.title: Best Hotel in the center of SF
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is located near Union Square so there is no need to rent a car, everything is in a walking distance and in 2-5 min walk there is cable car station, Metro station, Buses etc. This hotel is excellent and we had very good time. Staff was very helpful and nice. Overall rate 5.

review.title: Christmas at San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The hotel provided hot chocolate and apple cider for 2 of the 6 days we were there. The location is very convenient since it was about a couple of blocks from union square. The bus line 38 dropped off us a block of the hotel which made traveling easy. The Starbucks at the street level of the hotel was a plus. The hotel was close to the cable cars, bus and subway lines so traveling using the Muni system was easy. Bought the Muni passport which allowed us to use the bus line, cable cars and muni subway line. Was a bargain since the cable car charges 6.00 per person. We got the 7 consecutive day passport for 27.00 each.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: It's a good hotel near Union Square. Stuff was very friendly. We got early check-in for free. Only minors were relative oldness of the hotel and jacuzi smelled as cloride lime.

review.title: WELCOME TO BANK OF AMERICA
review.reviewText: THIS IS NOT MY IDEA OF HOTEL, THIS HOTEL LOOKS LIKE BANK OF AMERICA ENTRANCE AND IS COLD NO COZZY AT ALL. ALSO DE DECOR IS BAD TASTE UGLY FURNITURE, NICE GYM THOUGH, POOL OK, GREAT LOCATION, ROOMS ARE CLEAN, BEDS ARE FINE SMALL ROOMS. I WON'T GET BACK MY FACIAL CREAM WAS TAKEN FROM MY ROOM
review.negativeRemarks: DECO
review.locationRemarks: GREAT IS IN UNION SQUARE

review.title: Appalling customer service at check-out
review.reviewText: All was fine until check-out. The hotel tried to overcharge us grossly for minibar and phone calls and did not handle our valid objections to this very well. Two local calls to the car hire company around the corner were charged at over $30. First they said this was normal! Then that there was a mistake with their system. Then something different. very badly handled. had to get very angry to get anything approaching an apology and agreement to drop the charges. Elementary hotel management failure. Ruined my impression of what seemed a decent hotel,

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Great Location. Friendly staff. Rooms nice but small.

review.title: Clean, Comfortable, Convenient.
review.reviewText: The hotel room was clean and comfortable to come back to after a long day of sightseeing. The location is super convenient. No hesitation to recommend to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is the ultimate plus for this hotel.

review.title: Hotel Nikko at Christmas
review.reviewText: I would like the hotel to work with other hotels to have a shuttle from the airport. It was very nice that the hotel offered hot cider and hot chocolate from 3-5pm.
review.negativeRemarks: the extra costs
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Great hotel in a prime location.
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the services in this hotel. The staff at check-in, in the dining areas and the cleaning staff were all friendly, courteous and helpful. Of particluar note, the concierge, Christopher, was top notch. We stayed in a deluxe room which was spacious and well-appointed. The fitness facilities, including pool, were more than adequate. The only disappointing factor was Wi-Fi use in rooms incurred a charge as did the use of the fitness facilities. However we were able to upgrade at small cost to include both these. Hotel Nikko is a JAL hotel and it certainly reflects high standards we have encountered in Japan. We would definitely stay here again
review.locationRemarks: In Union Square so close to major shopping venues and many tourist attractions easily accessible

review.title: Super Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was just gorgeous. The rooms and bathroom were modern, clean and had great amenities. The hotel gym was one of the nicest of any I've seen and the sauna and pool were very nice. The hotel was just off Union Square and was very easy to get to and had tons of great stuff around it. I would absolutely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

review.title: Matthew
review.reviewText:
Front of house were rude, arrogant and LACEKED ANY professional and communiaction skils. Most conversations turned into an argument, where has the customer is aleats right gone to?? They made you pay for the gym, ON TOP of what you already paid to stay in the actual hotel - i don't know about you but i have never had to pay for a gym on top of what i have already paidfor the hotel? The rooms were small, no bed side lighting, so getting up in the middle of the night proved very difficult and poor cleaning of the room.

Would never stay there again! Rubbish....

review.title: Great hotel - inc for families - expensive
review.reviewText:
Indoor pool was a highlight for my kids!
Will go back when staying in SF.

review.title: need to be better
review.reviewText: The hotel locates in convenient place. However, the service need to be better.

review.title: yass
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, great location

review.title: I've seen closets bigger than my room.
review.reviewText:
Tiny little box of a room. Poor room layout.
Snowy reception on some channels. Electrician told me it's a building wide issue No HDTV.
Paint is chipped away on elevator doors.
Gym is big, but they charge $10 a stay to use it.
Wifi is $15 a day but you can get wifi at the Starbucks in the building.
Overall, the place is a bit dated and overpriced.

review.title: great stay!!!
review.reviewText: Hotel was beautiful and convenient. Two block from BART, cable cars, and munis. Restaurant was a bit pricey but there were surrounding eats nearby.....Lori's Diner, Starbucks nextdoor. Room was large, 2 double beds, separate shower and large tub! Vanity, hallway, and large double closet. Complimentary essentials were nice. Take the BART from SFO and get off at Powell St station. The Visitor's Center is at the stop. Buy multiple day passes for Muni/Cable Cars to save money. We bought unlimited transportation pass (not BART) for 9 days with entrance into 5 museums for only $69 pp. Cable car stop is at O'Farrell or two block down to the end at Powell. Walgreens around the corner if you need essentials. Great location and friendly, professional service at Hotel Nikko. Will stay there again!!!!

review.title: Excellent staff and clean room are reasons I will go back.
review.reviewText: The staff were very nice. The room was clean and the color of the room made me feel relax. I had my breakfast at the hotel. Although the selection was a little bit limited, the quality of food was good.

review.title: Extremely pleased
review.reviewText: I felt very satisfied with this hotel. Stayed in the imperial section (top 3 floors). Nice hifi in room, great fitness center, friendly staff and amazing breakfast.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Room is very clean and cozy. I love it !

review.title: good Night
review.reviewText: Great place to stay, room was nice, excellent location in downtown, parking cost high,

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, functional, nice room, good restaurants nearby. No need for anything more.

review.title: Mrs. Felton
review.reviewText: It was a spectacular stay. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the location of the hotel is just great your in walking distance to great restaurants, shopping stores and everything you can think off. I highly recommend this hotel I promise you the trip will be worth while weather for business or personal.

review.title: Beautiful hotel with amazing lounge and bar!!!
review.reviewText: I loved the Hotel Nikko it was so beautiful and everyone who worked there was so friendly and hospitable. I would love to go back to San Francisco and I would definitely stay at the Hotel Nikko again!!
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Nikko Hotel SFO
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, well located

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel; great service from staff. Super comfy beds and spacious room. Only downside was costly in-room WiFi, but was able to use Starbucks in the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - easy access to anywhere in the city and all amenities

review.title: Great hotel BUT ...
review.reviewText: We found some good value diners just within a short walk of this hotel. The location is absolutely great and our room was lovely and very comfortable. Only disappointing issue was that, although I had prepaid for our stay, when I was checking in they asked to record my credit card in case I ran off without paying for incidentals and, when I produced the debit card I'd used to pre-pay, they advised they would be taking $300 dollars out of my account as security and this would not be paid back for a couple of weeks! My husband proffered his credit card instead, which attracted no such piracy. This did not exactly make us feel like guests.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText:
This is my third time to stay at the Nikko, and it was great, perfect just like before.

Rooms are very comfortable and cozy, and the location can't be beat...great places to eat very close by not to mention Union Square just down the street.

Ideal hotel for San Francisco trips.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, has just about everything (eating, shopping, public transport stations etc.).

review.title: Friendly staff
review.reviewText: Great location, and very friendly staff at all levels

review.title: Gets better over the years
review.reviewText: We've stayed at Hotel Nikko multiple times over the years and have seen nice renovation improvements. We return for its location convenience, cleanliness, and indoor heated pool for the kids. One experience really shined during this stay. We had more interactions with various hotel staff this time around and found each staff member to be very pleasant, very helpful, very professional.

review.title: Perfect SF spot
review.reviewText: Always a pleasure to stay at Hotel Nikko. This was the first time in years the service felt a little off but overall still a great place to stay in SF.

review.title: We will not hesitate to go back
review.reviewText:
Our first time in S.F.
The staff helped us with everything and were happy to do so without being 'in your face'
We were offered an upgrade which included breakfast and regretted not accepting it.
Location was perfect for our needs. Great selection of restaurants and attractions within walking distance. We actually walked back from Fisherman's Wharf one afternoon. (tough but do-able).
We will return.

review.title: Hotel Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel located in a very good location. This hotel is located very close to the cable cars, shopping, restaurants, and the BART which makes it very easy to commute between the airport and hotel.

review.title: great vacation hotel
review.reviewText: great location. very nice hotel within a perfect vacation city! not a boutique hotel. fun bars and great food within walking distance. not far from the bart or the cable cars. friendly staff and a starbucks on site. the only thing missing was the bar of soap for the bathroom; minor oversite i'm sure.

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was a great hotel. The hotel workers met our needs every time we had a questions. The concierge were so helpful with information to your questions. The hotel is definitely the right location to be, right in the center of everthing.

review.title: Hotel Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText:
Very nice hotel but disappointed with Expedia description.
Be careful with the mini bar, if you remove something you are automatically charged. They have put some sitwch under the bottle really tricky !

review.title: Lots of plusses
review.reviewText: Overall, we were satisfied. The location was fine and the hotel good, but the room just did not have enough space - petite is a word that will warn us in the future. Overpriced for the space furnished...

review.title: SF traveler
review.reviewText:
Our recent stay at Nikko SF started out very badly: we had booked a room with a King size bed through Expedia, but upon arrival the front desk gave us keys to a room with a petite Queen bed, and said nothing about it!! (hoping, I suppose that we can't tell the difference?!?!).
Back down we go to the front desk and complain. They tell us they don't have any King bed room available. We then ask for a partial refund, which they refuse, offering things we don't want in return, like access to the Spa, or the swimming pool, when we haven't packed any clothes for any of this.
They only grudgingly agreed to move us to a King room the next day, but we had to waste all of our morning in the city for this to happen.

What the problem is, is not so much the unavailability of a King size bed in the room (although, knowing that in advance I would have picked another hotel for our stay). These things can happen - so, just be upfront about it, and offer some remedy that makes sense. The problem is they said nothing about it, hoping we would not care or complain. When we did, they handled it in a bad way. I'm not going to stay there again.

There is plenty of choices in the city, and they should be aware of that.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great city dont let to tale a breakfast at sears

review.title: Extremely impressed
review.reviewText: The best hotel stay we've had in San Francisco

review.title: Hotel Nikko is Very Nice but WiFi Sucks!
review.reviewText: I highly recommend Hotel Nikko, the rooms are very nice, it's close to everything in the Union Square area. The service is great. The one thing that made our stay a bit frustrated is their WiFi (in room & in the Lounge) is Very Weak! You'll have to pay WiFi for $15.95 PER machine....means per Mobile Phone, per LapTop, per iPhone, per iPad, etc.... EXPENSIVE!!! Unless you stay in their much more expensive suites, WiFi is Free!!! The signal for their WiFi is consistently Week, my iphone kept cutting off & takes forever to download etc... I spoke with the receptionist & she B.S. me that the Hotel CANNOT connect the WiFi so that we can pay ONE fee for all our systems!!! REALLY!!!???!!! Otherwise, it's a Very Nice Hotel to stay!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText:
I booked a NIkko level room through Expedia and when I checked in I was told there were no Nikko level rooms available. Instead of immediately stating that one might be available the next day, the front desk attendant attempted to convice to stay the week in a smaller room. Later an older gentleman working the front desk was outright rude ignoring as I waited seven minutes to be acknowledged to ask a question. I requested of four different people at least six times for the items in the automated minibar to be removed which was never done.
