The Internet reception in my room was poor and after speaking with the provider, a bridge was sent up to my room. I had never used a bridge before. It was delivered but no one explained how to set it up and use it until I called for additional assistance.

Housekeeping needed daily reminding about my request for extra towels and kept turning off the air conditioner in my room (it was an unusually warm week for SF)

Generally the rooms are in dire need of repair - wallpaper is peeling off the walls and the finish on top of the bureau was peeling.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed staying at the hotel. It is close to the cable car, stores, restaurants. My husband had the best sushi ever at the restaurant. Nice pool and work out room. The room was a bit small, we got the petite queen, so the size was expected. In the next few years they'll need to redo some carpeting, but for the money a solid 4 rating.

review.title: Great Location & Extremely Clean!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is in a great area of San Fran, walking distance to Union Square and many restaurants and bars. The staff are friendly and the rooms are clean and tidy. Definitely a good choice!

review.title: Worth your money $$$
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and convenient location. It's a little pricey but compare to quality so it's worth for it. I would come back if I have a trip to SFO again.

review.title: Friendly and Simple
review.reviewText:
Hotel Nikko is a simple but stytlish hotel. There are TV sets in the walls all over the hotel which keeps you in touch with the news. The rooms are well equiped, clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet was good, with a Japanese twist.
Location is central to the shops and cable cars. But there are a few roads a few block behind the hotel, that must be avoided. It is a great hotel and would highly recommend it.

review.title: Great location!!!
review.reviewText: We loved staying at this hotel; it was convenient to EVERYTHING. The staff was excellent and very helpful. The only thing was that the maid left a dirty rag in our room and didn't hang up the towels one day.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We recently visited San Francisco and chose Hotel Nikko due to its location. Overall, we were very impressed with the hotel. Although the rooms are older, they were clean and comfortable. The hotel is also within very close walking distance to Union Square. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Good choice in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfectly located for my needs. It was right in the heart of Union Square's shopping area, within walking distance of the major department stores and close to public transportation. The staff was helpful and courteous. Unexpectedly received turn-down service - very nice! the room was well appointed and decorated. My only negative comment would be an upgrade could be used in the shower area of the bathroom. The rainfall shower head was very high and could not be repositioned, which meant had to stand right in front of the tap to get wet.

review.title: Location! Location!
review.reviewText:
This hotel's the best selling point is the location. Close to everything - shops, restaurants and public transportation including BART and Cable Car line.
My 8 year old daughter loved the indoor swimming pool and gym.
Somewhat family friendly.
Would I stay here again? Most definitely!!

review.title: Central San Francisco hotel
review.reviewText: This is a very nice hotel central to Union Square shops and public transport. The famous cable car, train and buses are all within 5 min walk. Room was clean and roomy enough if you are out all day sight seeing. No fridge in basic rooms. Concierge was always helpful even doing our online flight check-in for us. Neighborhood one block over is "unsafe" at night but we never had any trouble. Easy to catch the train to/from airport....saves you $45 compared to taxi.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: the only thing was the room smell a cigarrete

review.title: Nice hotel and good location.
review.reviewText: Hotel was very comfortable and service was good.

review.title: one of my top hotels to stay in SF
review.reviewText: Great hotel, clean and great service. We have stayed there on several occasions and never had a complaint. Also, great location if you want to be in the center of the city and near all the shopping.

review.title: Excellent location!
review.reviewText: The hotel couldn't have been better located, it was only a short walk from Union Square. There were plenty of cafe's, restaurants and coffee bars close to the hotel. The public transport made it very easy to get around the city and .The room was very nice, but the large furniture made the room feel small. The pool was a little bit of a disappointment, it was too shallow. The jacuzzi was lovely and warm but again too shallow (3ft).

review.title: Best hotel for short visit to SF
review.reviewText: Clean and confortable hotel, the service is excellent.

review.title: nice location
review.reviewText: It is a nice hotel. Close to the BART station, very convenient when you come from the airport. Too bad that the internet connexion and the pool access are not included in the price.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Great hotel at a very convenient location, can't wait to go back!!!! Teenagers travelled with us are very impressive about this hotel.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: We were thrilled to be upgraded to a city view room on arrival, the views were stunning! Hotel was lovely and staff were so helpful as it was our first trip to San francisco. Only criticism is the cost of parking but there are garages very nearby (2-3 mins walking) for half the price. We had a great stay!

review.title: Would definetly go back
review.reviewText: Great service great location and excellent amenities.

review.title: Good hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: The room was small but the location and service were great. There was a small problem with bag delivery on check-in that had me riled but it was solved with many apologies--both written and verbal and a complimentary fruit plate. Pool was nice--a little small and hot tub was not a really nice one. But if those are the 'negatives' then that is pretty good.

review.title: Trip tp San Francisco
review.reviewText:
You do not need or want a car. The traffic is CRAZY and the hotel wants $55 per day to park a car. That is higher than the price of renting the car.

The hotel is beautiful. The concierge(s) were great.

The gym is extra, which I didn't expect, but it is a great gym.

A petite queen, means that the room is petite not the bed.

All in all, a great vacation.

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText:
Really nice lobby, but rooms are very small and utalitarian
Service was VERY good though

review.title: Great San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I just spent 4 nights at the Hotel Nikko and it will be our hotel of choice from now on. Great location that's convenient to public transportation and a huge choice of places to dine. Large, quiet, comfortable rooms, a friendly, helpful staff and beautiful views from our 20th floor room made this a great place to stay. There's even a Starbuck's on the first floor.

review.title: Excellant!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Nikko for 6 nights. The hotel is in a excellent location...tourist sites or access to cable cars, buses was all within walking distance. We felt very safe walking back and forth to the hotel. I am very picky about hotel cleanliness and was happy that Nikko met my high standards. Our room was on the 18th floor and was quiet..

review.title: It is ok
review.reviewText: It is an ok hotel, very nice interior and rooms but it is primarily aimed at business travellers rather than tourists. We had a lovely time however it is difficult to get to in the downtown maze of one way streets and the parking charge of 45 dollars a day was a killer!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location for shopping, restaurants and public transportation to other attractions. The rooms are spacious with good views, except the windows are very dirty. The mini bar is automated, so you may get charged if you move stuff around. A lot of the staff are japanese. Access to the pool is an extra charge. All in all, a good choice.

review.title: Family Vacation
review.reviewText:
Stayed at the hotel for the first time as part of a family vacation. Comfortable, quiet. The only negative about the room is that the carper was a bit worn and took away from the luxury of the room.

Hotel was close to the cable cars and in a key location to get out to various parts of the city without much headache. Has a Enterprise car rental on site.
Next trip would not pay the $55/night parking fee and would simply rent car on days that I needed it.

review.title: Sleek & chic
review.reviewText: We loved it! a well run hotel with great staff, lovely big rooms and great for a central location. One complaint no free wifi - should be standard everywhere. they also charge to use the pool and spa.

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText: Hotel was adequate, but when I called to have them retrieve a forgotten item in the room I was told they could not find it.

review.title: Another Great Stay
review.reviewText: This is about the 5th time I have stayed at the Hotel Nikko. The location is great, the hotel is clean and the staff is very helpful. The front desk personnel sometimes seem to be aloof but I have never had a bad experience there which is why I keep going back.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and conveniently located near Union Square. The rooms do not have a refrigerator but we asked for one and it was brought to our room very quickly. I would stay here again.

review.title: Modern, Sweet and Well Managed
review.reviewText: No complaints, in fact it was a lovely hotel in every way!

review.title: great location, nice hotel
review.reviewText: worth the money for location (very close to cable car, BART and light rail). "petite" room is small but fine for a single or couple. plenty of nearby restaurants, but be careful as neighborhood gets rough just 1.5 blocks away. Great housekeeping. pool/jacuzzi is okay, nice gym for only $10/stay.

review.title: recommened^ ^
review.reviewText: i was satisfied with that hotel^ ^

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Very convenient location to Union Square. Close to shopping, eateries, Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf. Hotel restaurant was very good and hotel staff very professional and accomodating. Even was able to get an early check in time. Would definitely stay at this hotel when in San Francisco next time.

review.title: San Francisco Without the Kids
review.reviewText: My husband and I were impressed with the Hotel Nikko. It is beautiful! From the hotel staff to the people of San Francisco, all were warm and friendly. We now understand why people head to California with the intention of visiting, and end up returning as residents!

review.title: Great place to stay in SFO
review.reviewText: Staff was polite and professional. Location was great - it was close to all the shops at Union Square. Also close to mass transit, giving us easy access to get to shops and restaurants on Embarcadero and Pier 39 at Fisherman's Wharf. The only thing that I would consider is the price of the valet parking at the hotel - it was almost like paying for a full tank of gas every day!

review.title: Great size room for its location!
review.reviewText: We've stayed at several other hotels around Union Square, and by far Hotel Nikko has the most spacious room. We are accustomed to hotel rooms with limited space in this area, so hotel Nikko really excelled especially if you are travelling with little kid(s). The bathroom is very spacious as well. They also provided us with a complimentary refrigerator although the refrigerator seemed to feel not as cold as one should be. The room's decoration is pretty lame, but it is clean and spacious. Overall, We will go back and stay at hotel Nikko again.

review.title: Hotel Nikko is a great Union Square hotel.
review.reviewText:
We booked Hotel Nikko because we were looking for a 4 star hotel in Union Square San Francisco. This hotel was in a great location, had excellent reviews and Expedia was offering a very good deal for the nights we needed. We weren’t disappointed!!! It was in a great location. The service was excellent. The rooms were beautifully decorated and spotless. The bathroom was huge and had very beautiful fixtures. The elevators were extremely fast. The Starbucks in the hotel was open extended hours and had free wifi. We thought we were going to use the spa and fitness centre but unfortunately ran out of time. There was a $10 cost to have access but I would have paid that if time permitted.

The minibar was full of items to purchase and if you pulled anything out of it you were automatically billed for the item. We were not tempted at those prices but I would be worried if I would have had small children with me. We wanted to chill some beverages so the hotel actually wheeled a little fridge into our room for us to use.

If I could make a suggestion to the Hotel Nikko it would be to offer free internet in their business centre. It was $8 for 15 minutes and all I wanted to do was book my airline tickets. I cannot penalize the hotel for such a small issue as it truly was an excellent hotel.

Overall we were extremely pleased with the Hotel Nikko and would definately stay there again.

review.title: SF hotel
review.reviewText: We always check the price on the Nikko first when headed for San Francisco. Great location and service. Easy access to the freeways and Union Square.

review.title: Very pleasant stay
review.reviewText: I stayed in the Nikko during my recent trip to a conference held at Moscone West. The hotel was easy to find, the staff professional, the entire facility was immaculately clean. My only gripe was the charge for in-room Wi-Fi, although both my AT&T iPhone and iPad had no issue using it for free, only my laptop couldn't. That gripe aside, I have nothing bad to say about my stay. I expect I'll be back again next year.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: great hotel. Everything is expensive, very high rate for parking, charges you to use fitness room, internet, etc. Good access to all areas of SF but also very close to a very umpleasant area. Beautiful room and bathroom

review.title: "Not impressed"
review.reviewText: It was nothing to boost about. Pretty overpriced and very overrated. The bed wasn't comfortable as I hoped. I believe when staying at a "luxury" hotel, the bed better be amazing. That's why I choose more of a higher end hotel and unfortunately... disappointing. Yes, the staff was friendly and it was in a great location. So, if you're looking for somewhere in a great location and not spending a lot of time in the room but want to spend a pretty penny... Absolutely

review.title: Great Hotel, Poor Neighborhood.
review.reviewText: Booked Petite Queen for five days in early June 2011. Staff was pleasant and efficient. Room was very good with large TV, bed, and a reasonable amount of outdoor noise. Requested a mini-fridge, which was delivered promptly but did not work. Pool and gym was well-maintained, but cost an additional $10 for entire hotel stay. Business center also cost an additional $10. Biggest problem was the surrounding neighborhood, full of homeless and panhandlers. Went to Starbucks within the building (very convenient) only to have homeless people stand outside the store and beg for money, or do the very same thing inside the Starbucks (!!). Hotel Nikko Doorman also were often absent and often one panhandler was waiting until you walked out the door. Hotel Nikko is excellent otherwise.

review.title: Friendly hotel
review.reviewText: Everything about the hotel was great - accessibility, friendly environment, and close to everything in downtown. However, my gf and I experienced an odd moment. Some how in the middle of the night the lamp by the window just turned on, like a big super flash, and turned off by itself. The flashing of the light lasted for a second and a half. We were freaked out. THIS was a weird. I called back to the hotel to find out if they could control the lights. BUT no one returned my call. I would appreciated if they could call me and find out or explain what they have found.

review.title: Good location and neat room but poor service
review.reviewText:
The location of the hotel was really convenient which we loved it very much. The room was neat and clean. We loved about the bath room which has both a shower room and a bath tab. We would guess that such bath rooms are for Japanese guests who tend to love bathing in bath tabs.

However, we did not particularly like the attitude of the front person who took care of our check-in. The person was simply not as polite as the normal front personnel of such kind of hotel should be. In addition, We did not have a crib for our baby in our room when we checked in even though we requested it at the time of making the reservation.

Aside of those service issues, we were basically satisfied by the hotel overall.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel. Great room and facilities. Good size bathroom, bed, etc. Good view, good location (close to shops, cable car, etc..) decent gym. Would return to this hotel.

review.title: Would stay there if i went back
review.reviewText: it was nice and clean, very friendly staff, close and convenient to everything.

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko in San Francisco is not as clean as other Nikko Hotels we have stayed in. Otherwise it is a decent place to stay in an intense downtown environment. The staff were efficient and helpful.

review.title: Yelena E.
review.reviewText: If you have a very comfy vacation budget, and shopping at Barney's is number one on your to-do list - definitely stay at this hotel. However, be prepared to pay $45/day for valet-parking your car (plus tips, of course). You may also want to bring your own bottle of watter from the little deli on the corner. The one provided in your room will cost you $6. The rooms are nice and comfy. Ours had a very nice view of the city and even a little piece of the Golden Gate Bridge. But keep in mind that the City looks a lot nicer at night from the 18th-floor window. Shall you venture out in the street of this neighborhood - all kinds of people, smells and sounds will accost you. So, figure out if you really need to stay downtown and if you really need that car (the famous trolley is just a block or two away), or if living withing 2 blocks of the country's second largest Macy's is critical. If not - rent something nice and affordable near the airport. Otherwise - enjoy and be prepared to pay for it!

review.title: Clean, fresh and quiet
review.reviewText:
I've stayed in a few places in the Union Square area for business trips. This hotel was clean, comparatively safe, did not suffer from any musty odors or tobacco smells, and is situated conveniently for several dining and shopping options, as well as for businesses located on Market St.

My biggest complaint is that this hotel - as with so many in downtown SF - charges for internet WiFi. In this case they outsource to AT&T, but it's frustrating nevertheless.

Service is reactive, not pro-active, which is a minus for what is otherwise a very comfortable place to stay.

review.title: Convenient Conference Location
review.reviewText:
Hotel was convenient to my conference location at a decent price but the cell phone reception in my room, lobby, outside of hotel was poor and sporadic.
I was given the option to change rooms or just use the hotel phone which cost me a bundle for 5 minutes!
Internet connection did not work, had to bring laptop downstairs and the hook took several tries before I got service (at a premium price since I wasn't in one of the deluxe rooms with free internet service).
Aside from those 2 issues, the hotel was clean, close to the conference site, and close to everything in the Union square district.

review.title: Union Square San Francisco
review.reviewText: Right by Union Square, easy access to public transportation, very nice, clean hotel. Would stay there again. Plenty to do with kids in city, but not much in immediate area around hotel. SF city pass is a great deal, tickets to multiple places, plus unlimited public transportation including trolleys.

review.title: Perfect Spot in Union Sq
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Great hotel with friendly service.

review.title: Very nice... I stay here each time I can
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice. I stay here almost every time I come to San Francisco. It is clean, moderately priced, and very convenient to the convention center and to Union Square.

review.title: Our third visit and it's a "Honeymoon" every time!
review.reviewText: This was our thrid visit to San Francisco and we have always called the Hotel Nikko "our place"! Staying here always provides us with that "Honeymoon" experience. The Hotel Nikko offers the very best location; the staff is the greatest; and it's become a part of our San Francisco experience! We love visting San Francisco and the GIANTS! And we love, love, love the Hotel Nikko!

review.title: Nice hotel and value for money
review.reviewText: We stayed for 8 nights in a Petite Queen Room in the hotel, and asked for an upgrade room on our first day with no joy (they wanted extra payment for upgrade which we declined). I gave the chambermaid a decent tip on our first morning and it was money well spent -- we were then given 2 bathrobes and a mini fridge without asking. The room size is spacious enough for the 2 of us, clean and has air conditioning. Internet access is subject to extra charge per day but you can use the Starbucks on the ground floor and get free internet. Extra charge for gym & heated indoor swimming pool but well worth paying the fees. Pool is not well used, small but clean & warm, so you don't have to worry about bumping into other swimmers . A jaccuzi as well as sauna & steam room. The hotel bar is also reasonably priced, unlike some other hotels which charge a lot. We did not eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food there. All in all, a very nice hotel and we would not mind staying there again.

review.title: The best choice
review.reviewText:
Next time I go back to SF I will stay at Nikko Hotel, very good location, two blocks from cable car main station, two blocks from BART Powell Station, Civic Centrer, Downtown, Market Street, etc....
If you are driving, you can park in front of hotel, there is a parking lot for less than a half of the fare.
Very nice hotel, very clean, good price for the room.
Recommended!!

review.title: Impeccable
review.reviewText: Excellent room, amazing staff...just wonderful.

review.title: I go to San Francisco frequently but this past four night visit was my first to the Nikko.
review.reviewText: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed this four night trip to San Francisco. The only thing that we would change is to have requested a much firmer mattress, both of us appreciate a firmer surface. Since I have been making trips to San Francisco at least four or five times a year, I have stayed at a good number of the better hotels but the Nikko was at least the equal of any of them. Total recommendation from both of us.

review.title: very satisfactory all round
review.reviewText: My answers above are my review

review.title: bad experience
review.reviewText: small room,torn carpet,tv din't work properly,when I asked to be moved because of the poor conditions of my room ,the response was an "upgrade' for $ 80.00 dollars per day !! finally after three requests I was moved to a different room,poor customer service from the front desk (female clerck,male manager)...NOT A FIRST CLASS HOTEL period.

review.title: This was a fail, not the retreat advertised.
review.reviewText:
it was hard to find the building, almost drove past it on Mason street twice. Parking was the most expensive of the area, but there were plenty of staff around to help you get in and out of your car, retrieve your car etc. You have to pay for internet access and it was very costly. THe bottom line is there are other chains that offer so much more for less. The appeareance is the luxe with Asian flair that will pamper you and sooth you, well it falls short and is more like a lower price point off brand hotel. The bathroom sink would not drain and a call was place before 7 am to fix it or help me out in some way. At 7:30 and two additional calls to say they were "coming right away, right now to fix it" no show. So I had to cancel a breakfast meeting and brush my teeth and clean my face out of the tub :(
They sent me a free buffet coupon and a note saying they were sorry. The immediate aea was sketchy but a short distance from Union Square area. It was ok but not the city retreat I had hoped. The saving element was the daytime concierge Ernesto, who directed me tot he best hidden Tea House for a late tea/lunch by the Yerba Buena park.

review.title: Katie
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I had an amazing stay at hotel Nikk. The location is ideal we walked to AT&T park! The room was so nice! And the room service was delicious! We can't wait to come back!

review.title: Aesthetic Asian Hotel
review.reviewText:
Hotel is beautiful; pool was out of service most of the stay. Great service.
Great restaurant.

Location is on the edge of the Tenderloin with lots of homeless begging for
money and food each time I walked out the door. Homeless are especially
aggressive at night at this location. If you are freaked out by druggies,
prostitutes and homeless, this probably is not the location for you.

review.title: Comfortable and Convenient Shopping
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and in a great location. Surprise charges for internet and gym, but overall nice location and facility.

review.title: Very nice hotel in San Francisco. Wonderful location.
review.reviewText: I liked very much the hotell, it is new, well located, the room and bathroom are very nice and clean. The service is very nice too.

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfectly situated for our needs and meant easy walking access to anywhere we wanted to go (MOMA, Moscone Centre, Union Square, cable car start at Powell St to go to Fisherman's Wharf). The hotel itself was excellent and I would recommend it to anyone. The hotel restaurant was very good and there were plenty of other restaurants/cafes of good quality just 5 minutes' walk away. Had a really good stay in SF.

review.title: Hotel Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, an very convenient.

review.title: Great for travel with Young Children
review.reviewText:
This was our first time staying in a hotel with the 2 kids: a 2.5 yr old and a 1 yr old.

We called in advance for a room with 2 cribs - got a double queen room and the cribs were set up all ready. They told us over the phone that there was going to be plenty of room and though skeptical, they were totally right.

The room was very comfortable with plenty of room considering that it was a room in the heart of Union Square in SF - no it's not like a room at the Embassy Suites in the middle of nowhere, but it's certainly comfortable. The bathroom was huge.

It was close to the shopping on Market and more importantly for my son, the Market/Powell cablecar turnabout that started at 6:30am (we were jetlagged from NYC).

The pool was closed for renovations, but we didn't plan to use it. We didn't really utilize the hotel services, but everything appeared to be consistent with a nice hotel. $45/night for parking, but with in-and-out privileges.

Definitely would recommend this place for traveling with young children.

review.title: Loved Nikko.
review.reviewText: We usually say at small boutique hotels in SF, but stayed at the larger Nikko and were very pleased throughout our stay. The staff was exquisitely polite, and prompt with every request (a fan, a fridge, make up room late one evening) and the guy manning the continental breakfast room on the 23rd floor was super nice and thoughtful. Didn't miss any of the boutique design touches either--Nikko had it all, including a large luxurious bathroom. In contrast, at two nearby boutique hotels, also this year, we encountered a few staff and room issues--nothing serious, but things were smooth at Nikko. Up the hill the neighborhood gets more posh, but lots of nice restaurants nearby for various tastes, and we felt safe late at night.

review.title: Room too small and noisy
review.reviewText: Room too small and noisy

review.title: Probably not go back... but not bad
review.reviewText:
When we checked in, to my surprise we were told that we have to pay for EVERYTHING extra. THis took me by surprise. Not a good surprise. For example: if you want to use the spa or the fitness room, you are charged $10. If you would like wireless internet, that was also an additional fee. I would think that when paying a high fee for a nice hotel that these ammenties would be included.
But other then that draw back. it was a nice place to stay and it was walking distance from BART and Union Square.

review.title: All around enjoyable
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko was everything I expected and more. My husband and I both had the a really good rest in the perfect bed. The room temperature was also perfect. We'll be back soon.

review.title: Nikko Hotel
review.reviewText: The location was very convenient. It was only a short walk to Chinatown, Union Square and the Trolley station. Althought parking our rented car there was quite expensive ($50 a night), we kind of figured that it was a normal price for all the hotels in SF. all the furniture and bathroom was updated and modern in our room. It was clean and tidy.

review.title: Would definitely return.
review.reviewText: Lovely, elegant and comfortable hotel. Room was large and attractive. The staff was pleasant and friendly - especially the doorman. Would definitely return - nice central location with accessibility to BART, streetcars, buses etc.

review.title: Philip
review.reviewText: The only problem is that I wish the hotel was a part of OR even had their own "travel reward" program....I would then stay there more ofter as I really like the hotel!

review.title: High price, low quality - go with Parc 55 instead
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was overpriced, service was marginal at best - it took over 45min & a phone call to get bags from car to room. Parking was overpriced & not readily displayed on hotel details/fees, television was overpriced as well - everything you touch in the place requires an extra fee! Next time, I will go back to the Parc 55, just two blocks away.

review.title: Comfortable and classy
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel for the comfort and cleanliness of the room, the great location, and the reasonable price. The health club facilities are a nice plus.

review.title: Everything about this hotel made our visit pleasant.
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko clearly understands how to make the hotel stay an excellent experience. Service was competent and friendly, the amenities was what we needed, fitness center was well-maintained and the hotel location was extremely convenient.

review.title: Will Go Back
review.reviewText: Pleasant and clean hotel. Ideally located. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Original room was very small and not what I expected as I had reserved a Deluxe King. They changed my rooms to a larger room and it was a wonderful stay.

review.title: Can't wait to go back. If I am in San Francisco, I'll stay here.
review.reviewText: Location, location, location. Walk to/from Bart in the middle of the city. Everything nearby: great restaurants, shopping, museums, concert halls, business meetings.

review.title: The best in Union Square
review.reviewText: Fantastic location. Steps away from all major shopping attractions. The hotel itself is a nice sanctuary from the chaos of Union Square. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and the American/Japanese Breakfast Buffet amazing. Great, pool & spa area too. Well worth the $10 charge which is good for your entire stay.

review.title: Nikko sets the standard in affordable luxury.
review.reviewText: Nikko Hotel truly understands customer service and satisfaction. They are a first-rate hotel.

review.title: so so
review.reviewText: Very dissapointed to be charged an exhorbitant internet 'access fee' at a higher end hotel

review.title: Love The Nikko- met my Expectations
review.reviewText: The sheets were comfortable, everything was very clean. Little details were noticed but not enough to tarnish my stay...Wrinkled curtains, and dusty vent in the bathroom. But the service was top notched and professional. The Sunday Brunch was enjoyable and extensive. And I would definitely go back again.

review.title: My choice of hotels to stay in in San Francisco
review.reviewText: See above ratings

review.title: Clean and Tight
review.reviewText: Despite a very small room at Hotel Nikko, the space was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the room had the feel of a nicer hotel. The location was great, as it was near the BART which we used, and near many restaurants and bars. I would consider returning to Hotel Nikko and recommend the hotel to friends and family.

review.title: Early Arrival
review.reviewText: Please see above.We liked this hotel very much.

review.title: Great place to visit
review.reviewText:
Room was small, the use of the wifi was expensive so we went to the Starbucks downstairs for no charge. The hotell was convenient to everything.
Also the hotel was clean and the people were courteous.

review.title: San Francisco Marathon & Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: Arrived on Friday around 1:30 and checked in without any issues. Front desk very friendly. Room was very nice and fairly roomy according to SF standards. Had 2 queen beds that were super comfy with great quality linens. Nice bathroom with a large counter. We were in San Fran for the Nike Women's Marathon and had requested a fridge for drinks be in room on arrival and it was. Nighttime is quite noisy but that's SanFran, not sure how you would get around that staying right in the city. Hotel located acrossed the street had employees picketing and that started first thing in the morning, so if you weren't awake you would be once they arrived with their blowhorn. Hotel is in a great location to Union Square and other city activities. We were able to do mega shopping and come back to hotel unload, rest and go at it again. Ran the beautiful course of the SF Marathon on a rainy Sunday and used the hotel hottub to relax. It was fairly chilly and another guest called maintenance who came immediately and fixed the temperature. Can't say that the hottub/pool area is really anything to rave about as the hottub is quite old, but it was wonderful to be able to soak our aching muscles! We weren't departing until 8:00pm Monday and had to check out by noon despite a late checkout request. Bellman did store our bags and we were able to hangout in the lounge area which is quite comfortable. Would stay at Nikko again in a heartbeat!

review.title: Would definitely stay again.
review.reviewText: Clean room, new shampoo etc. supplies replaced every day, comfortable bed, pleasant experience. Great location.

review.title: good spot
review.reviewText: nice location. Breakfast only at 22usd.

review.title: Outstanding location
review.reviewText: Highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: The Nikko was awesome! We honeymooned in SF and stayed here. It was the nicest room I have ever stayed in!

review.title: Good hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel conveniently located near Union Square. We were in a petite queen which is quite small but it had everything we needed for the one night that we were staying. I would not recommend their petite queen rooms for longer stays. Overall good experience and would stay there again.

review.title: Impressive for the price
review.reviewText: We had not visted SFO before and was extremely happy with the hotel overall. We got a good deal through Expedia and was more than satisfied. The area is good for Union square, and the lack of free Wi-Fi was not an issue as Starbucks was right next door anyway.

review.title: " Would love to go back to this Hotel "
review.reviewText: The staff were eficient and friendly always very polite if they could do anything for you they would. Didn't at first like the one time pool fee but once I used the pool the pain went away. Area its quite close to the Tenderloin lots of homeless people about but we didn't have any problems with them.Starbucks in the lobby great, We were on the 12th floor quiet, the beds and pillows were very nice, blackout drapes help you get good sleep, Bathroom was nice large mirror but my wife would have liked another moveable mirror so she could see her hair from the back . The mat on bathroom floor needed some non slip tape on for safety, the towels though plentifull were not soft in the least not quite luxury hotel standard but what the heck. We enjoyed our week at the hotel Nikko. and would definately return.

review.title: Nikko is Nice!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is well located near public transport and within walking distance of excellent shopping, restaurants, and sights. The surrounding neighborhood was busy late into the night and we had no safety concerns. Hotel has a modern, upscale look with rooms that are well appointed, clean and comfortable. At check-in our room wasn't ready and we were given an immediate upgrade. The king size bed and glass walled shower with separate tub was nice addition. Internet access in room and at the business centre was far too expensive. Hotel staff were helpful, the concierge typically had a line-up of 3 to 4 people waiting to ask questions. However, staff didn't go out of their way to be overly welcoming or friendly. Pool and gym facilities were a nice addition ($10 charge for use was waived) and not too busy. Room service menu was pricey, especially with added "delivery" and gratuity charges. The airport shuttle - an outside company arranged by the hotel - didn't show-up for our trip to the airport, but a taxi was readily available and only slightly more expensive. Overall, no major issues, a pleasant place to stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Great hotel close to lots of great diners
review.reviewText: The hotel was classy, the room had a great bathroom, the cot was in the room when we arrived. Housekeeping was there in a jiffy with a vaccuum when a glass broke.Pool was nice too.

review.title: Go for the Pool, Jacuzzi, Steam/Sauna Room!!!
review.reviewText:
I stayed on the Nikko Floor (20 or 21st floor?) which had lovely views and capped off an awesome SF Bday weekender. But when I stay in a 4-star hotel, I expect exceptional hospitality. Nikko's hospitality is not exceptional, and here's why:

1) They neglected to ask me about the hotel pool charge when I checked in, so when I went to the pool with guests, I couldn't access the pool. Had to walk downstairs (in my pool robe) to authorize a charge for $10. Obviously it was super important to "observe" procedure since they had me sign on what looked like the back of a napkin. 2) HOTEL FRIDGE - took (3) hours to get someone to empty out the hotel fridge so I could store champagne, etc. that I brought for my bday weekend. I asked them - can you make sure I don't get charged for all this? They said, sure. One week later I'm reading my credit card statement, and SUPRISE! Yep, they charged me for the ENTIRE contents of hotel fridge ($212.00). Ouch. 3) I requested a king size bed and they gave me (2) doubles. No biggie, but they weren't apologetic about it either. 4) Counters were dirty - I found old food stains. Yuck.

Overall, nice hotel - really great swimming pool/jacuzzi/steam/sauna. Hospitality needs improvement. Nikko take note: Take the time to scrub down the rooms before you cram more people inside.

review.title: Mixed bag
review.reviewText: Not a bad hotel overall but the staff there is pretty unfriendly. Room was good and the location is right in the middle - if you prefere this busy part of town.

review.title: Great hotel, great Location
review.reviewText:
Great location in the middle of the city. My room was very nice and confortable. The staff was friendly enough. My only problem is that when you fully paid through Expedia, they ask for $100 deposit per night taken on your account on the first day and giving back when you leave! If you are short financially and want to stay few nights...it is a lot of money out of your account temporarly.
If you want to access to the pool and gym you have to pay an extra and it is not included in the room price!

review.title: Great location! No need for a car...esp if parking is so expensive!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is in the center of it ALL...Everything you need and want is within walking distance...and if it's not...it's the transportation hub of SF...so you cna just hop on anything within a couple of blocks and be there within 30 mins...the staff at Hotel Nikko is very kinda and helpful. PARKING at the hotel is ridicuouls tho, $45 per day. I would figure if you're a patron you'd get a significant discount. BUT YOU DON'T. We ended up driving the car around during the day for three days visiting all the places we wanted to see outside of SF..then parking it after 5pm in the Ellis-O'Farrell parking garage a block away for $10 a night till 8am...we usually picked up the car by 9am and was only charged an extra $3.50. So $13.50 vs. $45..you choose.

review.title: Love it, modern, clean.
review.reviewText: Parking overnight costs ($45) , a lot but there is a garage nearby that charges only much less ($10) for overnight. Conveniently located near Union Square, my husband and I enjoyed the hotel.

review.title: Perfect family stay
review.reviewText:
Our stay in Imperial Club Room was nearly perfect, except for the check-in problems. The Imperial Club provided us with 2 queen beds to fit our 4-person family (our 2 girls comfortably shared the bed), a huge bathroom, and more food than we could possibly eat at the main breakfast buffet and also in the Imperial Club Lounge.

The location is very convenient to Union Square and different modes of transportation. However, if you walk less than 2 blocks in the opposite direction, the area gets a bit colorful.

review.title: Outstanding Hotel in Great Location!
review.reviewText: We loved our 4 day family reunion weekend at this beautiful hotel in Union Square, and will definitely stay there again. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the service at the restaurant and throughout the hotel was excellent. It has a lovely lobby with a piano player during the cocktail hour. There's also a nice nightclub onsite called the Rrazz Room, where we saw a cabaret performance. The gym is huge with a nice indoor pool and suntan / lounge area. The hotel is perfectly located for walking to restaurants, shops, galleries and Chinatown. Our entire family loved it, including my sister's teenagers and my husband, who has very discriminating taste.

review.title: Nikko consistently satisfies
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this Nikko about 8 times now. It has been the best hotel in our experience for this area. Service and quality are always great, and they do not deviate. On the most recent trip, the valet guys went the extra mile to make sure I was happy. Thank you Nikko, I will be staying there again very soon!

review.title: Very nice hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Very comfortable hotel. Location is excellent. Very easy walking distance to Union Square, shopping, transport, cable cars etc. Check in staff were friendly as was the concierge. We had a king deluxe room and it was perfect for the two of us. Quite spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was gorgeous

review.title: will stay again
review.reviewText: for a central location and quality hotel this tops the list

review.title: Great Hotel in Central Location
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in great location not far from Union Square. Staff were great, room was a decent size and the gym was one of the best we've ever used in a hotel. Overall a great experiene and we'd definately return to this hotel.

review.title: 10 days in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very nice, very clean, pool was great, staff very nice and helpful

review.title: nice place, great value
review.reviewText:
We stayed in the executive floors. The club space was a wonderful feature -- attentive service, ripe fresh fruits and the usual continental breakfast, all combined to start each day on a pleasant note. Excellent rate through Expedia for the room. The health club was nice and clean. Pool with max depth of 4'6" was uncrowded.

Truly the only down note was check-in. No room was available until after the stated 1500 time, even with Amex early check-in privilege; no facility to change out of travel clothes. I was given a floor pass to the Executive club but there was nothing there other than TV and newspapers. And, although the bags were supposed to be in the room when we finally were through check-in, it took two calls and over 30 minutes before they finally arrived at the room.

review.title: This place is flawless!
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Location, Location, Location for starters. You are a short walk to Union Square, Chinatown, the Trolly Stop, shops and the Muni or BART rail service to take you anywahere in San Francisco! The room was clean, hotel service was top-notch and there was a Starbucks right off the lobby which was great for morning breakfast. One tip: there is no need to pay for wireless internet-Starbucks now has free internet. Just take your laptop with you and camp out in Starbucks. I would stay at the Nikko again and recommend to anyone.

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was a very nice hotel in a great location. We were close to everything we wanted to do and a block away from the cable cars. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was quiet. I would stay here again:)

review.title: WILL ALWAYS RETURN!
review.reviewText: LOVE THIS HOTEL!! Staff is very friendly, front desk clerk remembered me and welcomed me back. Pools ia awsome! Gym is open 24 hrs unlike other hotels like big chain one across the street that charges a daily rate but closes at 8 (one of the showers in mens locker room was broken but not a problem)

review.title: Pretty good!
review.reviewText: The valet service was very accommodating. They always brought the car around to the front really quickly and always gave us great dining recommendations. Check-in and out was also quick and easy. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The only negative was that the pool was old and moldly. Needs updating.

review.title: Not Impressed!!!!
review.reviewText: Would not stay again and who ever heard of paying for parking that is as much as the hotel stay!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I have stayed at Nikko a few times before so I knew what to expect. The staff is always friendly and courteous. They placed a fridge in the room so I wouldn't have to pay $5.00 for a Coke from their minibar. Nice comfortable bed. Room was spotless after cleaning each day. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Stay away from the Starbucks in the hotel because it is the slowest moving I have ever seen. There is another one block away on Powell St.

review.title: Great Choice!
review.reviewText: My daughter chose this hotel for us. Great Choice! A big beautiful lobby, friendly staff and most importantly a spacious, clean & comfortable room. Close to Union Square, the Powell Street Cable Car turnaround, the mall and all transportation. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Wonderful quality, comfort, and location
review.reviewText: This hotel is well maintained, clean, comfortable, and well situated near transit lines. I can only comment on two negatives: lack of free in-room wi-fi internet, and the locked doors at the rear of the hotel after 10 PM. Stay here, and you won't be disappointed.

review.title: This trip stay, disappointed, over last stay at the Nikko.
review.reviewText:
First, please review our check-in notes. It is unfortunate that our experience was not as wonderful as our last Nikko stay. We were there celebrating our 26th and I saved the card from our last trip of the contact to write to if returning to make our next stay as delightful. I emailed that contact via the hotel website and never received any correspondence back nor any recognition at the front desk when arriving. Most importantly, when offered the fitness/pool/spa for an additional charge & we accepted, we were never told that it was going to be used by Hilton Hotel guests as their pool and spa facility was closed due to remodeling. We were sadly disappointed each time we went to use it that it was overcrowded with Hilton guests and mostly children in the spa unsupervised. We think it proper that we should have been informed of such on check-in. Why should Nikko guests be charged for this ammenity when Hilton guests were not? Not good etiquette for us. Also, our next door guests were extremely noisy from 11pm until 3am the 1st night and then the 2nd night started again at 2am. When we called the front desk, they immediately responded and took care of it. At best we learned, not to be so patient with noisy neighbors in an expensive hotel. The hotel offered us only 1/2 of our upgrade costs for 2 nights of lost sleep.

The sushi restaurant is costly but good. Happy Hour food is a bargain and service always exceptional.

We will not choose the Nikko for future stays.

review.title: Happy with the Nikko!
review.reviewText: Great, great, great! Great location. Great clean, large room. Convenient to food and things to do and especially wonderfully close to cable car lines and Bart.

review.title: Great choice
review.reviewText: Great Japan-style hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Rooms are not big, but this is indeed Japan-style. Friendly staff and extremely clean hotel.

review.title: Great location and good service
review.reviewText: Staff are helpful. The service was great!

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and easy to walk or pick up transport to other parts of the city. Room exactly as stated and hotel staff helpful. Would stay here again.

review.title: would stay there again
review.reviewText: Hotel was very plesant, clean staff was very helpful over all experience was good, good location would stay there again

review.title: Great Hotel / Great Location
review.reviewText: Have stayed at the Nikko before and happy once again.

review.title: Nikko hotel - wouldn't recommend to tourists.
review.reviewText: Being an SF native, I can't recommend this hotel to tourists. It's already expensive and nothing is included. And even worse, the surrounding area, sans Starbucks, (and I really can't believe I'm making an argument for a corporation right now) because they have fixed prices for their items, every store marked up their items 100 percent over what you would pay for them if you just walked 4 blocks out of the area. Of course, this is exactly what we did. But I feel bad for the tourist that doesn't know any better and thinks that all of SF is that expensive. Basically what I'm suggesting is that if you want to vacation is SF, stay away from the Union Square/Theatre district area unless you are totally okay with spending more for everything just to be in that particular area.

review.title: A Wonderful Time
review.reviewText:
My wife and I stayed at Hotel NikKo San Francisco in June with in-laws and we all had a great time. We had a good rate with Expedia. Our rooms were quiet, the beds were very comfortable, and we had nice views. We enjoyed the location close to the Powell Street stop. We used the pool everyday and it felt great swimming after hours of exploring the city. The staff was great too.
We had a wonderful time in San Francisco. Tip: take advantage of the bar at Nikko, the happy hour until six is great and you can try some really nice wite wines from Napa.

review.title: Nobody bother. exellent location.
review.reviewText: Everything was nice. Very ecological system. I like Japanese style worming welcome. I request that Japanese Restaurant ANZU more serve better Japanese dishies.

review.title: Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel ....nice location handy to all shopping, convention center, cable cars, jazz club. Most restaurants are a cheap cab ride away....

review.title: i hate the hotel nikko in san francisco
review.reviewText: as above. the hotel rooms smell, lumpy beds and dirty carpets that must be 20 yrs old.

review.title: Location, Location, Location!
review.reviewText: Great hotel in excellent location. Well worth the price.

review.title: I will go again.
review.reviewText: I will go again because of a few simple things. Hotel Nikko is the cleanest Hotel I have ever been to. The staff was ultra friendly and helpful. Its location to all our activities was perfect.

review.title: Would go back in a heartbeat!
review.reviewText: It was a great experience. People were friendly and the staff was very helpful.

review.title: Rooms a bit small
review.reviewText: The rooms were a bit small for our liking, but it was very clean and cozy so that made up for the lack of space.

review.title: Nikko was Great
review.reviewText: Hotel was great - good location, nice amenities, nice staff! Clean and comfy, would stay again.

review.title: Almost flawless hotel stay
review.reviewText: Every member of hotel staff I dealt with was friendly and efficient. My Imperial Club room was large and perfectly clean and maintained, and came with free wifi, and complimentary evening wine & cheese which was appreciated. The spa is very pleasant, though the pool is extremely shallow and the sauna wasn't really hot enough. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good, but I was less impressed with the evening service and food. It's only a short walk from Powell Street BART/MUNI and there are four car rental companies almost directly across the street which is very handy. Overall a very enjoyable stay.

review.title: was glad to stay so close to my venue
review.reviewText: very nice and conveniently located for my purpose.

review.title: Better off booking through hotel website
review.reviewText: Wonderful housekeeping staff, but rather disappointed in room assigned to me. Room had torn carpet just inside entry door, bathroom was rather small with poor water flow through the showerhead, and the bathroom door was designed to close shut if not held open (hence had to use a chair to prop the door open to be able to hear morning news while getting ready in the morning). Colleague staying in same hotel at same time had much better room- better view of the city, larger bathroom, bathroom door that would stay open. She payed a little more by booking directly with the hotel, but we both booked the exact same type of room

review.title: Wonderful stay in Union Square...highly recommend it
review.reviewText: The hotel was very quiet. The bathroom separates the hallway from the sleeping area and the walls are very well insulated. We never heard any conversations or music. During our 2 nights of stay, we heard maybe 1-2 very dull thumps from someone dropping something on the floor above us. It was wonderful for our small children who are light sleepers. The indoor pool was a lifesaver since it rained during our stay. We drove into the city and were able to check in our luggage with the bellman until our room was ready. We opted to park at the Mason O'Farrell Garage which is basically catty-corner to the hotel. This saved us parking $$ and we didn't have to haul our luggage from the parking garage to the hotel. The hotel was very conveniently located. We had a great easy day taking the Muni out to Golden Gate park. Will go back to Hotel Nikko in a heart beat. Was probably one of our best family vacations.

review.title: San Fran Nikko - Spring Break
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel convenient to restaurants, shopping and the cable car line. Check in line was long, but otherwise our stay was great. Expensive parking at the hotel. If you're driving, use one of the adjacent municipal parking garages that are less expensive.

review.title: Easily the Best Around Union Square
review.reviewText: Having stayed at four big chain Union Square area hotels on seven occasions over the last 12 months The Hotel Nikko is definitely the pick of the bunch. Modern, clean, not too large and uncrowded - the hotel across the road is a bit of a zoo at peak hours - and competitively priced. The restaurant was very good but closes at an early 10PM. Room service menu predictably very Japanese oriented. Quite good health club facilities available for a one-off nominal charge irrespective of length of stay. "Deluxe King" Rooms not large and vary in size - we prefer the ones with separate shower. Great value.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText:
The last time I stayed is SF I stayed in the Fisherman's Wharf area, Hotel Nikko is a much better option. The area is vibrant and filled with shops and the hotel is just blocks from Union Square with easy access to public tranportation. Be prepared, it's $45/day to valet park at the hotel. Also, the local establishments charge a fee to subsidize the employee's benefits. The fee is not overwhelming, it's just an item I wasn't accustomed to seeing.

As for the rooms, they are smallish but comfortable enough to hang out and enjoy 24 hour room service.

I'm looking forward to going back.

review.title: Very classy
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at the conveniently located Hotel Nikko. Staff was fairly friendly. The concierge was very helpful. First Crush is a cute wine bar with good eats close to the hotel.

review.title: Hotel Nikko here we come in July!
review.reviewText: We were there over Easter weekend and the start of Spring Break in California. Despite having a full house, we were treated as Queens. Our every wish was their command and the staff could not have been nicer. Our room was upgraded to a suite which was gorgeous and have a fabulous view of the Bay and Union Square. It was simply the best weekend and we will definitely be back in July to stay again for a girls escape weekend!

review.title: Excellent stay in Union Square
review.reviewText: At check-in nobody was at the counter. However, this was expected because of my late arrival. The room was spectacular. I went back down to the front desk to ask for accommodations and a place to grab food. The staff met all my requests with a smile. Plus, the recommended diner was delicious. Respectful, nice facilities, and great location.

review.title: Excellent choice for our family
review.reviewText:
We chose Hotel Nikko for two specific reasons, the location and the indoor pool. We were extremely pleased with both. We were upgraded to a Japanese Suite upon check-in because of an error with our reservation. Every staff member we had contact with was very helpful, from the reservation mix up to the free printing of our boarding passes to the offers of hot chocolate for the kids in ANZU.
We chose to include the Imperial Club in our reservation and the amenities provided for this expense were worth it. We thoroughly enjoyed the afternoon wine and cheese, continental breakfast, full breakfast in ANZU, and the fitness center. And our girls were welcomed to all.
The hotel's location is excellent for those utilizing public transportation. The BART and Cable Cars are only a few blocks away. In addition, several attractions are within walking distance.
Though we had an exceptional experience at Hotel Nikko, we would probably stay in a less expensive hotel upon returning to San Francisco. This was a splurge and well worth it, but we aren't likely to do it again.

review.title: Great service
review.reviewText: Nice service and location near Union Square. Convenient to BART.

review.title: Great location and quality
review.reviewText: High quality hotel, fabulous location to walk to Union Square, room very nice.

review.title: Excellent hotel; very convenient location.
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel for the special rates being offered; we had excellent service and a spacious, comfortable room. The location was very central, which allowed easy access to the cable cars and street cars, as well as being in easy walking distance of a lot of places we wanted to go. There are lots of great restaurants within blocks of the hotel. Just don't touch anything in the fridge - as soon as you so much as move anything it will be charged to your bill! You can request a separate fridge for your room if you want to store your own food or drinks. Highly recommended!!

review.title: Perfect Choice
review.reviewText: Recently stayed at the Nikko for 6 nights with my adult daughter in a room with two double beds. The room was a good size, bathroom was huge with a bath and separate shower with hairdryer and the usual nice quality bath products, towels were big and fluffy. The beds were probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in (Hilton are good as well). We also had a large flat screen TV.I do agree with others who said the carpets were stained, but honestly it didn't worry me that much because the room still felt very clean to me. As far as position goes, couldn't ask for a better spot. We were out and about every day and it was great to come back to a room with a great bathroom and comfy beds.

review.title: Excellent location and clean hotel
review.reviewText:
I have stayed in this hotel for 6 nights during the month on March 2010. Clean room , nice location and great room rate.
Will stay there again

review.title: Perfection near Union Square
review.reviewText: Perfection, as we've come to expect at this hotel over many stays in the last 10 years. The only drawback is that the smallest rooms are very compact. Knowing that, we always choose a larger room. The facilities are immaculate and the location near Union Square is outstanding. We especially like the swimming pool, spa, and health club.

review.title: Clean and convenient hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I like this hotel very much. The location is good; there are multiple rental car shops right across the street; the city center is in a walk-distance. Plus, the room is clean. I have no complaint about this hotel.

review.title: Lived up to expectations
review.reviewText: I probably would not have parked a car in the hotel lot ($45/day), but other than that the service was great and the hotel was clean and quiet.

review.title: Hotel Nikko, very good
review.reviewText: A good choice.

review.title: Good access to downtown
review.reviewText: This hotel is best for Japanese who stay San Francisco. There are many good Japanese restaurant around the hotel. Easy access to cable car, many shops, China town and union squere.

review.title: SF
review.reviewText: THe reviews about the deposit are correct. Upon checkin they stated that the deposit would be refunded upon checkout. Not true! I am still waiting and it has been 2 weeks. I called my bank and they said that legally they have 30 days to refund your deposit back. Just not a good practice in my opinion. $100 deposit per night so dont plan on getting it back for 30 days

review.title: Epic Fail
review.reviewText: This hotel is a complete and utter epic failure on service. They messed up our reservations, staff was rude. The only exception was the concierge who provided excellent service.

review.title: Doesn't live up to advertising.
review.reviewText:
The Nikko puts itself out as a high class establishment, luxury hotel. Although the building is beautiful and the lobby and Anzu are nice looking, the hotel staff is not apparently up to the rep. Basically, the valet couldn't be bothered to open the car door for my wife once in the ten or so times we went in and out.
The maid turned on the stereo in our room when she went in to turn the bed down and forgot to turn it off twice (if that was intentional they could have at least turned it to a station that comes in well in the room). By the way parking FOR HOTEL GUESTS is $45 a day and is not included in the Expedia price.

My wife got a massage in their "spa" and was given a less than thorough shiatsu massage and was not even asked what type of massage she wanted or anything, but she did get to pay $125 for it!! She was not remotely happy but didn't have time to stay because we had to get to dinner.

The bathroom was the nicest part of the room. The shower was okay and the in-mirror t.v. thing was a cool gimmick but it didn't make up for the rest of the hotel.

We picked a hotel at random for less than $100 for the night near the airport in Minneapolis before we left and were happier in that room. Overall we were disappointed with the Nikko and will not return.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: our stay in the imperial room was great. The view of the city and bay made this trip amazing, along with biking the golden gate. The hotel service was great. The staff was friendly. The food was good..The only thing was that everything was pricey especially parking..over all the stay was great.

review.title: GORGEOUS ROOM! LOVED IT!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful. Stayed on the top floor. There was a television in our mirror!! Couldn't have asked for a cleaner and more hospitable hotel!!

review.title: Smaller rooms than I expected, even for San Francisco standards
review.reviewText: the hotel is in a very good location just a few blocks from the major shopping and street car lines. however, the rooms were FAR smaller than i expected. also, the front desk was not very friendly at all. they were cordial but not welcoming in any sense. I have stayed in several hotels while on vacation downtown san francisco, and this was by far the smallest yet. the hotel looks nice and lobby is open from the outside but the rooms were cramped. when we first arrived, our non-smoking room also smelled like smoke. the front desk said they were completely booked for the night so we had to just make do. we expected that they would at least upgrade us to a different room if rooms in our level were booked by they only brought in an air purifier. another piece to clutter our already tiny hotel room. the bathrooms were nice and the housekeeping staff cleaned nicely but i would not recommend this hotel to friends. i would go back to the hotels i stayed at perviously before choosing hotel nikko again.

review.title: Very conveniently located
review.reviewText:
this is our second stay at the Nikko and we enjoy the location as well as the hotel.
We tried the imperial level room, that include access to the fitness center and swimming pool which was nice for the boys (11 and 14) after a day of walking in the streets. This also included a lounge service for drinks before dinner and continental breakfast. We never went for the breakfast as we enjoy some of the japanese choices of the hotel but the service was very minimal for the drinks and appetizers. We have stayed at hotel that offer the same kind of service with more and better options. Pretty much if you arrived at 6:30 pm after a large group everything was gone and no one came to clean the place or refill.
Overall we really enjoy the hotel and its location.

review.title: one thing...
review.reviewText: I booked for my dad. and after He went back his home, he noticed he forgot his scarf at the hotel clothet. then i called them but cleaning lady said they havent find any scarf the room. thats too bad....

review.title: Perfect Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is nice, clean, comfortable bed...and best of all...in the PERFECT location! Walking distance or a short bus ride away to most places. Friendly staff. Good experience overall!

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: Good location. Good value

review.title: Great Hotel, good location
review.reviewText: We love this hotel. It's just down the street from Union Square. We went up to see Wicked, the musical, which was less than a mile from the hotel. I also love the gym here. It's big, indoor pool, and all the equipment was in great shape.

review.title: Great hotel experience
review.reviewText: The Nikko had excellent service, a very nice gym/pool and was in the perfect location. It was quiet, with well appointed rooms. I'd definitely go back. The special Expedia rate made it a really good deal, too.

review.title: Good VFM hotel in good area
review.reviewText: Stayed at Marriott, Nikko was by far better VFM

review.title: Great location but not a great hotel
review.reviewText:
I was in town for the big MFA auditions they hold each Feb.
For this purpose the location of the hotel was fantastic.
It was very close to the cable cars, The metro, ACT, and plenty restaurants and shopping.

What I did not like was the 100.00/night incendental fee they charge each night of your stay.

They also charge 10.00 to use their gym and a bunch of fees if you want to use their business center. There is a fee for printing, using the internet, faxing and copying.

They also charge if you want to use their pool (which we didnt.. but wow !)

The room was small and there were a lot of black marks all over the walls.
The had no fridge and no mini bar but a bottle of water you could drink for nine dollars.

The staff was nice though but I will not be retuning there are plenty of other hotels in the area that dont tack on a lot of fee's. If you have a lot of money to waste than this place is for you. I will not be returning.

review.title: san francisco anniversary
review.reviewText: a wonderful experience, would love to do it again immedietly.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
Hotel Nikko turned out to be a comfortable hotel, with nice (smallish) rooms.

My only criticism is aimed at the health club on the 5th floor. Firstly there is a charge to use the facility, and secondly there was not enough ventilation in the cardio area, making it uncomfortably warm to do any kind of serious workout.

Other than that, had a great stay.

review.title: Nikko with some reservations
review.reviewText: loced the hotel and the price, didn't love the ridiculously high deposit they put on your credit card on check in-it left us a bit cash poor for our stay in SF. Otherwise, the hotel is excellent, the gym facility is worth the extra $10 charge, and it was lovely relaxing in the hot tub after long days working.

review.title: Will definitely go back
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the best possible location. 2 blocks for Union Square with lots of fine restaurants and shops. Macys and Saks Fifth Ave are within easy walking distance. I booked a junior suite and was upgraded to a beautiful and hugh corner suite on the 16th floor. Everything is first rate. Service is great. People are very courteous and friendly. I would definitely go back there and would recommend to anyone looking for a great hotel in San Franisco.

review.title: nothing but truth
review.reviewText: great location, good hotel

review.title: Boutique Hotel Near Everything
review.reviewText: I really liked Hotel Nikko; I used to live just up the street from hotel location so I knew neighborhood already, it is near absolutely everything-stores, restaurants and both Muni and Bart. It is 2 blocks from Bart station in front of Westfield Center if you are coming in from airport. The hotel was lovely, everything was very clean and modern. I would say the only negative was the room was a little small but that may have been because it was a corner room, so the views made up for it! Did not eat at hotel, but had drinks in bar-very nice. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Close to many SF attractions. Good Value.
review.reviewText: Accommodating staff, very clean, good restaurant, close to theaters and Union Square. Good value.

review.title: The best hotel service in our experience
review.reviewText: We checked in New Year,s Eve. We had made reservations for the hotel's wonderful restaurant Anzu but our flight was delayed and we missed our reservation seating. The hotel staff called the restaurant and had them wait for us. Check in was quick and we were on our way to celebrate a wonderful New Year. We paid a little extra and our room was on a top private floor with wonderful views and a bathroom that looked like a separate apartment. We had a choice of a complimentary breakfast and/or a full breakfast in the hotel restaurant, Anzu(incredible!!)The indoor pool and hot tub were perfect for relaxation. The spa was beautiful (very zen like): steam room , sauna, lockers.towels, showers and a gym facility. It was free for those on the private floor worth the extra money which was excessive.Our greatest raves goes to thehotel staff from the maintenance staff to the restaurante wait personnel. They were so friendly and accomodating and made our stay that much more enjoyable.

review.title: I WANT A REPEAT
review.reviewText: Room was nice, a little small but neat and clean with big screen tv. Maid service was good. Spa was fantastic. Pool, steam, sauna, towel service, weight room, deck chairs for naps - you could live there!!!!!! Hotel Nikko must be a good place to work because THERE WAS NO ATTITUDE!!!! Recomend it to everyone!

review.title: Second visit as good as the first
review.reviewText: My father travels from Europe to be with us at Christmas. This is the second year we booked him at the Nikko. He loves this hotel. It is located downtown near Union Square. It is a clean, modern, luxury style hotel with an excellent and professional staff. His room this time had an even better view, which my father loved. The location is great as it was so convenient for my father to take public transporation to my part of the city as well as other areas he wanted to explore. As long as the rates stay competitive, we will use this hotel again.

review.title: Hotel Nikko was fine
review.reviewText: Only one complaint: there was no one at the concierge desk for our first 3 days there, when we would have asked for neighborhood recommendations.

review.title: Once again, Nikko is awesome
review.reviewText:
This was my third stay at the Nikko Hotel. The room appeared to be updated. The bed was extremely comfortable. The layout of the bathroom was wonderful -- and it appeared extremely updated. Nice seperate vanity area, separate shower area (with great water pressure). Located right at Union Square in SF. From all staff to the appearance and condition of lobby area, restaurants, and room, everything was wonderful.
Beware of the fee for parking. I did not know about it and was surprised at check-out of the fee (and how expensive it was).

review.title: high quality, excellent value
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel and staff

review.title: Great Holiday Getaway
review.reviewText:
The Nikko is now my preferred hotel for visits with extended family. Hotel personnel were extremely professional, friendly and accommodating (from reservations to check-in to restaurant servers!). The Imperial Club Room was worth the extra tariff - it was a delightful place to gather everyone together outside our hotel rooms and relax and chat. We all were also delighted with the morning buffet breakfast offered - it was a great way to start our day - again the hotel personnel were terrific.

The hotel is perfectly situated halfway between Union Square and the Westfield shopping Center and just two blocks from the Powell Street cable car (very important to our guests). The only (minor) qualm would be for those returning to the hotel in the late evening . . . it would be better to cab in as the Nikko borders and iffy part of town on the western side.

review.title: "I've stayed there before and hope to stay there again"
review.reviewText: I had a great time, hotel and all, mainly around going to the San Francisco Jazz Fest which I have attended every year since 2000. It is more of a cultural trip with me. Sometimes in the the past I have attended plays and once I even went to an opera performance of "Dead Man Walking". If you're bored in S.F., that's your fault.

review.title: wonderful show
review.reviewText: the ashford and simpson show was wonderful. my whole experience was wonderful

review.title: Better options for tourists
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko and its location are "okay," if all you want to do is shop at Union Square. But for the money, we've stayed at other hotels with more charm, much bigger rooms, and better locations in the SF area.

review.title: Would definitely stay here next time
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and bright from the moment you walk in from the street. The location is so convenient to Union Square, the Muni, the Bart and the cable cars. Rooms are so clean and spacious. Make sure you pay that little bit extra to gain access to the pool, spa, gym, sauna and steam room - a great way to wind down after a big day in SF! Would definitely recommend this hotel looking for a bit of luxury during their stay in SF at a very reasonable price - and the breakfast buffet is a hit too :-)

review.title: San Francisco Best Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is very nice. The room was nice ,the bed was comfortable with nice sheets and pillows.

review.title: A little hard to get to if your drivingto the hotel,
review.reviewText: Market street is a little hard to traverse with all of it's no right turns and one way streets, but what a wonderful hotel! I highly recommend the Imperial suites with their awesome views of the city, yes we will stay there again!

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: good location, the concierge was very helpful and was able to get us into the Infusion lounge as a VIP.

review.title: location,cleanliness
review.reviewText: two blocks to theaters, shopping, and good restaurants, also best bathroom so far in San Francisco,valets and bells and concierges were great..

review.title: Class right next to the Tenderloin
review.reviewText: I thought I hated boutique hotels. I was incredibly wrong. This place is gorgeous. The reception area was huge, pretty and entertaining. The bed was huge and comfortable. Nice LCD on the dresser. The bathroom was somewhat typical but clean and comfortable. The service was almost perfect. We ordered chocolate cake the first night we were there and it never came. So, after a bit of complaining, the next morning two free breakfast vouchers were at our door. We took advantage of the vouchers on the day we left and decided that while the food was decent there was no way the vouchers were worth $25 each. Still, great place to stay, business or pleasure. However, it is right next to the tenderloin and when we walked outside, it was a bit of a pain. Too many people begged for anything that we had. So, for vacation, it's best to stay at this hotel if you have experience there.

review.title: A great place to stay
review.reviewText: We were upgraded to a better room and we found the food and services to be excellent.
