review.title: LOVED THE BARTENDER
review.reviewText: BIG PRICE FOR A SOMEWHAT SMALL ROOM. THE BATHROOM DOOR HAD TO CLOSED IN ORDER TO OPEN OR CLOSE THE MAIN DOOR. FURNITURE WAS WORN AND RAGGED. VIEW? NEEDED TO BE UP ANOTHER FEW FLOORS. WE LOOKED IN TO ANOTHER BUILDING!

review.title: An excellent option
review.reviewText: We were quite pleased with our stay at the Hotel Nikko. The room was very nice and the friendliness and help of the staff was first-rate. It's also very conveniently located in the heart of downtown San Francisco -- close to major stores, theaters, and other attractions as well as to mass transit (BART). The only downside is one common to ALL of downtown San Francisco, which is that the location is not particularly "comfortable" late at night. There are a lot of street people and other late-night denizens who can make you feel rather uncomfortable and may even be threatening. But, again, that's true virtually anywhere in downtown SF late at night, so it shouldn't be held against this hotel in particular. (The area is perfectly safe and quite busy during the daytime.)

review.title: super
review.reviewText: We had a great time; very friendly staff

review.title: Nice clean Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean. Executive floor was great. Great breakfast buffet.

review.title: Very nice, but.........
review.reviewText: ........don't expect your room to look much like the virtual tour. Excellent service from the concierge desk! Fantastic breakfast buffet!

review.title: Good, but not as good as normal
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Nikko on four occaisions over the past few years. It's a typcial business hotel in a large city, i.e. the rooms are clean and well appointed but small. This trip, the hotel seemed as if it needed a refit. There were lots of small things that made it less than perfect. The carpets had stains, the air conditioning had to be repaired twice. The staff were helpful, but did not go out of their way to provide exceptional service. All in all, the hotel is fine, but I would give it three stars not four.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I would recommend this hotel to anyone and plan to stay there again when I return.

review.title: Overall, good pick if you get an expedia discount
review.reviewText: Good place; the health club and swimming pool were really nice. However, having to pay for internet on a daily basis is really unacceptable considering the cost of the room and the fact it claims to be a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Good price, Excelent location, Very comfortable room
review.reviewText: Excelent location, everything is close by, the room was very confortable, the bed and pillows were great. We got an upgrade because the type of room we have asked for was not available. The concierge was a lot of help, always willing to help.

review.title: Convenient hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: 1.Very convenient location in down town; near restaurant, station of BART/cable car/bus, department store etc. 2.They keep kindly big luggages during our absence to Yosemite tour. But luggage keeping area different floor from front is unconvenient a little. 3.The front desk is always busy/crowded.

review.title: Good trip
review.reviewText: Great location. Very nice staff. Comfy beds. Triple sheeting. Really nice bathroom/shower. My only complaint was that the carpet had some fresh dirty spots from a prior guest. Housekeeping probably should have taken care of these spots...or let maintenance know about it.

review.title: Great SF Hotel when it is on sale
review.reviewText: This is a very well appointed and comfortable hotel. Great location too (albeit a little close to the tenderloin for 5 AM folks). The discount proce made it as affordable as many not as nice hotels. A good option when available.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I spent one night in a junior suite and was very happy with it. I picked this hotel because my daughters love to swim and there aren't that many SF hotels with pools. The room and bed was very comfortable and the staff helpful (although we didn't use many services) the pool was warm and clean. For the large room, I thought it was a bargain. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Felt like home. Friendly staff felt like family
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable rooms. Great location blocks away from Union Square and San Francisco Shopping Center. Friendly business center, concierge, reception and bell boys. Overall quiet, great view from the room. Enjoyed the pool and the sauna, too.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Lighting in bathroom just OK. Lighting in room unsatisfactory. If 2 people in room, mirror in room is unusable due to poor lighting (for makeup, etc.) Hall light did not work 1/2 the time. Closet door was difficult to open & shut. Staff very nice and friendly. Valet parking may have been standard price but seemed exorbitant. Location is good.

review.title: not impressed at all
review.reviewText: the hotel staff was very nice, but the hotel itself was not what i expected. the room was extremely small and the view was terrible considering that i was staying at Union Square (a very nice part of SF). I have stayed at other Nikko hotels and i have to say that this one was far from what i liked about those other Nikko hotels. The location is good.

review.title: Hotel Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: This is the 4rth time I've stayed at this hotel. Previous visits were excellent. The room I was given this time was somewhat dingy, and the furniture placement made it very cramped. The view was of the side of the Sheraton next door, and I know the hotel had rooms available with a better view. I can no longer recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Place and view
review.reviewText: My first time in San Fran was even better because of this hotel. Great people, rooms, food, etc. Location is perfect for shopping, dining, overall fun.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Ideal location near Union Square. This hotel was spotlessly clean. We had a room on one of the Imperial Club Floors which meant breakfast and drinks from 5-7pm were included in our rate, which was good value. The views from our room on the 22nd floor were great. The staff we dealt with were pleasant and helpful. Would stay here again.

review.title: I want to stay here every time I'm in San Francisco!
review.reviewText: Stayed on the Imperial Floor. Brunch in the Anzu was lovely. The lounge upstairs w/continental breakfast and happy hour was comfortable and relaxing. Our room was clean and comfortable and the service was excellent. Every staff member was gracious and polite and every request was met with prompt attention. Loved the indoor pool, hot tub and steam room.

review.title: A beautiful hotel in the best location
review.reviewText: A beautiful hotel in the best location - close to Union Square, cable cars and trolleys. The bedroom had space to move, a luxurious bed and even a separate shower in the bathroom.

review.title: Great for Leisure, Bad for business
review.reviewText: Everything was great except the internet access. Wayport was their third party provider. I was on the phone with Wayport and they determined the modem in the room was not working. I went to another room with the building engineer to see if the internet was accessible and it wasn't - the modem didn't work in that room either. I was relegated to the hotel's business center, which was extremely expensive for windows 95.

review.title: Great room for the price
review.reviewText: We got an awesome deal on Expedia for a junior suite at Hotel Nikko. The room was very spacious with a great view of Union Square. Unless your spending major $$$, square footage is hard to come by in the city. We were quite pleased. I loved the separate shower/tub. I totally recommend room service for breakfast. Yum!

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: This is a first class modern hotel in the heart of the city..strongly recommend.

review.title: Good Breakfast
review.reviewText: This hotel serves a authentic Japanese breakfast which is very tasty and healthy. That is why I choose this hotel every time I visit San Francisco.

review.title: Great Hotel and strategic location!
review.reviewText: Nikko was better than I expected! The hotel was clean, service was exemplary and to top it off, it was located at a very convenient place near to the shopping areas. The staff accommodated my request for an extremely early check-in, and concierge service was great too. Definitely would recommend Nikko to other Expedia travellers! :))

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText: Hotel in person was even nicer than it looked on website, beautiful marble and granite everywhere, lobby, hallways, very nice. Mattress was most comfortable ever, loved it. Atmosphere in bar very congenial, breakfast buffet was just great, definitely will return, sorry we could only stay one night.

review.title: Pay for Standard, difference is minimal!
review.reviewText: Nikko Hotel was nice, but I upgraded to the Imperial Suite and to be honest it was not worth the extra cost for a slightly bigger TV, TV in the bathroom and so-called "view". The bed and pillows were surprisingly uncomfortable considering its star rating (4) and cost. Since not much time was spent in the room I would recommend purchasing standard room if staying here but would try a different hotel next time.

review.title: Ok for a 4 stars hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel room condition was really standard: part of the curtain wasn't attached to the rail, two metal plates on the bathroom door handle were not attached (and despite a request for service was made, it wasn't repair during our 3 night stay). The staff made a mistake on our bill. They were going to bill the hotel room on my credit card. The hotel room was already pre-paid with Expedia. Be aware to verify your bill (placed at your door) before checking out. The gym looks great and the swimming pool is warm, but not deep. Towels are provided at the pool. Valet parking only. A Starbucks coffee is located in the hotel. Hotel rooms are as displayed on Expedia. I was expecting more from this 4 stars hotel.

review.title: Not really deluxe
review.reviewText: I decided to pay a little more for a deluxe room and it was so small, I wonder what the normal rooms are like. Everything was fine, but nothing was special. Internet is expensive and they do not provide hourly options.

review.title: Great Hotel in Convenient Location
review.reviewText: We stayed in Hotel Nikko for 5 nights and found our room to be extremely comfortable and the staff were friendly and always willing to help. Concierge was a wealth of information and assisted us with sightseeing and tour information. Central location to restaurants and bars, as well as Union Square and shopping precinct. Would definitely recommend to other travellers.

review.title: Minimally impressed
review.reviewText: Japanese design might be minimal but it is still a design - empty walls do not qualify. Putting calls through in the middle of the night from unidentified sources is not acceptable.

review.title: Like a second perfect honeymoon
review.reviewText: It was absolutely wonderful!!! no words todescribe!

review.title: Best bang for your buck!!!
review.reviewText: My wife spent our first night of our honeymoon at Hotel Nikko before we hit the Napa Valley for some great wine, it was amazing we requested a room with a great view and they did not fail in that regard we were on the 21st floor in a junior suite that was huge!!! We could see both the Golden Gate and Bay Bridge from this corner room. When we arrived we were early they checked our bags and we went to the "wharf" for some chowder and fresh seafood then we came back and they had champagne on ice for us upon arrival at the room it was great. Will stay here every time we go back. The pool, gym, spa and sauna were great to wake up to along with the sun rising through all the windows in our room.

review.title: Great option to know San Francisco
review.reviewText: Initially, the room they gave us did not have a flat screen, even though advertisement showed it would and the room needed a slight overhaul. We complained and were changed to another room which completed our expectations. Great location, close to local attractions and shopping. Great professional service.

review.title: Overhyped
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable, but over rated.

review.title: IT'S THE ONLY PLACE WE WILL STAY IN SAN FRANCISCO.
review.reviewText: THIS HOTEL OFFERS THE BEST BREAKFAST BUFFET OF ANY HOTEL WE STAYED IN. IT'S in THE ANZU RESTAURANT. We look forward to this meal since the quality is the best.The rooms are very modern and it offers flat screen tv.

review.title: Nice room but on the small side
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed in a a room with queen bed on the 20th floor. The room did not have a spectacular view as it faced towards Market Street and looked directly into the rooms of the Parc 55 hotel across the street. The room was a bit small and next time I would probably upgrade to the king room for the additional $20 per night but we didn't spend too much time in our room so it wasn't too big of a deal. The hotel (like all other 4 star hotels surrounding Union Square) is conveniently located hotel within a very short walk to Union Square, bars, restaurants, Market Street, and the base of the cable car.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Bathroom spacious, separate shower. Staff were very friendly and attentive. Received an amazing rate on Expedia for the Junior Suite. Called hotel directly and was quoted double the price. However, furniture in suite was old, worn and fabric on couches and chairs needed cleaning. If furniture had been updated and cleaned it would have been an excellent trip.

review.title: Bad Choice
review.reviewText: Price was supposed to include breakfast - this was not provided. Hotel was in poor condition and unclean. I do NOT recommend this hotel.

review.title: EXCELLENT!
review.reviewText: I recommend Hotel Nikko to anyone traveling to San Francisco. The location is great, you won't need a car to get anywhere. I requested a higher floor in the Petite Queen room, and got the 20th floor. The elevators are lightening speed, and the view from the room was great! The beds are extremely comfortable, and they provide great slippers, toothpaste, and toiletries. The staff is very friendly, and always willing to help. The rooms are clean, and the bathroom is amazing! They say that this room is small and "tight for two", but my boyfriend and I found it to be roomy. There is also a very convenient restaurant on the second floor of the Hotel Nikko called ANZU if you're looking for some authentic Japanese food and don't feel like leaving the hotel. Overall, I had an amazing stay here, and will definitely come back!!

review.title: Great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The Nikko is a beautiful modern hotel that is in a very convenient location, close to Union square and all the shopping, bars & restaurants, and close to many attractions including the cable car. The double I was in was of a good size, had a 40" flat panel TV, and had a very large bathroom that included both a tub & a separate shower. I'd certainly stay there again, especially if there were an Expedia special rate.

review.title: confortable and practical
review.reviewText: The hotel is well located, very close to union square and Moscone convention center if you are in San Francisco for a convention. I found it to be quiet and confortable. The hotel in general looks clean even though no special attention is paid to the rooms/bathrooms after the first night.

review.title: Will consider staying at your hotel the next time I go to S.F.
review.reviewText: Had a great time.

review.title: Best Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It is worth every dollar that I paid.

review.title: It's always our 1st Choice!
review.reviewText: Good size rooms with great amenities. Some rooms have larger bathrooms with separate tub,shower and vaniety. Great location for shopping around Union Square and one block from Powell St. Also close to Nordstrom Center and Westfield Shopping Center. Consistently fine service from the courteous staff.

review.title: Nikko Hotel
review.reviewText: A very nice and pleasant hotel, with a great location in San Francisco!

review.title: LOVELY HOTEL
review.reviewText: Great place to stay at!!! convenient to many locations, walking distance to Niketown and Macy's. The Anzu Dining was GREAT!! Would definetly return to this hotel and the city!! Great Valentine Weekend trip!!

review.title: Valentines Day Getaway
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I live in the bay area but wanted to visit San Francisco for the night for valentines day anyway. I found Hotel Nikko on Expedia at a very good price and booked it without knowing anything about the hotel. I then looked up reviews and read nothing but good things. When we arrived at the hotel everthing I had read about was proven. The staff was extremeley nice and attentive. The room was beautiful with a lovely bed, a plasma tv, a lavish bathroom and a mini fridge. We read on the fridge that your room could be charged if anything was moved, so I called bousekeeping and they rolled in another mini fridge that was empty for our own stuff! It was great! Overall the stay was amazing, the hotel was very quiet and peaceful even though it was obvious there were a lot of guests. I would definiteley recommend this to ANYONE! Awesome hotel!!!

review.title: NOT 4-Star Quality
review.reviewText: As we arrived for our stay - they didn't have our room available to us. Especially when we stayed in their Imperial Club Rooms! The room had an awkward layout and the "special" services they had for their Imperial Club Rooms were mediocre to say the very least. Our turn down service was not provided like we had asked and the quality of the breakfast/brunch in ANZU was...passable. All in all - not what you would expect from a 4-Star hotel. There are definitely better hotels around the area that's more in line of what 4-Star hotels are expected to be!

review.title: Great not perfect
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location which helped us a lot since it was raining the weekend we were in. I found the front desk people to simply be ok, for a 4-star hotel. Didn't really feel like I was a welcome patron. Parking was pretty expensive in comparison to other hotels in the area. The rooms were very nice, with a shower stall and a separate tub.

review.title: SFO's best bargain
review.reviewText: great hotel at the price and at a higher price

review.title: Great Hotel, honoring Japanese Quality Fame
review.reviewText: Great pick from Expedia, we`ve got an incredible rate per night (non-cancelable)for this truly 4 stars hotel. Clean design (a lot of white marble, not kitsch at all), japanese equipment 1st class (elevators, tv, premium sound, air conditioning), BIG bathroom with tub and separated shower.` I believe that because it is not a big chain, their appearance stay better even after almost 20 years operating. Looks like recently open! ANZU Restaurant is a first class Japanese, the sushi master is very competent, and the fish, fresh from JAPAN!!! Very, very good!

review.title: Good Place
review.reviewText: Went there for Macworld, room was nice, very clean good service.

review.title: Book an Imperial Club room
review.reviewText: We got a package from Expedia for air fare plus a week's stay in an Imperial Club double. A great deal. The Imperial club room comes with complimentary breakfast (an excellent American buffet including Japanese selections [Miso soup, etc.]), complimentary happy hour at a pleasant private lounge (gratis beer, wine, cheese'n'crackers: you can eat there and socialize or take back to your room), and complimentary use of the pool and gym. All this amounts to considerable savings. Excellent views from this level (we were on the 24th floor). Roomy and clean. Terrific location two blocks from the cable car lines, and close to everything. You just can't go wrong here.

review.title: Many good things to recommend and a few drawbacks
review.reviewText: Great location and good service. Staff tried hard to make one happy.

review.title: Would book at Nikko again
review.reviewText: Great Bar and Friendly Staff

review.title: Going back in March
review.reviewText: Excellent Hotel

review.title: Would definitely go back again!
review.reviewText: It was in a great location and a very beautiful and clean hotel. The staff was very helpful. I would definitely go back again!

review.title: Fantastic San Francisco! Loved it!
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an excellent location for exploring the city. We booked all our trips via the conceirge who was extremely helpful. We ate once in the restaurant 'Anzu' which was good but expensive, although watching the sushi chef was amazing.

review.title: Great place for all!
review.reviewText: Consistently impresses at reasonable rates. Due for a re-do soon though. Very clean but needs an update in the rooms. Excellent service! Highly recommend!

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText: We originally made a reservation directly with the Hotel Nikko but cancelled this when we found a better deal, including flights, through Expedia. We had an Imperial Club room on the 23rd floor which was spacious and very well equipped. The room included complementary buffet breakfasts at the excellent Anzu restaurant and cocktails each evening in the lounge. There is free WiFi, but if you don't have your laptop, there are 2 computers with free internet access in the lounge. There have been some critical comments about the condition of the hotel - all we can say is that our room left nothing to be desired and overall, the hotel and staff were all excellent. Can't think of any negative comments because there are none.

review.title: Modern Tranquil Hotel with a Japanese Flair
review.reviewText: Good location, close to theaters and just a few blocks from the stores on Market St., the Powell St. station and a cable car line. Large open lobby with water feature suggests the quiet, peaceful atmosphere of this modern hotel. I had a nice quiet air-conditioned room on the 15th floor. The room was a good size - not huge - but I never felt cramped. Every room has a lighted door bell, which is a nice touch when service or guests arrive. Pushbuttons in the room set the light outside to red for "do not disturb" or green for "please make up room." The modern bathroom had a vessel sink. The bed was very comfortable. A minor annoyance was the fancy alarm clock, which was way too difficult to program. (I like to set the clock in addition to the wake up call.) I was working in my room (wireless high-speed internet for a fee), and I used room service a lot. The food was very good. I tried some Japanese specialties. The service was super-fast. Starbucks is also accessible from the lobby. The service throughout the hotel was friendly and professional. I had stayed in other older smaller hotels in the area, and I will definitely be going back to the Nikko.

review.title: I wish all hotels were like this
review.reviewText: Great hotel. We got a suite because our booked room was not available. Room was beautiful, staff super helpfule and nice

review.title: hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: everything was great

review.title: Avoid Disappointment and Disrespect by Avoiding the Nikko
review.reviewText: For an allegedly four-star hotel, the Nikko struggles to meet the level of comfort standard I have experienced at two-star motel. The initial room I was given looked nothing like the pictures and did not match the Expedia description. It consisted of a long hallway back from the door back to a cramped, undecorated (no pictures, no wallpaper), starkly lit room painted landlord-white and furnished only with the bed, curtains, a TV on a small stand, a desk, and a small bedside table. (No chairs, no reading lamps.) It felt (and echoed) like vacant commercial office space. I later learned that the staff referred to this as an airline-room because it was usually used by flight crews crashing for a few hours. We asked if anything else was available and were shown a couple of just OK, but way not four-star rooms. (Presumably the rating has to do with the large glass showers that overpower the bathroom space.) We took one and were nickeled-and-dimed a small nightly fee for the change. I soon learned that this was part-and-parcel of a culture of disrespect for the customer. For instance, when we ordered the old-fashioned-Quaker-oatmeal for breakfast we were surprised to find it had been made with apple juice rather than water (making it a kind of slushy). We politely registered out surprise to the waitress who treated us like we were insane for thinking oatmeal came any other way and refused to change our order. I could go on, but you get the idea.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed staying at the hotel. It was in a convenient location and was nice and modern with a comfortable bed. Rooms are a little small even with an upgrade but we didn't spend that much time in the room other than to sleep.

review.title: Dead center located, Charming and well equiped
review.reviewText: Nikko Hotel is located downtown, by the Streetcar, by the Shoping centers, by Union square, on top of a Starbuck and surrounded by breakfast restaurants. Fisherman Wharf? It is at 20 mins in "bus" taking line F. What else do you want??? The hotel is also well equipped to work out and the Jacuzzi & Sauna do work well. Also, it has 6 high speed elevator, lobby to tenth floor in 20 seconds taking into account the waiting time for the elevator - It is so great not to have to wait endlessly to go back to rest !!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: The only gripe I had was that my Maid service light was broken and she skipped me the first day. A quick call to the desk fixed that promplty. That and tthe TV in the bathroom mirror is mounted behind the faucet. Bad planning.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: Nice room, kind of small, but comfortable beds, free New York Times, and overall clenliness. Close to very good local resturants, but can be hassled by panhandlers and homeless, particularly at night, but this of course is not the hotels fault. The gift store kept odd hours, but the staff was very courteous and professional. Very satisfied

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: Excellent

review.title: Great stay as always
review.reviewText: I've stayed here a few times and always stay here when I come to SF. The service is great, the prices are reasonable, the location is great. It's not the most upscale hotel, but I definitely feel luxury here and comfort.

review.title: Well located and comfortable
review.reviewText: It has a good gym; the hotel staff are very kind and it is very well located, near shops and convention center.

review.title: Services professional and efficient. Convinient location.
review.reviewText: Very nice except for the restaurant wich is fine but not outstanding as its website proclaims to be.

review.title: very impressed, excellant location
review.reviewText: very friendly from moment we arrived.breakfast is very good in the ANZU restaurant.Location is central and very near to shopping centers and restaurants.

review.title: Can be a good deal.
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at the Nikko and though it is comfortable with little touches that remind one of Japan, I doubt I'll be back. Despite being upgraded to the Nikko Floor, I was not impressed by the furnishings, which seemed strangely dated (and the faucet in our bathroom seemed precariously attached, making us nervous with every use).

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: My friend and I were greatly impressed with the hotel staff, room and amendities offered by Hotel Nikko while on a recent trip to San Francisco. We were booked into a junior suite and therefore I cannot speak to the quality of other rooms at the hotel but I was very impressed with our room and the attentiveness of the staff!

review.title: Great hotel,.
review.reviewText: We stayed 4 nights in the Nikko and the hotel was lovely, the staff very helpful. The hotel is close to all amenities, and as we did not have a car all the buses, trains were close by. Shopping was good too. We enjoyed our stay in San Francisco.

review.title: Peace of mind in downtown SF
review.reviewText: The Nikko was a very pleasant experience; the lobby is bright and spacious, front desk service was friendly and efficient, and the rooms were clean, well designed and appointed. Stayed in a premium king size room...room size was not that big but not cramped either...cozy. Overall has a relaxing atmosphere due to the well appointed furniture and bathroom using nice contemporary designs and light color/texture combinations. Hotel has great location very close to Union Square. Will definitely stay again!

review.title: Nice suites
review.reviewText: The suites were spacious and clean. We got the 1.5 bath suite which was great with 2 kids. There was comp. breakfast in the morning and wine & cheese in the afternoon. The location was great - about 1.5 blocks from Union Square and 2.5 blocks from the end of the cable car line. It was walking distance to Chinatown as well (if you don't mind walking uphill). Nice place - we would use it again.

review.title: Hotel Good From Sun-up to Sundown
review.reviewText: I decided to treat myself to a nice time in S.F. and stay at the Nikko. When I checked in, they immediately offered me an upgrade that actually wasn't that much more money that included free internet service, which I was going to use, free breakfast in their restaurant Anju, which is one of the best deals in town with their mix of Japanese and American breakfast items, and a larger room in the Nikko Suites section which included a few extra amenities. (Though I never got the robe and slippers next to the bed, which I had gotten the last time I was there, for some reason I didn't miss it and never called the desk on it.) The wide screen TV was persnickety at times but I didn't watch it that much anyway. Great Time.

review.title: S. F. Experience
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is a beautiful and beautifully appointed hotel in a great location just off Union Square. Loved the hotel with two exceptions. First they charge you to use a computer in the business office and secondly it took a while to get a taxi in the evening even using the doorman. Otherwise the hotel is a four star experience.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was good. Clean rooms, good service and located close to union square. We would certainly stay here again.

review.title: Small Rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is in a great location and rooms were clean and nicely decorated. However, I don't think I have ever been in a smaller hotel room before. Even though it was only overnight, my husband and I felt very cramped. At least we had a big bathroom. Our son's room was small also, but he had a really small bath. Overall, I would not stay here again. To many better rooms in San Francisco.

review.title: Don't plan to go back
review.reviewText: The valet and bell service were great. It was nice to have Starbucks and shopping so close. We had problems with the room service orders both mornings and the front desk was not willing to resolve anything upon check out.

review.title: Style and comfort
review.reviewText: I spent four days at Nikko and everything was excellent. Great location, great staff and very reasonbly priced.

review.title: I would recommend the hotel to anyone.
review.reviewText: Top notch service, cleanliness, amenities, staff & a quick elevator. Rooms are well decorated. Great location.

review.title: Not As 4 Star As I Hoped
review.reviewText: This hotel had a beautiful lobby and a great restaurant. The beds were incredibly comfortable and they had a big nice flatscreen. The maid service was less than fabulous. They only did partial cleaning, didn't completely make the bed, didn't fold towels... I thought it was kind of odd and it made me feel like the room wasn't very clean because the maids weren't thurough. Some of the fixtures were old and needed updating. I felt you could find a much better value than what was paid to stay here.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We stayed in the club lounge room which gives you access to the gym ,indoor pool breakfast and club lounge . The beds were so comfortable. The club lounge was fantastic , bottled water and apples help yourself plus internet and 5pm happy 2 hours with good quality wine ,soft drink , cheese and biscuits .. great value. The hotel , mostly business people staying and within walking distance to shops and cable car.

review.title: Comfortable and convenient hotel
review.reviewText: Great location and comfortable room. We celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary here August 11th, 2008. Shopping, cable cars and nice walking all nearby.

review.title: Like the hotel location, can get to almost every where around SF by bus
review.reviewText: Hotel staff is very courteous/professional and I was able to check0in early, since my flight got in early.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: For a slightly higher rate we chose a room with a king size bed and it was relatively spacious

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Accommodations, health club and access to city couldn't be better.

review.title: Nice Polite and expensive
review.reviewText: We had a really good time in SF but every little detail were extremly expensive (minibar, internet, parking) The will not help you if you need to change currencies. Very orientated to japanese customers.

review.title: East Meets West in Exceptional Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is San Francisco is exceptional. If possible, book a room on the Imperial floors, 23 or 24. While they are showing a slight hint of needing a little sprucing up, they are still excellent. Bathroom are particularly luxurious, even tv in the mirror. The swimming pool is one of the finest indoor pools I've used. The morning buffet is excellent, exceptionally fresh and tasty, catering to both American and Oriental tastes. Great location and professional, friendly staff. Nice amenities everywhere.

review.title: Great Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very good hotel and great location for the price. Service was flawless and hotel staff was very helpful and courteous. Would stay there on future trips to San Francisco.

review.title: High quality hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed for 5 nights and therefore had plenty of time to experience the comfort and quality of the hotel. The concierge was very helpful with tips for dining and directions. The rooms are very clean and in good (but not perfect) condition. The hotel is located very conveniently for both shopping and dining. Would consider going there again.

review.title: Nice Place, Good Value
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Nikko over Labor Day.We had prepayed for a deluxe king room, but upgraded to the "Nikko" level when we got there. The extra money bought us a higher level room with a 42" flat screen, breakfast buffet for two people each day wireless internet access, and use of the pool and gym. It was worth the upgrade. Hotel was clean and bed linens were upgraded. Bathroom was very nice with a frameless glass shower , and separate tub with massage shower. Right by Union Square and the Powell St cable car. Lots of street people near the hotel. Has a Starbucks attached to the lobby.

review.title: The Best in the city by the bay!
review.reviewText: The Nikko San Francisco is a haven of sophisticated luxury with an Asian flair. It's located near anything and everything, from shopping to dining, that one could possibly want in the city by the bay!!! We loved it and will stay there again!

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: Gteat location and overall nice hotel! We were very pleased with the expedia price we paid. Good value!

review.title: Hotel sadly neglected
review.reviewText: What was once a very nice hotel ... now has gone downhill suffering from neglect and no attention to important details expected of a higher class Hotel. We had an "upgraded?" room on the top floor which would have had a wonderful view if the window had not been filthy and crusted in dirt ... the window shades were worm and torn and the bed skirt was inexcusively wrinkled and unsightly. Chairs in the lobby were also threadbare and marble floors in entrystairway were stained badly. We were doubled billed for a massage in the spa and the reception desk made us feel like we had made a mistake even though we had all our reciepts with us. The Manager promised to call back but didn't and I was put into an endless "message system" loop when i tried to call back. The one bright note was the buffet breakfast and restaurant staff.

review.title: We loved the Hotel Nikko!
review.reviewText: I happened upon Expedia's offering of 30% off an Imperial Club floor room (Floors 22-24) at the Hotel Nikko including comp. breakfast and evening beer,wine,soda, etc. This was the nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in - spacious, clean, modern, quiet, great bathroom (with a TV screen built in to the wall mirror!) We received two coupons per person per day for the hotel's breakfast buffet (normally $20 pp.) Since there were four of us, some days we ate from the continental bkft offered in the 23rd floor lounge, other days all 4 of us ate at the restaurant buffet. I can't emphasize how nice it was having access to the 23rd floor lounge. All the staff were excellent. The hotel location was perfect, a block off Union Square, two blocks from the Market Street "F" Streetcar which takes you down to the Ferry Building and along the piers to Fisherman's Wharf. If you find a good deal on an Imperial Club floor room, like Expedia got for us, grab it. We can't wait to come back!

review.title: Great hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: Our 6 night stay was fabulous! The hotel was clean, everyone was friendly, it was a great location (couple blocks from everything), the beds were comfy, bathrooms nice & clean. The concierge was amazing. So, so helpful as far as public transporation goes and where we should visit. We ate at the restaurant and it was good, but expensive. Not quite my type, but I'm not complaining. Hotel Nikko is definetly a great place to stay in San Fran!

review.title: Overall Pretty Good
review.reviewText: Even though our stay was only for one day, we enjoyed it. We arrive hours earlier than the check-in time, but the room was ready and we were checking in, which was a relief. We had the Imperial Room and though it was not very big it was very nicely decorated. The view was spectacular and the bathroom was almost as big as the actual room. Only "bad" things were; only 1 bathrobe was given plus not enough towels and I wish the movies on demand would have been HD for the price we paid. Valet is definetly worth paying for, if your planning trips outside the city but the location is convenient for public transportation.

review.title: Great place to go!
review.reviewText: We were so pleased with our stay at Hotel Nikko! They have amazing service and a beautiful building. We can't wait for the next time we travel to San Francisco so we can stay there again!

review.title: Excellent stay in the heart of downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had an excellent stay in this bright and modern hotel in the heart of down town San Francisco. Located only minutes from Union Square and the cable cars we had a spacious room which was very well appointed. Highly recommended.

review.title: I fell in love with San Francisco and Hotel Nikko!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was stylish and comfortable. The concierge was able to make great recommendations based on what he thought was more our style and he was dead on! Another bonus is that it's walking distance from Everything (and the trolley cars are one block away) and there's a Starbucks on-site!!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel just two blocks from Union Square and two blocks from Market street. Staff is extreme courteous. Concierage was very busy and I couldn't utilize their services as a result. Room was comfortable, clean.

review.title: Unecesary extra charges
review.reviewText: my stay was great. the extra expenses for things that should be inlcuded like using pool $10.00 using wireless internet 10.00 using gym 10.00 it was prety ridiculus i didnt like that. also the food there is supper expensive. i orderred room service. a small pizza, soup, and 4 pieces of cal roll sushi and my bill was 100.00. i was amazed. if motel 6 can offer complimentary gym,pool and wireless internet i dont see my hotel nikko has to charge.otherwise my stay was pleasant i would stay here again.

review.title: Perfect San Francisco Location
review.reviewText: I brought my 10 year-old son with me for a "mommy and me" trip to San Francisco. He had never been to the city. We live in Las Vegas and our hospitality expectations are very high. Hotel Nikko was perfectly situated near everything we needed. The customer service levels were exemplary, the room was very clean - large bathrooms. My only recommendation would be to update the dresser/desk/nightstands as they are very old and not representative of the rest of the decor (bed, flat screen tv, etc.).

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, nice rooms and well located to all the shops, sights and travel routes. Give the breakfast a miss and go to one of the many nearby cafes which are excellent - Tads Steakhouse or Loris Diner.

review.title: 'Never wanted to leave!'
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko is a wonderful destination for anyone travelling to San Francisco. The concierge package we purchased was great. It included a daily delicious breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant and the use of the concierge private lounge with daily afternoon beer and wine and hors d'eouvres, computers, newspapers, library, etc. The whole experience was delightful!

review.title: Nikko
review.reviewText: Nikko hotel is in a great location for tourists. In general it was clean and new looking. Sometimes you could hear the next door slam when they opened their front door or bathroom door.

review.title: Loved It!
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay on my vacation. The staff was wonderful and the service was great.

review.title: Nicw but watch the hidden costs
review.reviewText: The hotel was first rate. what i didn't expect was to get charged for the use of the pool and fitness facility. Local phone calls charges were ridiculous. Parking was extremely pricey. WiFi DAILY charges were equivalent to cable internet MONTHLY charges.

review.title: Good location, with small rooms for families
review.reviewText: Great location; weird to see bathrooms as big as the room. As a result, the room size was small when it had a king bed. Staff were friendly however. At times, conceriege was overloaded with requests. They could have more people manning the desk.

review.title: In Imperial club it is a pretty good
review.reviewText: a good cityview, a good food, a good....

review.title: close to union square
review.reviewText: good for the price

review.title: Nice Upscale Hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent service; nice, large room.

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: All expectations were met. Don't touch the snack bar unless you are rich!

review.title: Good but Worn
review.reviewText: The beds at Hotel Nikko were great but the furniture was a bit worn and dated. Things were chipped or cracked. I could tell the place was fabulous when it was new but now it shows signs of age. The bathrooms were spacious and luxurious, better than the actual room.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Great staff & service. The beds are comfortable. Great view of San Francisco.

review.title: The quality of the service has gone down since 2000.
review.reviewText: It is called Nikko hotel but you do not get the service that you can get in Japan.

review.title: Has slipped in maintenance
review.reviewText: Great location, comfortable room, but maintenance and upkeep has slipped.

review.title: Hotel Nikko - an FRancisco dissapoints
review.reviewText: While the room was quite nice, the executive level wine was "headache" wine; the restaurant breakfasts were great. Thank goodness I didn't have to pay the $20 and the price was included in my room. Otherwise, the restaurant dinner prices may be OK for Japanese customers, but not me at upwards of $50 per person. The worst part is that they lost my bag at check in. My rook was not ready at 1:15PM and I returned at 4:30. My room was ready and the front desk told me my bags were in the room. They were not. I had to go to the concierge desk who tried the baggage storage. 10 minutes of waiting and no bags. It took an annoying 1/2 hour for the staff to locate and return my bags. The the problem was the mini bar. It was supposed to operate through a remote electronic connection. This was not working for the entire three days I was at the hotel and the bar was re-locked each day and would not open until I called the service desk and had an engineer visit the room with a screw driver to pry open the bar. This took a 1/2 hour each time. I finaly gave up on using the mini bar.

review.title: Great central location with access to public transportation.
review.reviewText: Very quiet and reasonably spacious room. Large, well-appointed bathroom with separate shower from tub. Front desk staff very pleasant and helpful. Concierge staff friendly but knowledge limited to normal tourist activities rather than more off-the-beaten path activities. Pool is swimmable but very shallow and there is a fee to use the hotel pool & gym. Easy access to all public transportation (2 blocks to BART, streetcar, Muni, & cablecars)and very close to all downtown shopping. Only downside is constant solicitation & panhandling on the streets.

review.title: Excellent stay at a reasonable price
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent in terms of its location, very close to Union Square and the shopping district, close to puclic transport, very friendly stuff, the room was very clean, nice bathroom, TV and bed. Good places closeby to eat.

review.title: Great hotel with great service
review.reviewText: We just got back from our stay at the Hotel Nikko. The location is great (just a block from the cable cars) and the quality of the rooms was good. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was modern and in good condition. The service from the staff was exemplary. Checkin time is 4pm in the afternoon but we arrived from the airport at 9:45 am and they offered us a room since they had one available. This was a refreshing and something unexpected in this day and age. The pool area is decent (although it's smaller than what's shown in the pictures) but we found that the pool is often filled with children in the afternoon and evenings and its tough to get laps done in the pool (due to the children playing in the pool) unless you go in the morning. As for downsides, the carpet was a little tired and the room was a bit small but I think this size room is common in a metropolitan downtown hotel. I disagree with the previous review about the water pressure in the shower. The showerhead is a rain-showerhead... it's supposed to be lower pressure to simulate what you would experience in the rain. This was a nice effect and the wife and I loved it. Overall, we loved the quality of the hotel, the location, and the great service from the staff and would definitely go back to this hotel in the future.

review.title: hotel
review.reviewText: we stayed in the little princess room which was perfect for us. The room was very comfortable but we found the cleaning staff did an ok job ... not bad but not what we would have expected from a hotel of this class. That being said if we come to San Francisco again we would stay here again for sure.

review.title: Amazing hotel, good price, excellent buffet breakfast, good views, nice amenities
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the center of Union Square. It is just around the corner from Union Square. The lobby is fantastic with marble everwhere. The breakfast buffet at ANZU was amazing. The sausages were delicious. It even has a Japanese breakfast which I didn't try, but looked interesting. The elevators were super quick, except they made a "ding" sound at every level, which can be annoying. The room that we stayed at had an obstructed view because of the Park 55 Hotel, but it was still pretty amazing. The carpet in the room had a massive dark stain, which needs to be either replaced or steam vacummed. The windows also had smudge stains from someone putting their faces on it. Housekeeping was fine otherwise, with plenty of towels. The bed was so comfortable and the sheets were super soft and fine. Stay on the Club level and get free access to the pool and jacuzzi.

review.title: Small swanky room is still a swanky room
review.reviewText: Everything about our stay at Nikko was exceptional and we only have gripes about two things. The petite Queen room felt very small though we got a great price for it so we really should just shut up about it. The other item is the homeless population around the hotel that aggressively ask for change the second you step outside. Hardly the hotel's fault though but it was a huge pain if you're staying at Nikko. They also would hang out in the hotel Starbucks for hours on end after buying an item. Something else that

review.title: Nikko Floor
review.reviewText: The views were great from our room on 21th floor. The king bed was very comfortable!! The service was very good too. It might be little pricey but that what you get to have the city views of San Francisco.

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was very nice. Our room was smaller than expected but was clean and comfortable. We especially enjoyed the health club and spa.

review.title: Could be so much better
review.reviewText: I had not one but two reservations for this hotel. One was for my mother a smoker. I requested a smoking room for her. I conformed it the week before. I conformed it the night before and you guessed it....arrived and there was no smoking room available. Then they put her on a floor seven floors away from me so I had to go to my handicapped mothers room every few hours, walk her downstairs and assist her back to her room just so she could have a cigarette. They eventually changed her room but that was also not convenient as it required repacking and unpacking again. Many of the rooms face the setting sun so the windows have sun shades on them. Forget about any napping between 2 and 7 pm. No turndown service even on the "Imperial Floor" which apparently was also the kids lounge and the Japan Airlines crew waiting area. All in all a disappointment

review.title: nice location shame about the sheets!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was in a great location for shopping and restaurants and night life in san fran but the hotel lacked that welcoming feel. Staff not overly helpful or friendly and the room was a little tatty especially the bedding. We had to complain about the rubber sheet over the mattress firstly because it was uncomfortable and secondly, on inspection it was covered in old pee stains which made us feel quite sick !!! Took them ages to take it off and we had to sleep without a matress protector.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: Hotel staff extremely helpful. Location superb. I was travelling with my daughter and we felt very safe in the hotel and surrounding area. Will definitely stay here again

review.title: excellent
review.reviewText: clean rooms and reliable service excellent value restaurant is expensive but reasonable dining opportunities nearby the water pressure of the showers could be stronger

review.title: Great hotel and Great Location
review.reviewText: Very nice, comfortable hotel in a great location. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: Consistently excellent service, great rooms, great location...this is my favorite San Francisco hotel.

review.title: Fantastic location for shoppers.
review.reviewText: If you are in San Francisco to shop this hotel is in a fantastic location. Macy's is so close you can nearly touch it from your room!

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: We had a fantastic room that was constantly getting cleaned with turndown service. The location was right near union square and not far from other attractions. Plus, the breakfast in the morning was nice before a day of sightseeing.

review.title: Hotel was awesome!
review.reviewText: I have never stayed at a better hotel. The complimentary breakfast of miso soup, rice, and fish was probably my favorite thing. Everyone there was so nice, and I truly felt like a guest. If I return to San Francisco, I will definitely stay there again.

review.title: Perfection!
review.reviewText: This hotel is fantastic. The service is consistent and top notch from the housekeeping staff to the bellmen to the front desk to the servers in the restaurant. Beautiful accomodations and very well kept.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: It's more like a business hotel. Not the best for leisure or romance. However the hotel has a Good location, close to everything.

review.title: More than what you pay for.
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel in May 2008. After checking in I went to my room (deluxe king). I thought the room was somewhat small and asked for another. After viewing several rooms I realized that I already had the best one. The bathroom was nicer with the seperate shower and tub. The bed was also very comfortable. The hotel was very clean.

review.title: Great located Hotel
review.reviewText: I have enjoyed my stay in this hotel, location is great. Room was very small but ok for 1 person. Walls need to be repainted asap.

review.title: A good time by all!
review.reviewText: San Francisco what a town! And what a hotel! Soft beds, excelent service. Amazing food in and just around the corner! The cabel cars are in easy walking distance from the hotel. Mass transit will take you everywhere you want to go! The subway is something like 3 blocks from the hotel!!! What a great hotel and great location!!!!

review.title: not as great as I expected
review.reviewText: The staff & service at the Nikko were fantastic, but the bed was not very comfortable. I was expecting more based on the number of stars & the price, although the room was a decent size for SF and the bathroom was very nice. I travel to San Francisco several times per year for business, and this was definitely one of the better hotels I've stayed at.

review.title: Particularly courteous staff
review.reviewText: The Hotel is lovely and the staff especially courteous. I was really impressed with the touches like orchids everywhere and very polite helpful staff. Be aware of extra fees - health club for example. But only small fee so no big deal. Also, like most hotels now they put that "complimentary water" in the room with a way too high price if you so much as move it! But seriously - really really lovely people - from front desk to waiter and waitress at breakfast. Speaking of food - quite a breakfast buffet - and unlike previous reviewers I liked the food. The Asian Chicken soup - a good late night room service order was fantastic. The Hotel is in good location IF you walk away from the "Tenderloin" way - which we messed up and did first day. But the Chinatown way and towards the hills lovely. Concierge was really really helpful and gave us great directions to get around. Enthusiastic and friendly. I would stay there again for sure. Very nice. I liked the open feeling - the calm un-hectic vibe.

review.title: Hotel Information
review.reviewText: My boyfriend and I enjoy our stay at the Nikko Hotel, we receive great service. All the Nikko employees were very helpful and made our stay enjoyable. The only complaint was the $45.00 day parking fee, which is the cost for all downtown hotels. This was a surprise to us, but we were able to fine parking at the meters for our enterer stay at the Nikko. Thanks

review.title: Quality and comfort
review.reviewText: It's what I expected from a 4 star hotel in downtown San Francisco, and I was pleased with the experience.

review.title: Long SF Weekend
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine. Well located for out-of-towners. Decent hotel bar to hang out for casual drinks.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Good location. However, the hotel staffs keeps providing basic services, a lots of room for improvement.

review.title: Nice hotel but wouldn't go back
review.reviewText: The Nikko was a very nice, well kept hotel and we had a good conceirge. The things I was disappointed with in the hotel had a lot to do with the price of items they charged for in the hotel. The number one complaint I had was why any hotel charges $10 or anything for that matter to use their swimming/exercise area. I've never paid good money to stay at a hotel and then had to pay if I wanted to sit in the hot tub or go swimming. The number two complaint, which is probably tied with my number one complaint was the water pressure in the shower, there was none. When the water doesn't even make it to you there's a problem. Don't even consider eating at this hotel as a cheeseburger and fries were $18!! Maybe if you're from one of the coast's then you might be used to paying this, but an extremely expensive meal to me for a Cheeseburger and fries is around $10 (roughly twice as much as I normally pay). As far as for a business side complaint they charge $13 a day for internet, another ammenity that you get for free at a Super 8 even. We also placed items in our refrigerator that were taken out. Later we did see that our refrigerator in our room essentially wasn't for personal use or they could charge us for what was put in there, unlike any normal hotel. This was the first "4 Star" hotel we've ever stayed in and if this is how they all are, I'll never stay in one again.

review.title: Clean and quiet
review.reviewText: The Nikko is pefectly located, within walking distance of shops and restaurants, yet the room felt like an oasis of tranquility away from city noise. The room was small but impeccably clean. I was on the Nikko floor where I had free internet access. The room was equipped witha nice flat screen TV and a CD player. The bathrrom was again impeccably clean. The bed was super comfortable and the hotel restaurant was very nice. I would absolutely go to the Nikko again when in San Francisco. The price was very reasonable considering what I got.

review.title: Very Impressed with customer service
review.reviewText: Their customer service is great.

review.title: Fire Alarm
review.reviewText: The fire alarm was going off for 2 hours until 11 PM. Everything else was fine, but that tainted my trip.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Good hotel, close to Union Sq and everything you want to see. Hotel could use some work - paint and carpets are tired.

review.title: Really great hotel and great location
review.reviewText: A really good hotel and location for exploring San Fran. About 2 blocks from Union Square, Powell Street and shopping mall. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Would certainly stay again on visiting San Fran.

review.title: Great stay after a shaky start
review.reviewText: On booking in the hotel had messed up our reservation. We were given a double bed room for 2 adults and a child. This took a while to sort out and we had to move rooms after the first night to get what we needed. After this the hotel was excellent. We paid for the Imperial Club and this was worthwhile. The room was excellant and clean and the leisure acalities good. For grown ups the downtown area was excellant. Having said this with children if I went again I would stay in the Fishermans Wharf area. Overall though we got good value from this hotel,

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText: This is a lovely hotel. The room was fantastic, very clean and spacious. The bed in particular was amaizing. Great location also, right next to bars, restaurants and shops.

review.title: Serenity in the city
review.reviewText: Our room was understated and serene, with tons of pillows on the bed, European-style bedding, responsive climate control, a flat-screen TV on the wall, and an elegant sink area in the bathroom. Unlike other comments about this hotel, I found the room relatively spacious for a city hotel. The desk staff were helpful and the lobby was calm and quiet. I not only would stay here again, I will look for Nikko hotels in other cities I visit.

review.title: San Francisco Vacation
review.reviewText: Great Location. 2 Blocks from Union Square. 2 Blocks from trolley stop. Within walking distance to China Town. Rooms were a little small but very clean and modern. Bathroom was beautiful and spacious. O Farrelys next door has a great dueling piano bar in basement.

review.title: GREAT LOCATION
review.reviewText: We found the Hotel Nikko a very good hotel for our purposes. I am grateful that Expedia has some offerings with 5-star establishments like the Nikko. The giant screen TV was great for viewing films. Everything came with a cost though, except the daily newspaper.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, great hotel. Exactly where we needed to be in the city, and we had a really good deal through expedia. View from the room wasn't the best, but then for the money we paid - i couldn't complain about that! Would definately reccomend staying here, and if we go back to San Fran then this'll be the first place i check out for deals.

review.title: I think the quality corresponds to the price.
review.reviewText: I think the room is a little bit small, but ingeneral the service was really good.

review.title: very nice - recommend it.
review.reviewText: Very convenient

review.title: wonderful view, One of San Francisco's finest
review.reviewText: Loved the room, Very private and quiet. Staff were helpful and welcoming

review.title: Will be back to Nikko !!!
review.reviewText: After booking my reservations, I read so pretty negative reviews on Expedia and started to get a little worried. However I was completely satisfied with my room, the hotel and everything about it. The employees were always attentive. I know that unhappy customers are much liklier to complain than happy ones are to rant and rave so I wanted to make sure I put in my two cents worth. Nikko is STILL a beautiful hotel !!!!

review.title: Would definitely stay at Hotel Nikko Again
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel Nikko from March 15th to 19th, 2008. We were very pleased with the hotel in terms of comfort and location. The location was excellent as it is close to Union Square and close to lots of shopping and restaurants. It is also a block away from the cable car station. There is a Starbuck's and Enterprise Rental Car on site which we used making it very convenient. Room was spacious and beds were comfortable. Large washroom with separate tub and shower.

review.title: Very impressive
review.reviewText: Impressive does not come cheap. you have to pay to use the business center. however they will provide you with whatever you may need. great location, very nice, will be a repeat customer.

review.title: great location and views
review.reviewText: Womderful lobby, rooms and views but furniture and bathrooms fairly shabby and outdated ... in dire need of remodel and refurnishing. Staff were effiecient and business like but not very friendly. Never the less had a very enjoyable stay.

review.title: 4 stars? Maybe on a scale of 1-10...
review.reviewText: The positive: Nice linens. Yes, there is a 42 inch plasma, but nothing broadcasts in HD so it looks awful. They have a gym, but you pay $10 pp per day. I wouldn't have minded except the equipment was in disrepair (especially the 2 ellipticals)and no one is around to help. Great concierges. Which was good because all the interesting things that drew me to the hotel were discontinued and I needed their help to find replacements. The hotel is no longer particularly Japanese. They don't have shiatsu massage rooms any more. The concierge will set up in-room massages for you, but it is very tight. We had a couple's masssage; one girl was very good, the other just ok. The restaurant is supposed to be japanese/european, featuring a japanese breakfast, etc. They have one $29 bento box that is so Americanized it is a joke. SImilar issues with the sun brunch. The milkshakes mentioned in many reviews are now off the menu. Housekeeping went insane and moved my stuff around so much that I spent 10 minutes looking for my pocket knife (went from nightstand to far under the bed). My $30 eyeliner that was in the bathroom was never located. No turndown. Phone buttons like "wakeup" and "concierge" don't work, you have to wait forever for the front desk to answer and transfer the call. Overall, the place would be fine for a 3 star. It is no way a 4 star. I did not complain because I got it cheap thru expedia. If I paid anythign close to rack rates I would have been furious.

review.title: good place to chill
review.reviewText: nice , clean , quiet. the rooms and nice and the bed was great. plasma tv's in the rooms. totally happy .

review.title: Solid value for San Francisco
review.reviewText: Downtown San Francisco hotels are notoriously expensive but with its great location and the great service, the Nikko is an enjoyable place to stay. Like in pretty much all other San Francisco hotels the rooms are small and cramped but they make the best of it with nice decor and space-saving plasma TV screens. Overall a pleasant, friendly and clean stay. If you arrive by car, be prepared for a hefty parking fee!

review.title: A nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Although i stayed in the petite queen room, the bed was awesome , very comfortable. nice view. no down sides except if you want to use the pool now and you are not staying above the 23rd floor you have to pay a $10 service charge. usally the pool is free in most hotels even motel lodges. I dunno, gotta make a buck somewhere since the rate i got was so awesome. Love the staff . Concierge had some so-so picks with the local restaurants. I think i might get a Zagat's before asking again. super clean , nice and quiet. overall a wonderful stay.

review.title: Nikko Feb 08
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel in the past and it is much more run down since I last stayed in 2004. The floor was dirty and the furniture was beat up a bit.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: Got a great deal from Expedia...hotel is clean and concierge services were awesome. Managed to check in early and the room, bed etc. were really comfortable. Contemporary style throughout...

review.title: This was one of the best choices in hotels that I've made!
review.reviewText: This hotel, aside from being beautiful it and of iteself, it's very centrally located, it's elegant without being pretentious, and it's incredibly comfortable. The best feature in the room was the amazing bed and the huge flatscreen TV which offered WebTV for a very reasonable price. I would recommend trying the Spa and Pool... very nice ammenities. I give this hotel a solid A!

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, small room but comfortable, Large screen Flat panel TV nice. Star Bucks attached to the Hotel convenient.

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText: Cramped room and slightly tired decorations/furnishings. Nothing wrong with the hotel but nothing special.

review.title: a great bargain in the financial district
review.reviewText: I stayed at Hotel Nikko for a work conference. The room was very nice, although the bathroom was a little outdated. The staff was wonderful and attentive, and the bed was very comfortable. If you need to stay dowtown and are looking for a good deal, I would recomend Hotel Nikko.

review.title: Beautiful Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was lovely and very conveniently located, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast buffet at Anzu, the hotel's restaurant, was first-class. My friends and I had a wonderful time all-around.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I paid extra for an Imperial Club room, only to find that while the bed was amazing, the bathroom was completely rundown. And we even had one of the nicer "separate bathtub and shower" ones. This hotel in definite need of renovation. Their pool and whirlpool were nice, but could use some work as well. The sauna did not work, and massages were "temporarily unavailable" during our entire 4 day stay. Although the staff was very friendly, I would not stay here again.

review.title: Best hotel i have stayed in, in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I have stayed in 5 hotels in San Francisco over the past 5 years and Hotel Nikko is the best so far, i up graded to a deluke king, and the room was very well layed out and equipped, the only 2 things i can use a down side it the fact you have to pay 10 dollars each person each day to use the hotel pool and gym unless you are staying in the top of the range rooms and also twice the house keepers came to make the room up late in the day, one day they knocked on the day at 6.30 in the evening and we were getting ready to go out for the evening and i had already rang for fresh towels, so we had to make do with the room as it was. Otherwise the hotel was very well located in walking distance for most things.

review.title: it's a great leisure.
review.reviewText: nice and clean hotel.

review.title: We are sure to stay this hotel for the next trip.
review.reviewText: Location is good.It is also convenient for transportation,sightseeing and meal.If we get a chance, we will come again.

review.title: Not impressive for a 4*
review.reviewText: The main entrance is very luxurious but as soon as you go into your room, you feel like stayin in a 2* hotel beside the big screen TV that has bad quality reception. The bathroom was not in good shape. The good point of this hotel is it is pretty quiet in the room even if it's right downtown and the bed is comfortable.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: good location

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: The room and bath were clean and pleasant. The room was quiet, and we had a nice view of the city. The bed was very comfortable. Great location, and lots of good restaurants nearby. I definitely recommend.

review.title: Always Trusted!
review.reviewText: It made our first day in SF an unforgettable one!

review.title: Great deal, ideal location, beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Nikko SF for just 1 night on Dec. 21st, 2007. We absolutely loved the hotel! The hotel was just 2 minutes away from Union Square, and had a wonderful view of the city from our room which was on the 17th floor. We didn't try their breakfast as it was way too expensive for us. We walked to a small breakfast place across the street from the hotel.

review.title: Great location for shows and dinner
review.reviewText: The Nikko was perfect for a weekend theatre trip. It was so convenient to just take a cab to from the airport and either walk or ride the trolley for the remainder of the trip. The theatre was one block away, and the trolley stop was just 2 blocks. The view was also amazing. We had a junior suite, which was worth every cent. Highly recommend.

review.title: Flabbergasted at charges
review.reviewText: Used to be a great placed to stay--now there is a charge to watch T.V., a charge to use the swimming pool or gym. Stingy on soap, bathroom amenities and burned out lightbulbs. Although they are very polite and courteous--there is always a problem with the room not being ready at check in time--or they offer you a different room than you have reserved. Has deteriorated from a four star hotel to a mercenary disappointment

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Our room was very clean, and very comfortable - we also go an upgraded room. I had to mention to the clerk who checked us in since it was mentioned on expedia. To be able to use Niko's facilities like the pool and exercise room there was an additional charge and the parking I found a bit expensive. I believe it should be included with your stay.

review.title: Friendly staff and great views of the city
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. It was very comfortable, we had a fantastic view over the Union Sq area of the city, the bathroom was lovely and the beds were very comfortable. Best of all the staff were so friendly and helpful: the concierges were very happy to book restaurants for us and the reception staff also looked after us well.

review.title: Great Location and more...
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at Nikko a great deal. If you want to stay in the Union Square area, this is a good hotel. I don't know why people say the bathrooms need to be re-done, my bathroom was fine - not uncomfortable in the least! Also, go to Cafe Mason for breakfast as someone else said - Great!

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko in San Francisco was excellent. We were in the Imperial rooms so took full advantage of the breakfasts and the evening wine/cheese. The pool was long enough to swim in. The staff were very helpful and the hotel was very central. We would go back again

review.title: My memories of the hotel were better
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, but the unique advantage it had ten years ago in terms of high end rooms, service are gone; may be the competition got stronger and I bacame pcikier (being 80 night s a year in a hotel); a parctularly bad feature was the smell of french fries in the bathroom; probbaly a bad air connections

review.title: Needs some renovation
review.reviewText: Nice location, nice staff,... but the room I stayed at needed some renovation, especially the bathroom that is out of date.

review.title: Avoid
review.reviewText: The hotel room smelled terrible; the bathroom and tub were covered in hair. The vents in the bathroom were covered with coagulated dust, and the bath tile had black mold. The hotel is in need of renovation.

review.title: Terrible Room Service
review.reviewText: The room service delivery was prompt but the food was marginal at best. The Kobe-style burger was a hockey puck and the rest of the offerings we tried were not much better. The hotel's location is terrific...and that's about it. When you walk in to the place you are wowed by the decor of the lobby and entryways - quite gorgeous and modern with television monitors built into the walls, interior fountains, marble etc. Unfortunately that's where it stops. Our room was dirty, the tiles in the bathroom dirty, some hair on the floor, cheap toiletry products (although nice ones for purhcase in the room), thin uncomfortable towels, no robes, flat screen tv was nice, no bench for luggage. Just not even close to worthy of a 4-star rating. Parking was $45 a day I think - very expensive but about what you can expect anywhere else in that neighborhood.

review.title: club level the best!
review.reviewText: The room was great, but the bathroom needed to be updated.

review.title: A little shabby for the price
review.reviewText: Good location. The public areas of the hotel are nice. The room was small and a little rundown.

review.title: Can't Wait To Go Back
review.reviewText: Courteous, Friendly Staff. Quick to address any problems. Imperial suite very nice.

review.title: Pleasant Stay
review.reviewText: My recent 4 night stay at Hotel Nikko was a very nice & wonderful experience. I upgraded to a bigger room, cause the standard room was a little on the small side. For a single guest it may have worked, but there was 2 people in my party. The bed was sooo comfortable, I sleep better than in my own bed. It was near to the shopping area and close to all the public transportation. No need for a car, public transportation is fantastic in this city.

review.title: Unimpressed for the pricepoint
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice overall, but carpet was old and stained and the walls needed a coat of paint. Otherwise the stay was nice, but for the pricepoint, I expected more...

review.title: An absolute find
review.reviewText: This hotel's accommodation exceeded expectations. We had a suite with panoramic views to the Oakland bridge . It was ideally located for sightseeing, a two minute walk from cable cars. An absolute find. I have no hesitation in recommending and would love to return to this hotel.

review.title: Really quality hotel
review.reviewText: Bed was very comfortable and great quality sheets and duvet. Nice light room. Not at all noisy.

review.title: Great location, comfortable bed, but the shower?
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, just minutes from the BART,great shopping, and the famous cable cars! The bed and the room were extremely comfortable. But, for a 4 star hotel, the shower was pathetic. Hardly any water pressure, I always felt like I could never get all the shampoo and soap rinsed off.

review.title: San Francisco's one of the best Hotel
review.reviewText: I am sure this is one of the best hotel in San Francisco! They have two types of rooms - One king size bed room and two beds room. Two beds room is a bit bigger, however one king size bed room was also comfortable for 2 people. There was a audio system and CDs in the room. You can enjoy romantic night!

review.title: Nikko good property - needs some fine tuning
review.reviewText: In arriving at the Nikko, you are greeted by an excellent valet, bus and front desk staff. The rooms are a bit stuffy with no available outside air and the decorations are nice but miss in the attempt to appear upscale. The regency level lounge is very poorly done with limited choices and times. The hotel would do good to look at the Grand Hyatt to learn how to run a top tier operation

review.title: Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: Really rundown. Tiny rooms. Will never stay there again

review.title: Extra charges for health club/pool
review.reviewText: If you think that hotels should provide certain amenities - health club and pool access in this case - Nikko SF is not for you. Nikko charges $10/day/person for access to health club and pool, even if you are a guest. This may make sense to some, but not me. I still think hotels should provide complimentary access to these facilities to guests. Will look elsewhere next time. Other details like location and cleanliness of room was acceptable. Great location, sure, but there are many hotels near Union Square. Room was clean but expectedly so for a hotel of this class, and a bit on the small side. All other things being equal, the extra charge for health club/pool was disappointing.

review.title: Baaaaad Service, but well located.
