review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for 03 nights. The check in was slow, I was told that the room was ready, but when I went upstairs, they were still cleaning it. But the really sad part was when the airline delivered my luggage and they simply lost it in the hotel !!! Not even I'm sorry was said to me. Actually, you can't expect much, because most of the staff can understand english, but I don't if they can speak ... It is well located, and clean. But, that's it.

review.title: Well located quality hotel
review.reviewText: Well presented, clean and tidy accommodation

review.title: WOW what a great city, great hotel
review.reviewText: Nikko is great hotel. From our Window you looked out to Macys, and Macys sits on Union Square the heart of downtown. The room had great views of the city, big windows. Climate control, 40 inch Plasma and great King Size bed. Did not eat at the restaurant, but did go in for drinks. Across the road is a 24hour café (Mason) that serves brilliant breakfasts. Irish Bar Foleys is also just across the road, and that was great with live music, good food, and lots to drink. Starbucks is located in the Lobby. Only thing that was odd, no safes in the rooms, you had to use the reception safety deposit boxes. $10 to use the pool/gym. My advise would be to stay in this area, the Pier area of the city is over commercialized and full of American tourists Things to do in the city, hire a bike and ride across the Golden Gate Bridge, a great experience. Muir Woods, and Yosemite Park are lovely places. Can not fault the Nikko really at all, we spent 3 weeks in the states and this was the best hotel we stayed in and would absolutely choose the Nikko the next time we go to San Francisco, just wish it had free Wi-Fi.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: Good Location

review.title: In the middle of everything
review.reviewText: We were near Union Square, many great restaurants. We will be back !

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel in a good location, union square is only 3 blocks away. Will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Awesome place to stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was great. The room was even better. It's clean, bright and was a good size. The big screen tv was a bonus and the bed was super comfortable. The hotel is close to everything in the downtown area and I would go back anytime. Staff were very helpful and polite.

review.title: Nice, Clean and very well Located.
review.reviewText: Nice, Very Clean and well Located.

review.title: Great location; Would go back to Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: Great location to trolleys and restaurants. Staff was extremely helpful in suggestions for places to see, restaurant recommendations and maps. Drove to Napa and Sonoma - very easy from hotel - about an hr's drive. Went to San Jose and drove up Route #1 up coast - spectacular views! We would highly recommend Hotel Nikko.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We had a large room, WC was separate from bathroom, which contained walk-in shower. Hotel is close to downtown. If youn use the pool, expect to have it to yourself. It's mean to charge $10 but lovely to have a swim. It's a decent size.

review.title: Excellent Hotel. Great Stay
review.reviewText: The Nikko in San Francisco was excellent. Great rooms, clean, very comfortable and stylish. The entire staff was very professional, courteous and very accomodating. Additionally, the hotel location was near everything. A great hotel.

review.title: Great location with nice amenities!
review.reviewText: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel, and I would continue to use this hotel on future trips to San Francisco. The location is fantastic (just a block and a half away from Union Square, cable cars, MUNI subway lines, etc), and the hotel is very nice. The room was comfortable and generally clean.

review.title: Good, clean Japanese-inspired hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby is standard, but the rooms are particularly nice. Not only are they clean, well-maintained and bright but their beds are to die for. They're quite possibly the most comfortable beds in the world. By the third night there were a few feathers floating around from the duvet and pillows - so maybe not the best choice if you're allergic to down. The TVs are big and flat-screen. The room service menu is pretty decent (a bit pricey) - the food from the restaurant below is amazing. I highly recommend it. Even for the price.

review.title: Great hotel at a great price and at a great location
review.reviewText: Very close to Bart (Powell St. station), cable car originating stop, all the buses, union square, and restaurants. Some streets near the hotel/union square/market street areas are not that safe, but I didn't have any problems. Great Japanese restaurant (Danjiwa? on O'Farrell St.) across the street from hotel.

review.title: Nice, quiet, clean, conviently located
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay very much.

review.title: Nikko SFO - DONT STA THERE - Worst hotel on plant earth!!
review.reviewText: This would be the worst hotel on the face of the earth. 1. Unless your Japanese,forget it - it is owned by Japan Airlines. 2. Very bad odurs in rooms and corridors. 3. You have to pay $10 per person,per day to use the pool and hot tub! 4. Not value for money 5. Still in the 80's.. Dont stay here, find somewhere else.

review.title: Great Hotel...I highly recommend it.
review.reviewText: Try the Sushi restaurant in hotel Nikko called Anzu...delicious!

review.title: Will stay again!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was great! The location was awesome. We could walk to Union square and shop, go to our room and return to shop more without any difficulty. We were only a very short cab ride to the theater also. I think I had the best sleep ever while at Nikko too. The bed was wonderful!!

review.title: Excellenh hotel.
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel. An oasis of calm and luxury in a hectic city. Quality & decor of room and the hotel overall was excellent. The concierges were wonderful to deal with. Only blip were the computers in the Executive Lounge. When we reported them faulty we were offerred an alternative method to keep up with our e-mails. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel & would love to go back again.

review.title: Very crowded!
review.reviewText: Exceptional hotel! Very comfortable, nice staff, concierge was very helpful. This is in a location surrounded by shopping malls and stores and one block from cable car route, three blocks from F street car route. Very busy area , but convenient to get to anywhere you wanted to go!

review.title: highly recommended!
review.reviewText: A wonderfully comfortable hotel in an excellent location. Staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful.

review.title: Excellent experience!
review.reviewText: Fantastic location, attractive prices, small room but in very good condition. Nice eucalyptus and thyme shower amenities.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Fabulous hotel. Although the pool was good, we both like to swim, we did feel that the cost of $10 per person per day for use of the same was top heavy and should be inclusive for guests. We therefore did not swim as much as we would like to have done, because although it was per day, nobody wants to swim all day, and we do not use gyms.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel, excellent breakfast buffet, friendly service, clean rooms, super comfortable, great pool adn health club! I have nothing but positive things to say regarding this hotel. It's worth it!

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and comfortable

review.title: always business but great for pleasure best choice
review.reviewText: Hotel was very clean, centrally located and the staff treated us with the utmost hospitality. I am usually not so quick to give a great review but this place deserves and I would def. stay again for pleasure. Room had 2 queens in it which was nice. Didn't eat in the rest. but it was very busy and people seemed to enjoy it. To large conventions were at the hotel same time didnt see one person. I dont know how they did it but it worked. Def try it out.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is perfectly situated. The rooms are nice and tidy but we have one remark about the swimming pool. We had to pay an extra fee to enter the swimming pool! We think this is not possible for a hotel of that quality.

review.title: Great Place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: My son and I went on vacation to San Francisco for the first time and we picked the Nikko Hotel because rates were pretty resonable. Valet parking, internet service and the ANZU hotel resturant will leave your wallet at lot lighter. Also, the hotel hits your credit card to the tune of $200 for "incidentals" but doesn't tell you this at check in, so bear in mind you'll be out that money as well. The O'Farrell-Mason Parking Garage kitty corner from the hotel is cheaper by $10/day, and the walk is only a 1/2 block. Also a nice deli at the exit of the parking elevator with big sandwiches at cheap prices. Beds were very comfy, view from room was cool. Nice Starbucks downstairs. Great access to everything in the city, including shopping, Chinatown, cable cars and muni. Ate at hotel one night and it was not very good and very, very expensive. Found great diner up Mason street 1/2 block that was good and cheap. Got directions to Alcatraz Pier from concierge and she led us directly into the San Francisco Marathon and we almost missed our tour, so be wary of their advice. Lots of street people out front of hotel, so we started exiting out through the valet area which was a little better. All in all a great place but alot of extra costs involved. Would probably stay somewhere near piers in Fisherman's Wharf area next time.

review.title: very high standard
review.reviewText: we had a very enjoyable week at this hotel and were completely satisfied

review.title: A haven of peace and (almost) tranquility!
review.reviewText: Excellent hotel, quiet and peaceful, without the hordes of delegates that you get in the larger offerings around that area. Room was good, although it was showing some signs of wear and tear. Extremely comfortable beds! Anzu restaurant is very good, I reccomend the sushi bar too. All in all, a great hotel if you want quiet comfort in a fantastic location.

review.title: Responsive to problems
review.reviewText: The condition of my initial room assingment was sub-par, not befitting a four-star hotel. To their credit, the Nikko was responsive and rectified the situation immeditately, exceeding my expectations. I'll try them again on my next visit.

review.title: Even better than I had imagined
review.reviewText: I spent 7 nights at the Nikko and they were the best 7 nights sleep I've had in a long time..The bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on!!!! The room is a bit small but I didn't spend too much time in it so that didn't really matter..The toiletries they provide are awesome too!!! All of the hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful..The location was excellent..Everything was in walking distance and there are alot of great restaurants in the area...I plan on staying at Nikko again on my next visit to San Fran.

review.title: Excellent location - within 3 mins walking distance to Union Square, Powell Street and Market Street
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful staff. Checked us in at 07:00 in the morning even though their check in time is 3:00 pm. Room, although small for American standarts, is neat, comfortable bed, flat screen TV (that we never switched on). No outside noise whatsoever. I recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Elegant and clean hotel close to cable cars.

review.title: Might go back, but do more research
review.reviewText: The hotel was wonderful, but there was a fee for everything from using the pool to internet to parking (parking is outrageous). I'm not sure if all hotels downtown SF are like this, that is why I would do more research before staying at Nikko again. If all the hotels downtown were to be like this I would definitely stay here again. There is a considerable homeless problem downtown. Next time I might try to stay outside of town near a Bart station and use the bart to get around and rent a car so I can go see things outside of SF.

review.title: Just for Japanese people
review.reviewText: Yes they have internet but you need to pay for it Yes they have gym and swiming pool but you need to pay for it. If you think that pettit its the small room than you can imagine you are rigth. The concierge was upstanding congratulations

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: We had a super stay, close to great shopping and the cable cars. My only complaint is the $10 charge for the pool, Two kids swimming everyday adds up.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I would definitely go back! Service was excellent. We asked for a small fridge and they had one in our room almost within the 1/2 hour, same with our request for towels. We were able to control the temperature of the room. The room was very comfortable!

review.title: Excellent location, modern hotel
review.reviewText: We found this hotel to be a modern, well located hotel, a couple of blocks from Union Square, one block from cable car terminal. Clean, oriental feel, large rooms, well appointed. Good value.

review.title: Best Location
review.reviewText: Breakfast buffet was great. Anzu Restaurant is excellent. We walked everywhere, Westfield Shopping (Nordstrom and Bloomies)Center is 2 blocks away, Union Square is 3 blocks. Chinatown is walkable. Very close to the Powell St. Cable Car Station which takes you to Fisherman Wharf. We also walked 2 blocks to Curran Theatre to see 'Jersey Boys'. It was magnificent. Many great ethnic restaurants around the hotel as well.

review.title: San Francisco's Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Service was great, hotel personnel were polite and helpful. Food in the restaurant was excellent especially the sushi. We will definitely return. Richardd

review.title: Elegant lobby
review.reviewText: The hotel had an elegant lobby, and the concerieges were very helpful. The room was of average size, and the shower in the bathroom did not have great water pressure. Great downtown location, near all transportation

review.title: Great location; beautiful hotel with fabulous service
review.reviewText: We loved the Hotel Nikko! Service was incredible, the staff was so sweet, and we loved the location. I do wish the room had an easy chair to lounge in or something other than just the bed and desk chair, but that could be b/c we got a petite queen and so there was no room. Also, I'm surprised in this day and age, one can't either have a DVD player in the room or get one at the front desk to hook up. After full days trekking around SF and walking miles, sometiems we wanted to just hang and watch a movie at night. The room had a beautiful TV, but no DVD player. But oh well! It is SF; we should have been out clubbing, right?

review.title: BEWARE OF EXTRAS !
review.reviewText: We really enjoyed our stay at the Nikko (in particular we got a corner room with a wonderful view) to extras (even mentioned on the site - checked after our stay)which come very easily :use of the swimming pool is invoiced on a per guest/day basis, internet, etc. We did not expect to pay a dime at the Nikko for something which is offered for free in a Motel !

review.title: great hotel
review.reviewText: great for kids.

review.title: Great service but not sleep
review.reviewText: We recently spent four nights at Hotel Nikko in San Francisco, the hotel is clean, the staff is wonderful, Concierge was extremely helpful and added to our enjoyment with dinner tips and obtaining game tickets. The only negative is that the bed - petite queen suite with queen bed was extremely small, the bed was called a queen size bed but was small and short, sleep was not relaxing or restful and for that reason I would not recommend this hotel.

review.title: The bed was so comfy!
review.reviewText: First off..the bed was exactly as shown in pictures and as comfortable as you've imagined. We stayed in a deluxe King room on the 12th floor. It was an averaged sized hotel room with all the trimmings (fridge, hairdryer, iron/board, coffee machine) and a flat panel TV. The room was clean and probably better than average. The bathroom was clean but will need some touch ups soon to maintain a 4 star rating. Not a big deal, but things like the bottom of the bathroom door chipped, or the countertop scuffed up, etc. Although the weather was not hot during our stay (60s), we found the AC useful to help with the humidity. Beware travellers...the older hotels may not have AC, so if you must have it then ask the question before booking. It was at a great location and staff very friendly. Close enough to Union Square and shopping but just off to the side so there wasn't too much traffic. I felt safe walking back to the hotel at night. You could see a couple of homeless people asking for change but they were harmless. One thing though, if you are walking by yourself (or even in company) DON'T walk towards the tenderloin district on O'Farrell (I think that was the street). For about a 3-4 block stretch, it was definitely scankie and shady. I didn't feel safe. If you must walk in that direction, take a bigger street like Geary or hop on the bus (muni #38 takes you to and from Japantown on Geary for some great Japanese food at Japan Center). Overall, it was a great stay. I would go back.

review.title: Better than I expected!
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel to stay at. The front desk adn concierge were very helpful for us as traveling and sightseeing guests. They had many suggestions when we needed them. Our room was a corner room which gave us a small amount of space in teh actual room, but 2 full window walls - it was amazing! Room service was a bit pricey, but my husband and I were celebrating, so we splurged.... and finally the location was PERFECT! Right near the Bart/Muni station and easy to get anywhere we needed to go! We would certinaly stay here again! It topped off our trip experience!

review.title: would definetly go back
review.reviewText: excellent. very friendly

review.title: Good location, very upmarket feel to it - would use it again
review.reviewText: Modern, spacious hotel located near Union Square - very convenient for liesure or business. Rooms spotless and superbly decorated. Bathroom very typical of American 4 star hotels with bath and huge shower cubicle. Large flat-panel screen on the wall makes for very comfortable viewing and access to in-house information services. Only disappointment was no wi-fi access in bedroom for my PDA (although ethernet cable available for laptops at a charge) - wireless only accessible in lobby area.

review.title: Extremely good hotel!
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights here in early July and were very impressed by the service and quality of the hotel. The location is great really close to the shops and trams. The service was always excellent - we had a lot of trouble with delayed baggage and the hotel staff accomodated us with everything we needed in the mean time and even chased American Airlines on our behalf (who i wouldn't recommend especially if its not a direct flight!) This hotel is well worth a look but do remember that you will be charged extra for internet access in your room and the leisure facilities too!

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: My girlfriend and I were extremely happy with our stay at Hotel Nikko (July 2007). The location, the price, the friendly staff, this hotel has it all. The room was a touch small, but this wasn't much of an issue to us because we didn't spend a ton of time in the room anyway. I highly recommend Nikko to anyone looking to stay in a Union Square hotel!

review.title: Comfortable, cool decor, great hotel
review.reviewText: My husband and I enjoyed the Hotel Nikko. We liked the decor. Big screen TV, fridge, coffee, comfortable bed and blankets, very clean. Great locatiion near Union square, shopping and restaurants. Would definitely choose to stay here again when in San Fran.

review.title: Downtown location with uptown comfort
review.reviewText: The hotel Nikko, despite some high prices for room service/minibar, really is great for the traveller who wants location with luxury. The room was great, bathroom and tv especially, but my only criticism is the extra $10 charge for use of a (very small) indoor pool and gym

review.title: Great hotel, Great location
review.reviewText: I was extremely pleased with the hotel. It is close to everything. The hotel is extremely nice and extremely clean. The only downside is the super costly parking at a per day fee which I guess is typical for San Francisco.

review.title: The best!
review.reviewText: The rooms are perfect sized! The beds were fabulous! The people were very nice and always went out of their way to help in any way they could. The location of the hotel is also marvelous because it is accesible to all locations. I highly recommend this hotel!

review.title: VERY Disappointed with service
review.reviewText: If you are looking for good service, courtesy and respect from staff (and hotel rooms that function) this is NOT the hotel for you. Upon arrival we were made to feel like we'd just been scraped off the bottom of the receptionist's shoe. Not a good start. A couple of days into the stay came back to the hotel to find that key wasn't working. Called front desk, they didn't believe that it was broken so sent security. Long story short, after an hour of waiting around, they told us what we already knew - the door lock was broken and they couldn't fix it. They then made us move rooms. For wasting an hour and a half of our evening and having to move to another room (not an upgrade) we got a couple of tickets for a free martini in the hotel bar from the security guard! No-one else even came to speak to us about it. We complained again on departure only to be told to fill out a customer feedback questionnaire and mail it back to them!!! The only good thing about the hotel was a great concierge who made us some great recommendations and got us dinner reservations. In terms of quality, in the first room we were given the mini-bar was broken and couldn't be opened. In the second room the air conditioning rattled all night (we didn't have the energy to mess around with moving again!). If you are looking for good service, courtesy and respect (and hotel rooms that function) this is NOT the hotel for you.

review.title: Nikko is in a good spot
review.reviewText: Overall, the Hotel is good however some of the hotel staffs are not friendly and not helpful.

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Good central location within easy walking distance of excellent restaurants, bars and shops. Staff are helpful and friendly. Beds are very comfortable and rooms are competitively priced, but check on the price of parking; it was expensive. This was our second stay and we'll definitely be going back.

review.title: Nice Hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: Service was great, room was small & the fee for parking was horrible. With what you paid for parking & the room, they could have atleast allowed you to swim in the club for free. No, you had to pay for admittance to the health club facilities.

review.title: Nikko
review.reviewText: The hotel was just fine for us. My daughter and I didn't spend much time in the room but the TV was nice and the bed was very comfortable and it was cleaned very well everyday. The bathroom could use a reno but it was clean and big enough to be comfortable using it. The concierge service was more than I expected and I was so grateful for thier excellent and friendly service. My cell battery died so I had to use the hotel phone, 60 dollars for 2 calls is too expensive in my opinion, but that wouldn't stop me from staying here again. The location was good and the starbucks downstairs came in very handy.

review.title: The Hotel in S.F.
review.reviewText: I live out in vegas and know everything about hotels. Hotel Nikko in San Francisco is one of the best hotels around from service, cleanliness, and overall satisfaction. Definately would stay again AAA+++

review.title: 1st Time in S.F.
review.reviewText: It was a wonderful stay I would go back there it is in walking distance from hotel to Tolley Had a Blast

review.title: Would definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: Great location and facilities. Hotel staff was responsive, room was clean and well maintained for the most part. Also having a Starbucks in the lobby was a big plus, as was being a block and a half from Union Square. If the price is right, would highly recommend and definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Hotel for the First Time Visitor to San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Hotel was easy to find from the union square BART station. The hotel staff were friendly helpful and knowledgeable and made us feel welcome. The staff gave us great suggestions on dining, traveling about town and must see sites. The only negative thing I could say is that the spa/gym is extra if you want to use it. I thought that should be included in the price. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

review.title: Is a very good option. Very well located. Confortable
review.reviewText: I recomend it because we had a good experience.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: This is a great hotel. The only problem, as with all San Francisco hotels, is parking. $50 nightly for valet, which is the only practical choice.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and quiet. They were accomodating when we arrived at 11:00 and let us check into a very nice room. We were very pleased with the hotel and would stay there again when we go back to San Francisco.

review.title: Cramped and moldy
review.reviewText: The hotel was very nice at first. We got put into the wrong room first off. It was small and cramped. The bathroom had mold in the shower/tub. It took two days to get put into the correct room, which was more comfortable, but again the shower was moldy. There is a charge for every amenity i.e. pool--$10.00 a day, internet--$10.00. You would think at least the pool would be included considering the nightly rate was so high. It was not a bad hotel, but you have to get the best suite in the hotel to be comfortable.

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: The lobby is nice and modern, the restaurant is good, and the staff are very cordial and helpful. My bedroom was very comfortable but the bathroom could do with some renovation - the tiles and vanity top were quite old, drab and had some permanent stains. Even though the bathroom was clean the old tiles caused it not to look as clean as I guess it was.

review.title: So-So... spend a few bucks more and go elsewhere
review.reviewText: I am a regular traveller and have stayed in everything from the 'five star' to the place where you sleep with your shoes on. While Hotel Nikko was neither the former nor the latter, it was simply moderate for the cost and I would not recommend this hotel to a friend. My advice is to either spend much less for something slightly less in quality or spend a few bucks more and get one of the premeir hotels in the SF area. Hope this helps you fellow travellers!

review.title: Quite nice, but not exceptional
review.reviewText: I went for business and then stayed a few days to do the touristy stuff in SanFran. Overall very nice hotel, the room was nice (the plasma TV is a nice touch), but it's nothing special really. I'd stay there again if I were back in town.

review.title: Great value in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: I stayed at Nikko for three nights in June, 07 with my family. Great location, high quality and wonderful service. You can't go wrong here.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: ufgy

review.title: San Francisco - Union Square
review.reviewText: Nice hotel a block from Union Square - Great Shopping-- close to many great restaurants - Very Clean - Bed very comfortable --

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a good location to tour San Francisco. The indoor pool was nice and never crowded.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: The hotel itself would be considered 4-star. The staff were always very helpful and pleasant. Our room...well, for some reason I expected to have a beautiful room, it wasn't quite what I had thought. Just the sight of the mildew stained tub was a turn-off. Then there was the, what looked like a 1980's compact fridge, that was placed inside the closet(??). Lots of frost so it wasn't really cold. I did get a good rate for the room, so I guess the type of room surely fit my budget, which is why I didn't complain when I was there.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: A great location for those looking to shop downtown and catch a cable car to fisherman's wharf, staff where pleasant.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Excellent service, everyone was very pleasant. Perfect location. We will stay here again.

review.title: Best Value Hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location, right in the shopping area. Friendly and helpful staffs. Comfortable room with a good size TV and lots of channels to pick from. Best value hotel.

review.title: Ok hotel. Nothing special
review.reviewText: Everything was ok. I got a really good deal on it so I can't complain.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: A nice hotel 2 blocks from Union Square. Very nice, comfortable rooms. Douuble rooms are larger than king rooms but well appointed. Nice thick mattresses and linens are top of the line. Plasma TV and good ventilation in rooms. Good service in hotel and very clean. The concierges here are friendly and helpful and indispensible if you need resevations at the last minute or a tour on the fly. Quiet hotel with Starbucks adjacent to front door. Close to Powell line of cable cars (1 block). Get a Muni pass in the gift shop. $18 for 3 days (unlimited) vs $5.00 for a one-way ride!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: I was there for a conference, so most of my time was spent in a meeting room. Nikko is a great location--2 blocks from Union Square and Powell/Market cable cars and shopping. Maid staff was slow on making up the room, but room was fine otherwise. Room is rather small, but huge bathroom/shower!!

review.title: nice stay
review.reviewText: room was small, but the location is great. bed was nice and the staff was friendly and helpful

review.title: Could have been better.
review.reviewText: The location was wonderful, right in the center of where you want to be. The upkeep of our room could have been better. Furniture was chipped and looked worn. Walls needed minor repair. I like cleanliness, and when we walked into the hotel, the dirty rug in the main walkway was a big turnoff.

review.title: SF Vacation
review.reviewText: We always stay at the Nikko. It is in the best location and always clean. The rooms are comfortable and staff is friendly. It's our favorite place in SF.

review.title: Would recommend to other travelers
review.reviewText: I found the hotel to be convenient to all the tourist destinations and the staff very helpful.

review.title: first time to city
review.reviewText: This was my first time to San Fransisco and had a fantastic time. The hotel was in a convient location. The room was nicely decorated and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bath room floor could have used a good bleach scrub. The cost of the hotel was moderate for quality, but they charge for all extras, such as internet and pool. And the food/drinks in the refrigerator was outragiously priced. Overall good experience at hotel.

review.title: Best Hotel Ever
review.reviewText: This was our first trip to San Francisco and we could not have made a better choice as far as hotels go. The location was perfect. We could walk to just about everything. Cable Car was 1 block away. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Hotel was very clean, staff helpful, rooms were comfortable,
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location easy access to all sites in the San Francisco area. Although city should do something about the homeless people constantly asking for money. Cable car conductors could use a lesson on how to treat tourists!!!!!!!!!!!! Waited for a cable car for 1/2 hour before one came by and drove right by us followed by 3 others, compained to the person in charge, he treated us like we were from another world................. Seen San Fran, would not go back....

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel, great staff. Downtown SF, easy to get to most major attractions.

review.title: Maybe not a FOUR star hotel
review.reviewText: upon arrival, the hotel staff seemed pretty helpful, but that is where it ended. we booked a petite queen room, and let me tell you... it is SMALL!!! the bathroom had tons of mold on the moulding and there were no night stands to be found. i killed several spiders in the closet as well. the concierge was beyond rude, and when we complained, the front desk offered to upgrade us. they did so, but they gave us two full size beds instead of a king (whatever). we called down to guest services to get more cream and sugar for our coffee maker, and they never came. also, the sunday brunch buffet is NOT worth the $50 per person they charge. i was under the assumption there would be sushi and other fine delicacies, but instead what we got was french toast, bacon and an omlet bar. on a positive note, the location could not be more ideal. it is close to everything including bus stops and cable cars. overall, we had a blast, but we spent as little time in the hotel as we could. we will definetly not stay here again.

review.title: Loved the location!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I spent a long holiday weekend at the Hotel Nikko recently and we loved it. The hotel and the employees were lovely, and we enjoyed the proximity to Macy's, Crate and Barrell, Chinatown and sightseeing. We would recommend it, and would stay there again.

review.title: Just average.
review.reviewText: The check process was not very good, the hotel forgot requests that were made a ahead of time and because we were traveling with twin babies the wait was a bit of an inconvenience. Overall its not a bad hotel just not what you would expect for a 4 star rating. The location was the best thing about the hotel.

review.title: Nikko Hotel, such a nice place
review.reviewText: First of all, the locaction of the hotel is downtown, very close to the subway and the famous cable-cars. The room are great, more than clean, the facilities are impressive. Everything is done to help you having a good stay.

review.title: As good as the reviews posted
review.reviewText: No complaints. Very clean, relaxing and very well located. All the good things I read on the reviews were 100 matched. All the service people very polite. I would go back to this hotel with no doubts. JF

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Communications with receptionists difficult.

review.title: Big Beds
review.reviewText: Great Hotel in a good location. The service was excellent, they could do enough for you. The room was a little on the small size but the bed was HUGE and look up most of the room, oh and a massive flar screen TV too. Would recomend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco as near Union Square and Cable Cars. NICE!!

review.title: This is not a 4 star hotel, NOT HAPPY!
review.reviewText: When I called and confirmed our reservations at this hotel I was assured that every room had a refrigerator, equipped with wireless internet, and a DVD player. As we were registering, we were told that the pool and fitness center was an extra $10.00 a DAY and the internet would be at the rate of $9.95 a DAY. Yes, you can get wireless but only in the lobby and that is a separate service and another charge. Oh and NO there are no DVD players. Our room did not have a refrigerator it had a mini bar! We called and housekeeping brought this portable thing they called a refrigerator. The control button was broken the outside looked as though someone had taken a hammer to it and the inside was all cracked and broken. Well we get past all of that and since we are going to be there for 12 days we thought we would just make the best of it. As the days ticked by, we started noticing that the only thing the house cleaner service was doing, each day was making the bed, emptying the garbage and putting new towels in the bathroom. By the time we left the room had dust an inch thick (I wish I were kidding but I am not). Furthermore, they did not clean the tub or shower one time in 12 days even though we asked them to. I will end this on a good note however and say that the restaurant that is located in the hotel, "ANZU's" is wonderful; they know how to cook a steak. So there you have it. Moral of the story, you are paying for a 4 star hotel and getting a 2 star deal.

review.title: Great Place Great Location
review.reviewText: Great place, walking distance to union square. Room was not to big and not to small. The bed was super comfortable. The concierge was great. The only negative thing was our neighbors fighting with eachother from 12 am to 4 am. You can hear all your favorite 4 letter words through the walls. I will definitely stay again.

review.title: Not impressed with staff. Hotel was nice, but service needs vast improvement.
review.reviewText: I contacted the concierge for services and was never responed back to. After waiting several hours for a response, I called down to the concierge desk and was never able to get through, ever! Hotel establishment was nice, but the service was terrible. I have also never had to pay for Valet parking at a Hotel I paid to stay in. They also charge to use their pool which also seems a bit much.

review.title: great business hotel
review.reviewText: Very good value for money. Sunday breakfast was not impressive - it was served in a function room as the main restaurant was hosting the weekly Sunday buffet. Expensive parking ($40/night).

review.title: Very Impressed... Hotel Nikko is wonderful!
review.reviewText: The hotel is beautifully decorated and the rooms were magnificent. The staff were very helpful and curteous. My stay at the Hotel Nikko was overall a wonderful experience and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who will be visting San Francisco.

review.title: Nice place. Good location
review.reviewText: Nice room, great TV.

review.title: Pleasant, clean and cosy
review.reviewText: Service staff is accomodating and friendly. Room is clean, modern and comfortable. Would definitely stay with Nikko again during my next visit

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: My second time at this hotel. Location and service is great! Although I don't remember having to pay for entrance to the pool/spa area. Otherwise, the close proximity to Union Square and the shops are excellent. Also close to BART and Muni. I've got to remember to try using BART to/from the airport next time.

review.title: Fabulous Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The view from the 20th floor was amazing. The staff was extremely helpful and very nice. The extra fee for the indoor pool and jacuzzi, sauna, huge tub, shower and exercise equipment was worth every penny.

review.title: Comfort, respite, convenience
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is spotless and tidy, provides incredibly comfortable beds and very quiet rooms, and is conveniently located for business or pleasure in San Francisco. The sauna and pool are lovely and clean. The bar in the lobby, though we did not visit it, is incredibly inviting and looks like a great place for a fun drink in the evening. Will definitely return.

review.title: Don't get fooled
review.reviewText: When your first impression of a four star hotel is to be in line for almost an hour to check in. it is not a good start. I had booked their best avalible room and it looked as "tired" as the interior of the elevator. We had trouble using our room key to operate the elevator as contrary to posted instructions, you had to remove the card from the reader. When our bags finally arrived, mine was missing, turned up later. The first call I made to the front desk was foe more towels. I think that three towels is not enough. Overall, this was not in the class of a four star hotel by any means. Two stars would be my rating.From the very "worn" appearence to the "over-worked" hotel employees, I cannot think of a nice thing to say about this hotel. No morning newspaper either. Beware of parking in the garage, the rates are unreasonable.

review.title: My favorite hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was the best hotel i Have stayed at in San francisco, It is reasonably priced for a 4 star hotel the only problem i had with it was the auto matic debit mini fridge in the room it charges you even if you move it out of it's designated place. I moved something just to make room for something that i had. I never opened the water just moved it.but besides that great hotel I will be back.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: service was slow and am very upset that i had to wait in the lobby for 45 minutes to get my reservation

review.title: Nikko
review.reviewText: Good location, nice features, friendly service great bed with new flat panel TV. Only downside was the additional expense for the onsight exercise room.

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: I was very disappointed,this hotel looked and felt like a two star hotel.

review.title: Great hotel. Will definitely stay again.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Very good service, very affordable for the quality.

review.title: The Best value in san Francisco
review.reviewText: Exelent service, huge room's, 42 inch plasma in each room, great location.

review.title: Hotel Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was expecting more of a boutique hotel. The ambience was non-existant. The front desk staff was borderline rude and double charged for the use of the pool area and facilities. It was an additional $10 per person per 24 hours to use the pool (which is not very large) and the workout room and/or sauna. The room was very clean and the bed was remarkably comfortable. Overall, this hotel was great once you passed the front desk and headed to your room. If you were interested in utilizing the facilities, bring extra money for the extra fees.

review.title: The whole family loved the Nikko!
review.reviewText: The Nikko was located just right, within walking distance for our night out at the theater. We swam with the kids before dinner. Our room was cheerfully up graded to double queens, which were so comfortable the kids were just happy to relax and watch the large! plasma tv. Loved the room layout.

review.title: above average
review.reviewText: above average hotel very friendly and nice staff

review.title: Clean Hotel, good service, right on the middle of everything!
review.reviewText: This hotel is well situated on Union Square, all the shopping is very near! very nice area, hotel staff is very helpful and rooms are decent, lobby is a bit cold and sad looking (in terms of colors and decor). Rooms are confortable and nicely decorated. All in all it was a great stay and reasonably priced. Would stay there again

review.title: Quiet, comfortable, impeccably clean, good value!
review.reviewText: Very conveniently located to Union Square and Market Street shopping district, as well as theatres and art galleries. Room very quiet and restful, large flat panel TV -- nice! -- firm but comfortable bed with tons of pillows. No robes with the room; I was sort of expecting to see some. Also, American-style room breakfast wasn't all that good. Nevertheless, these are the only negatives in the whole experience, and not really such a big deal.

review.title: Not a Four Star
review.reviewText: The service was just OK and the bathroom was not what I could expect from a four star hotel. Overall, it was just OK.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This Hotel is right off of Union Square-the price for the location was great. I thought the rooms were a bit small but clean and well maintained. I think it's unfortunate they charged their guests $10/day to use the fitness center-that should have been included.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was everything Expedia indicated it would be. The food and ambiance were exciting and the rooms were very comfortable. We will stay here on our next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: For a 4 star hotel I expected much better service. The staff was not very helpful nor were they very accomodating. Everything at the hotel had an extra charge (internet, pool/gym, etc.) unless you were staying in one of the higher end rooms.

review.title: Content stay
review.reviewText: The best part of staying at the Hotel Nikko is that it is only 2 blocks away from union square & the BART/MUNI/cable cars. You do not need to rent a car or get a taxi to get around town. We reserved a deluxe room and we received a corner room on the 8th floor, so the plus side is that you get floor length windows 2x much as a standard deluxe which is great and we were overlooking the corner of o'farrell & cyril magnin, we could see the cable cars passin by on powell street. The down side is the room is much smaller than a regular deluxe. Now I am into cleanliness of bathrooms, and the bathrooms had thin streaks of mold on the grout between the tiles in the bath/shower and on the bathroom floor. Also, you have to pay $10 per person per day to use their pool/health spa. There is a Starbucks adjacent to the hotel. The bedding was very very comfortable. I would have really loved this hotel if it weren't for the bathroom. I jutst have a thing with bathrooms.

review.title: Best hotel in SF
review.reviewText: very good place to stay 2-queen bed rooms very spacious coffee maker, teabags in every room great convieniences like starbucks in lobby reasonable price awesome, incredibly comfortable beds..super soft would definitely love to stay there again no doubt the most comfortable hotel in the downtown area, would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Well Situated
review.reviewText: This hotel is in very close proximity to all of San Francisco's sights to see. The staff at the front desk was very friendly and helpful, as well as the valet staff.

review.title: enjoyed the Nikko
review.reviewText: Great location, fine service. Room service was impossible to reach.

review.title: Nice Hotel but ...
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Nikko two times, the last time was in December of 2006. The hotel staff is very helpful, the rooms are very nice, with large flat screen TVs. The only thing I don't like is that they are becoming a little cheap. They are now chargin additional fees for using the exercise room, for the "good" toiletries. Internet was never free.

review.title: Clean, yet not too expensive
review.reviewText: It's very close to the Union Square and easy to catch the cable cars. Also, very close to many car rental offices for trips around the town.

review.title: Totally satisfied with this property.
review.reviewText: Really cannot say enough about the service in this hotel, took care of everything I needed, anything that needed to be fixed was done immediately, the pool/gym are great/24hrs, the Concierge(s) was extremely knowledgeable and helpful, nice view, very comfy bed, desk was also extemely helpful, easy check in and out.

review.title: Beautiful hotel!
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel! The decor is exquisite and the beds were so comfortable it was hard to get up for sight-seeing. Great location, excellent staff. We decided we want to live there permanently.......

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We spend a wonderfull Thanksgiving holiday in this Hotel. What we enjoyed the most was: the Comfort of our room (clean and quiet), the quality of the food in the restaurant (ANZU), the spa and swimming pool (always relaxing after a busy day). What's more the hotel location is perfect for shopping around Union Square, taking the cable car, or eat outside the hotel.

review.title: Very pleasant
review.reviewText: Apart from the fact that we were originally given the wrong type of room, we found the Nikko to be pretty ideal in terms of location as well as the standard of its facilities.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText: This place was nice. We had Thanksgiving dinner at the buffet and it was decent.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The room was okay - pretty much what I had expected only much smaller. The bathroom was pretty bad though - very old and quite worn out. They had the worst shower I have ever seen - more like a sprinkler! - the hairdryer wouldn't work and the drains were blocked so we had to call maintenance on the very first day. Apart from that, pretty much everything is charged extra - there is a charge for internet access and a charge to use the pool and the fitness center (yes, for guests!). There is no safe in the room so you have to get your valuables stored in a safe deposit room by the reception. The only thing worth staying there was the location but it really didn't feel like a 4-star.

review.title: Stayed in Better
review.reviewText: The hotel was blah. It is very cold and impersonal and the people working the desk are as well.

review.title: Would definately stay there again
review.reviewText: Hotel is very,very quiet, and very central for shopping and museums. It was fully booked on Thanksgiving weekend and we could tell that there might be some more guests in the hotel or was it outside...? Modern rooms, hotel is not on the cosy american side, it's very japanese. Don't look down at the carpets when you get out of the elevator if you easily get carsick...the carpets are actually the worse of the hotel! Not dirty or anything, just weired! Restaurant is good. Nice staff, helpful. Good concierges. Take a 2 queen bedroom, its a large room. Beds nice , pillows too high. Nice pool but costs 10 dollars a day now. Dont touch anything before you know what it costs!!! If you open the zipper of the toiletries you have bought it. And check yor bill on the TV screen right away. Despite of all that its a great hotel.

review.title: It was a very nice hotel and the service was great
review.reviewText: loved it

review.title: impressed....
review.reviewText: the hotel was in an excellent location. it's in the middle of union square and public transportation was very simple to figure out. the room itself was ok and the bed sqweeked everytime we shifted our weight. we had to check in really late and the front desk was nothing but a pleasure. they made sure we had everything we needed. must try First Crush around the corner. it's good and reasonably priced.

review.title: Sliding Down Hill and Getting Greedy
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Nikko several times in the past and always been pleased. This time I stayed on the "Nikko Floor" and was less impressed than before. The room seemed a bit run down. The mattresses were very lumpy, the shower had an inconsistent spray. The HVAC fan periodically clanked. The room was also noticably dusty for the first night. The hotel has also instituted a per person fee for access to the health club and pool since my last stay in July, which is excessive for the quality of the facilities. Included as part of the room rate, the facilities are fine. For the additional fee, they are inadequate at best.

review.title: Beautiful hotel, ready for re-model however.
review.reviewText: The hotel has a very sophisticated feeling with detailed attention to design and comfort. However, the bathrooms are ready for upgrading as they are so 1980's in style. If they could install better shower heads, bath fixtures and new tiling, the hotel would be up to par with all the newer luxury hotels. It is still a lovely place to stay and the location is perfect for shopping downtown. With these minor updates the hotel will remain a San Francisco Classic.

review.title: Excellent example of a four star hotel
review.reviewText: Very tidy room, with a great view over the city. Bathroom was almost spotless, and the room was not cleaned when expected, but otherwise this hotel delivered in every regard. Polite reception, knowledgeable concierge, comfortable accommodation - it is only a shame my visit did not allow time to sample the menu!

review.title: Great location easy to find transportation.
review.reviewText: The hotel was 2 blocks from the BART station, cable cars and buses. Lots of shopping and restaurants close by. Friendly hotel employees. The only problem with our room was the shower stall had lots of mold on the grout and the vanity stool cover needed cleaning. Other than that the room was clean. Would stay there again.

review.title: Want to relax?
review.reviewText: This is a place to go to if you want to relax. The trickling water fountain in the front lobby is so soothing to come back to, as well as the massages given! The room was gorgeous & I didn't hear a peep from any of my neighbors. They have a light system for the "Do not disturb" & when they were not allowed in to clean, they left me a message & asked if they could come later! EXCELLENT service. They also have a place to store your bags if you have a later flight!

review.title: Good service - but strange smells in rooms
review.reviewText: Very good service but we smelled a very strange gas smell in our first room. Same in the next room.

review.title: Good Not Exceptional
review.reviewText: Clean rooms except for carpet. Average size rooms. Comfortable hotel. Strict checkout time! Good central location to get around and easy access from BART (to and from airport).

review.title: Are you kidding me?
review.reviewText: This review may not be fair, since I didn't have an ordinary room...I was upgraded to a suite, and my life may never be the same again... The room was gorgeous! The view was amazing! Black tile bathroom with huge tub that could have sat 4 people. The Japanese screens in the bedroom were elegant and relaxing, the black stone medidation area, the second bathroom (!), the flat screen TV's... Need I say more?

review.title: comfort and convinience
review.reviewText: I was traveling with tow children ages 4 and 1 1/2 yrs old. Found the hotel to be very convenient and centrally located. Made the whole trip enjoyable. Found the staff tob e very helpful, and it helps to have a starbucks in the lobby. Will definitely make the Nikko our base in San Francisco.

review.title: OK, but nothing special
review.reviewText: The Nikko was perfectly pleasant, but had nothing special to recommend it. It was all rather worn. The bathrooms in particular showed signs of age, as did the swimming pool and hot tub. It was all clean and pleasant though. The staff were very pleasant. And we did have a nice stay. However, I would consider a different hotel next time I go to San Francisco.

review.title: Got a Charge on my credit card after the Front Desk said No Charges
review.reviewText: San Francisco is a great city. We used BART and the 3 day MUNI pass...well worth it! The hotel was convenience in location. We were able to check in early after a red eye. Maid service was excellent. Concierge & Security recommended some very good dining choices. Upon requesting a late check out, Front Desk agent simply said we are full and I had to ask about other options for storing luggage and washrooms...not what I expected. The BIG surprise, I got a credit card charge after confirming with the Front Desk that everything was clear!@#$% Still waiting for a response from their Accounting Office???

review.title: We'll definitely stay there again
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the beauty of the lobby as soon as we checked in. Classy and sofisticated are the words to describe it. The elevators are the fastest I've been on without feeling any movement. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was small but enough for the two of us for 3 days. Our traveling companions had a double room and it was spacious. It was within walking distance to Union Square, Market Street, Cable Car stops, the BART, and numerous shops and eateries. Sadly, we did not try out the restaurant or bar at the hotel since we tried to pack in as much sightseeing as we could in such a short time. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and relatives. We were very happy with our choice.

review.title: Would recommend
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel itself was well-kept. And the location is perfect--very close to restaurants, shopping, galleries, etc.

review.title: San Franciso Best Hotel
review.reviewText: Great service, clean and comfortable rooms, nice atmosphere, perfect conditions to relax

review.title: Great hotel central SF
review.reviewText: Professional service, slightly sterile atmosphere

review.title: Simply awesome!!!!!!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, Great location. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Plenty of food and shopping nearby. 2nd time here and looking forward to the third.

review.title: Wonderful hotel
review.reviewText: I was extremely impressed by the Hotel Nikko. After reading reviews here, the room was not nearly as small as I had expected. The staff was cheerful, helpful, and seemed to go above and beyond the norm. A pleasant surprise!

review.title: Totally impressed
review.reviewText: What a great experience. The location was perfect; top notch hotel and staff. Would recommend it to anyone!

review.title: Great hotel right near Union Square
review.reviewText: Hotel was really nice and chic. Great location, literally steps away from Union Square! The rooms are not that roomy, but clean. Housekeeping did a lousy job with cleaning the room, we actually had the same dirty cup in the room for 3 days! But, besides that really nice hotel. If you happen to stay over a Sunday, the hotel's restaraunt ANZU has a great Sunday Jazz brunch where San Francisco's jazz station broadcasts from.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko was very comfortable. The staff very willing to assist us. The location was convenient and accessible to the downtown area.

review.title: To many beggars outside the hotel
review.reviewText: But I guess this is San Francisco!!!!!! The hotel was nice, but the room had dirty vents, dusty. The dresser on top was dusty as well. I used one glass and no other glass was replaced. One day we did not get our shampoo and conditioner. We got charged for the using items out of the refrigerator, but we did not. They did take it of our bill. Or daughter was told she used items from the bar, but it was never stocked. She also was not charged but the night staff person at the desk was not to friendly with her, since he assumed she was only 18 when in fact she is 29. I had to complain the way he addressed the issue with her. Other then that the Hotel was ok.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: The location is great, the rooms are elegant, simple and restful, the staff is pleasant, interested and efficient.

review.title: Excellent Hotel, Great Location
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is a great hotel in the Union Square part of town with great resturants and shopping, close to Chinatown and 2 blocks from the Powell St. BART and MUNI station, making it easy to navigate the city, and cable cars -- about a 15-minute cable car ride to Fisherman's Wharf. The staff was very nice, and anything that we needed they were on right away. The pool area also was excellent and a great way to unwind after sight-seeing in the city.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Nikko for our anniversary. Never having been to San Francisco, it was the perfect location. The staff was professional and polite, and it's a beautiful hotel.

review.title: Great Stay, but had minor issues
review.reviewText: The Nikko was great, it has a great reputation, we were complimented when we were were dropped off by the shuttle and cab rides. We were checked in imediately. We booked a Deluxe King for more space which I recommend. The bed was extremely comfortable with heavenly down comforters. This made naps and sleeping great after a full day of activities. The location was close to all the activities, dining, and shopping. The only problem we had with this hotel is the lack of toiletries. It was almost embarrassing for this class of hotel. We had to ask for shampoo, towels and soap almost everyday. Also, the bathroom had no vents, so everything will get wet from the steam of the shower. One day we even had to ask for floor mats for the bathroom. Outside of this, the hotel itself was great.

review.title: Great location, comfortable
review.reviewText: Expedia rate was excellent. The 2 double beds were completley sold out, we were upgraded to last room of the hotel. Not sure of our options if this was not available, as we would not sleep 4 in a bed. Reviews of regular rooms may be quite different to what we experienced. The Nikko floor was fantastic. The beds were comfortable (4*), the service was impeccable. The turndown service was the best I'd ever seen with refreshing linens, remaking beds again, etc. I believe only Nikko and Imperial floors. Hotel is great location.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText: Great hotel, very clean, near Union Square. nice Gym. Very friendly staff, Clean I would go back James

review.title: Excellent hotel at excellent location
review.reviewText: This is an excellent hotel in downtown San Francisco, great location 2 blocks from Powell station and Union Square, lots to do and lots to eat. Room is clean, spaceous (for double bed), and nicely equipped. The only problem I had was with the check in, first they screwed up on reservation and then I had to wait 1 hour for the room (normal check-in time is 3 PM and I did not get my room until 4:30). Great place to stay if they can get their act together in the front desk.

review.title: great hotel....
review.reviewText: very nice hotel in great locations...

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: This hotel is great. It is very contemporary and sleek. The staff is very friendly and willing to help in any way. The location is great too. Highly recommend.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel. Close to everykind of transportation. Inexpensive cab ride to ballpark, wharf, clubs (including jazz and blues) and everykind of food you could want. Shopping as far as the eye can see. Trendy and dive bars with character in walking distance. Awesome views especially from suites.

review.title: Great hotel in a geat city
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was a great place to stay. We had a Petite Queen room on the 20 th floor w/fantastic, unobstructed views of San Francisco. The room was easily large enough for teh two of us. The video tour on the website did not do justice, at least for the room we had. Nice pool & hot tub, adequate workout room. Great location, near Union Square and cable cars. Most everything else is easily acessible by public transportation.

review.title: we will go back in December
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is courtious and friendly. pool was a great asset to the accomidations. Easy walking distance to Theaters, and Union Square.

review.title: Leave the Car behind!
review.reviewText: The hotel lobby was very nice. The beds were extremely comfortable. The concierge recommended a wonderful little local shop for breakfast. The ANZU bar was quite pricey, but the staff was very friendly. I only have two problems with this hotel, you have to pay for WIFI, and price for parking extremely ridiculous, So forget about the rental car, I'd would walk or take the the trolly cars, the pay that price...

review.title: Hotel Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great service, very clean. Would go back.

review.title: Perfect
review.reviewText: Our family of 4 thoroughly enjoyed the Hotel Nikko. Service was fantastic and the concierge was very helpful. We couldn't have picked a better location - only 1 block from a cable car stop, wonderful restaurants, shopping, mass transit station, etc. We made a lot of great family memories with this vacation and the Hotel Nikko was a big part of that. Rental car location was right at the hotel - couldn't get more convenient than that! Thanks!!

review.title: Awesome!!!
review.reviewText: I thought this was one of the best Hotels I've stayed in, in San Francisco. The overall comfort and ammentities were terrific. This is great hotel for a weekend get away. Right in Downtown and close to Union Square (Shopping District). The staff was terrific and the resturant ANZO, that is in the Hotel, is one of the finest in the city. I would definately recomend this to someone who just wants to get away for the weekend, or needs a good place to stay during a business trip. Definately on my top ten list of best hotels in San Francisco.

review.title: Favorite Hotel Ever!
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the Nikko hotel in San Francisco from 7/16 - 7/20/06. I didn't know what to expect and knew of no one who stayed here, I just went by reviews from this website! First of I must say that the location is EXCELLENT! It is located in the heart of Union Square which is PERFECT for public transportation. VERY easy to get to Fisherman's Wharf, North Beach, Chinatown, etc.Between the buses, trains and cable cars it was perfect. The hotel Nikko is sparkling clean in every area. The main lobby has beautiful with fountains, japanese lanterns and a grand piano. The Anzu bar area has wonderful and had a great variety of drinks. I loved the Saki-Tini! YUM. The Staff at the front desk are all very friendly and SO accomodating. (Hello Be!) We had the Deluxe King room which was spacious enough for 2 and the bathroom was huge! When we asked for a refrigerator for our room and it was brought up in 5 minutes. They upgraded our TV to a 37inch flatscreen on the last day, I was shocked!! You are totally treated like royalty at the Nikko. The pool is the cleanest, nicest I have ever seen with beautiful Japanese plants surrounding it. It was empty most of the time during our stay. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and honestly cannot wait to return! Wish I WAS STILL THERE!

review.title: the 80s Rock
review.reviewText: This hotel is great location and has great styling from the 80s. All the people working there are very friendly and helpful...If you have the opportunity stay in room 1303...

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, great location, watch for the parking prices.

review.title: not impressed expensive
review.reviewText: bed was not comfptable.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel in March for business and was very impressed. I couldn't wait to go back. This time they put me in a smaller room (not the room I reserved) and despite my efforts to switch to a larger room, they said they were sold out. The carpets were dirty, and the bathroom grout needed to either be bleached or replaced. My next stay in SF will not be at Hotel Nikko.

review.title: Unimpressed
review.reviewText: While the price was very reasonable, I would not stay there again. Rooms are small, bed had a terrible lingering smell, no safe in room (camera missing after leaving it in room all day). The hotel in general is clean and service is good but one should expect that. The bathroom was also spacious and clean. The concierge was quite helpful, but four stars is a joke for sure.

review.title: Great Hotel in the Center of San Francisco
review.reviewText: This was a greatest place to stay. We are ready to go back. We like the location. Hotel was friendly and helpful in every way. When we go back to San Francisco we will sure stay there again.

review.title: Hotel Nikko Not impressed
review.reviewText: They are not very Helpful , if you request something please give a lot of time before your request is met.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: We often stay here because of its close proximity to shopping at Union Square and the SF Shopping Centre. Staff is friendly and helpful and though parking is pricey as is the case in SF, at least we rarely have to wait long for our car when we want to use it. The Japanese breakfast buffet is interesting, too.

review.title: A stylish beautiful hotel
review.reviewText: The Hotel Niko is serene and beautiful with fresh orchids in the lobby. The rooms were lovely with extremely comfortable beds. The hotel is within walking distance of Chinatown, the Powell street cable car stop and of course Union Square with all its wonderful shopping. One day we walked back from Pier One having taken the ferry to Sausilito and that was a lovely walk with no hills. I would highly recommend the hotel. The in house restaurant is very nice and we had a delicious breakfast there.

review.title: A beautiful place to stay
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect and our room was extremely comfortable.

review.title: Nice location, friendly doorstaff and great sunday brunch
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location and the doormen were very helpful and friendly. There is a great brunch on sundays although a bit pricey. Overall we were happy as the rooms were a bit small but comfortable and clean. We would stay again.

review.title: Great Location - would go back
review.reviewText: Service wasn't great, but after staying in a couple of other US hotels since realised this was standard. Hotel location is fantastic - you are at the very edge of Tenderloin (rough district of San Fran) but far enough away to feel totally safe and very convenient. My sister and I wandered around up to about 11pm and felt safe. Room is on the small side, bathroom adequate (shower pressure isn't great) but location makes up for it all. Would definitely stay again based on local and expedia special.

review.title: Great pool and excellent location
review.reviewText: Although we had to move our room after one night as the hotel was all sold out of the deluxe two queen bed room we ordered - we arrived at 10 pm - they did move us the next day. There is much cheaper overnight parking down the street. Was nice and kid friendly.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: We are most pleased with our stay at the Nikko. The room is very comfortable. The staff is very helpful. The location is very convenient. Overall, a wonder experience.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Normally we wouldn't stay at the Nikko as it tends to be on the pricey side, but we got such a good deal that we were really excited to stay there. The Nikko lived up to its expectations in service and location. Our cab driver even commented on how the Nikko has the best bellhops in the city! We would stay there again in a heart-beat!

review.title: Hotel Nikko was great for vacation
review.reviewText: I thought that Hotel Nikko San Francisco provided a great place to base our vacation in Northern California. The location is wonderful, centrally located in Union Square next to some of the best shopping and food in the country. Hotel service was exceptional. My only complaint was the size of the room but the comfort was great. I would recommend this as a place to stay for others thinking of traveling to SF.

review.title: Great hotel, but service can use a little improvement
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko San Francisco was very comfortable indeed and they upgraded our room for us as well, but when it came to simple directions to find out what time the bart train started in the morning, it was like pulling teeth from them. I couldn't get info from the front desk on this nor the bellhop. You would expect a high quality hotel would at least have the train information down to get to the airport. I would have given the hotel 5 stars if it weren't for this. Otherwise, great hotel.

review.title: Great Service, nice hotel
review.reviewText: I was most impressed by the service of the staff at the Nikko. Everyone was very friendly and polite. I was never kept waiting. The room was spacious and clean. I had a corner King-size-bed room, as a free-upgrade from my requested standard room. It had a separate dressing area, and comfortable bath. The hotel also had a pretty decent work-out room (for a hotel), with free weights, cybex machines, eliptic machines, and treadmills. Be warned that the elliptics and treadmills are in the pool area, so you will smell the chlorine.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square. Very clean room, but very small. Staff very professional and nice. Starbucks right in hotel definite plus.

review.title: Very Nice!
review.reviewText: They have a nice pool area and hot tub. Location is convenient to downtown. Even had conditioner! Pre paid with Expedia and there were no surprises.

review.title: I loved this hotel!!
review.reviewText: It's a beautiful hotel and the service was great!! The only complaint I have is that the comforter had feathers all over the place. It made a mess in the room. Other than that, this hotel was awesome!!

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Friendly staff and efficient check-in. The rooms are attractive, and the price is right for the quality of room you get. Wish they would reinstitute room packages that include the parking fee like they used to have.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: I was very impressed with the hotel. They checked us in early and allowed us to check out late. I would stay at the Hotel Nikko again on my new vacation to San Francisco.

review.title: Better than I thought
review.reviewText: After reading some reviews I was a little concerned about my stay at Hotel Nikko.Too my surprise, the service was excellent from checking in to room service. The room was a little small for my liking but still comfortable. The beds are great! I will stay at Hotel Nikko again when I visit SF.

review.title: excellent hotel
review.reviewText: near union square and lots of resuraunts. Great service.

review.title: Great hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko is a gorgeous hotel located right in the heart of Union Square with lots of great shopping near by. The staff was friendly and the room was fantastic. We would definitely go back!

review.title: Quiet, luxury - convenient but not a tourist hangout
review.reviewText: The Nikko is close enough to the Moscone Center, shopping and other downtown attractions to be convenient, but it is not the typical "chain" hotel or over publicized "landmark" packed with tourists. It has a quiet, reserved air that I find refreshing. It is a bit expensive, but immaculate, refined decor and well appointed. It is also often available when some of the more publicized convention center hotels are packed. I used to live in the SF area and it is my choice for a hotel if I need to be near Union Square and/or the Moscone Center.

review.title: Comfortable clean room.
review.reviewText: Comfortable clean room.

review.title: employees are very kind
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is just perfect!!, Do not miss the sake martini.

review.title: Will definitely go back!!
review.reviewText: We had a great time at this hotel. The staff was so nice - when we mentioned that we were on a special trip for our anniversary the front desk rep was kind enough to send up a bottle of champagne for us "on the house." We felt like VIP's every step of the way - the concierge was super-helpful. The rooftop (enclosed) pool and hot-tub was a really nice way to unwind after a long day. The restaurant was very good - we tried their buffet - it was a little pricey but the food was great and the selection was good too. The room was very comfortable - nice furnishings and a comfortable bed. We will definitely be back!!!

review.title: Nikko was Nice
review.reviewText: The Hotel is a very nice place to stay. It has a great poll/workout facility. The concierge is the key to seeing the best of the best around San Fran. The room was a little small, but designed and decorated w/ taste and class. The only downfall to the hotel is the parking. It costs $45/night to keep car parked and surrounding streets are not tourist friendly.

review.title: Best Kept Secret in NY
review.reviewText: This hotel is excellent, If you want to call it a hotel. I feels much more like your own apartment. Everything about it was exceptional.

review.title: Great Comfort for the Price
review.reviewText: Well appointed and laid-out rooms. Fabulous, roomy bathroom. The combination of location in Union Square, San Francisco and the amenties makes for an easy recommendation.

review.title: Great Hotel to Stay in S.F.
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko was a really nice hotel. My wife and I enjoyed the amenities and the great location. Its a few blocks from Union Square, and near multiple means of transportation and places to dine. The service was very friendly, and everyone was helpful with tips for getting around the city. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: A good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: We stayed at Hotel Nikko San Francisco during the memorial Day weekend. We had a late arrival since we were flying from the heartlad region. Our original room was smaller than a cabin on a cruise ship and after un-packing and getting ready to go to bed my husband found some hair and something that looked and felt like salt in our bed. After calling the front desk we were promptly moved to a new room in a different floor and it was a little bigger and nicer than the previous one. After moving, we didn't have any problems or complaints. The bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms were nice and comfortable but we had poor water preseure in the shower. For the price of the hotel+air package we will probabbly stay here again due to convenience. Is close to all the shops and lots of restaurants in downtown as well as to the bart and the cable cars.

review.title: perfect
review.reviewText: This was a honeymoon stay and it was everything that a couple would want. The bedding is fabulous

review.title: Office-like building but good hotel over all.
review.reviewText: Looking like a office building from the outside, the hotel might make you feel unwelcomed at first but the room I stayed was very clean and confortable over all. It would be much better if the hotel would change lighting to a warmer color.

review.title: Modern hotel with modern maintenance glitches.
review.reviewText: As a frequent visitor to San Francisco, I have always admired the outside facade and fantastic lobby of the hotel. The location just can't be beat. The Petite Queen Room was smallish but I was not expecting a massive suite. The decor was modern and tastefully spare. The bed was made up in clean crisp white sheets, fluffy pillows and a wonderful down comforter, a plus. The smallest of minifridges with the room was very useful. The hotel, although modern, is not new. There are hints of wear and tear.
