The room's bathroom tub being an absolute disaster with stained grout that was missing in places and a stained tub floor (safety footing marks looked filthy). This room's tub needs an overhaul. Also in need of an overhaul was the TV computer system. My remote keyboard would not function properly with certain keys broken. In addition the hotel charges for internet use on their TV computer system which I was unable to use. Also unable to check out electronically. Had a bit of a wait trying to check out at the front desk as some man was whining about the fact he was missing his free breakfast vouchers. Can't comment an further on the restaurant or other amenities but I can say the staff was friendly and courteous. I would consider staying at the Nikko again if they work out the repairs. I am not certain it deserves the four star designation given it's current condition.

review.title: Hospitality at its best
review.reviewText: User friendly hotel. Well loketed for pleasure or business in San francisco. Service was attentive and friendly yet not obtrusive. Well equipt and comfotable room. Overall Nikko hotel gives an axcellent value for money. I reccommend it for any visits to San Francisco

review.title: front desk was snobbish
review.reviewText: walked in to check in to 4 rooms. The man at front desk tried to move us to lower grade hotel across the street, then proceeded to tell us all he had was smoking rooms on seperate floors, we told him that was unacceptable, then miracously, 4 non smoking rooms were available on same floor, which is the rooms that were booked. we had just drove in from a river rafting trip on the american river, i think he didn't like the way we looked.

review.title: Wonderfully clean and organized
review.reviewText: This hotel is very clean, organized, and in a GREAT location! It felt like a sanctuary to return to after a day of exploring San Francisco.

review.title: Small Japanese Box
review.reviewText: Room was small and I was not overwhelmed at all. Nice health club and pool.

review.title: Clean, modern, well located hotel
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is superb. The hotel has very nice amenities and is well maintained. I'd highly recommnend if the price is right.

review.title: I would stay here again.
review.reviewText: I just wish the Hotel had a bar and more restaurants in it.

review.title: all the comforts of home, away from home!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was awesome! The location to union square and the surrounding restaurants was everything I was looking for. The hotel itself was great too. The beds were wonderfully comfy. I love the feather down comforter and all the amenities that came with a basic room. The view from the 18th floor is incredible during the day and so romantic at night. I have stayed at several hotels in San Francisco, but have never been so happy as I was with the Nikko. I visit a few times a year and always try to stay close to Union Square. You can't go wrong with Nikko!

review.title: As expected for mid-top tier hotel
review.reviewText: The SF Nikko is about what I would expect for a Nikko and a hotel in this price range in SF. Stylish, good-service (Save for one snafu with the bellman) and nice, but not extravagant, rooms.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very clean and comfortable. Concierge very helpful. Only problem was a missed wake up call which was very important and not handled by management. Otherwise a great stay. Located in Union Square area which is very convenient.

review.title: Comfortable Sleep
review.reviewText: Hotel is nice. Service is good. Room is a little small but amenities are good. Bed is firm and very comfortable.

review.title: I'll definitely go back
review.reviewText: great, convenient location, well-mannered staff,appealing japanese style!

review.title: clean and comfortable in great location
review.reviewText: close to transportation close to shopping Starbucks on premise attentive staff

review.title: Small but neat
review.reviewText: The room was small, clean, and efficient. The bed was very comfortable--could've used more pillows. The hotel was very nice and a great location. Easy to get to all tourist spots.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Great location near Union Square, very good service, nice lobby. Room was not as nice (a bit shabby) as we expected, but serviceable.

review.title: Would definately return
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel with a great location, right near union square, cable cars, bart station and great shopping and restaurants. Staff was very friendly and helpful, concierge gave great suggestions and directions. We upgraded to the deluxe room, and it was one of the smallest hotel rooms I've stayed in, so I can't imagine how small the regular rooms are. Though it was "cozy" it was clean, the bed was comfortable and we had a great view of the peninsula. I do recommend upgrading to at least the deluxe room. The pool was beautiful and the gym was one of the better equipped I've seen in a hotel. Restaurant Anzu was great also. Definately recommend.

review.title: Expected more,,,
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was excellent! The room was very small, but had nice extras such as a CD/stereo. There were signs of wear and tear in the room such as chipped paint on doors and dirty grout in the bathroom. Room service food was mediocre. The beds have some kind of plastic lined matress pad that makes a noise every time you turn over - didn't make for a very restful sleep.

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: it was clean, with a great view, and well located. I would stay again. great restaurants in the area, all the rental cars are in the same block. The only thing is that I wouldn't park at the hotel, because is very expensive, but there's a parking tower across the street, and other parking lots near by

review.title: Great buy for San Francisco
review.reviewText: The large spatious bathrooms made it a great place for primping before going out for a night of fun in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice Hotel great location
review.reviewText: While rooms were narrow, they were attractive and well appointed. The Expedia package made this a real value.

review.title: Nikko- Not for the oversized traveler!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko San Francisco has one thing going for it... location! It is in the perfect spot. Close to Union Square and the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. However, the rooms are tiny. In fact, if I were a little larger (and I'm only 5'4") I might not have fit in the room. So if you are looking for an afordable place to stay in a great location but don't plan on spending much time in the room, this is it. If you prefer to lounge, there might be some better options in the neighborhood.

review.title: Great hotel with pool
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay. The indoor pool was wonderful. A real break in the day from all the activity of San Francisco. I go often to visit my son and I will stay there from now on.

review.title: Extremely impressed with the Nikko Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: What can be said, our stay at the Nikko Hotel was perfect. Check in was easy. We told them our name and they said all was paid for and handed us our room key. It was the easiest check in ever. Thanks to the Hotel and Expedia for that!! The maid service was in and out of our room in the morning, and we were never disturbed. The refridgerator was stocked with food and drink, and the room and bathroom were clean and comfortable. Great stay, highly recommend it.

review.title: Great SF Hotel!!
review.reviewText: Great location! Very friendly staff. Room was clean and not small like every other SF hotels - but 2 people I heard cannot stay in the 'Petite Queen' - we moved up to 1 large King and had plenty of room! The bathroom was gorgeous and roomy (the green tea soap is outstanding!). Best deal in SF to stay close to everything you need. The Hotel Restaurant was terrific (and that is by SF standards, which is hard to beat). I grew up in SF and was throroughly impressed by my accomodations - in fact friends have stayed there as well and had the same great experience. But don't stay here - I want there to be plenty of room available next time I stay ;) as I will always stay at the Hotel Nikko whenever in SF!! (I am normally very critical, so this is very unusual to have such a perfect stay.)

review.title: Good location!!!
review.reviewText: Everything ok. hotel is very clear and staff friendly but better check prices for using stuff in your room and parking.

review.title: Small room, but very clean, efficient and comfortable with Pillow Tops!
review.reviewText: Very definitely a Japanese style hotel, but with very modern comforts. Green tea in addition to coffee for brewing. My room had its own stereo. The concierge fixed me up with their complimentary limo service in lieu of a taxi cab ride to downtown meeting. Ask for high floor to get a view.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: The main thing that my husband and I liked was the excellent service. The staff was very helpful and polite and took the time to recommend places in San Francisco to eat and visit. The staff gave us the sense that we were important guests.

review.title: Just average
review.reviewText: The Nikko Hotel is well located near union Square. However, the overall service is below par for a 4-star hotel. The parking was very backed up when we arrived as was registration. We had to wait almost 2 hours for a room, which was adequate but nothing special. The desk staff were pleasant but there are few in-hotel amenities.

review.title: Comfort and Service
review.reviewText: Simple, yet elegant the Hotel Nikko in San Francisco has an excellent location (two blocks from Union Square) and great, friendly service. I would stay there again. We had stayed there years ago and it is still very nice.

review.title: Nikko
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome for the price and location. The staff was very friendly and upgraded our room without even asking. The room was very roomy and clean and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone even though I did not use their pool or eat there.

review.title: Review of Hotel Nikko after staying over Easter
review.reviewText: We only stayed for one night but they allowed us to do an early checkin (we arrived at 9AM instead of noon as expected). That was nice. The hotel is very classy and quiet. Hotel employees are very friendly. No issues.

review.title: Very conveniently located to most attractions
review.reviewText: Hotel is very conveniently located in the downtown area. The pool and fitness facilities were adequate. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant is very good and priced right. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Nikko is a great place in a great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is great with 2 problems(nik picking): the tv was operational some time, the counter in the bathroom looked used,no shine on it. Outside of that,I say go for it.You realy couldn't do better.

review.title: Great Oriental ambience and service
review.reviewText: Location near Union Square and trolleys is ideal. For business travelers: The hotel handled an important fax with prompt delivery and send out faxes on off-hours without a hitch. I had some trouble logging onto the internet on day one but a telephone service provided simple instructions as to how to set up my laptop. Hotel restaurants were great. Clientele in the hotel was on the young side, 30s. The concierge set us up with restaurants perfect for what we needed--top-rate meal and value in a setting able to accomodate a small child. Pool was nice, with some exercise equipment poolside. The room was spacious compared to typical downtown rooms. The only thing I didn't like was the fluorescent lighting in the bathroom--I'm told the Japanese prefer this type of lighting but I find it harsh. I liked the origami exhibit in the lobby and the overall decor. There is lots of marble, impractical for a rainy setting (slippery) but very nice. There's a Starbucks off the lobby (if you consider that a good thing).

review.title: Stay somewhere else.
review.reviewText: The room was pretty standard, and without some of the items one expects in a hotel in this price range. The restaurant is much talked about, but I thought the prices were too high for what was served and service was astonishingly poor as well as unfriendly. The house wine was sour and undrinkable. I am in San Francisco once a month on business and won't stay here again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Location is good --- had to wait for extra pillows, but everything else met or exceeded expectations. Petite queen is a small room, but the beds are extra comfy.

review.title: Overall good stay
review.reviewText: Room needs updating but overall clean,bathroom is roomy. Staff service is excellent. Location also good.

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText: The room was a good size for San Francisco, myself, my wife and 18 year old son, had no problems. The beds were comfortable and bathroom big. Location was great, walking distance to most major attractions, convention center, and cable car. Didn't have time to use it, but looked in on Pool, very nice - rooftop enclosed, good size, and clean, with decent workout room. It was a separate section so more like club. The luggage service was great, all the bellmen were friendly, helpful and informative. Front desk effecient. Would recommend they allow free local calls and get wireless internet.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Location, service, food, everything was just perfect! I would highly recommend it.

review.title: Fairly stark, not very warm, doesn't say come in and make yourself comfortable.
review.reviewText: The lobby was very cold, temperature-wise, and the atmosphere was very stark and sterile. It was not the kind of place you would walk into and say, this looks really warm, comfortable, and "homey". The room was adequate and I like the 24-hour room service. For the money, it wasn't bad but no-where near the best accomodations I've ever had.

review.title: unimpressed
review.reviewText: started out as very poor service in anzo restaurant, fire alarms were going off and the person on the intercom was as much idiotic as the waiter...first impressions are the big thing and ruined a romantic week....thank God San fran is such a great place to get away from the hotel.....Concierge needed to learn how to smile and when you ask how to get to Chinatown...the receptionist shouldn't answer, "Oh, don't bother, there is a nice vietnamese restaurant just around the corner!"

review.title: Great Location, nice hotel, very small rooms, weird experience
review.reviewText: Location and hotel are very nice. The rooms are so small it's almost depressing - particularly when out of town on a business trip. Weird experience was the alarms started blaring and they are LOUD in the room - but it seemed like nobody knew how to turn them off, and they kept blasting. very shocking experience when you want to relax. probably a one-time thing, but odd.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Dont let the price of this hotel fool you. Just because they say the price is high, this does not mean it is a good place to stay. There is a 42 inch plasma screen tv in the hotel room, but you are watching it from about 2 feet in front of your face. The rooms are small and very compact. For the price that they are asking i would expect at least a suite

review.title: Pretty average!
review.reviewText: We paid the extra money for the "Imperial Club Room", and it was so not worth it. The breakfast was good but the evening cocktails and appetizers consisted of one plate of cheeses and crackers that were below average. I have stayed in other hotels where paying the extra for this floor is 100% worth the money. Not this one! There was one bar in this whole hotel and just not much going on. I have to say the rooms and the whole hotel were very clean. But just not the place I would stay again.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: First time to SF. Recommended by a friend. Had a wonderful time. Room was a little worn but comfortable. Could use new carpet and paint work or new wallpaper. Requested a mini fridge and extra pillows at the front desk and it was brought up quick. (No charge for the fridge). Great location, walking distance to shopping and dining. A great second honeymoon!

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Very quiet rooms. Staff was helpful. I'd go back again.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Room was very small; bed in the corner against a wall. Showerhead not working properly; never fixed despite asking to have it looked at. Room booked in 2 time increments; 4 nights in my partners's name; 1 night in mine, causing difficulty at check-in and not straightened out until following day.

review.title: Perfect location; professional and polite staff; definitely going back!
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, nicely appointed rooms, clean, great views, perfect location

review.title: Would go back to same hotel
review.reviewText: Every thing was great the food in the hotel was awesome and the customer service was good

review.title: Not too shabby
review.reviewText: The bed wasn't very comfy and the room was really small. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Parking was EXTREAMLY expensive. Enough to pay for another night's stay. The location was perfect though...down the street from Ruby Skye (the greatest club ever!)

review.title: A great experience
review.reviewText: Not only was it a great location,the rooms were very nice.It was a quick walk from the Bart station on Powell,Union Square,muni service, and cable cars were close by.Buy a muni pass for easy acess to public transportation. Plenty of good restaraunts nearby as well.We never ate at the hotel since there were so many good food choices nearby.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Found the service very good, a little over priced but nice. Room very clean and absolutely loved the oxygenetics shower head! Pool was great too! Nice place to unwind while in San Francisco and centrally located next to union square. Walking distance of all mass transit systems.

review.title: Bed and Pillows need to be improved. Clean, nice, good area of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: It is a very nice hotel. Good location. Convenient to shopping, transportation, China town, Museums, Pier 39 and restaurants. Rooms are bit small, for San Fanscisco, it is to be expected. Great Sushi restaurant in the Hotel. If Bed and Pillows were more comfortable, I'd rate NIKKO a five.

review.title: Extremely comfortable room!
review.reviewText: Hotel is very good sorrounded by good restaurants, transportation, culture and shopping activities.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Impressive restaurant and lobby. The room was just alright. Great Location

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and service was excellent. Facilities were good and food was excellent (restaurant in hotel is Anzu).

review.title: Sunday brunch is excellent!
review.reviewText: Best experience ever!

review.title: Crisp and Clean
review.reviewText: If you want a very zen atmosphere then check out the Nikko. It has some Japanesse influence for sure. Very comfortable stay.

review.title: Relaxing atmosphere
review.reviewText: Petite rooms are large enough for a couple. Very well-equipped fitness facility/pool/spa.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: If you want to stay at a luxury hotel and are willing to pay, this is a wonderful option. It is in a great location. The rooms are new and very nice and the service is excellent.

review.title: Good hotel in the middle of downtown
review.reviewText: Location is incredible. Next to Union square and the cable car stops. Hotel decor is also very nice. Nothing special about the rooms. But comfy and good service. Inddor pool and jacuzzi.

review.title: fantastic!
review.reviewText: good, very convenient location for almost everything.

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText: see above. unless you upgrade upgrade upgrade then don't bother

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was fabulous in a great location right off Union Square. The staff was friendly and accomodating.

review.title: A great downtown hotel
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable and clean. Friendly staff. The lobby is large and comfortable. Excellent baggage service. Weak points were the lines to check in and check out as well as no free internet.

review.title: Quite impressive - value for your buck
review.reviewText: The stay was quite impressive and comfortable. It was not 5 stars but the hospitality was comparable. I would defintely reconsider it on my return visit to San Fran. If you travel on a budget, expect to spend a lot of time out of your hotel room but still wish to be comfortable when you come back in or simply like to feel you are getting enough bang for your buck, Nikko is really worth considering. Happy travels.

review.title: Most convenient
review.reviewText: Front desk takes long to answer phone and concierge was never available. They could use automatic doors at their garage exit/entrance on the ground level

review.title: Unimpressive
review.reviewText: Hotel was on the edge of the "less desirable" part of town. Took a walk and a wrong turn and suffice it to say my suit, tie and bottle of sparkling water made me stand out in a dangerous way. High end restaurant was reservation only. Checked-in at 4pm and room was not ready until 5:30. Front desk was undermanned. No express check out. TV selection was very limited.

review.title: well run hotel
review.reviewText: friendly, efficient,

review.title: Would love to stay there again
review.reviewText: Fun

review.title: very good location!
review.reviewText: It is very well located near the cable car, shops and some nice restaurants near by. Swimming pool is a plus.

review.title: Excellent location, excellent staff......room needs some updates
review.reviewText: Stayed at the Hotel Nikko this past weekend. The staff could not have been better. Valet parking, for which I am always a bit afraid of...was perfect! They always greeted me by name and my car was returned safe with no dings or anything! Pool/gym was nice, though only one hot tub - with the size of the hotel, you would think there would be more. A word of warning - do not use the mini bar for your own personal use, as each item has a sensor on it and was charged to the room the second you removed it. After discovering this, I called down and they brought me my own personnal refridgerator to use. I put back all the items, but upon checkout was still charged. They quickly credited me the charge. My only complaint was that on the 18th floor, where we stayed, the rooms have older furnishings and the caulking around the tubs and showers are old and discolored. While I felt the room was clean, these items did stand out. Make sure to bring CD's as the room comes with a nice stereo - however, no DVD player. Excellent place to stay and I will stay there again!! Front desk was excellent!!

review.title: Great spot!
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in close proximity to Union Square and was a pleasure to stay at. The staff, especially the concierge, was very knowledgeable and very helpful throughout our stay. Highly recommended!

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The service is fine. However the rooms are too small, the mattress is old and the shower is dirty with no water pressure.

review.title: nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: hotel staff was really friendly, rooms nice and clean, the bathroom was fantastic, very big and comfortable. The swimming pool and whirlpool was nice in the evening. My kids loved the fitness center. The hotel is central, easy to reach with the bart system from the airport, 5$ and only 30 minutes. Starbucks is in the building which we enjoyed...

review.title: Excellent Stay!
review.reviewText: I thought the Hotel Nikko was great. The bed was very comfortable. The had nice high tech ammenitites (flat screen TV... small tv inside the mirror of the bathroom, digital Do Not Disturb signs, etc). The showers left a lot to be desired in tems of water pressure, but overall everything was great.

review.title: Great deal
review.reviewText: Great hotel at a great price! Great location with nice staff. Recommended!

review.title: Basic room definitely not four star quality
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is gorgeous and I was attracted to the Japanese theme, I was not impressed with the basic queen deluxe room. The bathroom was nice and the furniture was elegant, but the bed was extremely uncomfortable (as in - bowl full of jello). The room service was very good, and the service at the hotel bar was great. This is just not a good destination for a frugal traveler. Next time, we will upgrade to a nicer room or choose a different hotel.

review.title: Uncomfortable Bed
review.reviewText: Basic entry level hotel bed.

review.title: Absolutely perfect!
review.reviewText: Except the location. If I went back to San Francisco on business, I'd want to be closer to the Convention Center. Having said that, I can't be more emphatic about the beauty, cleanliness, and comfort of the Nikko Hotel.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Great staff, Clean rooms and terriffic work out area

review.title: hotel nikko: almost.
review.reviewText: very nice. great location. good service. needs an update of rooms. a little cramped.

review.title: Nice but small
review.reviewText: I was impressed by the Nikko in regards to the over style of the rooms. However, for the price, the rooms were a little too small. I even had the imperial club room and was dissapointed with the size. Their restaurant, ANZU, has great steaks.

review.title: Try Somewhere Else
review.reviewText: Queen Petite room was too small. We enoyed the location, but I would try somewhere else.

review.title: Great Hotel, Lousy Beds
review.reviewText: Great service is the hallmark of any good hotel and you will not be disappointed with your stay at the Nikko. The only problem lies in the substandard bed that was in our deluxe room.They were so uncomfortable that we really considered sleeping on the floor. If you exclude the beds, the Hotel Nikko has everything you are looking for world class service and great location.

review.title: High quality but very reserved which I liked
review.reviewText: I had a economy rate and suite which was a very good value for the price. (Petite Queen) My only complaint was the price of a gift tray of a small amount of fruit and cheese with crackers which my wife ordered for me and was charged $18 plus $8 service charge for a total of $26 for two dollars worth of food. Thank you.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: As someone who had never been to San Francisco before, I was worried about picking the right neighborhood. Hotel Nikko is on the nice side of the border between swank and scary. It's extremely accessable to everything touristy, just don't walk too far South or West. The hotel is beautiful, and if you stay in a 'Mini Queen', you'll have plenty of room for two, but won't have the high prices.

review.title: Not completly what I expected
review.reviewText: The room was considerably smaller than we were expecting and it had a strange odor when you walked in. The business center was only open M-F for only certian hours, and you had to pay almost $8.00 an hour (minimum time allowed) to use the internet. The in-room internet was a lot less desireable. The speeds were extremely slow and you had to hit the keys over and over to get them to respond. The cost was $10.95 for 24 hours, would have been worth it if it would have actually worked. Hotel was kind enough to remove the charge from my bill. Late night room service was not good at all. It says you can get tortilla chips with salsa and guac, but the chips are actually Doritos. The popcorn is microwave, and the sandwhiches were terrible. On the plus side, the staff was very nice and helpful. They were more than willing to help out and would greet us each and every time we entered the hotel.

review.title: Hotel Nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: My husband and I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Nikko. Contemporary elegance was our first impression. All staff extremely courteous. Hotel was restful and quiet. We booked a room on the Nikko floor.(recommended). Our stay included buffet breakfast, which was excellent, every morning. Loved the pool and jacuzzi. Hotel location in walking distance from all of the attractions. Easy check-in, easy check-out. Got a ride back to the airport in a Town Car for not much more than a taxi. Overall, very impressed with the Nikko: staff, room, bed, service. Will definitely stay again.

review.title: looked like a mistake
review.reviewText: the toilet was in a different compartment from the sink and shower. The toilet room had no windows or ventilation. It looked like an architectural mistake! Not luxurious at all, very simple and basic. Not worth the money.

review.title: Really lovely!
review.reviewText: I read a lot of reviews that said nasty things about the "petite queen" sized room, so I was apprehensive after booking it. However, when I arrived with my boyfriend, although we did find it a bit on the small side, it was totally adequate -- I mean, we wanted a central location to sleep and Nikko was terrific that way. The digitally controlled temperature was great -- we like it cold. We had plenty of water pressure and hot water for the shower. The shared areas of the hotel were gorgeous, the staff was friendly and efficient. Although it is true that the bed is in a corner and there aren't bedside tables, there is a headboard that provided all the near-the-bed storage we needed. If you're looking for a luxury room, pay extra for one of the bigger rooms, but the price with plane fare with expedia was great, and we had a terrific time in SF over a long weekend. We didn't even have to rent a car!

review.title: Excellent gym
review.reviewText: One of the best gyms you can expect in a hotel. In-room TV channels are very linmited.

review.title: Expensive but worth it
review.reviewText: This trip was both for work and extended for vacation purposes, so I needed to make sure the place was comfortable enough to get a good night's sleep for work. I paid high to book a room in the "Imperial Club" category (guaranteed top two floors of the hotel, exclusive elevator access) due to the high amount of street noise on lower floors. The location is excellent (very close to shopping and dining) but as experienced on previous trips, the noise at night can be loud. Despite the high price, I have absolutely no complaints about the hotel. These top floors were recently renovated and have beautiful accomodations (incl a plasma TV) and all services were prompt and unobtrusive. This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in, even compared to some of the top hotels in Chicago and NY. I can't comment on the regular rooms on the lower floors, but the extra dough was worth it in this case and made for a great trip (a bad hotel experience can ruin a trip too!)

review.title: Shoe box in San Francisco--The Nikko
review.reviewText: The dorm room we were given gave me claustrophobia on entering and then the cigarette smell to the bed cover sheet drove us out to a new room. The next room was equally small and even the TV was small. Don't stay here unless you are small.

review.title: The only Hotel for us.
review.reviewText: I only stay at the Hotel Nikko when im in the city. I have been to others but there is no comparison. Everyone is very polite and accomidating. I highly recommend to any visitor coming to SF for the first time.

review.title: If in San Francisco, I'll difinitely stay here
review.reviewText: Kind and impeccable service, quiet and subdued lobby and dining areas, and the middle of downtown location make this hotel an excellent choice for business meeting as well as for shopping and leasure.

review.title: Great hospitality, yucky cramped room
review.reviewText: The lobby is nice, the people are nice, the room was small and uncomfortable. The carpet was stained as was the tub. The wallpaper was peeling in the bathroom as well. The mattress really needed to be thrown out; it was very old and had no shape to it. Hospitality is first rate though.

review.title: Japanese San Francisco Style
review.reviewText: The hotel provides a very Asian feel, with the convenience of Starbucks at the bottom floor. Don't expect to park your rental vehicle there, the charge is $44 and it's cheaper to park just across the street at the public garage. Also be aware that the hotel borders a somewhat suspect area of the city known as the Tenderloin.

review.title: can't wait to go back....
review.reviewText: hotel was situated right smack in the middle of everything, esp. SHOPPING!! our room was very clean and comfortable. if ever anyone's planning a trip down to san francisco,i would recommend you check this place out!!!

review.title: great hotel, great location if you can tolerate homeless
review.reviewText: very nice hotel, nice pool and gym, nice first floor lounge. Lots of homeless and young travelers since hostelling neighbors the hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms a little small. Tons of nearby restaurants.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice, great location (next to Union Square in the heart of Downton). The only complaint is that the bed was too small. I recommend upgrading from the petite queen!

review.title: Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: We upgraded to Nikko Room (executive level) and were very impressed with the view, daily buffet breakfasts, comfort robes and large plasma screen television. The staff was extremely helpful and accomodating. The hotel itself is elegant with a modern, asian flare. It is vey conveniently located only blocks away from Union Square and the cable cars. There is also a rental car agency (Enterprise) located on the basement level floor which makes renting a car for the day easy and convenient. We rented a car and drove to Montery and Carmel down scenic Highway 1. Fantastic trip!

review.title: A mixed bag
review.reviewText: The desk staff were very pleasant and helpful, but the room was mediocre, small, but clean. The layout was awkward,with a heavy bathroom door opened out across the hallway, blocking the exit and closet access when open. The bedspread was old, unattractive, and very faded --but clean,and the bed had seen many a traveler. My room on 19 was very quiet. The work out room had a variety of good equipment, but no amenities like morning coffee or bottled water. The breakfast staff in Anzu would not wait on me the first morning, even to refill coffee, and made a fuss when I asked for a menu instead of the buffet. The second morning, service was excellent, with a smile and a promptly presented menu.

review.title: Small room for the price
review.reviewText: I thought overall the hotel was nice. I must say I was disappointed with the room size after viewing the hotel's web page. The hotel itself is gorgeous...but for the cost the room was very tiny.

review.title: Very Pleased with SF Nikko
review.reviewText: Both my wife and were very satisfied with the Nikko Hotel itself, their restaurant and location. I would recommend upgrading a level or two from the basic low rate,the room is slightly larger and getting a room on 15+ floor.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: It's worth the price.

review.title: Very Very Nice
review.reviewText: We stayed on the Nikko Floor. The room was fantastic. Very clean. Very comfortable. Nice views. Exceeded our expectations across the board. Word of caution - the thermostat has an IR sensor and will shut down the climate control if no-one is in the room. If you happen to place your bags so that it blocks the thermostat's view of the room ...

review.title: Incredible Service and Ammenities!
review.reviewText: I've never had better service! Great staff! The location is perfect also. There are some great 24 hour diners nearby for the late nighters which we loved! The hotel was very quiet, yet still lively. Room was comfortable and clean also. If we go back to San Francisco we will definitely go back to Nikko! The concierge staff was incredible and can really help out with your activities.

review.title: Place to stay in the Bay
review.reviewText: Great location downtown. Easy access from SFO via BART. Friendly staff, great restaurant with a variety of Sake Martinis, sushi etc. Well worth the visit and stay.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: Some of the front desk staff wasn't that friendly. My shower stall was full of soap scum and the bathroom isn't very clean. The furniture look real old. I would go some place else next time. The only good thing about it was the location, close to the cable car and union square.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Rooms small for the price. Ventilation and City noise. Valet parking leaves you only 15 minutes to check in before they charge $9/hour for your car. Go do that with kids! Stressful arrival.

review.title: Would stay at the Nikko again
review.reviewText: Good location for shopping and Theatre.

review.title: Incredible Stay
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our week-long honeymoon stay. Go for the shiatsu massage.

review.title: Wonderful Stay!
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The room service was excellent, food was good and all the staff were extremely helpful and nice!!! Our first room on the 9th floor was very depressing. Small dirty window and the rooftops for a view. We asked for the 19 floor (non smoking floor) and were given a wonderful new room at no charge. I had asked for a lower level due to not liking heights but would have been very unhappy with our first room. The first day we went out I came back to a wonderful bottle of bubbly for my birthday. I will always return to this great hotel when I visit SF. It was quiet, beautiful art and very relaxing.

review.title: I loved it
review.reviewText: we we're so happy with the service and our room. Everything was perfect. I have not been on a long vacation away from home in three years and this was worth the wait.

review.title: Safe bet
review.reviewText: Central location, clean and value for money.

review.title: accommodation
review.reviewText: very good

review.title: It was ok.
review.reviewText: Although we were able to rest very well since the hotel was was very quite, I was disappointed with the room. The room pictured in the internet ad was much nicer than the hotel room where we stayed. The room needed to updated - especially the bathroom floor tile.

review.title: Very nice experience
review.reviewText: It was very clean and comfortable. Also luxurious. However one day my key card did not work and I went to get another one. They gave me another key card without verifying ID, which made me a little nervous.

review.title: Close to main atractions
review.reviewText: Very close to main atractions. The Petite Room is really very small.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko San Francisco was great. It is located right in Union Square, walking distance to all the stores, and steps away from cable cars. It is a quiet hotel (even with a High School Prom event on Saturday night) with excellent service. My only complaint was the overnight valet parking price. It is "in-out" service but pricey. Overall, the hotel stay was well worth it and made our stay in San Fancisco an even better experience. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: ''It's a perfect hotel''
review.reviewText: I definitely want to stay this hotel again. I recommended your website to my friends.

review.title: matress uncomfortable
review.reviewText: very nice place to stay, close to union square and convention center

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel to evertbody.

review.title: Class and comfort !
review.reviewText: My wife and I had a superb time ! The floor to cieling windows gave us a stupendous view . Like the minimalst / clean decor and the concierge / and staff in were very helpful ! We'll be back !

review.title: Perfectly Located in Downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excellent service, automated digital media center in room, shower and bath - awesome experience!

review.title: Wonderful Honeymoon
review.reviewText: We spent our honeymoon at Nikko and cannot wait to return. The entire staff is exceptional and very accomidating. I recommend this hotel for business or leisure. Location was perfect, we couldn't have asked for anything more.

review.title: Beautiful, would recommend highly.
review.reviewText: Beautiful hotel with excellent, friendly service. Great location if you want to be in the middle of downtown area. Walking distance to everything. Concierge services were great. Were in other 4 and 5 star hotels in neighborhood and this was by far the nicest.

review.title: Convenience and Class
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko has a wonderful, accommodating staff who addressed our every need and concern. The location is wonderful--close to public transportation, major shopping and many good restaurants. No need for a car. The hotel's own restaurant boasts a sushi chef who previously served the Emperor of Japan. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: average holtel in below average neighborhood
review.reviewText: This hotel was better than decent but by no means special and I would not choose to stay in the neighborhood again. There were not many appealing restaurants nearby and it was not an area I felt safe wandering around in at night as a woman alone (this is from someone who lived many years in New York City). A bonus was the Starbucks off the lobby. A negative was street noise at night.

review.title: location was great
review.reviewText: the marble walls of the lobby was very impressive, although the rooms were a bit small but the location of the hotel made it all worthwhile. just minutes walk to union square puts you close to everything that the city can offer. convenient starbucks located downstairs of the hotel!

review.title: Great experience at the Nikko
review.reviewText: This was my first stay at the Nikko. I chose to treat myself to a floor room on a friend's recommendation. It was a very pleasant and peaceful visit. The room was always very clean, with twice-daily housekeeping service, and I found all of the staff to be pleasant, friendly, and very responsive to problems, without being intrusive. The food at ANZU was good, but not exceptional. However, I found it to be better than most hotel fare and room service was delivered very promptly! No 45 minute or longer waits! The Union Square area is packed with huge shops so shopaholics beware. This part of town does not have a ton of hills and seems to be close to transportation, such as the cable car (which always had quite a line of people waiting to get on), and the Muni buses. I would stay here again-definitely.

review.title: Excellent choice in SF
review.reviewText: Just came back from a short break in SF staying in the Hotel Nikko.  We had a deluxe room on the 19th floor.  Service is very good.  Room furniture and public space are probably recently updated.  The bathroom is a little outdated but it is clean and tidy, and very large (actually larger than necessary in my opinion).  For the price we paid for, this is an excellent choice in the Union Square area.  Very convenient, couple blocks to Cable car terminal at Powell St, shopping close by too.  They also have a home theatre style amp + CD player in the room, unheard of in a hotel room.

review.title: A fine hotel in a fine location
review.reviewText: Great hotel but if you don't pay the big bucks, you get a semi small room which at times can seem kind of cramped. The concierge was helpful but often times, did not guide you in the right direction which meant getting lost from time to time.  The location is prime, easily accessible to all modes of transportation and key tourist sites.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The hotel's biggest attraction for me was its proximity to Union Square.  I could see Macy's from my window.  The valet's were extremely friendly and courteous, the front desk person I checked in with much less so.  She seemed annoyed to see me.  Other than that my short stay was just fine.  The restaurant Anju is only so-so.  The service was slow even though the place was not packed.  The room was comfortable, the bathroom huge.

review.title: Enjoyed the visit
review.reviewText: I have stayed at the Nikko many times over the years.  I have always been satisfied.  My visit this month was a little disappointing because we did not have much of a view and the toilet was not working properly.  When you have only a short visit you make the best of it.

review.title: Excellent Hotels
review.reviewText: The Hotel Nikko is an excellent hotel.  It is in a great location just off Union Square.  The hotel restaurant is excellent.  I really liked the feature where you can flip a light switch and it displays a do not disturb signal to housekeeping.  My only complaint was the water pressure in the shower.

review.title: when in san fran, will ALWAYS stay at the hotel nikko!!!
review.reviewText: this is the second time we stayed at the hotel nikko.  beautiful hotel, great amenities, the staff is top notch.

review.title: Hotel Nikko-SF
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko located only a few blocks from Union Square shops exceeded expectations. The room (Queen mini-Suite), though small, was more than enough space for two people. Bed was quite comfortable and stocked in room refrigerator. Concierge was extremely helpful in locating restaurants and pointing out directions.  Had minor problem with toilet but staff remmedied problem immediately. Nice but small excercise room; would be nice if TV's were near the treadmills. Did not use the restaurant Anzu, but menu looked very interesting. Overall, for price and location, I was extremely pleased and would return on my next trip to SF.

review.title: Best hotel experience in 43 years
review.reviewText: Outstanding in every regard.  Extremely attentive staff.  Superb restaurant.  Impeccable service.  Excellent on-site massage therapist.  Stunning art exhibits.  Understated but elegant decor.  If I had the money, I would move in to Hotel Nikko!

review.title: Fantastic Service
review.reviewText: Just returned from a holiday stay at this hotel. What fantastic service they offer. Every staff member, from parking attendent, to desk staff, bellman, housekeeping, was prompt, courteous and worked so hard to make our stay pleasant. We had a great room with a view, and the lovely lobby was beautifully decorated for the holidays. We will return!

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Fairly safe location within walking distance of Union Square.  Quiet room located on 21st floor with nice view.  Large bathroom with separate bath/shower.  Wonderful breakfast at Anzu restaurant.

review.title: I left my heart at Hotel Nikko!
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko not only met my expectations for my first trip to San Francisco, it exceeded them ten-fold! I booked a Floor room (HIGHLY recommended) and had spectacular views of the Bay and the downtown area of the city. The accomodations were spacious, immaculate and modern. Complimentary high-speed web access, a sizeable bathroom and a wonderfully comfy bed made my stay that much more enjoyable. And the buffet breakfast at ANZU should be taken advantage of - the tastiest selection you could possibly want is all available. Location wise, it's literally a stone's throw from Union Square's shopping attractions and a short cable car ride to Fisherman's Wharf. It's hands down the BEST hotel in S.F. and I don't hesitate to give them 5 stars across the board. I can't wait to go back!

review.title: Niko stay a winner
review.reviewText: I went to San Francisco to spend time with my daughter and her growing family. I essentially left the hotel each day around 7 AM and returned around 8 PM. My room was impecable and quiet. The break from a noisy household was a real treat.

review.title: Very Good
review.reviewText: I was very pleased with my overall stay at the hotel.

review.title: Excellent Hotel
review.reviewText: Beautiful lobby area, rooms, gym and pool.  They have a wonderful Jazz Brunch on Sunday mornings - a bit pricey, but what quality and variety!  One of the best hotels we've ever visited!

review.title: Oriental sofistication at the best location
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is excellent, just walking distance of any major point of interest in this beautiful city, the staff is courteous and helpful, always ready to orient us at any time. Great restaurant and overall first class service. I already recommended it to my sister in law for their next trip to San Francisco next year. Our room was spacious and confortable with an excellent bathroom w/ both shower and tub, plenty space for clothes and luggage, vanity with mirrors for makeup and many other amenities.

review.title: Hotel Nikko
review.reviewText: staff was wonderful, loacation was fabulous, will always stay at this hotel

review.title: hotel nikko San Francisco
review.reviewText: Superb Hotel, great amenities, around many local attractions, ie union square, cable car turn around, chinatown, Moscone convention center.

review.title: Nikko Hotel Review
review.reviewText: A very nice lobby and a very good sushi bar, well located. If you need overnight parking try the garage across the street as it is 3x cheaper. I enjoyed my stay and would recommend the Nikko.

review.title: Wonderful Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel Nikko was a great place to stay for someone looking to experience San Francisco.  All the shopping near Union Square was just minutes away.  Fisherman's Wharf was easily reachable via cable car, or a 20 minute walk if you are really adventurous.  The rooms were made daily, and the concierge at Hotel Nikko was great.

review.title: OUTSTANDING
review.reviewText: The hotel was one of the nicest hotel around. It's beautiful inside and outside. The hotel is big and immaculate. It has a beautiful design/architect inside as well. There is an indoor pool.
